name: Abnormal endocrine morphology
description: Any anomaly of the structure of an organ ofthe endocrine system.

name: Anterior pituitary dysgenesis
description: Absence or underdevelopment of the anterior pituitary gland, also known as the adenohypophysis.

name: Congenital portosystemic venous shunt
description: A congenital defect of the vasculature such that there is a shunt (by-pass) of blood directly from the portal vein to the vena cava (i.e., the blood from the portal vein is not filtered through the liver).

name: Bowman capsular hyaline drops
description: An insudative accumulation of amorphous, eosinophilic, periodic acid-Schiff (PAS)-positive, silver-negative material protruding from Bowman's capsule into the urinary space. Although not always evident by light microscopy, this material is located between Bowman's capsule and the parietal epithelial cells, in some cases associated with newly formed matrix material.

name: Broad distal phalanx of the 3rd toe
synonyms: ["Broad outermost bone of the 3rd toe","Wide outermost bone of the 3rd toe"]

name: Cerebellopontine angle arachnoid cyst
description: An arachnoid cyst located at the margin of the cerebellum and pons.

name: Parathyroid hyperplasia
description: Hyperplasia of the parathyroid gland.

name: Irregular epiphyses of the toes
synonyms: ["Irregular end part of the toe bones"]

name: Intraaxonal accumulation of curvilinear autofluorescent lipopigment storage material
description: Curvilinear intracellular accumulation of autofluorescent lipopigment storage material within axons.

name: Acute hyperammonemia
description: An increased concentration of ammonia in the blood with sudden onset.

name: Hepatic amyloidosis
description: A form of amyloidosis that affects the liver.

name: Focal aware cognitive seizure with dyslexia/alexia
description: A focal cognitive seizure with dyslexia / alexia characterized by retained awareness throughout the seizure.

name: Focal impaired awareness sensory seizure with gustatory features
description: A focal sensory seizure with gustatory features in which awareness is partially or fully impaired at some point during the seizure.

name: Hyposthenuria
description: An abnormally low urinary specific gravity, i.e., reduced concentration of solutes in the urine.

name: Absent middle phalanx of 5th finger
description: Absence of the middle phalanx of the little (5th) finger.
synonyms: ["HP:0005774","Absent middle bone of little finger","Absent middle bone of pinkie finger","Absent middle bone of pinky finger","Aplasia of the middle phalanx of the 5th finger"]

name: Lip freckle
description: Increased focal pigmentation of the vermilion of the lips.

name: Recurrent upper and lower respiratory tract infections
description: Increased susceptibility to upper and lower respiratory tract infections, as manifested by recurrent episodes of upper and lower respiratory tract infections.

name: Third degree atrioventricular block
description: Third-degree atrioventricular (AV) block (also referred to as complete heart block) is the complete dissociation of the atria and the ventricles. Third-degree AV block exists when more P waves than QRS complexes exist and no relationship (no conduction) exists between them.

name: Febrile status epilepticus
description: A seizure lasting 30 minutes without fully regaining consciousness, provoked by fever (temperature greater than 38.0 degrees Celcius) at the time of seizure-onset, without a prior history of afebrile seizure and with no evidence of an acute central nervous system infection or insult.

name: Premature loss of permanent teeth
description: Premature loss of the permanent teeth.
synonyms: ["Early loss of adult teeth","Early loss of permanent teeth","Early loss of secondary dentition","Premature loss of adult teeth","Premature loss of secondary teeth"]

name: Arcuate artery intima/media liquefactive necrosis
description: A type of arcuate artery intima/media necrosis in which the dead (necrotic) tissue breaks down such that cellular detail is no longer recognized.
synonyms: ["Liquefactive necrosis of the arcuate artery intima/media"]

name: Enlarged kidney
description: An abnormal increase in the size of the kidney.

name: Abnormal response to corticotropin releasing hormone stimulation test
description: An anomalous response to the corticotropin releasing hormone (CRH) stimulation test. Normally,CRH is released by the hypothalamus to induce adrenocorticotropic hormone (ACTH) release by the anterior pituitary. In the stimulation test, CRH is administered intravenously and ACTH and cortisol are measured at intervals.

name: Anti-nuclear matrix protein-2 antibody positivity
description: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against NXP-2.

name: Increased antimullerian hormone level
description: An elevation above the normal range of the antimullerian hormone in the circulation.

name: Fragmentation of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 4th toe
synonyms: ["Fragmentation of the end part of the outermost bone of the 4th toe"]

name: Postaxial hand polydactyly
description: Supernumerary digits located at the ulnar side of the hand (that is, on the side with the fifth finger).
synonyms: ["HP:0004698","HP:0005763","HP:0009984","Extra little finger","Extra pinkie finger","Extra pinky finger","Polydactyly affecting the 5th finger","Postaxial polydactyly of fingers","Postaxial polydactyly of hand","Postaxial polydactyly of hands"]

name: Duplication of the middle phalanx of the 4th toe
description: Partial or complete duplication of middle phalanx of fourth toe.
synonyms: ["Duplication of the middle bone of the 4th toe","Duplication of the middle phalanx of the fourth toe","Partial/complete duplication of the middle phalanx of the 4th toe"]

name: Curved middle phalanx of the 3rd finger
description: Curved appearance of the middle phalanx of the 3rd (middle) finger.
synonyms: ["Curved middle bone of the middle finger"]

name: Craniopharyngioma
description: A benign pituitary-region neoplasm that originates from Rathke's pouch. Craniopharyngiomas are benign slow growing tumours that are located within the sellar and para sellar region of the central nervous system.

name: Stippled calcification proximal humeral epiphyses
synonyms: ["Speckled calcifications in end part of innermost long bone of upper arm"]

name: Anti-epidermal transglutaminase antibody positivity
description: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against epidermal transglutaminase.
synonyms: ["Anti-epidermal transglutaminase (anti-eTG) antibody","Anti-eTG antibody positivity","Anti-keratinocyte transglutaminase","Anti-TG3 antibody"]

name: Cone-shaped epiphysis of the middle phalanx of the 5th toe
synonyms: ["Cone-shaped end part of the middle bone of the little toe","Cone-shaped end part of the middle bone of the pinkie toe","Cone-shaped end part of the middle bone of the pinky toe"]

name: Protuberant abdomen
description: A thrusting or bulging out of the abdomen.

name: EEG with persistent abnormal rhythmic activity
Bilateral wrist flexion contracture
description: A chronic loss of wrist joint motion on the right and left sides.

name: Elevated urine pyridinoline level
description: An increased amount of pyridinoline in the urine.

name: Unilateral renal dysplasia
description: A unilateral form of developmental dysplasia of the kidney.

name: Epicanthus superciliaris
description: A type of epicanthus in which more extensive epicanthal folds with their origins in the eyebrow cover, pass in front of and lateral to the medial canthus (middle corner of the eye).

name: Decreased circulating GABA concentration
description: A decrease in the level of GABA in the serum.
synonyms: ["Decreased circulating GABA concentration","Decreased level of gamma-aminobutyric acid in serum"]

name: Aplasia of the middle phalanx of the 4th toe
Expiratory air trapping
description: Abnormal retention of gas within a lung or part of a lung, as a result of airway obstuction of abnormalities in lung compliance. In the classic presentation, the lung will appear normal at inspiration, but on exhalation, the diseased portions of the lung which have lost connective tissue recoil will remain lucent while the healthy portions of the lung will become more dense due to atelectasis. This helps distinguish it from mosaic attenuation due to patchy fibrosis, as occurs with nonspecific interstitial pneumonia, and in early usual interstitial pneumonitis (the hallmark imaging diagnosis of interstitial lung disease) in which there is no change with inspiration and expiration.

name: Desmoid tumors
description: Benign, slow-growing tumors without any metastatic potential. Despite their benign nature, they can damage nearby structures causing organ dysfunction. Histologically they resemble low-grade fibrosarcomas, but they are very locally aggressive and tend to recur even after complete resection. There is a tendency for recurrence in the setting of prior surgery and the most common localisation of these tumors is intraabdominal from smooth muscle cells of the instestine.

name: Pulmonary lymphoma
description: Lung parenchymal involvement with lymphoma.

name: Thoracoabdominal eventration
description: Congenital protrusion of the abdominal or thoracic viscera, usually with a defect of the sternum and ribs as well as of the abdominal walls.

name: Aortic elastic fiber fragmentation
description: Loss and/or fragmentation of elastic fibers of the media of the aorta creating increasingly extended translamellar spaces, with absence of elastic fibers, and increased gaps in elastic fiber lamellae as identified on a stain for elastic fibers.

name: Palpable purpura
description: A type of purpura in which the lesions are raised (and can therefore be appreciated upon palpation).

name: Tufted hairs
description: The presence of tufts of 8-15 hairs that appear to emerge from a single follicular orifice.

name: Renal cortical adenoma
description: The presence of an adenoma in the cortex of the kidney.

name: Increased VLDL cholesterol concentration
description: An increase in the amount of very-low-density lipoprotein cholesterol in the blood.
synonyms: ["Increased circulating very-low-density lipoprotein cholesterol","Increased circulating very-low-density lipoprotein levels","Increased plasma VLDL cholesterol"]

name: Abnormal lip morphology
description: An abnormality of the lip.

name: Glomerular subendothelial electron-dense deposits
description: Electron dense deposits at the glomerular basement membrane,

name: Parkinsonism
description: Characteristic neurologic anomaly resulting from degeneration of dopamine-generating cells in the substantia nigra, a region of the midbrain, characterized clinically by shaking, rigidity, slowness of movement and difficulty with walking and gait.

name: Attached earlobe
description: Attachment of the lobe to the side of the face at the lowest point of the lobe without curving upward.

name: Nausea
description: A sensation of unease in the stomach together with an urge to vomit.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the distal phalanx of the 4th finger
synonyms: ["Absent/small outermost ring finger bone","Absent/underdeveloped outermost ring finger bone"]

name: Extrapyramidal muscular rigidity
description: Muscular rigidity (continuous contraction of muscles with constant resistance to passive movement).

name: Limited horizontal extraocular movement
description: Limited mobility of the eye to move from side to side (horizontally) within its socket.

name: Increased fucosylation of N-linked protein glycosylation
description: Increased addition of fucose sugar units to N-linked glycans.

name: Anterior uveitis
description: Inflammation of the uveal tract in which the primary site of inflammation is the anterior chamber.

name: Erlenmeyer flask deformity of the femurs
description: Flaring of distal femur.
synonyms: ["HP:0006422","Erlenmeyer flask deformity of distal femur","Erlenmeyer flask femora","Erlenmeyer flask shaped thighbone"]

name: Thoracolumbar interpediculate narrowness
description: A reduction of the distance between thoracolumbar vertebral pedicles.

name: Abnormal cardiovascular system physiology
description: Abnormal functionality of the cardiovascular system.

name: Abnormality of the parathyroid morphology
description: A structural abnormality of the parathyroid gland.

name: Broad middle phalanx of the 4th finger
description: Increased width of the middle phalanx of the 4th finger.

name: P mitrale
description: A broad (120 ms or longer in duration) and bifid P-wave in EKG lead II.

name: Congenital megaureter
description: A developmental disturbance with extreme ureteral dilatation.

name: Osteolytic defects of the phalanges of the 4th finger
description: Osteolytic defects of the phalanges of the 4th (ring) finger.

name: Small epiphyses of the 5th toe
synonyms: ["Small end part of the little toe bone","Small end part of the pinkie toe bone","Small end part of the pinky toe bone"]

name: CNS hypermyelination
description: Increased amount of myelin in the central nervous system.

name: Supernumerary spleens
description: The presence of two or more accessory spleens.

name: Biliary dyskinesia
description: A motility disorder characterized by biliary colic in the absence of gallstones with a reduced gallbladder ejection fraction.

name: Cardiac shunt
description: Pattern of blood flow in the heart that deviates from the normal circuit of the circulatory system.

name: Mesocardia
description: Mesocardia is an abnormal location of the heart in which the heart is in a midline position and the longitudinal axis of the heart lies in the mid-sagittal plane.

name: Adrenal hyperplasia
description: Enlargement of the adrenal gland.

name: Abnormal circulating T4 level
description: A deviation from the normal concentration of thyroxine in the blood. Thyroxine (also known as T4) is the main hormone secreted by the thyroid gland into the blood. It can be converted into the active form triiodothyronine (also known as T3).

name: Cone-shaped epiphysis
description: Cone-shaped epiphyses (also known as coned epiphyses) are epiphyses that invaginate into cupped metaphyses. That is, the epiphysis has a cone-shaped distal extension resulting from increased growth of the central portion of the epiphysis relative to its periphery.

name: Small epiphysis of the middle phalanx of the 2nd finger
synonyms: ["Small end part of the innermost long bone of index finger"]

name: Abnormal circulating proteinogenic amino acid concentration
description: An elevated level of a proteinogenic amino acid in the blood circulation. These are the 23 alpha-amino acids that are precursors to proteins, and are incorporated into proteins during translation. The group includes the 20 amino acids encoded by the nuclear genes of eukaryotes together with selenocysteine, pyrrolysine, and N-formylmethionine.

name: Agenesis of permanent teeth
description: A congenital defect characterized by the absence of one or more permanent teeth, including oligodontia, hypodontia, and adontia of the of permanent teeth.
synonyms: ["HP:0000681","HP:0006287","Absence of permanent teeth","Absent permanent teeth","Agenesis of permanent dentition","Agenesis of secondary dentition","Failure of development of permanent teeth","Failure of development of secondary teeth","Missing teeth"]

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the proximal phalanx of the 5th finger
description: Absence or underdevelopment (hypoplasia) of the proximal phalanx of the little (5th) finger.
synonyms: ["Absent/small innermost little finger bone","Absent/small innermost pinkie finger bone","Absent/small innermost pinky finger bone","Absent/underdeveloped innermost pinky finger bone"]

name: Transient decreased circulating IgE
description: A temporary reduction beneath the normal level of total immunoglobulin E (IgE) in the blood.

name: Neoplasm of the eye
description: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the eye.

name: Increased red cell hemolysis by shear stress
Anti-CASPR2
description: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against contactin-associated protein-like 2 (CASPR2).

name: Hyperamylasemia
description: Increased level of amylase in the blood, an enzyme which helps digest glycogen and starch. It is produced mainly in the pancreas and salivary glands.

name: Reduced brain glutamine level by MRS
description: An decrease in the level of glutamine in the brain identified by magnetic resonance spectroscopy (MRS).

name: Increased high-mannose N-glycan level
description: An abnormal increase in the concentration of high-mannose N-glycans on glycoproteins.

name: Dependency on intravenous nutrition
description: Inability to be weaned from intravenous (parenteral) nutrition, as judged by the hydration status (urine output, blood urea nitrogen, creatinine, urine sodium concentration), ability to maintain weight, stool output, and serum electrolyte status.

name: Titubation
description: Nodding movement of the head or body.

name: Accelerated skeletal maturation
description: An abnormally increased rate of skeletal maturation. Accelerated skeletal maturation can be diagnosed on the basis of an estimation of the bone age from radiographs of specific bones in the human body.

name: Anti-ribosome Po antibody positivity
description: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against ribosome Po.

name: Broad forearm bones
description: Abnormally wide bone of the skeleton of forearm.

name: Abnormality of cardiovascular system electrophysiology
description: An anomaly of the electrical conduction physiology of the heart.

name: Caesarian section
description: Delivery of a fetus through surgical incisions made through the abdominal wall (laparotomy) and the uterine wall (hysterotomy).

name: Microtropia with identity
description: A type of microtropia with no manifest movement on cover test, the eccentric fixation point coinciding with the angle of ARC.

name: White lesion of the oral mucosa
description: White lesions of the oral mucosa are generally caused by a condition that increases the thickness of the epithelium. This increases the distance to the vascular bed and thereby tends to change the usual reddish color of the oral mucosa to white. Common causes include hyperkeratosis (thickening of the keratin layer), acanthosis (thickening of the spinous cell layer), increased edema in the epithelium (leukoedema), and reduced vascularity of the underlying lamina propria. Additionally, fibrin caps or surface ulcerations and collapsed bullae can appear white.

name: Endogenous lipoid pneumonia
description: A type of lipoid pneumonia in which the source of the lipids is the body itself. When an airway is obstructed, it is often the case that distal to the obstruction, lipid-laden macrophages and giant cells fill the lumen of the disconnected airspace.

name: Short phalanx of finger
description: Short (hypoplastic) phalanx of finger, affecting one or more phalanges.
synonyms: ["HP:0001168","HP:0005771","HP:0006087","HP:0006126","Hypoplastic phalanges","Hypoplastic phalanges of hands","Hypoplastic/small phalanges of the hand","Phalangeal hypoplasia","Rudimentary phalanges","Short finger bones","Short phalanges","Shortened phalanges"]

name: Peripheral fixation
description: Fixation of an object in a peripheral area of the retina.

name: Peripheral axonal atrophy
description: Atrophic changes of axons of the peripheral nervous system.

name: Glioma
description: The presence of a glioma, which is a neoplasm of the central nervous system originating from a glial cell (astrocytes or oligodendrocytes).

name: Transient hyperphenylalaninemia
description: A condition of not having consistently high levels of phenylalanine in the blood but of experiencing temporary hyperphenylalaninemia following ingestion of large quantities of phenylalanine (for instance, following an oral loading test with phenylalanine).

name: Binucleated visceral epithelial cells
description: Visceral epithelial cells with 2 nuclei. Can be observed on light or ultrastructral microscopy.

name: Tiger tail banding
description: An abnormal appearance of hair under polarizing microscopy (using crossed polarizers), whereby hair shafts show striking alternating bright and dark bands, often referred to as tiger tail banding.

name: Monoclonal light chain cardiac amyloidosis
description: A type of cardiac amyloidosis related to deposition of an immunoglobulin light chain. The current gold standard of amyloid typing is to determine the precursor protein using laser microdissection mass spectrometry.

name: Broad metatarsal
description: Increased side-to-side width of a metatarsal bone.

name: Abnormal biliary tract physiology
description: A functional abnormality of the biliary tree.

name: Chronic calcifying pancreatitis
description: A form of chronic pancreatitis that is characterized by calcification.

name: Abnormal CSF histidine concentration
description: Any deviation from the normal concentration of histidine in the cerebrospinal fluid.

name: Mild postnatal growth retardation
description: A mild degree of slow or limited growth after birth, being between two and three standard deviations below age- and sex-related norms.

name: Prelingual sensorineural hearing impairment
description: A form of sensorineural deafness with either congenital onset or infantile onset, i.e., before the acquisition of speech.

name: Metacarpophalangeal synostosis
description: Fusion of a metacarpal bone with the proximal phalanx of the finger distal to it across the corresponding metacarpophalangeal joint.
synonyms: ["HP:0100325","Fused long bone of hand with innermost finger bone"]

name: Asymmetry of the mandible
description: Lack of symmetry between the left and right mandible.
synonyms: ["Asymmetry of lower jaw","Canted lower jaw","Canted mandible","Crooked lower jaw","Deviation of lower jaw","Deviation of mandible","Lower jaw shifted to one side","Tilted lower jaw","Tilted mandible","Uneven lower jaw","Uneven mandible"]

name: Large cell lung carcinoma
description: A type of non-small cell lung carcinoma that is derived from undifferentiated malignant neoplasms originating from transformed epithelial cells in the lung, and which is differentiate from small-cell lung carcinoma by the larger size of the anaplastic cells, a higher cytoplasmic-to-nuclear size ratio, and a lack of salt-and-pepper appearance of the chromatin.

name: Fractured head of femur
description: A partial or complete breakage of the head of femur.

name: Increased head circumference
description: An abnormally increased head circumference in a growing child. Head circumference is measured with a nonelastic tape and comprises the distance from above the eyebrows and ears and around the back of the head. The measured HC is then plotted on an appropriate growth chart.

name: Small face
description: A face that is short (HP:0011219) and narrow (HP:0000275).
synonyms: ["Facial hypoplasia","Hypoplasia of face","Microface","Microfacies","Short and narrow face","Small face","Small facies"]

name: Multiple small bowel atresias
description: The presence of multiple areas of atresia affecting the small intestine.

name: Airborn particle hypersensitivity
description: An abnormally increased sensitivity to airborn particles. This can be diagnosed on the basis of the medical history, taking into account seasonality or a relationship to the concentration of airborn particles in the environment of the affected individual. Aerosol challenge is a gold standard of establishment of the symptom. There exist particle hypersensitivity (diesel exhaust, metals, inorganic material) vs. allergen (including pollen dander, etc) hypersensitivity. The responses are usually different and testing for allergen hypersensitivity is done in concert with serum IgE and or skin testing to the suspected allergen.

name: Central nervous system cyst
description: A fluid-filled sac (cyst) located within the central nervous system.
synonyms: ["CNS cyst","Cyst of the central nervous system"]

name: Spastic hemiparesis
description: Unilateral paresis (weakness) with spasticity of the affected muscles and increased tendon reflexes.

name: Intrahepatic bile duct cysts
description: The presence of cyst of the intrahepatic bile duct.

name: Increased heart rate variability
description: Increased variation of beat-to-beat intervals of the heart that occurs in conjunction with the respiratory cycle.

name: Solid pulmonary nodule
description: A type of pulmonary nodule whose density obscures the underlying parenchyma and thus has a \"solid\" appearance.

name: Epilepsia partialis continua
description: Epilepsia partialis continua (also called Kojevnikov's or Kozhevnikov's epilepsia) is a type of focal motor status epilepticus characterized by repeated stereotyped simple motor manifestations such as jerks, typically of a limb or the face, recurring every few seconds or minutes for extended periods (days or years).
synonyms: ["Epilepsia partialis continua of Kojevnikov","Kojevnikov's epilepsia","Kozhevnikov's epilepsia"]

name: Moderate hypermetropia
description: A form of hypermetropia with more than +2.00 diopters but not more than +5.00 diopters.

name: Congenital panfollicular nevus
description: A hamartomatous proliferation containing malformed hair follicles in various stages of development. Panfolliculomas are well-circumscribed lesions demonstrating all stages of follicular differentiation.

name: Elevated circulating glutaric acid concentration
description: An increased concentration of glutaric acid in the blood.

name: Enlarged epiphyses of the 2nd finger
description: Abnormally large size of the epiphyses of the 2nd finger with respect to age-dependent norms.
synonyms: ["Enlarged end part of the index finger"]

name: Antidromic atrioventricular reentrant tachycardia
description: A type of atrioventricular reentrant tachycardia (AVRT) where the accessory pathway is used for anterograde conduction and the atrioventricular node for retrograde conduction.

name: Coccidioidal meningitis
description: A type of fungal meningitis caused by dissemination of coccidioides to basilar meninges.

name: Hallux rigidus
description: Osteoarthritis of the metatarsophalangeal joint of the first toe.

name: Inflammatory myopathy
description: Chronic muscle inflammation accompanied by muscle weakness.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the middle phalanx of the 4th finger
synonyms: ["Absent/small middle ring finger bone","Absent/underdeveloped middle ring finger bone"]

name: Obtuse angle of mandible
description: Abnormally flat (obtuse) angle of the mandible. The angle of the mandibular, located at the junction between the body and the ramus of the mandible, is normally close to being a right angle. This terms describes an abnormal increase of this angle such that the mandible appears flatter than normal.
synonyms: ["High mandibular plane angle","Steep mandibular plane angle"]

name: Anti-Tr/DNER antibody
description: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against Tr/DNER. Anti-Tr antibodies are directed against cerebellar Purkinje cells (termed anti-Tr or PCA-Tr). Anti-Tr autoantibodies are frequently associated with Hodgkin lymphoma (HL). Anti-Tr antibodies are defined by a specific staining pattern in cerebellar tissue that is characterized by punctate immunoreactivity in both the dendritic tree and soma of Purkinje cells but not in their axons. This characteristic pattern is indicative of the presence of anti-Tr antibodies. The Delta/Notch-like epidermal growth factor-related receptor (DNER) was identified as the target antigen of anti-Tr.

name: Widened cerebral subarachnoid space
description: An increase in size of the anatomic space between the arachnoid membrane and pia mater in the region surrounding the cerebrum.

name: Focal aware bilateral motor seizure
description: A type of focal bilateral motor seizure during which awareness is fully retained throughout.

name: Overfolding of the superior helices
description: A condition in which the superior portion of the helix is folded over to a greater degree than normal.

name: Maternal hypertension
description: Increased blood pressure during a pregnancy.

name: Elevated circulating glutarylcarnitine concentration
description: Increased concentration of glutarylcarnitine in the blood circulation.
synonyms: ["Elevated circulating O-glutarylcarnitine concentration","Elevated plasma glutarylcarnitine, C5-DC"]

name: Achalasia
description: A disorder of esophageal motility characterized by the inability of the lower esophageal sphincter to relax during swallowing and by inadequate or lacking peristalsis in the lower half of the body of the esophagus.
synonyms: ["Achalasia of the esophagus","Achalasia of the oesophagus"]

name: Unusual fungal infection
description: An unusual fungal infection that is regarded as a sign of a pathological susceptibility to infection by a fungal agent.

name: Lymph node hypoplasia
description: Underdevelopment of the lymph nodes.

name: 3-Methylglutaconic aciduria
description: An increased amount of 3-methylglutaconic acid in the urine.

name: Biliary epithelial hyperplasia
description: Hyperplasia of lining epithelia of the septal and large bile ducts manifesting as micropapillary projections or as a stratification of the epithelium with or without dilatation of the duct lumen.

name: Confluent hyperintensity of cerebral white matter on MRI
description: Areas of brighter than expected MRI signal in the white matter of the brain whereby individual patches run together.

name: Meconium ileus
description: Obstruction of the intestine due to abnormally thick meconium.

name: Specific anosmia
description: Anosmia for one particular odor.

name: Low tissue non-specific alkaline phosphatase
description: An abnormally reduced level of alkaline phosphatase, tissue-nonspecific isozyme in the blood.

name: Abnormal metabolism
description: An abnormality in the function of the chemical reactions related to processes including conversion of food to enter, synthesis of proteins, lipids, nucleic acids, and carbohydrates, or the elimination of waste products.

name: Superior oblique muscle weakness
description: Decreased strength of the superior oblique muscle.

name: Reduced lysosomal acid lipase activity
description: Reduction in the activity of lysosomal acid lipase (LAL) in the blood. Lysosomal lipase activity is measured. LAL hydrolyzes cholesteryl esters derived from cell internalization of plasma lipoproteins.

name: Fractured forearm bones
description: Bone fracture in the radius, ulna, or wrist.
synonyms: ["Broken forearm","Fracture of the forearm","Fractured forearm bones"]

name: Generalized
description: Affecting all regions without specificity of distribution.

name: Silhouette sign
description: The silhouette sign is the absence of depiction of an anatomic soft-tissue border. It is caused by consolidation and/or atelectasis of the adjacent lung, by a large mass, or by contiguous pleural fluid. The silhouette sign results from the juxtaposition of structures of similar radiographic attenuation. The sign actually refers to the absence of a silhouette.

name: Abnormality of masseter muscle
description: An abnormality of a masseter muscle.

name: Abnormality of the middle phalanx of the 2nd toe
synonyms: ["Abnormality of the middle bone of the 2nd toe"]

name: Neuroepithelial neoplasm
description: A neoplasm composed of neural epithelium, not necessarily a neoplasm located in the neural epithelium or neuroepithelium.

name: Past obstetric history
description: Information about past pregnancies including gravidity (number of times a woman has been pregnant, regardless of the outcome), parity (total number of births), gestational age of births, and medical conditions related to past pregnancies.

name: Carotid artery dissection
description: A separation (dissection) of the layers of the carotid artery wall.

name: Elevated urinary N-acetylaspartic acid level
description: Elevated N-acetylaspartic acid (NAA) in urine. This feature can be measured using gas chromatography-mass spectrometry.

name: Right
description: Being located on the right side of the body.

name: Osteopetrosis
description: Abnormally increased formation of dense trabecular bone tissue. Despite the increased density of bone tissue, osteopetrotic bones tend to be more fracture-prone than normal.

name: Mandibular hyperostosis
description: Hyperostosis (bony overgrowth) of the mandible.
synonyms: ["Excessive growth of mandibular bone","Hyperostosis of lower jaw","Hyperostosis of mandibular bone","Increased ossification of mandibular bone","Overgrowth of mandibular bone","Thick lower jaw bone","Thick mandibular bone"]

name: Enlarged pituitary gland
description: An abnormally increased size of the pituitary gland.

name: Trapezoidal vertebral body
description: An anomalous trapezoidal appearance of a vertebral body. A trapezoid is a four-sided shape that has two sides that are parallel and two sides that are not parallel. In this case, the two lateral sides of the vertebra are parallel, and the top and the bottom are slanted with respect to each other such that the vertebra is shorter in the fron or back than on the other side.

name: Decreased red blood cell count
description: An abnormal reduction below the normal number of red blood cells per volume in the circulation.

name: Disseminated intravascular coagulation
description: Disseminated intravascular coagulation is characterized by the widespread activation of coagulation, which results in the intravascular formation of fibrin and ultimately thrombotic occlusion of small and midsize vessels.

name: Fibrotic non-specific interstitial pneumonia
description: A type of non-specific interstitial pneumonia in which interstitial thickening is due to uniform dense or loose fibrosis and mild chronic inflammation.

name: Absent bronchoalveolar dimeric surfactant-protein B
description: Significantly decreased level or failed detection of surfactant protein B in broncho-alveolar lavage fluid.

name: Antegonial notching of mandible
synonyms: ["Deep antegonial notch of mandible","Large antegonial notch of mandible"]

name: Tessier number 30 facial cleft
description: A lower midline facial cleft, also known as the median mandibular cleft. It is a rare anomaly, which may be limited to a defect in the soft tissue of the lower lip. However, in the more severe form, it may extend into the bony mandibular symphysis.

name: Infection-ssociated lymphopenia
description: Decreased lymphocyte count during infections.

name: Fibular metaphyseal irregularity
description: Irregularity of the normally smooth surface of a metaphysis of a fibula.
synonyms: ["Irregularity of wide portion of calf bone"]

name: Volar fingernail
description: The presence of an extra nail on the palmar (volar, ventral) surface of the finger.

name: Preterm intraventricular hemorrhage
description: Intraventricular hemorrhage that occurs in a premature infant.

name: Abnormal glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase level in blood
description: An anomaly in the level of glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase in the blood.

name: Hemangioma
description: A hemangioma is a benign tumor characterized by blood-filled spaces lined by benign endothelial cells. A hemangioma characterized by large endothelial spaces (caverns) is called a cavernous hemangioma (in contrast to a hemangioma with small endothelial spaces, which is called capillary hemangioma).

name: Leydig cell neoplasia
description: The presence of a neoplasm of the testis with origin in a Leydig cell.

name: Prolonged G2 phase of cell cycle
Abnormal glomerular mesangium morphology
description: An abnormality of the mesangium, i.e., of the central part of the renal glomerulus between capillaries.
synonyms: ["Abnormality glomerular mesangium morphology","Abnormality of the glomerular mesangium","Mesangial abnormality"]

name: Progressive microcephaly
description: Progressive microcephaly is diagnosed when the head circumference falls progressively behind age- and gender-dependent norms.
synonyms: ["Microcephaly, postnatal, progressive","Microcephaly, progressive","Progressively abnormally small cranium","Progressively abnormally small skull"]

name: Absent muscle fiber calpain-3
description: Western blot shows complete lack of calpain-3 protein in the muscle biopsy tissue.

name: Abnormal heart valve physiology
description: Any functional abnormality of a cardiac valve.

name: Abnormal factor VIII activity
description: A deviation from the normal activity of coagulation factor VIII. Factor VIII (fVIII) is a cofactor in the intrinsic clotting cascade that is activated to fVIIIa in the presence of minute quantities of thrombin. fVIIIa acts as a receptor, for factors IXa and X.

name: Decreased serum leptin
description: A decreased concentration of leptin in the blood.

name: Medial rotation of the medial malleolus
Abnormal circulating phenylalanine concentration
description: Any deviation from the normal concentration of phenylalanine in the blood circulation.

name: Short iliac bones
description: Underdevelopment of the iliac bones.

name: Cerebral ventricular adhesions
description: Bands of scar-like tisssue that hve formed within a cerebral ventricle.

name: Quotidian fever
description: Fever that occurs at daily intervals.

name: Hypoplasia of the corpus callosum
description: Underdevelopment of the corpus callosum.
synonyms: ["HP:0002319","HP:0007026","Corpus callosum hypoplasia","Hypoplasia of corpus callosum","Hypoplastic corpus callosum","Underdevelopment of part of brain called corpus callosum"]

name: Congenital shortened small intestine
description: Substantially shortened length of the small intestine as a result of a developmental defect.

name: Delayed ossification of the scaphoid
description: Formation of bone tissue of scaphoid is less than expected for age.

name: Abnormality of endocrine pancreas physiology
description: A function abnormality of the endocrine pancreas.

name: Platelet antibody positive
description: The presence in the serum of autoantibodies directed against thrombocytes.

name: Slender middle phalanx of finger
description: Reduced diameter of the middle phalanx of finger.

name: Stippling of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger
description: The presence of abnormal punctate (speckled, dot-like) calcifications in the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger.
synonyms: ["Speckled calcifications in end part of the outermost bone of little finger","Speckled calcifications in end part of the outermost bone of pinkie finger","Speckled calcifications in end part of the outermost bone of pinky finger"]

name: Abnormality of ethmoid sinus
description: An abnormality of an ethmoid sinus.

name: Confluent hypointensity of cerebral white matter on MRI
Lower limb hyperreflexia
synonyms: ["HP:0007245","HP:0007288","Brisk lower extremity reflexes","Hyperreflexia in lower limbs","Hyperreflexia in the lower limbs","Increased deep tendon reflexes in the lower limbs","Leg hyperreflexia","Overactive lower leg reflex"]

name: Abnormal renal tubule morphology
description: An abnormality of the renal tubules.
synonyms: ["Abnormality of the renal tubule","Morphologic abnormality of the renal tubules"]

name: Peripheral retinal atrophy
synonyms: ["Wasting of the outer part of the retina"]

name: Humoral immunodeficiency
description: A general term referring to a defect in immunity resulting from impaired antibody production.

name: Lip fissure
description: A severe crack in a lip. A lip fissure may be painful, may bleed and often is a recurring manifestation.

name: Breast hypoplasia
description: Underdevelopment of the breast.

name: Severe lactic acidosis
description: A severe form of lactic acidemia.

name: Tessier number 11 facial cleft
description: An upper medial orbital cleft produces a cleft of the medial one-third of the upper eyelid that extends through the eyebrow into the frontal hairline. The skeletal element of the cleft in the region of the frontal process of the maxilla may either pass lateral to the ethmoid, through the supraorbital rim, or it may pass through the ethmoidal labyrinth to produce orbital hypertelorism. This cleft usually accompanies the Number 3 cleft. The soft tissue features include a cleft of the medial portion of the upper eyelid, an irregularity in hair orientation at the medial end of the eyebrow, and a long tongue-like projection of the frontal hairline onto the forehead. There is a mild flattening of the frontal process of the maxilla and extensive pneumatization of both the ethmoidal and frontal sinuses, both of which are more prominent on the cleft side. No bony clefting of the supraorbital rim or frontal bone is evident. The cranial base and sphenoid architecture, including the pterygoid processes, are symmetric and normal.

name: Mucinous histiocytosis
description: Multiple subcutaneous non-fragile and skin-coloured papules characterized by interstitial infiltrate of spindle and epithelioid histiocytes, and mucin. There are well circumscribed aggregates of epithelioid histiocytes and mucin in the upper and middle dermis,with the histiocytes arranged between collagen bundles and separated from the epidermis by a Grenz zone.

name: Decreased proportion of gamma-delta T cells
description: Decreased proportion of gamma-delta T cells relative to the total number of T cells.
synonyms: ["Decreased proportion of gamma-delta T lymphocytes","Decreased proportion of gamma-delta T-cells","Decreased proportion of gamma-delta T-lymphocytes","Decreased proportion of gammadelta T cells","Reduced proportion of gamma-delta T cells"]

name: Osteopoikilosis
description: Osteopoikilosis is a benign, asymptomatic sclerotic dysplasia of the bones. It affects both male and female and may be seen at any age. Radiographically sclerotic circular or ovoid lesions are usually symmetrically distributed in a periarticular location. Lesions can increase or decrease in size and number in serial radiographs or even disappear and do not have increased bone radiotracer uptake.

name: Contracture of the distal interphalangeal joint of the 4th toe
description: The distal interphalangeal joint of the 4th toe cannot be straightened actively or passively.

name: Fractured talus
description: A partial or complete breakage of the talus.

name: Ivory epiphysis of the 1st metacarpal
description: The epiphysis of the 1st metacarpal appears hard and dense like ivory. An ivory epiphysis has a uniformly dense appearance on radiographs.
synonyms: ["Increased bone density of end part of the 1st long bone of hand"]

name: Broad distal phalanx of the 5th finger
description: Increased width of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger.
synonyms: ["Broad outermost little finger bone","Broad outermost pinkie finger bone","Broad outermost pinky finger bone","Wide outermost pinky finger bone"]

name: Radioulnar synostosis
description: An abnormal osseous union (fusion) between the radius and the ulna.

name: Dysplastic distal thumb phalanges with a central hole
Bracket epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb
description: An abnormality of the proximal phalanx of the thumb in which the epiphysis surrounds a phalangeal bone, having a bracket-like form and reaching from the proximal side of a phalanx to the distal side.
synonyms: ["Bracket shaped end part of thumb innermost long bone"]

name: Beevor's sign
description: Weakness of the inferior portion of the rectus abdominal muscle, which is ascertained clinically as follows. When a patient sits up or raises the head from a recumbent position, the umbilicus is displaced toward the head. This is the result of paralysis of the inferior portion of the rectus abdominal muscle, so that the upper fibres predominate pulling upwards the umbilicus.

name: Abnormal alpha granule content
description: A deviation from the normal contents of the platelet alpha granules, which normally contain hemostatic proteins such as fibrinogen, von Willebrand factor, and growth factors such as platelet-derived growth factor.

name: Dense posterior cortical cataract
description: A type of posterior cortical cataract characterized by dense lenticular opacities.

name: Chin myoclonus
description: Involuntary and irregular twitches of the chin.

name: Arcuate vein medial/intimal liquefactive necrosis
description: A type of arcuate vein medial/intimal necrosis in which the dead (necrotic) tissue breaks down such that cellular detail is no longer recognized.

name: Heavy proteinuria
description: Severely increased levels of protein in the urine (1000-3000 mg per day in adults).

name: Abnormal circulating inhibin level
description: Any deviation from the normal concentration of inhibins, which are heterodimeric protein hormones secreted by granulosa cells of the ovary in females and Sertoli cells of the testis in males. Inhibins suppress the secretion of pituitary follicle-stimulating hormone.

name: Hypometric saccades
description: Saccadic undershoot, i.e., a saccadic eye movement that has less than the magnitude that would be required to gain fixation of the object.

name: Myxomatous mitral valve degeneration
description: Myxomatous mitral valve is defined as the presence of excess leaflet tissue and leaflet thickening greater than 5 mm, resulting in a prolapse greater than 2 mm into the left atrium on parasternal long axis view.

name: Stomatocytosis
description: The presence of erythrocytes with a mouth-shaped (stoma) area of central pallor on peripheral blood smear.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia involving bones of the thorax
Microgastria
description: A developmental anomaly wtih a small tubular or saccular midline stomach.

name: Death in adulthood
description: Cessation of life at the age of 16 years or later.

name: Malrotation of small bowel
description: A deviation from the normal rotation of the midgut during embryologic development with mislocalization of the small bowel.

name: Focal aware sensory seizure with gustatory features
description: A seizure characterized by taste phenomena including acidic, bitter, salty, sweet, or metallic tastes.

name: Blebbing of apical cytoplasm of renal tubular epithelial cells
description: Tubular cross section with round/irregular cytoplasmic protrusion, shaped like the Greek capital letter Omega (or it may be more vertically elongated Omega), pinched off from apical membrane without apparent closure of the lumen, involving over 50 percent of the tubular cells in cross section. The feature can be further classified into proximal or distal tubule.

name: Absent epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 4th finger
description: Absence of the epiphysis located at the proximal end of the proximal phalanx of the 4th finger.
synonyms: ["Absent end part of the innermost bone of the ring finger"]

name: Bifid proximal phalanx of the thumb
description: This term applies if the proximal phalanx of the thumb is partially duplicated. Depending on the severity, the appearance on x-ray can vary from a notched phalanx (the duplicated bone is almost completely fused with the phalanx) to a partially fused appearance of the two bones. In contrast to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5, the proximal phalanx of the thumb is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits.

name: Decreased proportion of central memory CD8-positive, alpha-beta T cells
description: A reduced proportion of CD8-positive, alpha-beta central memory T cells compared to the total number of T cells in the blood. These cells have the phenotype CCR7-negative, CD127-positive, CD45RA-negative, CD45RO-positive, and CD25-negative.

name: Vertebral hypoplasia
description: Small, underdeveloped vertebral bodies.

name: Elevated maternal serum alpha-fetoprotein
description: An elevation of alpha-feto protein in the maternal serum.

name: Anti-mitochondrial M2 antibody positivity
description: The presence of M2 anti-mitochondrial antibody (immunoglobulins) in the serum.

name: Elevated circulating cartilage oligomeric matrix protein concentration
description: An increased blood concentration of cartilage oligomeric matrix protein (COMP).

name: Prostatitis
description: The presence of inflammation of the prostate.

name: Progressive gait ataxia
description: A type of gait ataxia displaying progression of clinical severity.

name: Multifocal hyperintensity of cerebral white matter on MRI
description: An abnormal area of increased brightness (hyperintensity) that occurs in several distinct areas.

name: History of bone marrow transplant
description: A past medical history of hematopoietic stem cell transplantation involving myeloablative chemoradiotherapy followed by stem cell rescue with autologous or human leukocyte antigen (HLA)-matched stem cells derived from a donor.
synonyms: ["Status post haematopoietic stem cell transplantation","Status post hematopoietic stem cell transplantation"]

name: Long penis
description: Penile length more than 2 SD above the mean for age.

name: Paraganglioma
description: A carotid body tumor (also called paraganglionoma or chemodectoma) is a tumor found in the upper neck at the branching of the carotid artery. They arise from the chemoreceptor organ (paraganglion) located in the adventitia of the carotid artery bifurcation.

name: Neuroma
description: A tumor made up of nerve cells and nerve fibers.

name: Ovotestis
description: A gonad that contains both ovarian follicles and testicular tubular elements.

name: Abnormal amyloid beta 42 peptide CSF concentration
description: Any deviation from the normal concentration of amyloid beta 42 peptide in the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF). Amyloid beta is a peptide of 36-43 amino acids that is processed from the Amyloid precursor protein. ABeta42, which is 42 amino acids in length, is the longer form.

name: Hallucinations
description: Perceptions in a conscious and awake state in the absence of external stimuli which have qualities of real perception, in that they are vivid, substantial, and located in external objective space.

name: Abnormal ocular alignment
description: Any deviation from the normal ocular alignment.

name: Focal emotional seizure
description: Seizures presenting with an emotion or the appearance of having an emotion as an early prominent feature, such as fear, spontaneous joy or euphoria, laughing (gelastic), or crying, (dacrystic). These emotional seizures may occur with or without objective clinical signs of a seizure evident to the observer.
synonyms: ["Affective seizure","Emotional seizure","Focal affective seizure","Partial emotional seizure"]

name: Muscle hemorrhage
description: Bleeding occuring within a muscle

name: Short 4th toe
description: Underdevelopment (hypoplasia) of the fourth toe.

name: Abnormality of the epiphyses of the 2nd finger
description: Abnormality of one or all of the epiphyses of the proximal, middle, and distal phalanges of the 2nd finger.
synonyms: ["Abnormality of the end part of the index finger bone"]

name: Increased circulating beta-C-terminal telopeptide level
description: A abnormal elevation above the normal concentration of beta-C-terminal telopeptide of type I collagen in the blood circulation.
synonyms: ["Increased circulating beta-CrossLaps level","Increased circulating beta-CTx level"]

name: Overjet
description: An abnormal anteroposterior extension of the maxillary teeth beyond the plane of the mandibular teeth upon jaw closure.
synonyms: ["Abnormality of horizontal incisor relationship","Protrusion of upper teeth in front of lower teeth"]

name: Increased proportion of memory T cells
description: An abnormally elevated proportion of memory T cells compared to the total number of T cells in the blood.

name: Joint contracture of the 4th finger
description: Chronic loss of joint motion in the 4th finger due to structural changes in non-bony tissue. The term camptodactyly of the 4th finger is used if the distal and/or proximal interphalangeal joints are affected.

name: Limb hypertonia
synonyms: ["Increased muscle tone of arm or leg"]

name: Urinary space collagenization
description: Acellular collagenous matrix within Bowman's space, not associated with extracapillary hypercellularity or necrosis, associated with sclerosis or deflation of the tuft.

name: Morphological abnormality of the lateral semicircular canal
synonyms: ["Morphological abnormality of the horizontal semicircular canal"]

name: Blood group
description: Any of the various types of human blood whose antigen characteristics determine compatibility in transfusion. While the ABO and Rhesus sytems are the most well known, there are in total about 300 different blood type antigens distributed across 34 different blood type systems.

name: Abnormal urinary odor
description: A deviation from the normal odor of the urine.
synonyms: ["Abnormal urinary odor","Abnormal urinary odour","Abnormal urine smell"]

name: Foot osteomyelitis
description: An infection of bone of the foot.

name: Elevated leukocyte alkaline phosphatase
description: Increased alkaline phosphatase measured within leukocytes.

name: Cone-shaped epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the hallux
synonyms: ["Cone-shaped end part of the innermost bone of the big toe"]

name: Abnormal cellular physiology
description: An abnormality in a cellular process.

name: Abnormal circulating carnosine concentration
description: Any deviation from the normal concentration of carnosine in the blood circulation.

name: Abnormality of the epiphysis of the middle phalanx of the 3rd toe
synonyms: ["Abnormality of the end part of the middle bone of the 3rd toe"]

name: Increased proportion of plasmablasts
description: An elevation above the normal proportion of plasmablasts in circulation relative to total number of B cells.

name: Distal ulnar hypoplasia
description: Underdevelopment of the distal portion of the ulna.

name: Abnormality of vitamin K metabolism
description: Vitamin K is a fat-soluble vitamin with a role in promoting the coagulation cascade.

name: Abnormal 3rd finger morphology
description: An anomaly of the third finger.
synonyms: ["Abnormality of the 3rd finger","Abnormality of the middle finger"]

name: Broad distal phalanx of the hallux
description: An increase in width of the distal phalanx of the big toe.
synonyms: ["Broad outermost bone of big toe","Wide outermost bone of big toe"]

name: Iris hypopigmentation
description: An abnormal reduction in the amount of pigmentation of the iris.
synonyms: ["Light eye color","Light eye colour","Reduced iris pigmentation"]

name: Combined cystic and ground-glass pattern on pulmonary HRCT
description: Co-occurrence of the cystic pattern and the ground-glass pattern on pulmonary high-resolution computed tomography,

name: Gastric ulcer
description: An ulcer, that is, an erosion of an area of the gastric mucous membrane.

name: Early ossification of capital femoral epiphyses
description: Developmental acceleration of ossification of the proximal epiphysis of the femur.

name: Irregular epiphyses of the middle phalanges of the hand
synonyms: ["Irregular end part of middle hand bones"]

name: Foot asymmetry
description: A difference in size or shape between the left and right foot.

name: Mucin casts
description: A type of airway casts that consist of impacted mucus.

name: Focal pedal automatism seizure
description: A type of focal automatism seizure characterized by coordinated bilateral or unilateral movements of the feet or legs at onset. The movement is more reminiscent of normal movements in amplitude, and is less frenetic or rapid in comparison to the movements seen in focal hyperkinetic seizures involving the legs.

name: Vibratory urticaria
description: Urticaria in response to dermal vibration, with coincident degranulation of mast cells and increased histamine levels in serum.

name: Lack of facial subcutaneous fat
synonyms: ["Lack of facial fat below the skin"]

name: Interlobular vein medial atrophy
description: Atrophy (wasting, decreased thickness) of the medial layer pf the interlobular veins of the kidney.

name: Urinary excretion of sialylated oligosaccharides
description: Excretion of oligosaccharides conjugated to sialic acid in the urine.

name: Complete duplication of the middle phalanx of the 5th toe
description: Complete duplication of the middle phalanx of the 5th toe.
synonyms: ["Complete duplication of the middle bone of the little toe","Complete duplication of the middle bone of the pinkie toe","Complete duplication of the middle bone of the pinky toe","Complete duplication of the middle phalanx of the fifth toe"]

name: Nevus flammeus nuchae
description: Naevus flammeus localised in the skin of the neck. This is one of the most common birthmarks and present in approximately 25% of all newborns.

name: Preductal coarctation of the aorta
description: Narrowing or constriction of the aorta localized proximal to the ductus arteriosus, i.e., to the preductal region of aortic arch.

name: Aplasia of lymphatic vessels
description: Aplasia (absence) of the lymphatic vessels.

name: Lateral displacement of the femoral head
description: A developmental anomaly with lateral displacement of the femoral head.

name: Crohn's disease
description: A chronic granulomatous inflammatory disease of the intestines that may affect any part of the gastrointestinal tract from mouth to anus, causing a wide variety of symptoms. It primarily causes abdominal pain, diarrhea which may be bloody, vomiting, or weight loss, but may also cause complications outside of the gastrointestinal tract such as skin rashes, arthritis, inflammation of the eye, tiredness, and lack of concentration. Crohn's disease is thought to be an autoimmune disease, in which the body's immune system attacks the gastrointestinal tract, causing inflammation.

name: Floppy eyelid
description: Excessive eyelid tissue laxity, typically affecting both upper eyelids and associated with spontanteous tarsal eversion during sleep. It is more common in the obese, it may be associated with obstructive sleep apnea and it may result in corneal exposure or chronic papillary conjunctivitis.

name: Functional abnormality of male internal genitalia
Severe infection
description: A type of infection that is regarded as a sign of a pathological susceptibility to infection because of unusual severity or intensity of the infection.

name: Transposition of the great arteries
description: A complex congenital heart defect in which the aorta arises from the morphologic right ventricle and the pulmonary artery arises from the morphologic left ventricle.

name: Moderate proteinuria
description: Moderately increased levels of protein in the urine (500-1000 mg per day in adults).

name: Plant based food allergy
description: Hypersensitivity in form of an adverse immune reaction against plant based food allergens.
synonyms: ["Allergy to plant based food allergens","IgE-mediated plant based food allergen allergy","Immunoglobulin E-mediated plant based food allergen allergy","Plant based food allergy"]

name: Abnormality of tensor veli palatini muscle
description: An abnormality of the tensor veli palatini muscle

name: Patchy sclerosis of the middle phalanx of the 5th toe
description: Uneven increase in bone density of the middle phalanx of the fifth toe. This can take on many forms depending on severity and distribution as can be seen on x-rays.
synonyms: ["Uneven increase in bone density in the middle bone of the little toe","Uneven increase in bone density in the middle bone of the pinkie toe","Uneven increase in bone density in the middle bone of the pinky toe"]

name: Atrophy of alveolar ridges
synonyms: ["Atrophy of alveolar margins","Atrophy of alveolar processes of jaw","Resorption of alveolar margins","Resorption of alveolar processes of jaw","Resorption of alveolar ridges","Shrinking of alveolar ridges","Shrinking of gum ridges"]

name: Iliac horns
description: Horn-like malformations of the iliac crests with symmetrical bilateral central posterior iliac processes. A characteristic finding in the Nail-Patella syndrome. Iliac horns are visible on X-ray and may be palpable, but are asymptomatic.

name: Increased hepatitis B virus antibody level
description: An abnormally increased level of immunoglobulin against hepatitis B virus in the blood.

name: Abnormal echocardiogram
description: An abnormality detectable by sonography of the heart (echocardiography).

name: Decreased anterioposterior diameter of lumbar vertebral bodies
Abnormal circulating hormone concentration
description: An abnormal concentration of a hormone in the blood.
synonyms: ["Abnormal circulating hormone level","Abnormality of circulating hormone level"]

name: Cochlear malformation
description: The presence of a malformed cochlea.

name: Type II pneumocyte hypertrophy
description: Increase in size of type II pneumocytes, characterized by qualitative morphologic alterations, including cuboidal shapes, increased nucleocytoplasmic ratio, enlarged nuclei, prominent nucleoli, and various alterations in their nuclear chromatin.
synonyms: ["Hypertrophic alveolar type II cells","Hypertrophic alveolar type II pneumocytes"]

name: High hypermetropia
description: A severe form of hypermetropia with over +5.00 diopters.

name: Corner fracture of metaphysis
description: Fracture or fragmentation at the lateral portion of the metaphysis of a long bone. The radiographic appearance is that of a small corner of metaphysis separated from the metaphyseal edge by thin linear radiolucency. This feature can be observed in child abuse but fragmented appearance of the metaphysis or facture-like lesions can also be detected in the setting of certain skeletal dysplasias.

name: Induced vaginal delivery
description: Vaginal delivery following induction of labor, a procedure used to stimulate uterine contractions during pregnancy before labor begins on its own.

name: Spinal cord posterior columns myelin loss
Abnormal left ventricular function
description: Inability of the left ventricle to perform its normal physiologic function. Failure is either due to an inability to contract the left ventricle or the inability to relax completely and fill with blood during diastole.
synonyms: ["HP:0005154","Impaired left ventricular function","Left ventricular dysfunction","Left ventricular failure","Left ventricular impairment","Left-sided heart failure"]

name: Odontogenic neoplasm
description: Neoplasm involving odontogenic cells, an odontogenic tumor.

name: Abnormality of thyroid physiology
description: An abnormal functionality of the thyroid gland.

name: Porokeratosis
description: A clonal disorder of keratinization with one or multiple atrophic patches surrounded by a clinically and histologically distinctive hyperkeratotic ridgelike border called the cornoid lamella.

name: Dural tail sign
description: This sign represents thickening and enhancement of the dura mater in continuity with a mass, which on MR images, gives the appearance of a tail arising from the mass. The dural tail is thought to represent reactive change; however, it may also be due to tumor invasion. Three criteria need to be met for a positive dural tail sign: the tail should be seen on two successive images through the tumor, it should taper away from the tumor, and it must enhance more than the tumor.

name: Joint stiffness
description: Joint stiffness is a perceived sensation of tightness in a joint or joints when attempting to move them after a period of inactivity. Joint stiffness typically subsides over time.

name: Tryptophanuria
description: An increased concentration of tryptophan in the urine.

name: Autosomal dominant inheritance with paternal imprinting
description: A type of autosomal dominant inheritance involving a gene that is imprinted with paternal silencing.

name: Abnormality of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger
synonyms: ["HP:0004127","Epiphyseal abnormality of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger"]

name: Complete duplication of the distal phalanx of the 3rd toe
description: Complete duplication of distal phalanx of third toe.
synonyms: ["Complete duplication of the distal phalanx of the third toe","Complete duplication of the outermost bone of the 3rd toe"]

name: Right unilambdoid synostosis
description: Premature synostosis of only the right lambdoid suture.

name: Abnormality of the cell cycle
description: An abnormality of the cell cycle.

name: Decreased urinary 3-methylhistidine
description: Decreased concentration of 3-methylhistidine in the urine.

name: Morbilliform rash
description: An exanthema consisting of widespread pink-to-red macules (flat spots of 2-10 mm in diameter) or papules (red bumps) that blanch with pressure. The macules and papules may cluster and merge to form sheets over several days.

name: Back pain
description: An unpleasant sensation characterized by physical discomfort (such as pricking, throbbing, or aching) localized to the back.

name: Abnormal response to human chorionic gonadotrophin stimulation test
description: An anomalous response to intravenous stimulation by human chorionic gonadotrophin. Stimulation with hCG stimulates testicular Leydig cells to secrete androgens via the Leydig hormone receptors.

name: Achlorhydria
description: A condition in which production of hydrochloric acid in the stomach is absent.

name: Long middle phalanx of finger
description: Increased length of the middle phalanx of finger.

name: Abnormal peristalsis
description: An anomaly of the wave-like muscle contractions of the digestive tract.

name: Abnormality of muscle of facial expression
description: An abnormality of any of the muscles of facial expression, which are innervated by the seventh (VII) cranial nerve and control facial expression.
synonyms: ["Abnormality of muscle of facial expression","Abnormality of musculature of facial expression"]

name: Widened greater sciatic notch
description: The sacroiliac joint in the bony pelvis connects the sacrum and the ilium of the pelvis, which are joined by strong ligaments. The notch is located directly superior to the joint. This term refers to a increase in the lateral dimension of the notch.
synonyms: ["HP:0010457","Widened sacrosciatic notch","Widening of the sacrosciatic notch"]

name: Clinodactyly of the 2nd toe
description: Bending or curvature of a second toe in the tibial direction (i.e., towards the big toe).

name: Scleritis
description: Inflammation of the sclera.
synonyms: ["Inflammation of the outer white part of the eye"]

name: Varicose veins
description: Enlarged and tortuous veins.

name: Ectropion
description: An outward turning (eversion) or rotation of the eyelid margin.

name: Cheyne-Stokes respiration
description: An abnormal pattern of respiration characterized by cycles of respiration that are increasingly deeper then shallower with possible periods of apnea. Affected patients may display a 10 to 20 second episode of hypoventilation or apnea, followed by respiration of increased depth and frequency over the course of about one minute. The cycle repeats every 45 seconds to 3 minutes.

name: Foveal depigmentation
description: Loss of pigment in the fovea centralis.

name: Abnormal urine carbohydrate level
description: Any deviation from the normal concentration of a carbohydrate in the urine.

name: Cutaneous melanoma
description: The presence of a melanoma of the skin.

name: Anti-H4 antibody positivity
description: The presence of autoantibodies in the blood circulation that react against histone H4.

name: Perilymphatic
description: Applies to an abnormality whose distribution and appearance are located at or near lymphatic structures (node or vessel).

name: Increased HDL2b concentration
description: An elevation above the normal concentration of the HDL2b subfraction in the blood circulation. An HDL2b particle is defined as an HDL particle with a size of 9.7-12 nm.

name: Intellectual disability
description: Subnormal intellectual functioning which originates during the developmental period. Intellectual disability, previously referred to as mental retardation, has been defined as an IQ score below 70.
synonyms: ["HP:0000730","HP:0001267","HP:0001286","HP:0002122","HP:0002192","HP:0002316","HP:0002382","HP:0002386","HP:0002402","HP:0002458","HP:0002482","HP:0002499","HP:0002543","HP:0003767","HP:0006833","HP:0006877","HP:0007154","HP:0007176","HP:0007180","Intellectual disability","Mental deficiency","Mental retardation","Mental retardation, nonspecific","Mental-retardation","Nonprogressive intellectual disability","Nonprogressive mental retardation"]

name: Hypoplastic anterior commissure
description: Underdevelopment of the anterior commissure.

name: Phantageusia
description: A form of altered taste sensation in which the affected person perceives a taste, usually an unpleasant one, in the absence of a corresponding stimulus in the environment.

name: Duplication of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd toe
description: Partial or complete duplication of proximal phalanx of second toe.
synonyms: ["Duplication of innermost 2nd toe bone","Duplication of the proximal phalanx of the second toe","Partial/complete duplication of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd toe"]

name: Elevated circulating erythropoietin concentration
description: Increased amount of erythropoietin in the blood circulation. Erythropoietin is a glycoprotein hormone produced by the peritubular cells of the kidney that stimulates red blood cell production.

name: Sclerosis of the middle phalanx of the 2nd finger
synonyms: ["Increased bone density in the middle bone of the index finger"]

name: Follicular thyroid carcinoma
description: The presence of an follicular adenocarcinoma of the thyroid gland.

name: Tooth malposition
description: Abnormal alignment, positioning, or spacing of the teeth, i.e., misaligned teeth.
synonyms: ["HP:0000693","HP:0001569","HP:0006303","HP:0006478","Abnormal dental position","Abnormal teeth spacing","Abnormality of alignment of teeth","Abnormality of position of teeth","Abnormality of teeth spacing","Crooked teeth","Malaligned teeth","Malposition of teeth","Malpositioned teeth","Misalignment of teeth","Teeth, malposition"]

name: Aplasia of the sweat glands
description: Absence of the sweat glands.

name: Central fundal arteriolar microaneurysms
description: Microscopic aneurysms of the retinal arterioles near the central part of the fundus, visible as small round dark red dots on the retinal surface (not arising from visible vessels) that are by definition less than the diameter of the major optic veins as they cross the optic disc.

name: Sternocleidomastoid amyotrophy
description: Wasting of the sternocleidomastoid muscle, the muscle in the anterior part of the neck that acts to flex and rotate the head.

name: Anti-GT1a IgG antibody positivity
description: The presence of IgG autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against T1a ganglioside.

name: Generalized clonic seizure
description: Generalized clonic seizure is a type of generalized motor seizure characterised by sustained bilateral jerking, either symmetric or asymmetric, that is regularly repetitive and involves the same muscle groups.
synonyms: ["Generalised clonic seizure","Generalised clonic seizures","Generalised onset clonic seizure","Generalised-onset clonic seizure","Generalized clonic seizures","Generalized onset clonic seizure","Generalized-onset clonic seizure"]

name: Sclerosis of the distal phalanx of the 5th toe
synonyms: ["Increased bone density in the outermost bone of the little toe","Increased bone density in the outermost bone of the pinkie toe","Increased bone density in the outermost bone of the pinky toe"]

name: Osteosclerosis of ribs
description: Osteosclerosis of ribs (increased density related to increased bone mass).

name: Facial hirsutism
description: Excess facial hair.

name: Chronic furunculosis
description: A furuncle (boil) is a skin infection involving an entire hair follicle and nearby skin tissue. Chronic furunculosis refers to recurrent episodes of furuncles, often caused by recurrent staphylococcus infection.

name: Mydriasis
description: Abnormal dilatation of the iris.

name: Transphyseal fracture of the distal humerus
description: A fracture through the distal humeral physis that separates the entire distal humeral epiphysis from the metaphysis.

name: Mongolian blue spot
description: Congenital deep dermal melanosis in the sacral area.

name: Chiari malformation
description: Chiari malformation consists of a downward displacement of the cerebellar tonsils and the medulla through the foramen magnum, sometimes causing hydrocephalus as a result of obstruction of CSF outflow.

name: Dermal atrophy
description: Partial or complete wasting (atrophy) of the skin.

name: Pelvic girdle amyotrophy
description: Atrophy of the muscles of the pelvic girdle (also known as hip girdle), i.e., the gluteal muscles, the lateral rotators, the adductors, the psoas major and the iliacus muscle.

name: 3-4 finger syndactyly
description: Syndactyly with fusion of fingers three and four.
synonyms: ["HP:0006133","Partial or complete syndactyly 3rd-4th fingers","Webbed 3rd-4th finger","Webbed 3rd-4th fingers"]

name: Proximal tapering of metacarpals
description: Some or all of the metacarpal bones (i.e., metacarpal II to V) have a pointed proximal appearance.
synonyms: ["Pointed innermost long bone of hand","Pointed proximal metacarpals"]

name: Bullet-shaped proximal phalanx of the thumb
description: Bullet-shaped phalanx refers to a short and wide phalanx that tapers distally. Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction. This term is used if the proximal phalanx of the thumb is affected.

name: Exercise induced anaphylaxis
description: Anaphylaxis after physical activity.

name: Everted lower lip vermilion
description: An abnormal configuration of the lower lip such that it is turned outward i.e., everted, with the Inner aspect of the lower lip vermilion (normally opposing the teeth) being visible in a frontal view.
synonyms: ["HP:0000184","HP:0002264","HP:0002712","HP:0004665","HP:0009086","HP:0009093","Drooping lower lip","Eclabium of lower lip","Everted lower lip","Everted prominent lower lip","Outward turned lower lip"]

name: Single interphalangeal crease of fifth finger
description: Presence of only one (instead of two, as normal) interphalangeal crease of the fifth finger.

name: Very frequent
description: Present in 80% to 99% of the cases.

name: Abnormal renal glomerulus morphology
description: A structural anomaly of the glomerulus.
synonyms: ["Abnormality of renal glomerulus morphology","Morphologic abnormality of the renal glomerulus"]

name: Partial duplication of the middle phalanx of the 5th finger
description: Partial duplication of the fifth middle phalanx of hand, seen on x-rays as a broad and/or bifid phalanx.
synonyms: ["Partial duplication of the middle little finger bone","Partial duplication of the middle pinkie finger bone","Partial duplication of the middle pinky finger bone"]

name: Abnormality of the outer ear
description: An abnormality of the external ear.
synonyms: ["HP:0001752","Abnormal pinnae","Abnormality of the auricle","Abnormality of the external ear","Abnormality of the outer ear","Ear anomalies","External ear malformations","Malformed pinnae","Outer ear abnormality"]

name: Decreased circulating aldosterone level
description: Abnormally reduced levels of aldosterone.
synonyms: ["HP:0000355","HP:0002924","HP:0008184","HP:0008190","Decreased aldosterone","Decreased aldosterone production","Decreased serum aldosterone","Hypoaldosteronism","Low blood aldosterone level","Mineralocorticoid insufficiency"]

name: Abnormal tricuspid chordae tendinae morphology
description: Any structural anomaly of the chordae tendinae of the tricuspid valve. The chordae tendineae connect the papillary muscles to the tricuspid valve.

name: Abnormal reproductive system morphology
description: A structural or developmental anomaly of any of the tissues involved in the genital system.

name: Anti-Sm antibody positivity
description: The presence of autoantibodies in the serum that react to seven proteins that consist of a core of small nuclear ribonucleoprotein (snRNP) particles.

name: Pica
description: An appetite for and the persistent ingestion of non-food substances such as clay. In order to diagnose pica, this behavior must have persisted over a period of at least one month.

name: Webbed penis
description: Ventral skinfold extending from penis to scrotum.

name: Ameliorated by pregnancy
description: Applies to a sign or symptom that is improved or made more bearable by pregnancy in a female.

name: Nephroblastomatosis
description: Presence of persistent islands of renal blastema in the postnatal kidney. Nephroblastomatosis represents a complex abnormality of nephrogenesis and has been defined as the persistence of metanephricblastema into infancy and childhood.

name: Generalized muscle hypertrophy
description: Hypertrophy (increase in size) of muscle cells in a generalized (not localized) distribution.
synonyms: ["Generalised increase in muscle cell size","Generalised muscle hypertrophy","Generalized increase in muscle cell size"]

name: Abnormal urine citrate concentration
description: A deviation from normal of the concentration of citrate(3-) in the urine.
synonyms: ["Abnormal urine citrate concentration","Abnormal urine citric acid concentration"]

name: Renal interstitial calcium phosphate deposits
description: The presence of interstitial aggregates of purple finely granular/laminated calcium- and phosphate deposits.

name: Coronary artery dissection
description: Acute occurrence of a dissection (tear within the tunica intima and entry of blood into the tunica media) of a coronary artery.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the tongue
description: Absence or underdevelopment of the tongue.

name: Cerebral calcification
description: The presence of calcium deposition within brain structures.
synonyms: ["HP:0002502","HP:0005806","HP:0006848","Abnormal deposits of calcium in the brain","Brain calcification","Intracerebral calcifications","Intracranial calcification","Intracranial calcifications"]

name: Elevated serum transaminases during infections
description: Elevations of the levels of SGOT (serum glutamic oxaloacetic transaminase) and SGPT (serum glutamic pyruvic transaminase) that occur during infections.

name: Oral melanotic macule
description: Flat, distinct, discolored area of oral mucosal membrane less than 1 cm wide not associated with a change in the thickness or texture of the affected mucosal membrane. The lesions are small, solitary, well-circumscribed and often uniformly pigmented.

name: Abnormal fetal morphology
description: Any structural anomaly of the fetus.

name: Triggered by dehydration
description: Applies to a sign or symptom that is provoked or brought about by being dehydrated, i.e., by a deficit in total body water.

name: 3-5 toe syndactyly
description: Syndactyly with fusion of toes three to five.

name: Broad distal phalanx of the thumb
description: Increased width of the distal phalanx of thumb.
