synonyms: ["HP:0004088","HP:0006198","Broad outermost bone of the thumb","Broad terminal thumb phalanx","Wide distal phalanx of thumb","Wide outermost bone of thumb"]

name: Spinal arachnoid cyst
description: Presence of arachnoid cysts of the spinal canal extradurally in the epidural space.
synonyms: ["Epidural arachnoid cysts of the spinal canal"]

name: Sparse lateral eyebrow
description: Decreased density/number and/or decreased diameter of lateral eyebrow hairs.
synonyms: ["HP:0004521","HP:0009923","Lateral hypoplasia of eyebrows","Lateral thinning of eyebrows","Laterally sparse eyebrow","Laterally sparse eyebrows","Limited hair on end of eyebrow"]

name: Extreme axis deviation
description: A kind of abnormal ventricular axis in the EKG whereby the QRS axis fall sbetween -90 degrees and 180 degrees. In this case, the ventricular vector is directed upward and to the right.

name: Coloboma
description: A developmental defect characterized by a cleft of some portion of the eye or ocular adnexa.

name: Paradoxical respiration
description: Breathing movements in which the chest wall moves in on inspiration and out on expiration, in reverse of the normal movements. It may be seen in children with respiratory distress of any cause, which leads to indrawing of the intercostal spaces during inspiration. Patients with chronic airways obstruction also show indrawing of the lower ribs during inspiration, due to the distorted action of a depressed and flattened diaphragm. Crush injuries of the chest, with fractured ribs and sternum, can lead to a severe degree of paradoxical breathing.

name: Frontalis muscle weakness
description: Reduced strength of the frontalis muscle (which is located on the forehead).

name: Optic nerve arteriovenous malformation
description: An arteriovenous malformation is a disruption of the normal vascular pattern in which arteries or arterioles connect directly to the venous collection system, bypassing any capillary bed. This term refers to an arteriovenous malformation located in the optic nerve.

name: Abnormal fecal osmolality
description: Abnormal concentration of feces as assessed by the total number of solute particles per kilogram.

name: Elevated circulating creatine kinase concentration
description: An elevation of the level of the enzyme creatine kinase (also known as creatine phosphokinase, CPK; EC 2.7.3.2) in the blood. CPK levels can be elevated in a number of clinical disorders such as myocardial infarction, rhabdomyolysis, and muscular dystrophy.
synonyms: ["HP:0002147","HP:0002906","HP:0003078","HP:0003525","HP:0003531","HP:0008164","Elevated blood creatine phosphokinase","Elevated circulating creatine phosphokinase","Elevated creatine kinase","Elevated serum CPK","Elevated serum creatine kinase","Elevated serum creatine phosphokinase","High serum creatine kinase","Increased CPK","Increased creatine kinase","Increased creatine phosphokinase","Increased serum CK","Increased serum creatine kinase","Increased serum creatine phosphokinase"]

name: Osteoarthritis
description: Degeneration (wear and tear) of articular cartilage, i.e., of the joint surface. Joint degeneration may be accompanied by osteophytes (bone overgrowth), narrowing of the joint space, regions of sclerosis at the joint surface, or joint deformity.

name: Beta-aminoisobutyric aciduria
description: An increased amount of beta-aminoisobutyric acid in the urine. Beta-aminoisobutyric acid is a non-protein amino acid originating from the catabolism of thymine and valine.

name: Subepidermal blistering with cleavage in the lamina lucida
description: The formation of bullae (blisters) with cleavage in the lamina lucida layer of the skin.
synonyms: ["Blistering with junctional split","Junctional split","Subepidermal blistering with cleavage in the lamina lucida"]

name: Posterior embryotoxon
description: A posterior embryotoxon is the presence of a prominent and anteriorly displaced line of Schwalbe.

name: Abnormal vas deferens morphology
description: A structural anomaly of the secretory duct of the testicle that carries spermatozoa from the epididymis to the prostatic urethra where it terminates to form ejaculatory duct.

name: Pseudoepiphyses of second metacarpal
synonyms: ["HP:0010221","Extra bone on end of second long bone of hand","Pseudoepiphysis of the 2nd metacarpal"]

name: Erythema migrans
description: An expanding erythematous (red) skin lesion, usually round or oval, by definition at least 5 cm in size (in largest diameter).

name: Hypoplastic left heart
description: Underdevelopment of the left side of the heart. May include atresia of the aortic or mitral orifice and hypoplasia of the ascending aorta.
synonyms: ["Heart left ventricle hypoplasia","Left ventricular hypoplasia","Underdeveloped left heart"]

name: Abnormality of the epiphyses of the 5th toe
synonyms: ["Abnormality of the end part of the little toe bone","Abnormality of the end part of the pinkie toe bone","Abnormality of the end part of the pinky toe bone"]

name: Metabolic acidosis
description: Metabolic acidosis (MA) is characterized by a fall in blood pH due to a reduction of serum bicarbonate concentration. This can occur as a result of either the accumulation of acids (high anion gap MA) or the loss of bicarbonate from the gastrointestinal tract or the kidney (hyperchloremic MA). By definition, MA is not due to a respirary cause.

name: Anal mucosal leukoplakia
description: Leukoplakia is a precancerous dermatosis of mucous membranes analogous Leukoplakia is basically a chronic inflammatory hypertrophy in which anaplasia and malignant dyskeratosis may develop and subsequently advance to an invasive squamous cell cancer. The clinical diagnosis of primary anal leukoplakia is indicated by single or multiple slightly raised,irregular, marginated, grayish-white keratinized' patches in the anal canal. Tissue biopsy is necessary for confirmation.

name: Recurrent gram-negative bacterial infections
description: Increased susceptibility to infection by gram-negative bacteria, as manifested by a medical history of repeated or frequent infections by these agents.

name: Abnormal monocyte count
description: An anomaly in the number of monocytes, which are myeloid mononuclear recirculating leukocyte that can act as a precursor of tissue macrophages, osteoclasts and some populations of tissue dendritic cells.

name: Abnormality of spinal facet joint
description: An anomaly of the small joints located between and behind adjacent vertebrae.
synonyms: ["Abnormality of apophyseal joint","Abnormality of Z-joint","Abnormality of zygapophyseal joint","Abnormality of zygapophysial joint"]

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia involving the nose
description: Underdevelopment or absence of the nose or parts thereof.

name: Abnormal sternum morphology
description: An anomaly of the sternum, also known as the breastbone.
synonyms: ["HP:0000780","HP:0006586","HP:0006594","HP:0006605","HP:0006630","HP:0006708","Abnormality of the sternum","Pectus carinatum or pectus excavatum","Pectus deformities","Pectus deformity","Pectus excavatum or carinatum","Pectus excavatum or pectus carinatum","Pectus excavatum/carinatum","Sternal anomalies"]

name: Uhl's anomaly
description: Uhl anomaly of the right ventricle refers to the almost complete absence of right ventricular myocardium, normal tricuspid valve, and preserved septal and left ventricular myocardium.

name: Ketosis
description: Presence of elevated levels of ketone bodies in the body.

name: Arterial thrombosis
description: The formation of a blood clot inside an artery.

name: Class III obesity
description: Obesity with a body mass index of 40 kg per square meter or higher.

name: Reduced blood 5-methyltetrahydrofolate level
description: A decreased concentration of 5-methyltetrahydrofolate in the blood.

name: Folate-dependent fragile site at Xq28
description: The presence of a folate sensitive fragile site at chromosome Xq28.

name: Short-segment aganglionic megacolon
description: A type of aganglionic megacolon in which the aganglionic segment does not extend beyond the upper sigmoid.

name: Aplasia/hypoplasia involving the skeleton
description: Absence (due to failure to form) or underdevelopment of one or more components of the skeleton.

name: Rimmed vacuoles
description: Presence of abnormal vacuoles (membrane-bound organelles) in the sarcolemma. On histological staining with hematoxylin and eosin, rimmed vacuoles are popcorn-like clear vacuoles with a densely blue rim. The vacuoles are often associated with cytoplasmic and occasionally intranuclear eosinophilic inclusions.
synonyms: ["HP:0009029","rimmed vacuoles' on biopsy","rimmed' vacuoles on biopsy"]

name: Young adult onset
description: Onset of disease at the age of between 16 and 40 years.

name: Torn meniscus
description: A tear in the cartilaginous pad (meniscus) of the knee.

name: Abnormality of uvular muscle
description: An abnormality of the uvular muscle

name: Disseminated nontuberculous mycobacterial infection
description: An infection with nontuberculous mycobacteria that affects multiple body sites. Such infections can occur in individuals with immune disease.

name: Supravalvular aortic stenosis
description: A pathological narrowing in the region above the aortic valve associated with restricted left ventricular outflow.

name: Narrow angle glaucoma
description: A type of glaucomatous optic neuropathy occuring in the presence of a narrow anterior chamber angle.

name: Abnormal aortic arch morphology
description: An anomaly of the arch of aorta.

name: Xanthogranulomatous pyelonephritis
description: Xanthogranulomatous pyelonephritis is a granulomatous inflammatory infiltrate composed of neutrophils, lymphocytes, plasma cells, xanthomatous histiocytes, and multinucleated giant cells.

name: Abnormal upper limb bone morphology
synonyms: ["Abnormal morphology of bones of the upper limbs","Abnormal shape of bones of the upper limbs","Abnormality of upper limb bone"]

name: Absent cremaster reflex
description: Lack of response to scratching of the skin of the medial thigh, which in males normally elicits a brisk, short elevation of the ipsilateral testis, a phenomenon that is referred to as the cremaster reflex.

name: Increased number of lymph nodes
description: An abnormally elevated number of lymph nodes in an anatomical region.

name: Neoplasm of the skin
description: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the skin.
synonyms: ["Dermatological tumors","Dermatological tumours","Skin cancer (non-melanoma)","Skin tumors","Skin tumours","Tumor of the skin","Tumour of the skin"]

name: Abnormal proportion of gamma-delta T cells
description: Abnormal proportion of gamma-delta T cells relative to the total number of T cells.
synonyms: ["Abnormal proportion of gamma-delta T-lymphocytes","Abnormal proportion of gammadelta T cells","Abnormal proprotion of gamma-delta T lymphocytes"]

name: Abnormality of the second metatarsal bone
synonyms: ["Abnormality of the 2nd long bone of foot"]

name: Body ache
description: Body ache is a complaint that is often used to denote vague symptoms of mild fatigue, lethargy, or dull aches. We will define it here to mean a dull and poorly localizable pain that is described by the affected individual to affect multiple joints or body parts or even the entire body.

name: Septo-optic dysplasia
description: Underdevelopment of the optic nerve and absence of the septum pellucidum.

name: Neurocytoma
description: A benign brain tumor composed of neural elements which most often arise from the septum pellucidum and the walls of the lateral ventricles.

name: Hypoammonemia
description: A decreased concentration of ammonia in the blood.

name: Infantile onset
description: Onset of signs or symptoms of disease between 28 days to one year of life.

name: Jaw hyperreflexia
description: Increased intensity of muscle tendon reflexes in jaw.

name: Abnormal blood 5-methyltetrahydrofolate level
description: An abnormal concentration of 5-methyltetrahydrofolate in the blood.

name: Shield chest
description: A broad chest.

name: Enlarged epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger
synonyms: ["HP:0004129","Enlarged end part of innermost long bone of index finger","Large epiphysis of proximal index finger phalanx"]

name: Dentinogenesis imperfecta limited to primary teeth
description: Developmental dysplasia of dentin affecting only the primary dentition.

name: Focal autonomic seizure
description: An autonomic seizure is a type of focal non-motor seizure characterized by alteration of autonomic nervous system function as the initial semiological feature.

name: Absent muscle fiber beta sarcoglycan
description: Immunohistochemistry shows complete lack of beta sarcoglycan protein in the muscle biopsy.

name: Osteolytic defects of the phalanges of the toes
Abdominal aortic dissection
description: A tear in the intimal layer of the abdominal aorta causing a separation between the intima and the medial layers.

name: Abnormal lymphocyte proliferation
description: Any abnormality in the multiplication or reproduction of lymphocytes, which results in the expansion of a cell population.

name: Abnormality of lingual tonsil
description: An abnormality of a lingual tonsil.

name: Bracket epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 3rd finger
description: An abnormality of the proximal phalanx of the third finger in which the epiphysis surrounds a phalangeal bone, having a bracket-like form and reaching from the proximal side of a phalanx to the distal side.
synonyms: ["Bracket shaped end part of innermost long bone of the middle finger"]

name: Abnormal labia majora morphology
description: An anomaly of the outer labia.
synonyms: ["Abnormality of the labia majora","Abnormality of vaginal lips"]

name: Cystic acne
description: A severe type of acne characterized by the formation of cysts enclosing a mixture of keratin and sebum.

name: Retinal vein occlusion
description: Blockage of the retinal vein.

name: Fasciitis
description: Inflammation of fascia, the tissue under the skin and over the muscle.

name: Abnormality of the middle phalanx of the 4th finger
synonyms: ["HP:0004204","Abnormal middle bone of ring finger","Abnormality of the middle phalanx of the ring finger"]

name: Abnormality of the shape of the midface
description: An abnormal morphology (form) of the midface or its components, the cheeks, maxilla, zygomatic bone, malar region, and infraorbital rims.
synonyms: ["Abnormal morphology of the midface","Abnormality of the shape of the midface","Dysmorphic midface"]

name: Abnormal brain FDG positron emission tomography
description: An anomaly detectable in-fluorodeoxyglucose (FDG) positron emission tomography (PET) brain scans. Glucose uptake measured with FDG-PET is a marker of neuronal metabolic activity.

name: Skeletal muscle autophagosome accumulation
description: Abnormal accumulation of autophagosomes in skeletal muscle tissue.

name: Hypopigmentation of the fundus
description: Reduced pigmentation of the fundus, typically generalised. Fundoscopy may reveal a low level pigment in both RPE and choroid with clear visibility of choroidal vessels (pale/albinoid) or low pigment level in the RPE with deep pigment in choroid so that visible choroidal vessels are separated by deeply pigmented zones (tesselated/tigroid).

name: Increased CSF tryptophan concentration
description: Abnormally increased levels of tryptophan in cerebrospinal fluid.

name: Pseudoepiphyses of the 5th finger
description: A secondary ossification center in the fifth finger that is distinct from the normal epiphysis that does not contribute to the longitudinal growth of a tubular bone.

name: Leiomyosarcoma
description: A smooth muscle connective tissue tumor, which is rare type of cancer that is a malignant neoplasm of smooth muscle. When such a neoplasm is benign, it is called a leiomyoma.

name: Angiokeratoma
description: A vascular lesion defined histologically as one or more dilated blood vessels lying directly subepidermal and showing an epidermal proliferative reaction. Clinically, angiokeratoma presents as a small, raised, dark-red spot.

name: Posterior fusion of lumbosacral vertebrae
description: Bony fusion of the posterior part of the L5 vertebral body with the sacrum.

name: Hypoprolinemia
description: A decreased amount of proline in the blood.
synonyms: ["Decreased blood proline levels","Low blood proline concentration"]

name: Hemolytic anemia
description: A type of anemia caused by premature destruction of red blood cells (hemolysis).

name: Abnormal isoelectric focusing of serum transferrin
description: Glycosylated transferrin concentrations can be measured in serum as a marker of N-linked glycosylation fidelity. In the traditional nomenclature for congenital disorders of glycosylation, absence of entire glycans was designated type I, and loss of one or more monosaccharides as type II. These terms are retained for historical reasons but for new annotations the precise glycosylation defect should be recorded.
synonyms: ["Abnormal isoelectric focusing of serum transferrin","Abnormal transferrin isoelectric focusing"]

name: Pseudoepiphyses of the middle phalanges of the hand
description: A secondary ossification center in the middle phalanges of the hand that is distinct from the normal epiphysis that does not contribute to the longitudinal growth of a tubular bone.

name: Spontaneous abortion
description: A pregnancy that ends at a stage in which the fetus is incapable of surviving on its own, defined as the spontaneous loss of a fetus before the 20th week of pregnancy.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the vagina
description: Aplasia or developmental hypoplasia of the vagina.

name: Anomalous origin of the left common carotid artery from the brachiocephalic artery
description: The left common carotid artery normally originates from the aortic arch. This term refers to an origin of this artery from the brachiocephalic artery.
synonyms: ["Anomalous origin of the left common carotid artery from the brachiocephalic trunk"]

name: Mixed cirrhosis
description: A type of cirrhosis characterized by the presence of regenerative nodules of a variety of sizes.

name: Protanopia
description: Blue and green cones only; no functional red cones.

name: Symmetrical progressive peripheral demyelination
description: A symmetric and progressive loss of myelin from the internode regions along myelinated nerve fibers of the peripheral nervous system.

name: Plantar edema
description: An abnormal accumulation of fluid beneath the skin on sole of the foot.

name: Abnormality of nasalis muscle
description: An abnormality of a nasalis muscle.

name: Abnormal glomerular filtration rate
description: An abnormally increased or reduced amount of fluid filtered out of plasma through glomerular capillary walls into Bowman's capsules per unit of time.

name: Aplasia cutis congenita of midline scalp vertex
Congenital stapes ankylosis
description: A form of stapes ankylosis with congenital onset.

name: Increased anti-fungi IgE antibody level
description: Increased level of IgE antibody against fungus, such as molds like zygomycota, ascomycota and deuteromycota.
synonyms: ["Increased anti-fungal IgE antibody level","Increased anti-fungus IgE antibody level"]

name: Motor axonal neuropathy
description: Progressive impairment of function of motor axons with muscle weakness, atrophy, and cramps. The deficits are length-dependent, meaning that muscles innervated by the longest nerves are affected first, so that for instance the arms are affected at a later age than the onset of deficits involving the lower leg.

name: Abnormality of the axillary hair
description: Abnormality of the growth of the axillary hair. Axillary hair is part of the secondary sexual hair, which normally ensues during puberty.

name: Antalgic gait
description: To avoid pain weight is put on the affected leg for as short a time as possible, resulting in a limp. The patients appear to be walking as if there were a thorn in the sole of the foot. To reduce the load on the affected leg the patients lift and lower their foot in a fixed ankle position.

name: Hyperphosphatemia
description: An abnormally increased phosphate concentration in the blood.

name: Anterior subcapsular cataract
description: A type of cataract affecting the anterior pole of lens immediately adjacent to ('beneath') the lens capsule.

name: Thin eyebrow
description: Decreased diameter of eyebrow hairs.

name: Abnormal sclera morphology
description: An abnormality of the sclera.
synonyms: ["Abnormality of the outer white part of eyeball","Abnormality of the sclera"]

name: Cortical diaphyseal thickening of the upper limbs
Cranial hyperostosis
description: Excessive growth of the bones of cranium, i.e., of the skull.
synonyms: ["HP:0002698","Enlargement of skull bones","Excessive growth of skull bones","Hyperostosis of cranial bones","Hyperostosis of cranial vault","Hypertrophy of cranial bones","Increased ossification of cranial bones","Overgrowth of skull bones","Thick skull bones"]

name: Optic disc coloboma
description: A cleft of the optic nerve that extends inferiorly.
synonyms: ["HP:0007997","Coloboma of optic nerve","Optic disk coloboma","Optic nerve coloboma"]

name: Congenital goiter
description: An enlargement of the thyroid gland with congenital onset.

name: Aganglionic megacolon
description: An abnormality resulting from a lack of intestinal ganglion cells (i.e., an aganglionic section of bowel) that results in bowel obstruction with enlargement of the colon.
synonyms: ["HP:0002029","HP:0002030","HP:0002606","HP:0004391","Congenital megacolon","Enlarged colon lacking nerve cells","Hirschsprung megacolon","Megacolon"]

name: Abnormal conus terminalis morphology
description: Any structural anomaly of the conus terminalis, which is the distal bulbous part of the spinal cord at the location where the spinal cord tapers and ends (usually between the L1 and L2 lumbar vertebrae).

name: Bracket epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 4th toe
synonyms: ["Bracket shaped end part of the innermost bone of 4th toe"]

name: Abnormal phagocytosis
description: An abnormal functioning of phagocytosis. Phagocytosis is an elegant but complex process for the ingestion and elimination of pathogens, but it is also important for the elimination of apoptotic cells and hence fundamental for tissue homeostasis. Phagocytosis can be divided into four main steps: (i) recognition of the target particle, (ii) signaling to activate the internalization machinery, (iii) phagosome formation, and (iv) phagolysosome maturation.

name: Anti-islet antigen-2 antibody positivity
description: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against tyrosine phosphatase IA-2.

name: Areflexia of upper limbs
description: Inability to elicit tendon reflexes in the upper limbs.

name: Fascicular left ventricular tachycardia
description: A ventricular tachycardia (VT) characterized by right bundle branch block (RBBB) and left axis deviation (LAD) on electrocardiogram (ECG).

name: Livedo reticularis
description: Livedo reticularis is characterized by the presence of a bluish purple, mottled or netlike pattern in unbroken circles on the skin. Exposure to cold environments usually intensifies the vascular pattern. Presumably, the condition results from slow or stagnant blood flow, vessel-wall pathology, and decreased oxygen tension.

name: Reduced factor XIII activity
description: Decreased activity of coagulation factor XIII (also known as fibrin stabilizing factor). Activated Factor XIII cross-links fibrin polymers solidifying the clot.

name: Abnormality of the lower limb
description: An abnormality of the leg.
synonyms: ["Abnormality of the leg","Abnormality of the lower limb","Lower limb deformities"]

name: Abnormal tricuspid valve annulus morphology
description: Any structural anomaly of the annulus of the tricuspid valve. The annulus is a ring composed of fibrous and myocardial tissue and is the structure onto which the cusps of the valve attach.

name: Glomerular basement membrane wrinkling
description: Irregular folding of the glomerular basement membrane with an intact lamina densa.

name: Delayed ossification of pubic rami
description: Delayed maturation and calcification of the rami (branches) of the pubic bone.

name: Increased adipose tissue around the neck
description: An increased amount of subcutaneous fat tissue around the neck.

name: Midshaft hypospadias
description: Hypospadias with location of the urethral meatus in the middle of the inferior shaft of the penis.

name: Impaired ristocetin cofactor assay activity
description: Abnormal response to ristocetin as manifested by reduced or lacking aggregation of platelets upon addition of ristocetin to platelet-poor plasma.

name: Suppurative cholangitis
description: Cholangitis characterized by the presence of numerous polymorphonuclear cells around and within the wall as well as within the lumen of the ducts. This may involve ducts of any size and is occasionally associated with abscess formation (cholangitic abscess).

name: Impaired platelet adhesion
description: An abnormality of adhesion of thrombocytes. Normally, platelets adhere to collagen in the vascular subendothelium within seconds of injury via a receptor made up of glycoprotein Ia and IIa and GPVI and to vWF via receptor GPIb/IX/V. The adherent platelets then release granules that lead to platelet activation and aggregation.

name: Hyperchloremia
description: An abnormally increased chloride concentration in the blood.

name: Increased carotid artery intimal medial thickness
description: An increase in the combined thickness of the intima and media of the carotid artery.

name: Truncal obesity
description: Obesity located preferentially in the trunk of the body as opposed to the extremities.

name: Late chronotype
description: A tendency towards rising very late in the morning and going to bed late at night.

name: Intestinal ischemia
description: Restriction of arterial blood supply to a testis associated with insufficient oxygenation to support the metabolic requirements of the digit. Acute intestinal ischemia can involve the small or large intestine, and usually presents with sudden severe non-specific abdominal pain.

name: Increased B cell count
description: An abnormal increase from the normal count of B cells.
synonyms: ["Increase in B cell count","Increase in B cell number","Increased number of B cells"]

name: Impaired touch localization
description: A reduced ability to identify precisely the site of a touch. This test is usually carried out by asking a patient, whose eyes are closed or covered, to touch the same site with a fingertip.

name: Transient decreased circulating IgD
description: A temporary reduction beneath the normal level of total immunoglobulin D (IgD) in the blood circulation.

name: Irregular epiphyses of the 3rd toe
synonyms: ["Irregular end part of the 3rd toe bone"]

name: Ichthyosis follicularis
description: Ichthyosis follicularis is characterized by widespread non inflammatory thorn-like follicular projections. Dyskeratotic papules are most pronounced over the extensor extremities and scalp and are symmetrically distributed.

name: Wide intermamillary distance
description: A larger than usual distance between the left and right nipple.

name: Y-linked inheritance
description: A mode of inheritance that is observed for traits related to a gene encoded on the Y chromosome.

name: Increased urinary urate
description: Elevated concentration of urate in the urine.

name: Megakaryocyte nucleus hyperlobulation
description: The presence of megakaryocytes in the bone marrow whose nuclei are more lobulated than expected for the size of the nucleus.

name: Duplication of the middle phalanx of the 4th finger
description: Partial or complete duplication of the middle phalanx of ring finger.
synonyms: ["Partial/complete duplication of the middle bone of the ring finger","Partial/complete duplication of the middle phalanx of the 4th finger"]

name: Decreased male libido
description: Reduced desire for sexual activity on the part of a male.

name: Anti-PKCgamma antibody
description: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against protein kinase Cgamma.

name: Divergence nystagmus
description: A condition in which both eyes beat outward simultaneously.

name: Aortic atherosclerotic lesion
description: The presence of atheromas or atherosclerotic plaques in the aorta.
synonyms: ["Aortic atherosclerosis","Atherosclerosis of the aorta","Atherosclerotic changes of aorta","Plaque build-up in aorta artery"]

name: Increased C-peptide level
description: An elevated concentration of C-peptide in the circulation. Since C-peptide is secreted in equimolar amounts to insulin, this feature correlates with increased insulin secretion.

name: Premature delivery because of cervical insufficiency or membrane fragility
House dust mite allergy
description: Hypersensitivity in form of an adverse immune reaction against house dust mites.
synonyms: ["Allergy to house dust mites","House dust mite allergy","IgE-mediated house dust mite allergy","Immunoglobulin E-mediated house dust mite allergy"]

name: Reduced circulating vitamin B6 level
description: An abnormally decreased concentration of vitamin B6 in the blood circulation.

name: Anti-GFAP antibody
description: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against glial fibrillary acidic protein (GFAP).

name: Thickening of the tubular basement membrane
description: Increase in thickness of the basement membrane of the tubulus of the kidney.

name: Narcolepsy
description: An abnormal phenomenon characterized by a classic tetrad of excessive daytime sleepiness with irresistible sleep attacks, cataplexy (sudden bilateral loss of muscle tone), hypnagogic hallucination, and sleep paralysis.

name: Patchy variation in bone mineral density
description: Patchy (irregular) changes in bone mineral density with patches of bone showing an increased density side to side with patches that are affected by reduction of mineral density. This is sometimes referred to as a moth-eaten appearance on x-rays.
synonyms: ["Patchy increased and decreased bone mineral density"]

name: Positive meconium barbiturate test
description: Detection of barbiturate metabolites such as phenobarbital in meconium.

name: Aspartylglucosaminuria
description: Excretion of excess amounts of aspartylglucosamine in the urine.

name: Lytic defects of the forearm bones
Abdominal ectopia cordis
description: Displacement of the heart outside the thoracic cavity and into the abdomen.

name: Lytic defects in metaphyses of the upper limbs
Elevated circulating hydroxybutyric acid concentration
description: An increased concentration in the blood circulation of a hydroxybutyric acid, that is, of a compound comprising a butyric acid core carrying at least one hydroxy substituent.

name: Loculated ascites
description: A type of ascites (peritoneal fluid collection) that is divided into loculi (compartments) by septa (fibrous walls). Ascites fluid can become loculated when confined by adhesions, malignancy or infection.

name: Enamel hypoplasia
description: Developmental hypoplasia of the dental enamel.
synonyms: ["HP:0000671","HP:0001565","HP:0003770","Defective enamel matrix","Dental enamel hypoplasia","Enamel hypoplasia","Enamel hypotrophy","Enamel, underdeveloped","Hypoplasia of dental enamel","Hypoplasia of tooth enamel","Thin dental enamel","Thin tooth enamel","Underdeveloped teeth enamel"]

name: Arcuate vein intimal mucoid edema
description: Accumulation of edematous extracellular matrix in the inner layer (intima) of arcuate veins of the kidney. The material resembles mucus and appears pale blue on hematoxylin and eosin staining.

name: Prolonged prothrombin time
description: Increased time to coagulation in the prothrombin time test, which is a measure of the extrinsic pathway of coagulation. The results of the prothrombin time test are often expressed in terms of the International normalized ratio (INR), which is calculated as a ratio of the patient's prothrombin time (PT) to a control PT standardized for the potency of the thromboplastin reagent developed by the World Health Organization (WHO) using the formula: INR is equal to Patient PT divided by Control PT.
synonyms: ["HP:0012201","Increased INR","Increased international normalised ratio","increased international normalised ratio","Increased international normalized ratio","Low factor II activity","Prolonged PT","Reduced factor II activity","Reduced prothrombin activity"]

name: Progressive visual loss
description: A reduction of previously attained ability to see.
synonyms: ["HP:0000560","HP:0007735","HP:0007753","HP:0007967","Loss of visual acuity","Progressive loss of vision","Progressive vision loss","Progressive visual acuity loss","Progressive visual impairment","Slowly progressive visual loss","Vision loss, progressive","Visual loss, progressive"]

name: Abnormal chromosome morphology
description: Any structural anomaly of a chromosome, which is a thread like molecule consisting of DNA and proteins (chromatin) that contains DNA sequences for genes and other genetic elements in linear order.

name: Hyperextensible thumb
description: The ability of the thumb joints to move beyond their normal range of motion.

name: Abnormal periventricular white matter morphology
description: A structural abnormality of the myelinated axons (white matter) located near the cerebral ventricles.

name: Labial abscess
description: A circumscribed area of pus or necrotic debris in the labia.

name: Hypoplastic frontal sinuses
description: Underdevelopment of frontal sinus.
synonyms: ["Decreased volume of frontal sinuses","Small frontal sinuses","Underdeveloped frontal sinuses"]

name: Enlarged brainstem
description: Abnormal increase in size of the brainstem.

name: Biconvex vertebral bodies
description: Presence of abnormal convexity of the upper and lower end plates of the vertebrae, i.e., an exaggerated bulging out of the upper and lower vertebral end plates.

name: Small epiphyses of the hallux
synonyms: ["Small end part of the big toe bone"]

name: Criss-cross atrioventricular valves with superior-inferior ventricles
description: Criss-cross atrioventricular valves with a rare cardiac malformation characterized by the two ventricles lying one above the other instead of side by side.

name: Congenital defect of the pericardium
description: A developmental defect of the pericardium with congenital onset.

name: Abnormality of lens shape
description: An abnormal shape of the lens.

name: Clasp-knife sign
description: Clasp-knife phenomonen refers to increased muscle tone while bending or stretching a limb, whereby there is a sudden relaxation (decrease in resistance) as the muscle continues to be streched. This phenomenon has been likened to opening a clasp knife.

name: Right ventricular outlet tract obstruction
description: An obstruction to the forward flow of blood in the outflow tract of the right ventricle.

name: Anti-SEZ6L2 antibody
description: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against seizure-related 6 homolog like 2 (SEZ6L2).

name: Pigmentary retinopathy
description: An abnormality of the retina characterized by pigment deposition. It is typically associated with migration and proliferation of macrophages or retinal pigment epithelial cells into the retina; melanin from these cells causes the pigmentary changes. Pigmentary retinopathy is a common final pathway of many retinal conditions and is often associated with visual loss.
synonyms: ["HP:0001146","HP:0007702","HP:0007821","HP:0007852","HP:0007869","HP:0007934","HP:0007961","HP:0008010","Pigmentary retinal deposits","Retinal pigment clumping","Retinal pigmentary clumping","Retinal pigmentary degeneration"]

name: Dilatation of the mitral annulus
description: An increase in the diameter of the ring (annulus) of the mitral valve.

name: Abnormal ejaculation
description: Abnormality in the process of ejection of semen (usually carrying sperm) from the male reproductive tract.

name: Screwdriver-shaped incisors
description: An abnormality of morphology of the incisor tooth in which the tooth is shaped like a screwdriver blade, i.e., having a rhomboid shape.

name: Bladder diverticulum
description: Diverticulum (sac or pouch) in the wall of the urinary bladder.

name: Blue irides
description: A markedly blue coloration of the iris.

name: Rectal fistula
description: The presence of a fistula affecting the rectum.

name: obsolete Generalized osteoporosis with pathologic fractures
Decreased post-bronchodilator forced expiratory flow 25-75%
description: A reduction compared to the predicted value of the forced expiratory flow over the middle one-half of the FVC; the average flow from the point at which 25% of the FVC has been exhaled to the point at which 75% of the FVC has been exhaled. Here, the test is performed after the administration of a bronchodilating medication.
synonyms: ["Decreased post bronchodilator forced expiratory flow 25-75%","Decreased post-bronchodilator FEF25-75%","Decreased postbronchodilator forced expiratory flow 25-75%"]

name: Polymelia
description: Polymelia is a congenital anomaly, which is defined as the presence of accessory limbs attached to various body regions and could be classified as cephalomelia (extra-limb attached to the head), notomelia (extra-limb attached to the back bone), thoracomelia (extra-limb attached to the thorax), and pyromelia (extra-limb attached to the pelvis).

name: Aqueductal stenosis
description: Stenosis of the cerebral aqueduct (also known as the mesencephalic duct, aqueductus mesencephali, or aqueduct of Sylvius), which connects the third cerebral ventricle in the diencephalon to the fourth ventricle, which is between the pons and cerebellum.
synonyms: ["Aqueduct of Sylvius stenosis","Aqueduct stenosis","Narrowing of aqueduct of Sylvius"]

name: Dermal translucency
description: An abnormally increased ability of the skin to permit light to pass through (translucency) such that subcutaneous structures such as veins display an increased degree of visibility.

name: Absence of the pulmonary valve
description: Refers to the specific combination of defects with a severely dysplastic pulmonary valve and massively dilated branch pulmonary arteries.

name: Calcification of the small brain vessels
description: Deposition of calcium salts within small blood vessels of the brain.

name: Atrial flutter
description: A type of atrial arrhythmia characterized by atrial rates of between 240 and 400 beats per minute and some degree of atrioventricular node conduction block. Typically, the ventricular rate is half the atrial rate. In the EKG; atrial flutter waves are observed as sawtooth-like atrial activity. Pathophysiologically, atrial flutter is a form of atrial reentry in which there is a premature electrical impulse creates a self-propagating circuit.

name: Myelin tomacula
description: The presence of multiple sausage-shaped swellings of the myelin sheath (The Latin tomaculum means sausage).

name: Central posterior corneal opacity
description: Reduced transparency of the central posterior portion of the corneal stroma.

name: Elevated circulating thyroid-stimulating hormone concentration
description: Increased concentration of thyroid-stimulating hormone (TSH) in the blood circulation.
synonyms: ["Elevated thyroid stimulating hormone","Elevated thyroid stimulating hormone levels","High TSH","Increased serum thyroid-stimulating hormone","Increased thyroid-stimulating hormone","Increased thyroid-stimulating hormone level","Increased thyrotropin level","Thyroid-stimulating hormone excess","TSH excess"]

name: Retinopathy of prematurity stage 5
description: Funnel detachment from the retina with generally traction in all four quadrants.

name: Reduced muscle fiber delta sarcoglycan
description: Abnormally reduced amount of delta sarcoglycan in muscle.

name: Malformed lacrimal duct
description: Congenital malformation of the lacrimal duct associated with incomplete development of the bony nasolacrimal canal or craniofacial anomalies.

name: Hypoplastic distal humeri
description: Underdevelopment of the distal portion of the humerus.

name: Sleep myoclonus
description: Myoclonus that occurs during the initial phases of sleep.

name: Peripheral pulmonary artery stenosis
description: Stenosis of a peripheral branch of the pulmonary artery.
synonyms: ["HP:0004957","Narrowing of peripheral lung artery","peripheral pulmonary stenosis","Peripheral pulmonic stenosis"]

name: Inferiorly positioned umbilicus
description: The position of the umbilicus (belly button) is abnormally low (inferior).

name: Elevated proportion of CD4-negative, CD8-negative, alpha-beta regulatory T cells
description: An abnormally increased proportion of CD4-negative, CD8-negative (double negative or DN) alpha-beta regulatory T cells (Tregs) as compared to total number of T cells.
synonyms: ["HP:0002845","Increased number of CD4-/CD8- T cells expressing alpha/beta T-cell receptors"]

name: Duplication of the distal phalanx of the 3rd finger
description: Partial or complete duplication of the distal phalanx of middle finger.
synonyms: ["Partial/complete duplication of the distal phalanx of the 3rd finger","Partial/complete duplication of the outermost bone of the middle finger"]

name: Severe photosensitivity
description: A severe degree of photosensitivity of the skin.

name: Zygotic cleavage failure
description: Failure of a fertilized oocyte to undergo the first round of cell division.

name: Lower cranial nerve dysfunction
description: A functional abnormality affecting the lower cranial nerves, which include the paired 9th (glossopharyngeal), 10th (vagal), 11th (accessory) and 12th (hypoglossal) cranial nerves.

name: Periventricular white matter hyperintensities
description: Areas of brighter than expected signal on magnetic resonance imaging emanating from the cerebral white matter that surrounds the cerebral ventricles.

name: Cone-shaped epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the hallux
synonyms: ["Cone-shaped end part of the outermost bone of the big toe"]

name: Moderate sensorineural hearing impairment
description: The presence of a moderate form of sensorineural hearing impairment.

name: Histrionic personality disorder
description: A personality disorder characterized by shallow and labile affectivity, self-dramatization, theatricality, exaggerated expression of emotions, suggestibility, egocentricity, self-indulgence, lack of consideration for others, easily hurt feelings, and continuous seeking for appreciation, excitement and attention.

name: Osteolytic defects of the proximal phalanx of the 3rd finger
description: Dissolution or degeneration of bone tissue of the proximal phalanx of the 3rd finger.

name: Abnormality of glycosaminoglycan metabolism
description: Abnormality of glycosaminoglycan metabolism.

name: Resistance to activated protein C
description: Poor anticoagulant response to activated protein C. A plasma is termed 'APC resistant' when the addition of exogenous APC fails to prolong its clotting time in an activated partial thromboplastin time assay.

name: Shortened PR interval
description: Reduced time for the PR interval (beginning of the P wave to the beginning of the QRS complex). In adults, normal values are 120 to 200 ms long.
synonyms: ["Electrocardiographic short PR interval","Short P-R interval","Shortened PR interval on EKG"]

name: Cyclic esotropia
description: Convergent strabismus in which normal binocular single vision is alternating with large angle esotropia in rhythmic cycle.

name: Abetalipoproteinemia
description: An absence of low-density lipoprotein cholesterol in the blood.

name: Obstructive shock
description: A type of shock characterized by inadequate cardiac preload due to obstructed venous return (e.g. pericardial tamponade, tension pneumothorax, abdominal compartment) or obstruction of arterial blood flow (e.g. pulmonary embolism).

name: Abnormality of ethmoid bone
description: An abnormality of the ethmoid bone

name: Prominent nucleoli of renal tubular epithelial cells
description: Tubular epithelium with nucleoli clearly visible at 100-fold magnification.

name: Dimple chin
description: A persistent midline depression of the skin over the fat pad of the chin.
synonyms: ["Chin butt","Chin dent","Chin dimple","Chin skin dimple","Dimple chin","Gelasin of chin","Indentation of chin"]

name: Hypopigmentation of hair
synonyms: ["Hair hypopigmentation","Loss of hair color","Loss of hair colour"]

name: Increased circulating metamyelocyte count
description: An abnormally increased number of metamyelocytes in the peripheral blood circulation. Metamyelocytes are immature neutrophils with a size of 10-18 micrometers, an indented or kidney-shaped nucleus, pinkish-blue staining cytoplasm with seconday granules, and a nucleus:cytoplasm ratio of 1.5:1.

name: Abnormal alveolar volume
description: Alveolar volume (VA) is a volume accessible during 10-second breath-hold, measured during a single breath manouver. VA is calculated by knowing the fractional concentration of the tracer gas (eg helium) and the volume of the gas inhaled. VA = Vi*(Fi tracer/Fa tracer). In this equation, Vi = inspired volume of tracer gas, Fi tracer= inspired fraction of tracer gas, Fa tracer = alveolar (exhaled) fraction of tracer gas.

name: Postnatal growth retardation
description: Slow or limited growth after birth.
synonyms: ["HP:0008844","HP:0008865","HP:0008868","HP:0008901","HP:0008918","Growth delay as children","Growth retardation as children","Postnatal growth deceleration","Postnatal growth deficiency","Postnatal growth failure"]

name: Reduced number of corneal endothelial cells
description: A reduction in the number of corneal endothelial cells.

name: Atrial situs inversus
description: Mirror image atrial arrangement, with morphologic right atrium on the left hand side and morphologic left atrium on the right hand side.

name: Elevated haptoglobin level
description: An abnormally high concentration of haptoglobin in the blood circulation. Haptoglobin is an acute-phase reactant whose levels can become elevated in the presence of infection and inflammation.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the middle phalanx of the 4th toe
synonyms: ["Absent/small middle bone of the 4th toe","Absent/underdeveloped middle bone of the 4th toe"]

name: Budd-Chiari syndrome
description: Budd-Chiari syndrome (BCS) is caused by obstruction of hepatic venous outflow at any level from the small hepatic veins to the junction of the inferior vena cava (IVC) with the right atrium, 1 and occurs in 1/100,000 of the general population worldwide. The most common presentation is with ascites, but can range from fulminant hepatic failure (FHF) to asymptomatic forms. Obstruction of hepatic venous outflow is mainly caused by primary intravascular thrombosis, which can occur suddenly or be repeated over time, accompanied by some revascularization, accounting for the variable parenchymal hepatic damage and histologic presentation. Budd-Chiari syndrome is thus a disease, but since it occurs as a manifestation of several other diseases, this term is kept for the present for convenience.

name: Cystinuria
description: An increased concentration of cystine in the urine.

name: Semilunar tooth
description: An incisor with a half-moon shape incisal edge.

name: Upbeat nystagmus
description: In primary position, the eyes drift slowly downward and then spontaneously beat upward. Upward gaze accentuates the nystagmus. The associated oscillopsias are often very irritating, but the symptoms are usually transient.

name: Elevated fecal osmolality
description: Abnormally high concentration of feces as assessed by the total number of solute particles per kilogram.

name: Thin ribs
description: Ribs with a reduced diameter.

name: Cervical C5/C6 vertebrae fusion
description: Fusion of the C5 and C6 cervical vertebrae.

name: Abnormality of dorsal nasal artery
description: An abnormality of a dorsal nasal artery.

name: Declarative memory loss
description: Impaired ability to remember facts and events.

name: Scapular muscle atrophy
description: Atrophy of the muscles that are responsible for moving the scapula, which are the levator scapulae, the infraspinatus muscle, the teres major, the teres minor, and the supraspinatus muscle.

name: Abnormal circulating gastrin concentration
description: An abnormal concentration of gastrin in the blood.

name: Lymphangioma
description: Lymphangiomas are rare congenital malformations consisting of focal proliferations of well-differentiated lymphatic tissue in multi cystic or sponge like structures. Lymphangioma is usually asymptomatic due to its soft consistency but compression of adjacent structures can be seen due to the mass effect of a large tumor.

name: Oval face
description: A face with a rounded and slightly elongated outline.

name: Stroke
description: Sudden impairment of blood flow to a part of the brain due to occlusion or rupture of an artery to the brain.

name: Abnormal superoxide dismutase level
description: An abnormal level of catalysis of the reaction: 2 superoxide + 2 H+ = O2 + hydrogen peroxide.

name: Abnormal circulating alanine concentration
description: An abnormality of an alanine metabolic process.

name: Increased urine glutamate level
description: An increased concentration of glutamate in the urine.

name: Abnormality of the odontoid process
description: Abnormality of the dens of the axis, which is also known as the odontoid process.

name: Abnormal DLCO
description: An abnormal amount of oxygen passes into the blood from the lungs and/or an abnormal amount of carbon dioxide passes from the blood into the lungs.
synonyms: ["Abnormal diffusing capacity","Abnormal TLCO","Abnormal transfer factor of the lung for carbon monoxide"]

name: Short phalanx of the 5th toe
description: Developmental hypoplasia of one or more phalanx of little toe.
synonyms: ["Hypoplastic/small phalanges of the 5th toe","Short little toe bone","Short phalanx of the fifth toe","Short pinkie toe bone","Short pinky toe bone"]

name: Abnormality of globe size
description: An abnormality in the size of the ocular globe (eyeball).

name: Hypoplasia of the upper arm musculature
description: Underdevelopment of the musculature of the upper arm, which may include the deltoid, the triceps, the biceps, and the brachioradialis.

name: Nontuberculous mycobacterial pulmonary infection
description: An infection of the lung caused by environmental mycobacteria. Such infections can occur in individuals with predisposing lung disease or immune disease.

name: Hyperserinemia
description: An increased amount of serine in the blood.
synonyms: ["Elevated circulating serine levels","High blood serine levels","Increased serine blood concentration"]

name: Increased urinary squamous epithelial cell count
description: An increased number of squamous epithelial cells per high-power field in urinanalysis.

name: Impaired renal uric acid clearance
description: A reduction in the ability of the kidneys to remove uric acid from the serum.

name: Folate-responsive megaloblastic anemia
description: A type of megaloblastic anemia (i.e., anemia characterized by the presence of erythroblasts that are larger than normal) that improves upon the administration of folate.

name: Proptosis
description: An eye that is protruding anterior to the plane of the face to a greater extent than is typical.
synonyms: ["HP:0000536","HP:0000644","HP:0000645","HP:0007711","HP:0007870","Anterior bulging of the globe","Anterior bulging of the globe of eye","Bulging eye","Exophthalmos","Eyeballs bulging out","Ocular proptosis","Prominent eyes","Prominent globes","Protruding eyes","Protrusio bulbi"]

name: Allergic conjunctivitis
description: Allergic Conjunctivitis is an allergic inflammation of the conjunctiva.

name: Uterine synechiae
description: Adhesions or scar tissue that form inside the cavity of the uterus.

name: Symptomatic seizures
description: A seizure that occurs in the context of a brain insult (systemic, toxic, or metabolic) and may not recur when the underlying cause has been removed or the acute phase has elapsed.

name: Abnormal cervical curvature
description: The presence of an abnormal curvature of the cervical vertebral column.

name: Craniofacial hyperostosis
description: Excessive growth of the craniofacial bones.
synonyms: ["Enlargement of craniofacial bones","Excessive bone growth of the skull and face","Excessive growth of craniofacial bones","Hyperostosis of craniofacial bones","Hypertrophy of craniofacial bones","Increased ossification of craniofacial bones","Overgrowth of craniofacial bones","Thick craniofacial bones"]

name: Tritanomaly
description: Difficulty distinguishing between yellow and blue, possible related to dysfunction of the S photopigment.
synonyms: ["Blue yellow color blindness","Blue yellow colour blindness","Blue-yellow dyschromatopsia","Dyschromatopsia, blue-yellow"]

name: EBV meningitis
description: Inflammation of the meninges related to infection by Epstein-Barr virus.

name: Beaded vitreous appearance
description: Vitreous humor of the eye displaying beaded bundles of irregular diameters.

name: Decreased circulating free T4 level
description: A reduced concentration of free thyroxine (fT4) in the blood circulation.

name: Abnormal circulating eicosanoid concentration
description: Any deviation from the normal concentration in the blood circulation of an icosanoid (also known as eicosanoids). These are signaling molecules derived from oxidation of 20-carbon fatty acids. Most are produced from arachidonic acid, a 20-carbon polyunsaturated fatty acid (5,8,11,14-eicosatetraenoic acid).

name: Small epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 4th finger
description: Abnormally small size of the epiphysis located at the proximal end of the distal phalanx of the 4th finger with respect to age-dependent norms.
synonyms: ["Small end part of the outermost bone of the ring finger"]

name: Triangular shaped distal phalanx of the hallux
synonyms: ["Triangular shaped outermost bone of the big toe"]

name: Tortuosity of conjunctival vessels
description: The presence of an increased number of twists and turns of the conjunctival blood vessels.

name: Decreased serum anion gap
description: An abnormally low value of the serum anion gap (the sum of serum chloride and bicarbonate concentrations subtracted from the serum sodium concentration).

name: Abnormality of the radius
description: An abnormality of the radius.

name: Sclerosis of middle finger phalanx
description: An elevation in bone density in one or more middle phalanges of the fingers. Sclerosis is normally detected on a radiograph as an area of increased opacity.
synonyms: ["Increased bone density in middle finger bone of hand","Sclerosis of the middle phalanges of the hand"]

name: EMG: myotonic runs
description: Spontaneous, repetitive electrical activity demonstrated by electromyography (EMG).

name: Abnormality of dental color
description: A developmental defect of tooth color.
synonyms: ["Abnormality of dental color","Abnormality of dental colour","Abnormality of dental shade","Abnormality of tooth color","Abnormality of tooth colour","Abnormality of tooth shade"]

name: Miliary
description: Characterized by numerous small lesions said to resemble millet seed.

name: Occupational disability
description: This is a general term that denotes a reduced ability to perform the work that one performed prior to an illness, and may be related to pain, cognitive dysfunction, fatigue or other physical disabilities.

name: Paraparesis
description: Weakness or partial paralysis in the lower limbs.

name: Gastrointestinal arteriovenous malformation
description: An anomalous configuration of blood vessels that shunts arterial blood directly into veins without passing through the capillaries and that is located in the gastrointestinal tract.

name: Impaired cytokine signaling
description: A defect or impairment in the series of molecular signals initiated by the binding of a cytokine to a receptor on the surface of a cell, and ending with regulation of a downstream cellular process, e.g. transcription.
synonyms: ["Cytokine signaling defect","Cytokine signalling defect","Impaired cytokine signalling"]

name: History of stillbirth
description: One or more previous pregnancies resulted in stillbirth, defined as death of a fetus in the later stages of pregnancy (definitions in the literature vary, with cut-offs ranging from 20 to 28 weeks gestation).

name: Pulmonary artery hypoplasia
description: Underdevelopment of the pulmonary artery.

name: Kinesiophobia
description: An excessive, irrational and debilitating fear to carry out a physical movement, due to a feeling of vulnerability to a painful injury or reinjury.

name: Pyriform aperture stenosis
description: Narrowing of the anterior nasal aperture (piriform or pyriform aperture), which is a pear-shaped opening in the skull that forms the bony inlet of the nose.

name: Decreased urinary 1-methylhistidine
description: Decreased concentration of 1-methylhistidine in the urine.

name: Nasolacrimal sac obstruction
description: Blockage of the nasolacrimal sac.

name: Abnormal response to glucagon stimulation test
description: An anomalous response to the glucagon stimulation test, which like the insulin tolerance test (ITT) stimulates the release of both adrenocorticotropic hormone (ACTH) and growth hormone (GH).

name: Atrioventricular block
description: Delayed or lack of conduction of atrial depolarizations through the atrioventricular node to the ventricles.
synonyms: ["HP:0001668","HP:0005142","HP:0006672","Interruption of electrical communication between upper and lower chambers of heart"]

name: Fibrous crescent
description: A type of glomerular crescent characterized by extracapillary fibrosis composed of greater than 75% matrix and of less than 25% cells with or without fibrin, usually associated with disruption of Bowman's capsule and involving over 10% of the capsular circumference.

name: Mild constriction of peripheral visual field
description: A diminution of the peripheral visual field whereby at least 50 degrees of central field are preserved in all meridians.

name: Productive cough
description: A cough that produces phlegm or mucus.

name: Mixed hypo- and hyperpigmentation of the skin
Increased proportion of CD25+ mast cells
description: An increased proportion of mast cells are positive for the cell surface marker CD25 (also called interleukin-2 receptor alpha chain).

name: Abnormality of finger
description: An anomaly of a finger.

name: Temporal optic disc pallor
description: A pale yellow discoloration of the temporal (lateral) portion of the optic disc.

name: Increased pineal volume
description: An abnormal elevation in the quantity of three-dimensional space taken up by the pineal gland.

name: Bullet-shaped middle phalanx of the 2nd finger
description: Bullet-shaped phalanx refers to a short and wide phalanx that tapers distally. Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction. This term is used if the middle phalanx of the 2nd finger is affected.

name: Triggered by head trauma
description: Applies to a sign or symptom that is provoked or brought about by exposure to a head trauma.

name: Posterior predominant subcortical band heterotopia
description: Longitudinal bands of gray matter located deep to the cerebral cortex and separated from it by a thin layer of normal appearing white matter visible along the occipital cortex.
synonyms: ["Occipital subcortical band heterotopia","Subcortical band heterotopia posterior predominant"]

name: Abnormal cortical gyration
description: An abnormality of the gyri (i.e., the ridges) of the cerebral cortex of the brain.

name: Persistent lactic acidosis
description: A continuous form of lactic acidemia.

name: Bilateral choanal atresia
description: Bilateral absence (atresia) of the posterior nasal aperture (choana).
synonyms: ["Bilateral blockage of the rear opening of the nasal cavity","Bilateral obstruction of the rear opening of the nasal cavity"]

name: Portal vein thrombosis
description: Thrombosis of the portal vein and/or its tributaries, which include the splenic vein and the superior and inferior mesenteric veins.

name: Small for gestational age
description: Smaller than normal size according to sex and gestational age related norms, defined as a weight below the 10th percentile for the gestational age.
synonyms: ["HP:0001422","HP:0008849","HP:0008919","HP:0008927","Birth weight less than 10th percentile","Low birth weight","Small for gestational age"]

name: Microcornea
description: A congenital abnormality of the cornea in which the cornea and the anterior segment of the eye are smaller than normal. The horizontal diameter of the cornea does not reach 10 mm even in adulthood.
synonyms: ["HP:0100688","Cornea of eye less than 10mm in diameter","Decreased corneal diameter"]

name: Dysplastic distal radial epiphyses
description: Abnormally developed (dysplastic) distal epiphysis of the radius.

name: Freezing of gait
description: Freezing of gait is defined as a brief, episodic absence or marked reduction of forward progression of the feet despite the intention to walk.

name: Smooth muscle antibody positivity
description: The presence in serum of antibodies against smooth muscle.
synonyms: ["Anti-smooth muscle antibody positivity","Smooth muscle antibody positive"]

name: Complete duplication of the proximal phalanx of the 5th toe
description: Complete duplication of the proximal phalanx of fifth toe.
synonyms: ["Complete duplication of the innermost bone of the little toe","Complete duplication of the innermost bone of the pinkie toe","Complete duplication of the innermost bone of the pinky toe","Complete duplication of the proximal phalanx of the fifth toe"]

name: Abnormal osteoclast count
description: An anomaly in the number of osteoclasts, bone-resorbing cells that develop from macrophages.

name: Non-convulsive status epilepticus without coma
description: A type of status epilepticus without prominent motor symptoms in the absence of coma.

name: Primary vesicoureteral reflux
description: Vesicoureteral reflux due to abnormalities in ureterovesical junction, e.g. ectopic insertion of the ureter or short intravesical tunnel at the ureterovesical junction.

name: Increased hepatitis C virus antibody level
description: An abnormally increased level of immunoglobulin against hepatitis C virus in the blood.

name: Mucopolysacchariduria
description: Excessive amounts of mucopolysaccharide in the urine.

name: Positive perchlorate discharge test
description: An abnormal result of the perchlorate discharge test. In this test, first radioactive iodine is administered, sufficinet time is allowed to pass so that the radioactive iodine is captured by the thyroid,and then, perchlorate is administered orally. The perchlorate displaces non-organified iodide from the thyroid. The perchlorate discharge test is considered positive (abnormal) if there is an abnormally rapid loss of radioactive iodine from the thyroid.

name: Abnormality of the head
description: An abnormality of the head.

name: Methylmalonic aciduria
description: Increased concentration of methylmalonic acid in the urine.

name: Decreased adipose tissue tocopherol level
description: A reduced concentration of tocopherol in fat tissue.

name: Fibrotic muscularis propria
description: The presence of excessive fibrous connective tissue in the muscularis propria of the intestine. Fibrosis is a reparative or reactive process.

name: Abnormal proportion of central memory CD8-positive, alpha-beta T cells
description: An abnormal proportion of central memory CD8-positive, alpha-beta memory T cells compared to the total number of T cells in the blood. These cells have the phenotype CCR7-positive, CD127-positive, CD45RA-negative, CD45RO-positive, and CD25-negative.

name: Patchy changes of bone mineral density
description: Patchy (irregular) changes in bone mineral density. These changes can either be patchy reduction or increase of mineral density as seen on x-rays. Depending on the pathomechanism and the underlying disease, these changes can either appear solely as reduction or increase or as a combination of both (patches of bone showing an increased density while others are affected by reduction of mineral density).

name: Abnormal muscle fiber-type distribution
description: Ay deviation from the normal distribution of fiber types in skeletal muscle. The skeletal muscle groups of the mammalian body are made up of bundles of muscle fibers. These fibers can be assigned to different Types, with characteristic movement rates, response to neural inputs, and metabolic styles. Skeletal muscle fibers are broadly classified as slow-twitch (type 1) and fast-twitch (type 2). Multiple fiber types are generally intermingled within a single muscle group, and different muscle groups have varying proportions of fiber types

name: Decreased specific antibody response to vaccination
description: A reduced ability to synthesize postvaccination antibodies against toxoids and polysaccharides in vaccines, as measured by antibody titer determination following vaccination.

name: Discoid lupus rash
description: Cutaneous lesion that develops as a dry, scaly, red patch that evolves to an indurated and hyperpigmented plaque with adherent scale. Scarring may result in central white patches (loss of pigmentation) and skin atrophy.

name: Cardiac myxoma
description: A myxoma (tumor of primitive connective tissue) of the heart. Cardiac myxomas consist of stellate to plump, cytologically bland mesenchymal cells set in a myxoid stroma. Cardiac myxomas are of endocardial origina and general project from the endocardium into a cardiac chamber.

name: Nephrotic range proteinuria
description: Severely increased amount of excretion of protein in the urine, defined as 3.5 grams per day or more in adults and 40 mg per meter-squared body surface area per hour in children.

name: Follicular hyperplasia
description: Lymphadenopathy (enlargement of lymph nodes) owing to hyperplasia of follicular (germinal) centers.

name: Mediastinal lymphadenopathy
description: Swelling of lymph nodes within the mediastinum, the central compartment of the thoracic cavities that contains the heart and the great vessels, the esophagus, and trachea and other structures including lymph nodes.
synonyms: ["Swollen lymph nodes in center of chest","Swollen lymph nodes in centre of chest"]

name: Increased anti-egg IgE antibody level
description: Increased level of IgE antibody against eggs, including egg whites, egg yolks, and egg proteins such as ovoalbumin and ovomucoid.

name: Pectoralis amyotrophy
description: Wasting of the pectoral muscles, i.e., of the pectoralis major and pectoralis minor.

name: Anti-GM1 IgM antibody positivity
description: The presence of IgM autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against GM1.

name: Limited shoulder abduction
description: Decreased ability to move the arm away from the midline of the body.

name: Apical
description: Applies to an abnormality whose distribution and appearance are located at the apex of an organ. For instance, apical refers to the superior portion of the lung.

name: Hypoplastic ischiopubic rami
description: Underdevelopment of the ischiopubic ramus, which is comprised of the inferior pubic ramus and the inferior ramus of the ischium.

name: Decreased proportion of CD4-positive T cells
description: A reduction in the proportion of CD4-positive T cells relative to the total number of T cells.
synonyms: ["Decreased proportion of CD4+ cells","Decreased proportion of CD4-positive, alpha-beta T cells","Reduced proportion of CD4-positive cells"]

name: Abnormal ventricular axis
description: Any deviation from the normal direction of the ventricular axis. The left ventricle makes up most of the heart muscle under normal circumstances and therefore generates the most electrical force visible on the EKG. The normal ventricular axis is directed downward and slightly towards the left. The ventricular axis can be determined by analyzing the QRS complex, which represents ventricular depolarization.

name: Complete heart block with narrow QRS complexes
description: A type of third degree heart block in which the escape rhythm arises at the atrioventricular node, which produces a narrow QRS complex.

name: EEG with central sharp waves
description: EEG with sharp waves in the central region, i.e., sharp transient waves of a duration between 80 and 200 msec.

name: Angiofibromas
description: Angiofibroma consist of many often dilated vessels.

name: Atrophic gastritis
description: Atrophic gastritis (AG) is a histopathological entity that is characterized by chronic inflammation of the gastric mucosa with loss of gastric glandular cells and replacement by intestinal-type epithelium, pyloric-type glands, and fibrous tissue.

name: Phenotypic abnormality
description: A phenotypic abnormality.

name: Abnormal circulating creatine concentration
description: A deviation from the normal concentration of creatine in the blood circulation. Creatine is a derivative of glycine having methyl and amidino groups attached to the nitrogen. Creatine is naturally produced from amino acids, primarily in liver and kidney, and acts as an energy source for cells, primarly for muscle cells.

name: Abnormal cortical radial artery intima/media morphology
description: Any structural anomaly of the inner or middle layer of the cortical radial arteries (also known as interlobular arteries) of the kidney.

name: Enlarged cerebellum
description: An abnormally increased size of the cerebellum compared to other brain structures.

name: Hypersarcosinuria
description: An elevated urinary concentration of sarcosine.

name: Glomerular capillary wall duplication with cellular interposition
description: Double contouring of the original glomerular basement membrane (GBM)/additional layer(s) of overlying basement membrane matrix with interposed migrated cells (mesangial, endothelial, monocytes) between the layers of original GBM and de novo GBM.

name: Simple renal cyst
description: An isolated cyst of the kidney.
synonyms: ["Simple kidney cyst","single cortical cyst","Solitary renal cyst"]

name: Bulging of the costochondral junction
description: Abnormal outward curving (protuberance) of the junction of ribs and costal cartilage.

name: Abnormal portal venous system morphology
description: Any structural anomaly of the portal venous sytem, which comprises all of the veins draining the abdominal part of the digestive tract, including the lower esophagus but excluding the lower anal canal. The portal vein conveys blood from viscera and ramifies like an artery at the liver, ending at the sinusoids. Tributaries of the portal vein, which make up the portal venous system, are the splenic, superior mesenteric, left gastric, right gastric, paraumbilical, and cystic veins.

name: Asymmetrical distribution of pattern reversal visual evoked potentials
synonyms: ["Crossed asymmetry of pattern reversal visual evoked potentials"]

name: HbH hemoglobin
description: Hemoglobin H (HbH) contains four beta-globin chains. It is normally not present at all in blood, but may make up about 1-40 percent of all hemoglobin in HbH disease, a subform of alpha thalassemia.

name: Abnormal lumbar spine morphology
description: Any structural abnormality of the lumbar vertebral column.

name: Ultra-low vision with retained motion projection
description: Ultra-low vision but with retained ability to identify a moving object (typically hand motion at distance of 30 cm).

name: Decreased sialylation of N-linked protein glycosylation
description: Decreased addition of sialic acids to N-linked glycans.

name: Chylopericardium
description: Accumulation of chyle (the whitish fluid taken up by the lacteals in the intestine, consisting of an emulsion of lymph and triglyceride fat thatpasses into the veins by the thoracic duct) in the pericardium. Chylopericardium is generally caused by obstruction of or trauma to the thoracic duct.

name: Immune dysregulation
description: Altered immune function characterized by lymphoid proliferation, immune activation, and excessive autoreactivity often leading to autoimmune/inflammatory complications.

name: Egg allergy
description: Hypersensitivity in form of an adverse immune reaction against eggs.
synonyms: ["Allergy to eggs","Egg allergy","IgE-mediated egg allergy","Immunoglobulin E-mediated egg allergy"]

name: Reduced 5-oxoprolinase level
description: Decreased level of the reaction 5-oxo-L-proline + ATP + 2 H(2)O = L-glutamate + ADP + 2 H(+) + phosphate.

name: Interhypothalamic Adhesion
description: An abnormal parenchymal band connecting the medial margins of the left and right hypothalami across the third ventricle.

name: Partial absence of specific antibody response to meningococcus vaccine
description: A reduced ability to synthesize postvaccination antibodies against a meningococcus antigen, as measured by antibody titer determination following vaccination.

name: Spontaneous platelet aggregation
description: Clumping together of platelets in the blood in a platelet aggregation test without addition of agents normally used to induce aggregation.

name: Multicystic kidney dysplasia
description: Multicystic dysplasia of the kidney is characterized by multiple cysts of varying size in the kidney and the absence of a normal pelvicaliceal system. The condition is associated with ureteral or ureteropelvic atresia, and the affected kidney is nonfunctional.

name: Coronal craniosynostosis
description: Premature closure of the coronal suture of skull.
synonyms: ["HP:0002675","HP:0002685","HP:0002739","HP:0004441","Coronal suture craniosynostosis","Coronal suture synostosis","Craniosynostosis of coronal suture"]

name: Abnormality of interleukin secretion
description: An abnormality in the production or cellular release of interleukins (a class of cytokines).

name: Decreased circulating apolipoprotein AI concentration
description: Reduced criculating level of apolipoprotein AI, which is the major protein component of high density lipoprotein (HDL) in plasma. Defects in this gene are associated with HDL deficiencies, including Tangier disease.
synonyms: ["Decreased apo-AI level","Decreased apoA-I level","Decreased apolipoprotein AI level"]

name: Male urethral meatus stenosis
description: An abnormal narrowing of the urethral opening (meatus) of the penis.

name: Bilambdoid synostosis
description: Premature synostosis of both lambdoid sutures.

name: Limited elbow extension
description: Limited ability to straighten the arm at the elbow joint.
synonyms: ["HP:0005073","Decreased elbow extension","Elbow limited extension","Limitation of elbow extension","Limited elbow extension","Limited extension at elbows","Limited forearm extension","Restricted elbow extension"]

name: Hamartomatous polyposis
description: Polyp-like protrusions which are histologically hamartomas. These can occur throughout the gastrointestinal tract. Hamartomatous polyps are composed of the normal cellular elements of the gastrointestinal tract, but have a markedly distorted architecture.

name: Laryngeal cleft
description: Presence of a gap in the posterior laryngotracheal wall with a continuity between the larynx and the esopahagus.

name: Abnormal circulating pyruvate family amino acid concentration
description: An abnormality of a pyruvate family amino acid metabolic process.
synonyms: ["Abnormality of pyruvate family amino acid metabolism"]

name: Metatarsal synostosis
synonyms: ["HP:0004705","HP:0008098","Fusion of metatarsals","Fusion of the long bones of the feet","Synostosis involving metatarsal bones"]

name: Sclerotic vertebral endplates
description: Sclerosis (increased density) affecting vertebral end plates.

name: Decreased facial expression
description: A reduced degree of voluntary and involuntary facial movements involved in responded to others or expressing emotions.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the sweat glands
description: Absence or developmental hypoplasia of the sweat glands.

name: Perioral radial furrowing
description: The presence of radial grooves in the skin surrounding the mouth (see Figure 4 of PMID:27833976).

name: Hyperdeviation
description: A type of strabismus in which the visual axis of one eye is higher than that of the other.

name: Perifolliculitis
description: Inflammation surrounding hair follicles.

name: Decreased corneal thickness
description: A decreased anteroposterior thickness of the cornea.

name: Hypersegmentation of proximal phalanx of second finger
description: Presence of an additional phalanx-like bone, producing an extra, wedge-shaped bone at the base of the proximal phalanx of the second finger.

name: Exostoses of hand bones
description: Abnormal formation of new bone on the surface of a bone of the hand.

name: EEG with burst suppression
description: The burst suppression pattern in electroencephalography refers to a characteristic periodic pattern of low voltage (<10 microvolts) suppressed background and a relatively shorter pattern of higher amplitude slow, sharp, and spiking complexes.

name: Restrictive external ophthalmoplegia
description: Fibrosis of the external ocular muscles such that the eyes of affected individuals are partially or completely fixed in a strabismic position. Residual eye movements are significantly limited.

name: Hypoplastic ischia
description: Underdevelopment of the ischium, which forms the lower and back part of the hip bone.

name: Ganglioglioma
description: Gangliogliomas are rare tumours of the central nervous system. The are WHO grade I and considered low grade. They are well differentiated neuroepithelial tumours consisting of both dysplastic neuronal and neoplastic glial cells.

name: Increased anti-drug IgE antibody level
description: Increased level of IgE antibody against a drug or class of drugs, such as antibiotics.

name: C2-C3 subluxation
description: A partial dislocation of the intervertebral joint between the second and third cervical vertebrae.

name: Cervix cancer
description: A tumor of the uterine cervix.

name: Stage 1 chronic kidney disease
description: A type of chronic kidney disease with normal or increased glomerular filtration rate (GFR at least 90 mL/min/1.73 m2).

name: Increased susceptibility to fractures
description: An abnormally increased tendency to fractures of bones caused by an abnormal reduction in bone strength that is generally associated with an increased risk of fracture.
synonyms: ["HP:0002662","HP:0002798","HP:0005710","HP:0005783","HP:0005931","Abnormal susceptibility to fractures","Bone fragility","Frequent broken bones","Increased bone fragility","Increased susceptibility to fractures","Increased tendency to fractures"]

name: Decreased serum insulin-like growth factor 1
description: A reduced level of insulin-like growth factor 1 (IGF1) in the blood circulation.

name: Intellectual disability, moderate
description: Moderate mental retardation is defined as an intelligence quotient (IQ) in the range of 35-49.
synonyms: ["HP:0007303","IQ between 34 and 49","Mental retardation, moderate","Moderate mental deficiency","Moderate mental retardation"]

name: Exaggerated cupid's bow
