description: More pronounced paramedian peaks and median notch of the Cupid's bow.
synonyms: ["Cupid bow upper lip","Cupid's bow, accentuated","Cupid-bow shaped upper lip","Exaggerated cupid's bow","Prominent cupid-bow of upper lip"]

name: Increased level of ribose in urine
description: An increase in the level of ribose in the urine.

name: Abnormal right ventricle morphology
description: An abnormality of the right ventricle of the heart.
synonyms: ["Abnormality of the right ventricle","Right ventricular abnormality"]

name: Centrilobular ground-glass opacification on pulmonary HRCT
description: A hazy area of increased attenuation in centrilobular areas of the lung with preserved bronchial and vascular markings seen on a computer tomography scan. Centrilobular refers to a location that is central within secondary pulmonary lobules.

name: Fluctuating splenomegaly
description: Intermittently increased size of the spleen.

name: Ectopic parathyroid
description: An abnormal anatomical location of the parathyroid gland.

name: Gliosis
description: Gliosis is the focal proliferation of glial cells in the central nervous system.

name: Malignant neoplasm of the central nervous system
description: A tumor that originates in the pineal gland, has moderate cellularity and tends to form rosette patterns.

name: Epicanthus inversus
description: A fold of skin starting at or just below the medial aspect of the lower lid and arching upward to cover, extend in front of and lateral to the medial canthus.

name: Periarticular soft-tissue mass
description: A lump detected in the region that surrounds a joiny. In this context, mass is a general term for a lump or growth that may be caused by the abnormal growth of cells, a cyst, hormonal changes, or an immune reaction.

name: Aplastic/Hypoplastic nasopharyngeal adenoids
description: Absence or underdevelopment of the nasopharyngeal adenoids.

name: Periosteal new bone of humeral diaphysis
Focal impaired awareness sensory seizure with somatosensory features
description: A focal sensory seizure with somatosensory features in which awareness is partially or fully impaired at some point during the seizure.

name: Congenital palmoplantar hyperkeratosis
description: Abnormal thickening of the skin on the palms and soles that is present at birth.
synonyms: ["HP:0007597","Congenital palmoplantar keratoderma","Congenital palmoplantar keratodermia","Congenital palmoplantar keratosis"]

name: Bracket epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 4th finger
description: An abnormality of the proximal phalanx of the fourth finger in which the epiphysis surrounds a phalangeal bone, having a bracket-like form and reaching from the proximal side of a phalanx to the distal side.
synonyms: ["HP:0004200","Bracket proximal epiphysis of the ring finger","Bracket shaped end part of the innermost bone of the ring finger"]

name: Absence of bactericidal oxidative respiratory burst in phagocytes
description: An absence of the phase of elevated metabolic activity, during which oxygen consumption increases, that occurs in neutrophils, monocytes, and macrophages shortly after phagocytosing material. An enhanced uptake of oxygen leads to the production, by an NADH dependent system, of hydrogen peroxide (H2O2), superoxide anions and hydroxyl radicals, which play a part in microbiocidal activity.

name: Neurodevelopmental abnormality
description: A deviation from normal of the neurological development of a child, which may include any or all of the aspects of the development of personal, social, gross or fine motor, and cognitive abilities.

name: Abnormality of humoral immunity
description: An abnormality of the humoral immune system, which comprises antibodies produced by B cells as well as the complement system.

name: Optic ataxia
description: Difficulty reaching to visually guided goals in peripheral vision, with the deficit leaves voluntary eye movements largely unaffected.

name: Triggered by sodium ingestion
description: Applies to a sign or symptom that is provoked or brought about by eating or drinking sodium.
synonyms: ["Sodium ingestion triggered symptoms","Sodium intake triggered attacks","Triggered by Na ingestion","Triggered by Na+ ingestion","Triggered by sodium intake"]

name: Abnormality of the somatic nervous system
description: Any abnormality of the part of the peripheral nervous system associated with sensation and skeletal muscle voluntary control of body movements.

name: Apical muscular ventricular septal defect
description: A muscular ventricular septal defect located at the apex of the heart.

name: Optic nerve glioma
description: A glioma originating in the optic nerve or optic chiasm.

name: Hypoplasia of the lower eyelids
description: Underdevelopment of the lower eyelid.
synonyms: ["Decreased size of lower eyelid","Small lower eyelid","Underdevelopment of lower eyelid"]

name: Abnormality of the biliary system
description: An abnormality of the biliary system.

name: Abnormality of the forearm
description: An abnormality of the lower arm.

name: Abnormal granulocyte morphology
description: Any structural abnormality or abnormal count of granulocytes.

name: Morbilliform
description: Applies to an abnormality whose distribution and appearance resembles that of measles, i.e., maculopapular lesions that are red and roughly 2 to 10 mm in diameter and may be partially confluent.

name: Increased CSF lysine concentration
description: Abnormally increased levels of lysine in cerebrospinal fluid.

name: Hypoplastic iris stroma
description: Underdevelopment of the stroma of iris.
synonyms: ["HP:0007991","HP:0008027","Hypoplastic iris stoma","Iris stromal hypoplasia","Underdeveloped iris stroma"]

name: Partial duplication of the phalanges of the 3rd finger
description: A partial duplication, depending on severity leading to a broad or bifid appearance, affecting one or more of the phalanges of the 3rd finger. As opposed to a complete duplication there is still a variable degree of fusion between the duplicated bones.

name: Delayed ossification of carpal bones
description: Ossification of carpal bones occurs later than age-adjusted norms.
synonyms: ["Carpal delayed ossification","Delayed carpal bone age","Delayed carpal ossification","Delayed maturation of carpal bones"]

name: Psychomotor deterioration
description: Loss of previously present mental and motor abilities.

name: Cleft in skull base
description: A bony defect in the skull base.
synonyms: ["Cleft in cranial base","Cleft in skull base"]

name: Upper eyelid retraction
description: An elevation of the eyelid above the normal level in the primary position.

name: Abnormality of the twelfth cranial nerve
description: Abnormality of the twelfth cranial nerve.
synonyms: ["Abnormality of cranial nerve 12","Abnormality of cranial nerve xii","Abnormality of the hypoglossal nerve"]

name: Focal impaired awareness motor seizure with dysarthria/anarthria
description: A focal motor seizure with dysarthria / anarthria characterized by impaired awareness at some point during the seizure.
synonyms: ["Focal motor impaired awareness seizure with dysarthria/anarthria"]

name: Elevated urine L-alloisoleucine level
description: Abnormally increased level of L-alloisoleucine in the urine.

name: Neoplasm of the outer ear
description: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the outer ear.

name: Eunuchoid habitus
description: A body habitus that is tall, slim and underweight, with long legs and long arms (i.e., arm span exceeds height by 5 cm or more).

name: Progressive hearing impairment
description: A progressive form of hearing impairment.

name: Complete or near-complete absence of specific antibody response to unconjugated pneumococcus vaccine
description: The inability to synthesize postvaccination antibodies against a pneumococcus antigen, as measured by antibody titer determination following vaccination.

name: Acute pancreatitis
description: A acute form of pancreatitis.

name: Dystonia
description: An abnormally increased muscular tone that causes fixed abnormal postures. There is a slow, intermittent twisting motion that leads to exaggerated turning and posture of the extremities and trunk.

name: Renal interstitial hemosiderin
description: Deposition of hemosiderin (a golden-brown, granular pigment derived from ferritin) in interstitial cells of the kidney.

name: Hyporeflexia of upper limbs
description: Reduced intensity of muscle tendon reflexes in the upper limbs. Reflexes are elicited by stretching the tendon of a muscle, e.g., by tapping.

name: Hypoplastic aortic arch
description: Underdevelopment of the arch of aorta.

name: Abnormal pupillary light reflex
description: An abnormality of the reflex that controls the diameter of the pupil, in response to the intensity of light that falls on the retina of the eye.

name: Pericardial effusion
description: Accumulation of fluid within the pericardium.

name: Focal cognitive seizure with dissociation
description: A focal cognitive seizure characterized by an experience of being disconnected from, though aware of, self or environment as the initial semiological manifestation.

name: Micropenis
description: Abnormally small penis. At birth, the normal penis is about 3 cm (stretched length from pubic tubercle to tip of penis) with micropenis less than 2.0-2.5 cm.

name: Ubiquitin-positive cerebral inclusion bodies
description: Nuclear or cytoplasmic aggregates that show positive staining with antibodies against ubiquitin within cells of the brain.

name: Abnormality of the internal auditory canal
description: An abnormality of the Internal acoustic meatus, i.e., of the canal in the petrous part of the temporal bone through which the cranial nerve VII and cranial nerve VIII traverse.

name: Abnormality of peripheral nerve conduction
description: An abnormality of the conduction of electrical impulses by peripheral (motor or sensory) nerves. This finding is elicited by a nerve conduction study (NCS).

name: Elevated transferrin saturation
description: An above normal level of saturation of serum transferrin with iron.

name: Abnormal doll's eye reflex
description: The doll's eye reflex (also known as oculocephalic reflex) is a test of brain function that is performed in comatose patients by elevating the head roughly 30 degrees and rapidly rotating the head from side to side with the eyes kept open. A normal response is for the eyes to move in the opposite direction. If the eyes do not move in the opposite direction this may indicate severe brain damage.

name: Rigidity
description: Continuous involuntary sustained muscle contraction. When an affected muscle is passively stretched, the degree of resistance remains constant regardless of the rate at which the muscle is stretched. This feature helps to distinguish rigidity from muscle spasticity.

name: Broad proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger
description: Increased width of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger.
synonyms: ["HP:0004126","Wide innermost bone of index finger","Wide/broad proximal index finger phalanx"]

name: Metaphyseal enchondromatosis
description: An enchondroma is a benign growth of cartilage that develops within the medullary cavity of bone. Enchondromatosis refers to the presence of multiple enchondromas, and this term refers to the presence of multiple enchondromas within the medulla of metaphyseal bone. Radiographically an enchondroma presents a an oval, linear, or pyramidal osteolytic (radiolucent) lesion with well defined margins.

name: Short mandibular condyles
synonyms: ["Bilateral hypoplasia of condylar process of mandible","Bilateral hypoplasia of mandibular condylar head","Bilateral hypoplasia of mandibular condylar neck","Decreased height of condylar process of mandible","Decreased length of condylar process of mandible","Short condylar process of mandible"]

name: Macular exudate
description: Yellow-white intraretinal deposits in the macula typically associated with damaged outer blood-retina barrier and exudation of serous fluid and lipids from the retinal microvasculature.

name: Reduced prothrombin antigen
description: Reduced prothrombin antigen as measured by ELISA assay. Prothrombin is a vitamin K-dependent coagulation factor that is proteolytically cleaved to form thrombin.

name: Gonadal tissue inappropriate for external genitalia or chromosomal sex
Submacular hemorrhage
description: Bleeding between the neurosensory retina and the retinal pigment epithelium (RPE) arising from the choroidal or retinal circulation.

name: Triangular nuclear cataract
description: A nuclear cataract with a triangular form.

name: Decreased circulating IgG subclass level
description: A reduction below the normal concentration of a subclass of immunoglobulin G (IgG) in the blood.

name: Congenital alveolar dysplasia
description: Arrest of lung development in the cananicular stage (weeks 18 to 26 of human gestation) resulting in simplified acinar spaces, frequently with abundant intervening mesenchyme and no alveoli. In later arrest growth stages early saccular formations may be seen. May resemble the lobular maldevelopment often seen in alveolar capillary dysplasia/misaligment of the pulmonary veins without vein misalignment or marked hypertensive changes of the pulmonary arteries.

name: Thin vermilion border
description: Height of the vermilion of the medial part of the lip more than 2 SD below the mean, or apparently reduced height of the vermilion of the lip in the frontal view. The vermilion is the red part of the lips (and confusingly, the vermilion itself is also often referred to as being equivalent the lips).
synonyms: ["HP:0000213","Decreased volume of lip","Decreased volume of lip vermillion","Thin lips","Thin vermillion"]

name: Abnormal uvea morphology
description: An abnormality of the uvea, the vascular layer of the eyeball.

name: Increased urinary mucus
description: An increased amount of urinary mucus. A small amount of mucus is produced by mucous membrane epithelial cells of the urinary tract. An increased amount of mucus can be detected upon urinalysis or other assays and may indicate conditions such as urinary tract infection, urinary tract reconstruction involving the use of bowel segments, or contamination of the urine sample prior to urinalysis.

name: Elevated urinary carboxylic acid
description: An increased amount of carboxylic acid in the urine.

name: Pes planus
description: A foot where the longitudinal arch of the foot is in contact with the ground or floor when the individual is standing; or, in a patient lying supine, a foot where the arch is in contact with the surface of a flat board pressed against the sole of the foot by the examiner with a pressure similar to that expected from weight bearing; or, the height of the arch is reduced.

name: Negativism
description: Opposing or not responding to instructions or external stimuli.

name: Small yellow foveal lesion with surrounding gray zone
description: A lesion that is observed following light damage to the macula. Damage to the retinal by exposure to intense visible light, usually the sun. Intense light exposure such as staring at the sun causes fine structural anomalies in the outer segments of the photoreceptors and the retinal pigment epithelium (RPE) cells of the macula. Symptoms usually develop within 1 to 4 h after exposure and include decreased vision, metamorphopsia, micropsia, and central or paracentral scotomas. Fundus examination typically shows a small yellow spot with a surrounding gray zone in the foveolar or parafoveolar area. Spontaneous evolution leads to the improvement of visual acuity.
synonyms: ["Small yellow foveal lesion with surrounding grey zone"]

name: Abnormal involuntary eye movements
description: Anomalous movements of the eyes that occur without the subject wanting them to happen.

name: Renal tubular epithelial lipofuscin
description: Presence of increased amount of lipofuscin, a yellow, granular cytoplasmic pigment in the renal tubules.

name: Shoulder flexion contracture
description: Chronic reduction in active and passive mobility of the shoulder joint due to structural changes in muscle, tendons, ligaments, or skin that prevents normal movement.

name: Severe norovirus infection
description: An unusually severe course of infection with Human norovirus, previously known as Norwalk virus. Norovirus, an RNA virus of the family Caliciviridae, is a human enteric pathogen. Norovirus infection-associated illness may also be more prolonged and severe in immunocompromised individuals and may be associated with remarkably persistent viral excretion in some of these individuals.

name: Midline nasal groove
description: An abnormal groove on the midline of the nose that may extend to the nasal tip.

name: Broad phalanges of the 3rd finger
description: Increased width of the phalanges of the 3rd finger.
synonyms: ["HP:0004166","Wide bones of middle finger","Wide/broad middle finger phalanges"]

name: Abnormality of the distal phalanx of the thumb
description: Any anomaly of the distal phalanx of thumb.
synonyms: ["HP:0004081","Abnormality of terminal thumb phalanx","Abnormality of the outermost bone of the thumb"]

name: Whistling appearance
description: An abnormality of facial morphology characterized by a small mouth opening and constant contraction of the lips as if the patient were whistling.

name: T-cell acute lymphoblastic leukemias
description: Acute lymphoblastic leukemia of T-cell origin. It comprises about 15% of childhood cases and 25% of adult cases. It is more common in males than females.

name: Cupped metaphyses of the upper limbs
synonyms: ["Cupped wide portion of the upper limb bone"]

name: Absent epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 5th finger
description: Absence of the epiphysis located at the proximal end of the proximal phalanx of the 5th finger.
synonyms: ["Absent end part of the innermost bone of little finger","Absent end part of the innermost bone of pinkie finger","Absent end part of the innermost bone of pinky finger"]

name: Premature adrenarche
description: Onset of adrenarche at an earlier age than usual.

name: Carnitinuria
description: An elevated level of carnitine in the urine.

name: Microdontia of primary teeth
description: Decreased size of the primary teeth.
synonyms: ["Decreased size of primary tooth","Decreased width of baby teeth","Decreased width of deciduous teeth","Decreased width of milk teeth","Decreased width of primary tooth","Microdontia of deciduous teeth","Small deciduous teeth"]

name: Abnormal sperm tail morphology
description: A structural abnormality of the sperm tail.

name: Galactosuria
description: Elevated concentration of galactose in the urine.

name: Anisospondyly
description: Abnormally increased variability of the size of the vertebral bodies.

name: Bone pain
description: An unpleasant sensation characterized by physical discomfort (such as pricking, throbbing, or aching) localized to bone.

name: Anti-class I HLA antibody positivity
description: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against a class I human leukocyte antigen (HLA). Class I HLA corresponds to MHC class I (A, B, and C).

name: Primary hyperaldosteronism
description: A form of hyperaldosteronism caused by a defect within the adrenal gland.

name: Decreased circulating IgG2 level
description: A reduction in immunoglobulin levels of the IgG2 subclass in the blood circulation.
synonyms: ["HP:0008310","Decreased IgG2 level in blood","Immunoglobulin IgG2 deficiency","Reduced IgG2 levels"]

name: Abnormal CSF isoleucine concentration
description: Any deviation from the normal concentration of isoleucine in the cerebrospinal fluid.

name: Vesicoallantoic abdominal wall defect
description: An abdominal wall defected related to a developmental anomaly of the allantois, which is an embryonic structure that develops as a diverticulum off the yolk sac at about 16 days post fertilization. During further development, the allantois becomes incorporated into the body of the embryo, connecting the ventral aspect of the urogenital sinus (which will develop into the upper pole of the urinary bladder) to the external portion of the umbilicus. Upon further development, the lumen of the allantois becomes obliterated and forms a thick fibrous cord called the urachus, which connects the apex of the bladder to the umbilicus. In adults, the urachus is known as the median umbilical ligament. Failure of the allantoic cavity to obliterate can result of one of four conditions: 1) congenital patent urachus (a completely open connection between bladder and umbilicus); 2) vesicourachal diverticulum (a diverticulum off the bladder but not communicating with the umbilicus); umbilical cyst and sinus (not communicating with the bladder); and 4) alternating urachal sinus. An abdominal wall defect can be associated with a urachal cyst.

name: Pulsatile tinnitus
description: Pulsatile tinnitus is generally classified a kind of objective tinnitus, meaning that it is not only audible to the patient but also to the examiner on auscultation of the auditory canal and/or of surrounding structures with use of an auscultation tube or stethoscope. Usually, pulsatile tinnitus is heard as a lower pitched thumping or booming, a rougher blowing sound which is coincidental with respiration, or as a clicking, higher pitched rhythmic sensation.

name: Short femoral neck
description: An abnormally short femoral neck (which is the process of bone, connecting the femoral head with the femoral shaft).
synonyms: ["HP:0003032","HP:0008779","HP:0008793","Hypoplasia of the femoral neck","Hypoplastic femoral neck","Short femoral necks","Short neck of thighbone"]

name: Lip telangiectasia
description: Telangiectasia (that is, the presence of small dilated superficial blood vessels) of the lips.

name: Abnormal proportion of effector memory CD8-positive, alpha-beta T cells
description: An abnormal proportion of effector memory CD8-positive, alpha-beta memory T cells compared to the total number of T cells in the blood. These cells have the phenotype of CCR7-negative, CD127-positive, CD45RA-negative, CD45RO-positive, and CD25-negative.

name: Intramuscular Myxoma
description: A benign tumor that is usually solitary, painless, palpable mass that is firm in consistency and slightly movable and often fluctuant. It can occur in any location, but tends to involve the muscles of the thighs, buttocks, and shoulders. On microscopic examination, there is abundant mucoid material and relative hypo cellularity and loose reticulin fibers. Vascular structures are sparse. The cells have a stellate shape with small hyper chromatic pyknotic nuclei and scanty cytoplasm. Some myxomas may show focal areas of hyper cellularity. However absence of nuclear atypia, mitotic figures or necrosis helps to rule out malignancy.

name: Decreased methylcobalamin
description: Decreased concentration of methylcobalamin. Methylcobalamin is a form of vitamin B12.

name: Hypoglycemic coma
synonyms: ["Coma caused by low blood sugar","Coma, hypoglycemic","Hypoglycaemic coma","Loss of consciousness due to hypoglycemia"]

name: Renal interstitial eosinophil infiltration
description: Increased numbers of eosinophils in the interstitial tissues of the kidney.

name: Flared metaphysis
description: The presence of a splayed (i.e.,flared) metaphyseal segment of one or more long bones.
synonyms: ["HP:0000945","HP:0003047","HP:0004994","HP:0005015","HP:0005095","HP:0200002","Flared wide portion of long bone","Flared, widened metaphyses","marked metaphyseal flaring of long bones","Metaphyseal flaring","Metaphyseal flaring of long bones","Metaphyseal splaying","Metaphyses flared","Splayed metaphyses"]

name: Abnormal timing of pattern reversal visual evoked potentials
Preaxial hand polydactyly
description: Supernumerary digits located at the radial side of the hand. Polydactyly (supernumerary digits) involving the thumb occurs in many distinct forms of high variability and severity. Ranging from fleshy nubbins over varying degrees of partial duplication/splitting to completely duplicated or even triplicated thumbs or preaxial (on the radial side of the hand) supernumerary digits.
synonyms: ["HP:0005629","HP:0005634","HP:0006182","HP:0009604","Extra thumb","Polydactyly affecting the thumb","Preaxial polydactyly of hands","Supernumerary thumb","thumb polydactyly"]

name: Glomerular basement membranes powdery deposit
description: Punctate electron-dense material typically in a band-like distribution along the lamina rara interna and within tubular basement membranes within the subendothelial aspect of the glomerular basement membrane.

name: Maternal virilization in pregnancy
description: Virilization (deepening of voice, facial hirsutism and scalp hair loss) with onset during pregnancy (usually towards the end of the first trimester) and regression several months post-partum.

name: Abnormal B cell morphology
description: A structural abnormality of B cells.

name: Low intestinal alkaline phosphatase
description: An abnormally reduced level of alkaline phosphatase, intestinal type in the blood.

name: Bilateral superior vena cava with bridging vein
Focal motor status epilepticus
description: Status epilepticus with focal motor signs originating within networks limited to one hemisphere. Involves musculature in any form. The motor event could consist of an increase (positive) or decrease (negative) in muscle contraction to produce a movement.

name: Bowman-space proteinaceous debris
description: The presence of eosinophilic Periodic Acid Schiff (PAS)-positive cell free, protein-derived material occupying Bowman's space.

name: Sclerosis of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd toe
description: An elevation in bone density in the proximal phalanx of the second toe. Sclerosis is normally detected on a radiograph as an area of increased opacity.
synonyms: ["Increased bone density in the innermost bone of the 2nd toe"]

name: Impaired social interactions
description: Difficulty in social interactions related to an impairment of characteristics such as eye contact, smiling, appropriate facial expressions, and body postures and characterized by difficulty in forming peer relationships and forming friendships.
synonyms: ["Impaired social interaction","Impaired social interactions","Poor social interactions"]

name: Decreased proportion of central memory CD4-positive, alpha-beta T cells
description: A reduced proportion of central memory CD4-positive, alpha-beta memory T cells compared to the total number of T cells in the blood. These cells have the phenotype of CCR7-positive, CD127-positive, CD45RA-negative, CD45RO-positive, and CD25-negative.
synonyms: ["HP:0025622","Decreased proportion of CD4+ central memory cells","Decreased proportion of CD4-positive central memory cells","Decreased proportion of central memory CD4+, alpha-beta T cell","Reduced proportion of CD4+ central memory cells"]

name: Decreased circulating apolipoprotein concentration
description: Reduced concentration in the blood circulation of a lipid-transport protein (apoliprotein).

name: Abnormal anatomic location of the heart
description: Developmental defect characterized by an anomalous anatomic location of the heart.

name: Thalamic arteriovenous malformation
description: An arteriovenous malformation is a disruption of the normal vascular pattern in which arteries or arterioles connect directly to the venous collection system, bypassing any capillary bed. This term refers to an arteriovenous malformation located in the thalamus.

name: obsolete Fused epiphysis of terminal phalanx of the middle finger
Hepatic lobular inflammation
description: Infiltration of inflammatory cells in lobules of the liver. A focus of lobular inflammation can be defined as two or more inflammatory cells (neutrophils, lymphocytes and other mononuclear cells, eosinophils and microgranulomas) within the lobule present within the sinusoids or surrounding injured hepatocytes (ballooned or apoptotic hepatocytes).

name: Abnormal circulating deoxycorticosterone level
description: An abnormality of the concentration of deoxycorticosterone in the blood. Deoxycorticosterone comprises 11-deoxycorticosterone and 21-deoxycorticosterone.

name: Facial muscle hypertrophy
description: Hypertrophy of one or more muscles innervated by the facial nerve (the seventh cranial nerve).
synonyms: ["Increased size of facial muscles","Large facial muscles"]

name: Reduced muscle fiber gamma sarcoglycan
description: Immunohistochemistry reveals reduced gamma sarcoglycan protein in the muscle biopsy.

name: Duplication of the proximal phalanx of the 5th finger
description: Partial or complete duplication of the fifth proximal phalanx of hand.
synonyms: ["Duplication of the innermost little finger bone","Duplication of the innermost pinkie finger bone","Duplication of the innermost pinky finger bone","Partial/complete duplication of the proximal phalanx of the 5th finger"]

name: Corneal erosion
description: An erosion or abrasion of the cornea's outermost layer of epithelial cells.
synonyms: ["Damage to outer layer of the cornea of the eye"]

name: Osteolytic defects of the middle phalanx of the 3rd toe
Asymmetric limb muscle stiffness
description: Stiffness of the limbs (a condition in which muscles cannot be moved quickly without accompanying pain or spasm) occurring in an asymmetric pattern.

name: Amegakaryocytic thrombocytopenia
description: Thrombocytopenia related to lack of or severe reduction in the count of megakaryocytes.

name: Long upper lip
description: Increased width of the upper lip.
synonyms: ["Elongation of upper lip","Increased height of upper lip","Increased vertical length of upper lip","Long upper lip"]

name: Cicatricial lagophthalmos
description: A type of lagophthalmos that occurs following trauma or surgery.
synonyms: ["Eyelids stay open due to scarring","Inability to close the eyelids due to scarring"]

name: Focal aware motor seizure with paresis/paralysis
description: A focal motor seizure with paresis / paralysis characterized by retained awareness throughout the seizure.

name: Long palm
description: For children from birth to 16 years of age the length of the palm is more than the 97th centile; or, the length of the palm appears relatively long compared to the finger length or the limb length.

name: Abnormal shape of the palpebral fissure
description: The presence of an abnormal shape of the palpebral fissure.
synonyms: ["Abnormal morphology of the palpebral fissure","Abnormal shape of the opening between the eyelids"]

name: Fatty replacement of ventricular myocardial tissue
description: Presence of an increased amount of fat tissue within a cardiac ventricle with corresponding reduction of muscle tissue.
synonyms: ["Fatty infiltration of cardiac ventricle","Intramyocardial fat infiltration"]

name: Eruptive vellus hair cyst
description: A cutaneous cyst that is small (one or two millimeters in diameter) and painless, presenting as a follicular papule that usually is skin colored but may have a reddish or brownish tinge.

name: Milia
description: Presence of multiple small cysts containing keratin (skin protein) and presenting as tiny pearly-white bumps just under the surface of the skin.

name: Postural instability
description: A tendency to fall or the inability to keep oneself from falling; imbalance. The retropulsion test is widely regarded as the gold standard to evaluate postural instability, Use of the retropulsion test includes a rapid balance perturbation in the backward direction, and the number of balance correcting steps (or total absence thereof) is used to rate the degree of postural instability. Healthy subjects correct such perturbations with either one or two large steps, or without taking any steps, hinging rapidly at the hips while swinging the arms forward as a counterweight. In patients with balance impairment, balance correcting steps are often too small, forcing patients to take more than two steps. Taking three or more steps is generally considered to be abnormal, and taking more than five steps is regarded as being clearly abnormal. Markedly affected patients continue to step backward without ever regaining their balance and must be caught by the examiner (this would be called true retropulsion). Even more severely affected patients fail to correct entirely, and fall backward like a pushed toy soldier, without taking any corrective steps.

name: Pineocytoma
description: A type of pineal parenchymal cell neoplasm that is a mature well-differentiated tumour (WHO grade I).

name: Cholestasis
description: Impairment of bile flow due to obstruction in bile ducts.
synonyms: ["Slowed or blocked flow of bile from liver"]

name: Medullary peritubular capillary intraluminal thrombi
description: Mixture of fibrin, red blood cells, platelets partly or completely occluding the vascular lumen of the peritubular capillaries located in the medulla of the kidney.

name: Camptodactyly of toe
description: Camptodactyly is a painless flexion contracture of the proximal interphalangeal (PIP) joint that is usually gradually progressive. This term refers to camptodactyly of one or more toes.

name: Melanin pigment aggregation in hair shafts
Abnormality of the vertebral endplates
description: Any abnormality of the vertebral end plates, which are the top and bottom portions of the vertebral bodies that interface with the vertebral discs.

name: Triangular shaped phalanges of the 3rd finger
description: Triangular shaped phalanges of the 3rd finger. A triangular or so called delta shaped phalanx is a typical result after a bracket epiphysis of the affected phalanx.
synonyms: ["Triangular shaped bone of the middle finger"]

name: obsolete Severe neonatal hypotonia in males
Tracheal papilloma
description: A wart-like lesion (papilloma, i.e., benign epithelial tumors that are caused by infection with the human papilloma virus) located on the trachea.

name: Posterolateral diaphragmatic hernia
description: A posterolateral defect in the diaphragm, commonly referred to as a Bochdalek hernia, which is often accompanied by herniation of the stomach, intestines, liver, and/or spleen into the chest cavity.

name: Myoclonic status epilepticus
description: A type of motor status epilepticus with repeating bilateral sudden brief (less than 100 ms) involuntary single or multiple contraction of muscles or muscle groups of variable topography.

name: Abnormality of masticatory muscle
description: Any abnormality of the masticatory muscle.

name: Intestinal duplication
description: A developmental disorder in which there is a duplication the entire intestine or of a portion of the intestine.

name: Increased circulating cortisol level
description: Overproduction of the hormone of cortisol by the adrenal cortex, resulting in a characteristic combination of clinical symptoms termed Cushing syndrome, with truncal obesity, a round, full face, striae atrophicae and acne, muscle weakness, and other features.
synonyms: ["HP:0000850","HP:0001578","HP:0004316","Cushing syndrome","Hypercortisolism","Increased circulating cortisol level","Increased cortisol production"]

name: Medullary peritubular capillary lumen cholesterol emboli
description: Needle-like or slit-like clefts within the interior space of peritubular capillaries located in the medulla of the kidney. Cholesterol emboli are visualized as clear spaces (cholesterol clefts) where the cholesterol crystals have been dissolved by routine processing. Acute lesions can be accompanied by inflammation and fibrin.
synonyms: ["Cholesterol emboli within the medullary peritubular capillary lumen"]

name: Abnormal pons morphology
description: A structural abnormality of the pons.

name: Short 5th toe
description: Underdevelopment (hypoplasia) of the fifth toe.
synonyms: ["Short fifth toe","Short little toe","Short pinkie toe","Short pinky toe"]

name: Mesangial Immune complex deposition
description: Extracellular meangial accumulation of finely granular material corresponding to immunoglobulin and/or complement by immunofluorescence/immunohistochemistry; most typically electron-dense although this may decrease with resorption of the deposit.

name: Fractured carpal bone
description: A partial or complete breakage of the carpal bone.
synonyms: ["bone carpal bone","Broken wrist","Carpal bone fracture","Fractured wrist","Wrist fracture"]

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the musculature of the pelvis
Recurrent bacterial upper respiratory tract infections
description: An increased susceptibility to bacterial upper respiratory tract infections as manifested by a history of recurrent bacterial upper respiratory tract infections (running ears - otitis, sinusitis, pharyngitis, tonsillitis).

name: Respiratory acidosis
description: Acidosis because of respiratory retention of carbon dioxide.

name: Fractured proximal phalanx of digit 3
description: A partial or complete breakage of the proximal phalanx of digit 3.

name: Polyclonal elevation of IgM
description: A heterogeneous increase in IgM immunoglobulins characterized by a diffuse band on serum electrophoresis.

name: Generalized-onset epileptic spasm
description: A type of epileptic spasm of generalized onset.
synonyms: ["Generalised onset epileptic spasm","Generalised-onset epileptic spasm","Generalized onset epileptic spasm"]

name: Hypogeusia
description: A decreased ability to perceive flavor.

name: Osteomalacia
description: Osteomalacia is a general term for bone weakness owing to a defect in mineralization of the protein framework known as osteoid. This defective mineralization is mainly caused by lack in vitamin D. Osteomalacia in children is known as rickets.

name: Fusion of gums
description: A congenital defect with an abnormal joining of the gums of the upper and lower jaw.
synonyms: ["Fusion of gums","Fusion of the gingiva","Gingival synechia","Partial fusion of the gums","Synechia of the gums","Upper and lower gums fused together"]

name: Long-segment aganglionic megacolon
description: A type of aganglionic megacolon in which the aganglionic segment extends proximal to the sigmoid.

name: Abnormal common carotid artery morphology
description: An abnormality of the common carotid arteries, which provide the arterial supply to the head and neck and give rise to the internal carotid artery and the external carotid artery.

name: Generalized aminoaciduria
description: An increased concentration of all types of amino acid in the urine.

name: Retinopathy of prematurity stage 3
description: The neovascularization accumulates at the edge of the vascularized retina and extends into the vitreous (also called extra retinal fibrosis proliferation). In cases of Zone 2 and Zone 3, this may be sausage shaped. In more posterior Zone 1 disease, the stage 3 can appear as a direct extension of the normal retinal vessels but extending tangentially over the avascular retina.

name: Cloudy urine
description: The appearance of the urine having visible material in suspension, i.e., appearing cloudy.

name: Abnormal internal carotid artery morphology
description: An abnormality of an internal carotid artery.

name: Abnormal circulating glutamate concentration
description: Any deviation from the normal concentration of glutamate in the blood circulation.

name: Intratubular bilirubin casts
description: A type of acelluar intratubular casts that have a surface composed of granules, which can vary in size. On H&E (red brown), PAS (amaranth purple), trichrome (red with ragged contours), Hall (olive-emerald green).

name: Abnormality of the temporomandibular joint
description: An anomaly of the temporomandibular joint.
synonyms: ["Abnormality of the jaw joint","Anomaly of the temporomandibular joint","Deformity of the jaw joint","Malformation of jaw joint"]

name: Moderate
description: Having a medium degree of severity. For quantitative traits, a deviation of between three and four standard deviations from the appropriate population mean.

name: Abnormality of the back musculature
description: Any abnormality of the back muscles.

name: Olfactory esthesioneuroblastoma
description: A malignant olfactory neuroblastoma arising from the olfactory epithelium of the superior nasal cavity and cribriform plate.

name: Portal fibrosis
description: Fibroblast proliferation and fiber expansion from the portal areas to the lobule.

name: Perineal fistula
description: The presence of a fistula between the bowel and the perineum.

name: Arcuate vein lumen cholesterol emboli
description: Needle-like or slit-like clefts within the interior space of arcuate veins of the kidney. Cholesterol emboli are visualized as clear spaces (cholesterol clefts) where the cholesterol crystals have been dissolved by routine processing. Acute lesions can be accompanied by inflammation and fibrin.

name: Abnormal CSF carboxylic acid concentration
description: Any deviation from the normal concentration of a carboxylic acid in the cerebrospinal fluid.

name: Sural nerve atrophy
description: Wasting of the sural nerve, a sensory nerve in the calf region of the leg.

name: Hypophosphatemia
description: An abnormally decreased phosphate concentration in the blood.

name: Oblique fracture
description: A type of fracture in which there is a diagonal break across the bone.

name: Absent anterior chamber of the eye
description: Absence of the anterior chamber of the eye owing to a developmental defect.

name: Abnormal lung morphology
description: Any structural anomaly of the lung.
synonyms: ["Abnormality of lung structure","Abnormality of the lungs","Abnormally shaped lung","Unusal lung shape"]

name: Proximal renal tubular acidosis
description: A type of renal tubular acidosis characterized by a failure of the proximal tubular cells to reabsorb bicarbonate, leading to urinary bicarbonate wasting and subsequent acidemia.
synonyms: ["Proximal tubular acidosis","Renal tubular acidosis, proximal","Renal tubular acidosis, type II"]

name: Splenomegaly
description: Abnormal increased size of the spleen.

name: Progressive distal muscle weakness
description: Progressively reduced strength of the distal musculature.
synonyms: ["HP:0008933","HP:0009022","HP:0009057","Muscle weakness, distal, progressive","Muscle weakness, progressive, distal"]

name: Abnormal platelet phosphatidylserine exposure
description: An abnormality of phosphatidylserine (PS) on activated platelets. PS is normally located on the cytoplasmic face of the resting platelet membrane but appears on the plasma-oriented surface of discrete membrane vesicles that derive from activated platelets. Thrombin, the central molecule of coagulation, is produced from prothrombin by a complex (prothrombinase) between factor Xa and its protein cofactor (factor V(a)) that forms on platelet-derived membranes. This complex enhances the rate of activation of prothrombin to thrombin by roughly 150,000 fold relative to factor X(a) in solution. The negatively charged surface of PS-containing platelet-derived membranes is at least partly responsible for this rate enhancement.

name: Decreased proportion of class-switched memory B cells
description: A reduction in the normal proportion of class-switched memory B cells (CD19+/CD27+/IgM+/IgD+) relative to the total number of B cells. Marginal zone B cells undergo limited somatic hypermutation and produce high-affinity IgM and some IgG, whereas class-switched memory B cells synthetize IgG, IgM, and IgA.

name: Elevated urine mevalonic acid
description: An abnormally increased amount of mevanolate in the urine. Mevanolate is that hydroxy monocarboxylic acid anion that is the conjugate base of mevalonic acid.
synonyms: ["Elevated urine mevalonate","Elevated urine mevalonate levels","Mevalonate aciduria"]

name: Irregular ossification of the radial metaphysis
Abnormality of the submandibular glands
description: Any abnormality of the submandibular glands, which are the salivary glands that are located beneath the floor of the mouth, superior to the digastric muscles.

name: Autoimmunity
description: The occurrence of an immune reaction against the organism's own cells or tissues.

name: Opacification of the corneal stroma
description: Reduced transparency of the stroma of cornea.

name: Steroid-sensitive nephrotic syndrome with infrequent relapses
description: A type of steroid-sensitive nephrotic syndrome in which relapses occur at a frequency of one relapse (albumin urine dipstick at least 3+ or proteinuria over 40 mg/m2/d or urinary protein to creatinine ratio at least 2000 mg/g for 3 consecutive days) within 6 months of initial response, or one to three relapses in any 12-month period.

name: Fractured middle phalanx of manual digit 2
description: A partial or complete breakage of the middle phalanx of manual digit 2.

name: Cortical dysplasia
description: The presence of developmental dysplasia of the cerebral cortex.

name: Neonatal electro-clinical motor seizure
description: Neonatal electro-clinical motor seizure is a type of neonatal electro-clinical seizure with predominant motor features.

name: Elevated urinary 3-hydroxybutyric acid
description: An increased amount of 3-hydroxybutyric acid in the urine.

name: Contracture of the metatarsophalangeal joint of the 4th toe
description: The joint between the fourth metatarsal and the proximal phalanx of the fourth toe cannot be straightened actively or passively.

name: Talipes
description: A deformity of foot and ankle that has different subtypes that are talipes equinovarus, talipes equinovalgus, talipes calcaneovarus and talipes calcaneovalgus.

name: Anomaly of the upper limb diaphyses
description: A structural abnormality of a diaphysis of the arm.
synonyms: ["HP:0003857","Abnormality involving the diaphyses of the upper limbs","Abnormality of shaft of long bone of the upper limbs","Diaphyseal abnormality of the upper limbs"]

name: Hyperactive renin-angiotensin system
description: An abnormally increased activity of the renin-angiotensin system, causing hypertension by a combination of volume excess and vasoconstrictor mechanisms.

name: Lateral canthal tendon laxity
description: Laxity of the tendon stabilising the lateral aspect of the tarsal plate to the zygomatic bone. This can result in rounded appearence of the lateral canthus. Also, when the eyelid is pulled medially, more than 2 mm movement of the canthal angle may be observed.

name: Rounded middle phalanx of finger
description: An abnormally round shape of the middle phalanx of the finger.

name: Lower eyelid retraction
description: Inferior malposition of the lower eyelid margin without eyelid eversion.

name: Small epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 3rd toe
synonyms: ["Small end part of the outermost bone of the 3rd toe"]

name: Abnormal CSF glucose level
description: A deviation from normal concentration of glucose content in the cerebrospinal fluid.

name: Anti-GD1b antibody positivity
description: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against GD1b ganglioside.

name: Abnormality of macular pigmentation
description: Abnormality of macular or foveal pigmentation.

name: Anti-laminin gamma1 antibody positivity
description: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against laminin gamma-1.

name: Abnormal cellular phenotype
description: An anomaly of cellular morphology or physiology.

name: Pituitary macroadenoma
description: A pituitary gland adenoma that is larger than 10mm.

name: Duodenal atrophy
description: Wasting or decrease in size of all or part of the duodenum.

name: Hip dysplasia
description: The presence of developmental dysplasia of the hip.
synonyms: ["HP:0008787","Abnormal formation of the hip","Congenital hip dysplasia"]

name: Inflammatory abnormality of the skin
description: The presence of inflammation of the skin. That is, an abnormality of the skin resulting from the local accumulation of fluid, plasma proteins, and leukocytes.
synonyms: ["HP:0002727","HP:0007423","Abnormal tendency to infections of the skin","Inflammatory abnormality of the skin","Skin inflammation"]

name: Episodic hypokalemia
description: An abnormally decreased potassium concentration in the blood occurring periodically with a return to normal between the episodes.

name: Generalized anhidrosis
synonyms: ["Generalised anhidrosis","Generalised anhydrosis","Generalised inability to sweat","Generalized anhydrosis","Generalized inability to sweat"]

name: Tetraparesis
description: Weakness of all four limbs.

name: Increased sensitivity to ionizing radiation
description: An abnormally increased sensitivity to the effects of ionizing radiation.

name: Focal aware emotional seizure with crying
description: Focal emotional seizure with crying (dacrystic)in which awareness is retained throughout.

name: Bullet-shaped middle phalanx of the 5th finger
description: Bullet-shaped phalanx refers to a short and wide phalanx that tapers distally . Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction. This term is used if the middle phalanx of the 5th finger is affected.
synonyms: ["Bullet-shaped middle little finger bone","Bullet-shaped middle pinkie finger bone","Bullet-shaped middle pinky finger bone"]

name: Facial hypertrichosis
description: Excessive, increased hair growth located in the facial region.

name: Focal impaired awareness sensory seizure with visual features
description: A focal sensory seizure with visual features in which awareness is partially or fully impaired at some point during the seizure.

name: Epicanthus palpebralis
description: A type of epicanthus in which a medial vertical fold is present between upper and lower lids.

name: Spondyloepiphyseal dysplasia
description: A disorder of bone growth affecting the vertebrae and the ends of the long bones (epiphyses).

name: Diaphragmatic weakness
description: A decrease in the strength of the diaphragm.

name: Trophic changes related to pain
description: Trophic changes is a term used to describe abnormalities in the area of pain that include primarily wasting away of the skin, tissues, or muscle, thinning of the bones, and changes in how the hair or nails grow, including thickening or thinning of hair or brittle nails.

name: Anti-GlyR antibody
description: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against Glycine receptor (GlyR).

name: Anti-Ma2 antibody positivity
description: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against Ma2.

name: Hepatic foam cells
description: The presence of foam cells, a type of macrophage that localizes to fatty deposits on blood vessel walls, in the liver.

name: External ear malformation
description: A malformation of the auricle of the ear.

name: Anal margin squamous cell carcinoma
description: A squamous cell carcinoma that originates in the skin of the anal margin.

name: Focal aware perseverative automatism seizure
description: A type of focal automatism seizure characterized by inappropriate continuation of pre-seizure movement or behavior at onset and during which awareness is fully retained throughout.

name: Bacteriuria
description: The presence of bacteria in the urine.

name: Parathyroid carcinoma
description: A malignancy of the parathyroid glands. Parathyroid carcinoma usually secretes parathyroid hormone, leading to hyperparathyroidism.

name: Cellular metachromasia
description: Metachromasia (also known as metachromacy) is a characteristic color change which certain aniline dyes exhibit when bound to particular substances or when concentrated in solution. For example, the basic dye toluidine blue becomes distinctly pink when bound to cartilage matrix. In the sense used here, the metachromasia refers to a change in color not observed with normal tissues, anomalous staining with the cationic dyes toluidine blue O and Alcian blue resulting from excessive amounts of the polyanionic glycosaminoglycans.

name: Carnosinuria
description: An increased concentration of carnosine in the urine.

name: Long face
description: Facial height (length) is more than 2 standard deviations above the mean (objective); or, an apparent increase in the height (length) of the face (subjective).
synonyms: ["HP:0000334","Elongation of face","Increased height of face","Increased length of face","Increased vertical dimension of face","Long face","Long facies","Vertical elongation of face","Vertical enlargement of face","Vertical excess of face","Vertical Facial Excess","Vertical hyperplasia of face","Vertical overgrowth of face"]

name: Abnormal vertebral artery morphology
description: An anomaly of the vertebral artery, the major artery of the neck that originates from the subclavian artery and merges to form the single midline basilar artery in a complex called the vertebrobasilar system.

name: Chronic decreased circulating IgG1
description: A lasting decrease of immunoglobulin G1 (IgG1) in the blood.

name: Triggered by galactose ingestion
description: Applies to a sign or symptom that is provoked or brought about by eating or drinking galactose. Galactose usually is ingested as lactose, which is composed of equimolar amounts of glucose and galactose.

name: Organized thrombi within interlobular vein lumen
description: Thrombi containg fibrous tissue and capillary-like vascular channels located within the lumen of the interlobular veins of the kidney.

name: Bilateral superior vena cava with no bridging vein
Glaucoma
description: Glaucoma refers loss of retinal ganglion cells in a characteristic pattern of optic neuropathy usually associated with increased intraocular pressure.

name: Autistic behavior
description: Persistent deficits in social interaction and communication and interaction as well as a markedly restricted repertoire of activity and interest as well as repetitive patterns of behavior.

name: Broad-based gait
description: An abnormal gait pattern in which persons stand and walk with their feet spaced widely apart. This is often a component of cerebellar ataxia.
synonyms: ["Broad based gait","Wide based gait","Wide based walk","Wide-based gait"]

name: Abnormality of fundus pigmentation
description: Any anomaly of the pigmentation of the fundus, the posterior part of the eye including the retina and optic nerve.

name: Focal atonic seizure
description: A focal seizure characterized at onset by sudden loss or diminution of muscle tone without apparent preceding myoclonic or tonic activity, typically lasting more than 500 ms but less than 2 seconds. It may involve the head, trunk, jaw or limb musculature.
synonyms: ["Localised atonic seizure","Localised hypotonic seizure","Localized atonic seizure","Localized hypotonic seizure","Partial atonic seizure","Partial hypotonic seizure","Segmental atonic seizure","Segmental hypotonic seizure"]

name: Labial melanotic macule
description: Flat, distinct, discolored area on the lip less than 1 cm wide not associated with a change in the thickness or texture.

name: EEG with series of focal spikes
description: Focal spikes occurring for several seconds.

name: Anti-histidyl tRNA synthetase antibody positivity
description: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against histidyl tRNA synthetase.

name: Blake's pouch cyst
description: The presence of an upwardly displaced normal cerebellar vermis, normal appearance of the fastigium, tentorium and size of the cisterna magna.

name: Abnormal lymphocyte morphology
description: An abnormality of lymphocytes.
synonyms: ["HP:0001887","HP:0012140","Abnormal lymphocytes","Abnormality of cells of the lymphoid lineage"]

name: Seizure cluster
description: A fourfold or greater increase of usual seizure frequency within a 3-day period, where the patient demonstrates full recovery between seizure events within the cluster. The seizure cluster should be recognisable by the primary clinician, carer or patient.
synonyms: ["Acute repetitive seizures","Crescendo seizures","Cyclical seizures","Recurrent seizures","Seizure flurries","Serial seizures"]

name: Narrow face
description: Bizygomatic (upper face) and bigonial (lower face) width are both more than 2 standard deviations below the mean (objective); or, an apparent reduction in the width of the upper and lower face (subjective).
synonyms: ["HP:0000318","Decreased breadth of face","Decreased horizontal dimension of face","Decreased transverse dimension of face","Decreased width of face","Horizontal deficiency of face","Horizontal hypoplasia of face","Horizontal insufficiency of face","Narrow face","Narrow facies","Thin facies","Transverse deficiency of face","Transverse hypoplasia of face","Transverse insufficiency of face"]

name: Abnormal ciliary motility
description: Any anomaly of the normal motility of motile cilia. Evaluation of ciliary beat frequency and ciliary beat pattern requires high-speed videomicroscopy of freshly obtained ciliary biopsies that are maintained in culture media under controlled conditions.

name: Positive blood lead test
description: Detection of lead in the blood.

name: Mitral regurgitation
description: An abnormality of the mitral valve characterized by insufficiency or incompetence of the mitral valve resulting in retrograde leaking of blood through the mitral valve upon ventricular contraction.
synonyms: ["Mitral incompetence","Mitral insufficiency","Mitral valve insufficiency","Mitral valve regurgitation"]

name: Increased intracellular sodium
description: An abnormally increased sodium concentration in the cytosol.

name: Ivory epiphysis of the middle phalanx of the 4th finger
description: Sclerosis of the epiphysis of the middle phalanx of the ring finger, leading to an increased degree of radiopacity (white or ivory appearance) in X-rays.
synonyms: ["Increased bone density of end part of the middle ring finger bone"]

name: Elevated dermal desmosine content
description: An increased amount of desmosine measure in the skin. Desmosine is a cross-linking amino acid formed from lysyl residues in elastin.

name: Duffy Fyb positivity
description: Presence of the Duffy Fyb antigen.

name: Elevated circulating 4-hydroxyphenylacetic acid concentration
description: An abnormally increased concentration of 4-Hydroxyphenylacetic acid in the blood circulation.

name: Renal interstitial foam cells
description: Accumulation of foam cells (FC) in the interstitium of the kidney. Renal FCs display phenotypic characteristics of macrophages and belong to the monocyte/macrophage lineage. Histologically, renal FCs are characterized by round cells with small nuclei and an abundant PAS-positive cytoplasm with lipid-containing vacuoles.

name: obsolete Decreased proportion of effector memory CD4-positive, alpha-beta T cells
Arteriovenous fistulas of celiac and mesenteric vessels
synonyms: ["Arteriovenous fistulas of coeliac and mesenteric vessels"]

name: Abnormal complex N-glycan level
description: An abnormal concentration of complex N-glycans on glycoproteins.
synonyms: ["Abnormal concentration of complex N-glycans on glycoproteins"]

name: Type 1 muscle fiber atrophy
description: Atrophy (wasting) affecting primary type 1 muscle fibers. This feature in general can only be observed on muscle biopsy.

name: Biconcave vertebral bodies
description: Exaggerated concavity of the anterior or posterior surface of the vertebral body, i.e., the upper and lower vertebral endplates are hollowed inward.
synonyms: ["HP:0002952","HP:0004561","HP:0004620","Biconcave 'codfish' vertebrae","Biconcave vertebrae","Codfish vertebrae","Fish vertebrae","Scalloping of vertebral bodies"]

name: Neonatal seizure with electrographic correlate
description: Neonatal seizure is a seizure type that occurs in neonatal period and is characterized by an electrographic event with sudden, repetitive, evolving stereotyped waveforms with a beginning and an end. This event can be associated or not with a clinical manifestation.

name: Nuclear pulverulent cataract
description: A type of nuclear cataract involving congenital dust-like (pulverulent) opacity of the embryonal and fetal nucleus.
synonyms: ["cataracta pulverulenta centralis","Central pulverulent cataract","Coppock-like cataract","Pulverulent nuclear cataract"]

name: Aplasia of the 1st metacarpal
description: Absent first metacarpal (long bone) of the hand.
synonyms: ["HP:0006027","Absent 1st long bone of hand","Absent first metacarpal"]

name: Subcortical dementia
description: A particular type of dementia characterized by a pattern of mental defects consisting prominently of forgetfulness, slowness of thought processes, and personality or mood change.

name: Corneal neovascularization
description: Ingrowth of new blood vessels into the cornea.
synonyms: ["Corneal neovascularisation","Corneal vascularization","Limbal neovascularization","New blood vessel formation in cornea"]

name: Episodic abdominal pain
description: An intermittent form of abdominal pain.

name: Pituitary resistance to thyroid hormone
description: A condition in which the pituitary gland is partially resistant to thyroid hormone, so that it continues to secrete thyroid-stimulating hormone (TSH) until the blood level of thyroid hormone rises higher than normal.

name: Decreased circulating IgG4 level
description: A reduction in immunoglobulin levels of the IgG4 subclass in the blood circulation.

name: Osteochondroma
description: A cartilage capped bony outgrowth of a long bone. Osteochondroma arises on the external surface of bone containing a marrow cavity that is continuous with that of the underlying bone.

name: Testicular mass
description: An abnormal bulge or lump in a testis. A testicular mass has a long differential diagnosis including testicular torsion, epididymitis, acute orchitis, strangulated hernia and testicular cancer.

name: Myelin outfoldings
description: The presence of excessive redundant myelin in the peripheral nerve sheath.
synonyms: ["HP:0003433","HP:0006898","HP:0007290","Excessive focal folding of myelin sheaths","Irregular myelin foldings"]

name: Abnormality of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger
description: Abnormality of the distal phalanx of the 5th (little) finger.
synonyms: ["Abnormality of the distal phalanx of the little finger","Abnormality of the outermost little finger bone","Abnormality of the outermost pinkie finger bone","Abnormality of the outermost pinky finger bone","Abnormality of the terminal phalanx of the little finger"]

name: Abnormal pattern of respiration
description: An anomaly of the rhythm or depth of breathing.
synonyms: ["Abnormal pattern of respiration","Abnormal respiratory patterns","Unusual breathing patterns"]

name: Reduced granulocyte surface marker level
description: Reduced level of a protein that is normally present on the granulocyte surface as assessed by flow cytometry.

name: Focal impaired awareness autonomic seizure with erection
description: A focal autonomic seizure with erection characterized by impairment of awareness at some point during the seizure.

name: Neonatal multifocal clonic seizure
description: Neonatal focal clonic seizure is a type of neonatal electro-clinical clonic seizure where the predominant motor feature is a regularly repeating jerking involving the same muscle groups, which occurs at multiple sites.

name: Lobar holoprosencephaly
description: A type of holoprosencephaly in which most of the right and left cerebral hemispheres and lateral ventricles are separated but the most rostral aspect of the telencephalon, the frontal lobes, are fused, especially ventrally.

name: Anti-parotid secretory protein antibody positivity
description: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against parotid secretory protein.

name: Uplifted earlobe
description: An abnormal orientation of the earlobes such that they point out- and upward. That is, the lateral surface of ear lobe faces superiorly.

name: Subtentorial periventricular white matter hyperdensity
description: Areas of brighter than expected signal on magnetic resonance imaging emanating from the cerebral white matter that surrounds the fourth cerebral ventricle (which is located beneath the tentorium of the cerebellum).

name: Abnormal amplitude of dark-adapted dim flash electroretinogram
Osteosclerosis of the base of the skull
description: An increase in bone density affecting the basicranium (base of the skull).

name: Irregular chondrocostal junctions
description: Irregular surface of the normally relatively smooth border between the distal part of the ribs and the costal cartilages, which are bars of hyaline cartilage that connect the ribs to the sternum.

name: X-linked dominant inheritance
description: A mode of inheritance that is observed for dominant traits related to a gene encoded on the X chromosome. In the context of medical genetics, X-linked dominant disorders tend to manifest very severely in affected males. The severity of manifestation in females may depend on the degree of skewed X inactivation.

name: Symphalangism affecting the phalanges of the 5th toe
synonyms: ["Fused bones in the little toe","Fused bones in the pinkie toe","Fused bones in the pinky toe"]

name: Increased circulating interleukin 10
description: An elevation of the concentration of interleukin 10 in the blood circulation.

name: Shovel-shaped maxillary central incisors
description: A tooth with a crown with marked lingual or palatal marginal ridges causing scooped lingual or palatal surfaces.

name: Retinal vascular tortuosity
description: The presence of an increased number of twists and turns of the retinal blood vessels.

name: Narrow femoral neck
description: An abnormally reduced diameter of the femoral neck (which is the process of bone, connecting the femoral head with the femoral shaft).

name: Allergy
description: An allergy is an immune response or reaction to substances that are usually not harmful.

name: Focal segmental glomerulosclerosis
description: Segmental accumulation of scar tissue in individual (but not all) glomeruli.
synonyms: ["HP:0004747","Focal and segmental glomerular sclerosis","Focal and segmental glomerulosclerosis","focal glomerulosclerosis"]

name: Personality changes
description: An abnormal shift in patterns of thinking, acting, or feeling.

name: Thalamic calcification
description: Calcium deposition in the thalamus.

name: Focal aware autonomic seizure with epigastric sensation/nausea/vomiting/other gastrointestinal phenomena
description: A focal autonomic seizure with epigastric sensation / nausea / vomiting / other gastrointestinal phenomena characterized by retained awareness throughout the seizure.

name: Visual hallucinations
description: Visual perceptions that are not elicited by a corresponding stimulus from the outside world.

name: Predominantly dermal neutrophilic infiltrate
description: Collection of neutrophils in the dermis.

name: Galactorrhea
description: Spontaneous flow of milk from the breast, unassociated with childbirth or nursing.

name: Decreased female libido
description: Dminished sexual desire in female.

name: Right aortic arch with retroesophageal left subclavian artery
synonyms: ["Right aortic arch with aberrant left subclavian artery","Right aortic arch with anomalous left subclavian artery"]

name: Hordeolum externum
description: Hordeola externa are acute purulent infections affecting the sebaceous glands of Zeis or the apocrine sweat glands of Moll, often caused by staphylococcus infections. In contrast to chalazia, hordeola are extremely painfull and can cause extreme local swelling.

name: Left ventricular systolic dysfunction
description: Abnormality of left ventricular contraction, often defined operationally as an ejection fraction of less than 40 percent.

name: Abnormal single motor unit action potential
description: Abnormally high or low single motor unit action potential reading (-Pk Amps).

name: Abnormal muscle fiber beta sarcoglycan
description: Deviation from normal in the amount of beta sarcoglycan in muscle. The alpha, beta, gamma, and delta sarcoglycans are components of the dystrophin-complex. They are all N-glycosylated transmembrane proteins with a short intra-cellular domain, a single transmembrane region and a large extra-cellular domain containing a cluster of conserved cysteines.

name: Anti-laminin 6 antibody positivity
description: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against laminin-6.

name: Abnormality of the ductus choledochus
description: An abnormality of the Common bile duct, a tube-like anatomic structure in the human gastrointestinal tract, formed by the union of the Common hepatic duct and the Cystic duct from the gall bladder.

name: Increased urinary zinc level
description: An abnormally elevated amount of zinc in the urine, typically as assessed by a 24 hour urine collection.

name: Supernumerary tracheal bronchus
description: Accessory bronchus which exits the trachea in addition to an anatomically normal branching upper lobe bronchus.

name: Abnormality of hindbrain morphology
description: An abnormality of the hindbrain, also known as the rhombencephalon.
synonyms: ["Abnormal shape of hindbrain","Abnormality of the hindbrain"]

name: Fibrous syngnathia
description: Complete or nearly complete soft tissue fusion of the alveolar ridges.

name: Elevated CSF amyloid level
description: Increased concentration of amyloid in the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF).

name: Abnormal insulin level
description: An abnormal concentration of insulin in the body.

name: Narrow forehead
description: Width of the forehead or distance between the frontotemporales is more than two standard deviations below the mean (objective); or apparently narrow intertemporal region (subjective).
synonyms: ["HP:0000314","HP:0004674","HP:0004677","Bitemporal narrowing","Bitemporal narrowness","Bitemporal skull narrowing","Decreased width of the forehead","Intertemporal narrowing","Narrow bitemporal diameter","Narrow bitemporal width","Narrow forehead","Temporal narrowness"]

name: Triangular epiphysis of the middle phalanx of the 4th toe
synonyms: ["Triangular end part of the middle bone of the 4th toe"]

name: Stercoral ulcer
description: An ulcer of the colon due to pressure and irritation from retained fecal masses.

name: Herpetiform vesicles
description: Multiple vesicles distributed in multiple distinct groups consisting of multiple adjacent vesicles.

name: Meningocele
description: Protrusion of the meninges through a defect of the skull or vertebral column.

name: Broad hallux
description: Visible increase in width of the hallux without an increase in the dorso-ventral dimension.
synonyms: ["HP:0001834","HP:0003094","HP:0004710","HP:0005883","Abnormally broad great toes","Broad big toe","Broad great toe","Broad great toes","Broad halluces","Wide big toe"]

name: EMG: neuropathic changes
description: The presence of characteristic findings of denervation on electromyography (fibrillations, positive sharp waves, and giant motor unit potentials).
synonyms: ["HP:0002178","HP:0002547","HP:0007279","EMG: neurogenic abnormalities","EMG: neurogenic changes","EMG: neurogenic findings"]

name: Abnormality of the midface
description: An anomaly of the midface, which is a region and not an anatomical term. It extends, superiorly, from the inferior orbital margin to, inferiorly, the level of nasal base. It is formed by the maxilla (upper jaw) and zygoma and cheeks and malar region. Traditionally, the nose and premaxilla are not included in the midface.
synonyms: ["Abnormality of the midface","Anomaly of the midface"]

name: Spatial pattern
description: The pattern by which a phenotype affects one or more regions of the body.

name: Osmotic diarrhea
description: Osmotic diarrhea results from the presence of osmotically active, poorly absorbed solutes in the bowel lumen that inhibit normal water and electrolyte absorption.

name: Elevated plasma cell count
description: An abnormally high number of plasma cells in the blood circulation. Plasma cells are the the effector cells dedicated to the production of a high amount of antibodies.

name: History of recent animal bite
description: Medical history of a recent bite injury due to an animal.

name: Focal impaired awareness autonomic seizure with palpitations/tachycardia/bradycardia/asystole
description: A focal autonomic seizure with palpitations / tachycardia / bradycardia / asystole characterized by impaired awareness at some point during the seizure.

name: Flat nasal alae
description: An abnormal degree of flatness of the Ala of nose, which can be defined as a reduced nasal elevation index (lateral depth of the nose from the tip of the nose to the insertion of the nasal ala in the cheek x 100 divided by the side-to-side breadth of the nasal alae).

name: Prominent superficial veins
description: A condition in which superficial veins (i.e., veins just under the skin) are more conspicuous or noticable than normal.

name: Severe B lymphocytopenia
description: A severe form of B lymphocytopenia in which the count of B cells is very low or absent.

name: Fused cervical vertebrae
description: A congenital anomaly characterized by a joining (fusion) of two or more cervical vertebral bodies with one another.
synonyms: ["Cervical spine fusion","Cervical vertebral fusion","Fused neck","Fusion of cervical vertebrae"]

name: Absent in utero rib ossification
description: Lack of formation and mineralization of the ribs in utero.

name: Tapered phalanx of finger
description: Phalanges of the fingers becoming thinner toward the distal end.

name: Progressive spinal muscular atrophy
description: Progressive spinal muscular atrophy, i.e., muscular weakness and atrophy related to loss of the motor neurons of the spinal cord and brainstem.
synonyms: ["Progressive spinal muscle degeneration","Progressive spinal muscle wasting"]

name: Ganglioneuromatosis
description: Hyperplastic submucosal and myenteric plexus containing an increased number of ganglion cells, glial cells and nerve fibers.

name: Delayed speech and language development
description: A degree of language development that is significantly below the norm for a child of a specified age.
synonyms: ["HP:0002116","HP:0002117","HP:0002336","HP:0002399","HP:0002498","HP:0006936","HP:0007004","HP:0007127","HP:0007170","HP:0007172","Deficiency of speech development","Delayed language development","Delayed speech","Delayed speech acquisition","Delayed speech and language development","Delayed speech development","Impaired speech and language development","Impaired speech development","Language delay","Language delayed","Language development deficit","Late-onset speech development","Poor language development","Speech and language delay","Speech and language difficulties","Speech delay"]

name: Giant cell tumor of bone
description: A bone tumor composed of cellular spindle-cell stroma containing scattered multinucleated giant cells resembling osteoclasts.

name: Yellow-brown discoloration of the teeth
synonyms: ["Yellow-brown discoloration of the teeth","Yellow-brown discolored teeth","Yellow-brown discoloured teeth","Yellow-brown tooth shade"]

name: Intention tremor
description: A type of kinetic tremor that occurs during target directed movement is called intention tremor. That is, an oscillatory cerebellar ataxia that tends to be absent when the limbs are inactive and during the first part of voluntary movement but worsening as the movement continues and greater precision is required (e.g., in touching a target such as the patient's nose or a physician's finger).

name: Retinopathy of prematurity plus
description: Venous dilatation and arteriolar tortuosity of the posterior retinal vessels and may later increase in severity to include iris vascular engorgement, poor pupillary dilatation (rigid pupil), and vitreous haze. This definition has been further refined in the later clinical trials in which the diagnosis of plus disease could be made if sufficient vascular dilatation and tortuosity are present in at least 2 quadrants of the eye.

name: Anomalous origin of left subclavian artery
description: Origin of the left subclavian artery from an anomalous anatomical location.

name: Serpiginous stem of antihelix
description: Posterior curving of the antihelix from its origin at the antitragus, traveling initially almost perpendicular to the descending helix and obscuring some of the concha.

name: Orthodeoxia
description: Low level of blood oxygen induced by changing from a recumbent to an upright position.

name: Focal aware cognitive seizure with dissociation
description: A focal cognitive seizure with dissociation characterized by retained awareness throughout the seizure.

name: Abnormal plantar dermatoglyphics
description: An abnormality of dermatoglyphs on the toes and soles, i.e., an abnormality of the patterns of ridges of the skin of sole of foot.
synonyms: ["Abnormal dermatoglyphics on feet","Abnormal prints on feet"]

name: Abnormal chondrocyte morphology
description: Any abnormal structure of a chondrocyte, which is a polymorphic cell that forms cartilage.

name: Verrucae
description: Warts, benign growths on the skin or mucous membranes that cause cosmetic problems as well as pain and discomfort. Warts most often occur on the hands, feet, and genital areas.

name: Intestinal fistula
description: An abnormal connection between the gut and another hollow organ, such as the bladder, urethra, vagina, or other regions of the gastrointestinal tract.

name: Increased serum bile acid concentration
description: An increase in the concentration of bile acid in the blood.

name: Abnormality of the protein C anticoagulant pathway
description: An anomaly of the protein C anticoagulant pathway, which serves as a major system for controlling thrombosis, limiting inflammatory responses, and potentially decreasing endothelial cell apoptosis in response to inflammatory cytokines and ischemia. A natural anticoagulant system denoted the protein C pathway exerts its anticoagulant effect by regulating the activity of FVIIIa and FVa. The vitamin K-dependent protein C is the key component of the pathway. Activated protein C (APC) cleaves and inhibits coagulation cofactors FVIIIa and FVa, which result in downregulation of the activity of the coagulation system. The endothelial protein C receptor stimulates the T-TM-mediated activation of protein C on the endothelial cell surface. The two cofactors, protein S and the intact form of FV, enhance the anticoagulant activity of APC.

name: Abnormal urine alpha-ketoglutarate concentration
description: A deviation from normal of the concentration of 2-oxoglutaric acid in the urine.
synonyms: ["Abnormal urinary 2-oxoglutarate level","Abnormality of urine alpha ketoglutarate concentration"]

name: Melanocytic nevus
description: A oval and round, colored (usually medium-to dark brown, reddish brown, or flesh colored) lesion. Typically, a melanocytic nevus is less than 6 mm in diameter, but may be much smaller or larger.
synonyms: ["Beauty mark","Melanocytic naevus","Melanocytic nevi","Nevocellular nevi","Noncancerous mole","Pigmented naevi","Pigmented nevi"]

name: Severe demyelination of the white matter
description: A severe loss of myelin from nerve fibers in the central nervous system.

name: Wide proximal femoral metaphysis
description: Increased width of the proximal part of the shaft (metaphysis) of the femur.

name: Coxa valga
