description: Coxa valga is a deformity of the hip in which the angle between the femoral shaft and the femoral neck is increased compared to age-adjusted values (about 150 degrees in newborns gradually reducing to 120-130 degrees in adults).

name: Focal aware autonomic seizure with piloerection
description: A focal autonomic seizure with piloerection (bristling of hairs due to the involuntary contraction of small muscles at the base of hair follicles) characterized by retained awareness throughout the seizure.

name: Erysipelas
description: Increased susceptibility to erysipelas, as manifested by a medical history of repeated episodes of erysipelas, which is a superficial infection of the skin, typically involving the lymphatic system.

name: Bullet-shaped phalanges of the 3rd finger
description: A third finger with short and wide phalanx that tapers distally. Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction.

name: Abnormality of the nares
description: Abnormality of the nostril.
synonyms: ["Abnormality of the nostrils","Anomaly of the nares"]

name: Renal interstitial inflammation
description: Histopathological findings of inflammation of the renal interstitium potentially involving fibrotic as well as non-fibrotic areas, composed of lymphocytes, monocytes, plasma cells.

name: Iritis
description: Inflammation of the iris.

name: Radial deviation of the hand or of fingers of the hand
Pseudoepiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 4th finger
description: A secondary ossification center in the distal phalanx of the fourth finger that is distinct from the normal epiphysis that does not contribute to the longitudinal growth of a tubular bone.

name: Abnormal glomerular basement membrane texture
description: Anomalous appearance or structure of the surface of the glomerular basement membrane.

name: Ivory epiphyses of the toes
synonyms: ["Increased bone density of end part of the toes"]

name: Osteolytic defects of the proximal phalanges of the hand
Fractured lateral malleolus of fibula
description: A partial or complete breakage of the lateral malleolus of fibula.

name: Diaphyseal sclerosis of the upper limbs
description: An elevation in bone density in one or more diaphyses of the arms. Sclerosis is normally detected on a radiograph as an area of increased opacity.
synonyms: ["Increased bone density in central part of long bone of upper limbs"]

name: Anti-PM-Scl75 antibody positivity
description: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against PM-Scl75.

name: Short proximal phalanx of the 5th toe
description: Developmental hypoplasia of the proximal phalanx of fifth toe.
synonyms: ["Hypoplastic/small proximal phalanx of the 5th toe","Short innermost bone of little toe","Short innermost bone of pinkie toe","Short innermost bone of pinky toe","Short proximal phalanx of the fifth toe"]

name: Frontal bossing
description: Bilateral bulging of the lateral frontal bone prominences with relative sparing of the midline.

name: Blue cone monochromacy
description: A form of monochromacy in which vision is derived from the remaining preserved blue (S) cones and rod photoreceptors.

name: Blue sclerae
description: An abnormal bluish coloration of the sclera.
synonyms: ["Blue outer white part of eyeball","Blue sclera","Bluish sclerae","Whites of eyes are a bluish-gray color","Whites of eyes are a bluish-gray colour"]

name: Focal impaired awareness emotional seizure with paranoia
description: Focal emotional seizure with paranoia in which awareness is partially or fully impaired at some point during the seizure.

name: Squamous cell carcinoma
description: The presence of squamous cell carcinoma of the skin.

name: Increased circulating brain natriuretic peptide concentration
description: An increased concentration of brain natriuretic peptide in the blood circulation.
synonyms: ["Elevated circulating BNP concentration","Increased B-type natriuretic peptide","Increased ventricular natriuretic peptide"]

name: Myelokathexis
description: Impaired egress of mature neutrophils from bone marrow causing neutropenia.

name: Endolymphatic sac tumor
description: A low-grade papillary epithelial neoplasm (adenocarcinoma) with a slow growth pattern. The endolymphatic duct emerges from the posterior wall of the saccule (of the inner ear) and ends in a blind pouch, the endolymphatic sac. Endolymphatic sac tumors (ELSTs) are known under different names in the literature (Heffner tumor, aggressive papillary middle ear tumor, and low-grade adenocarcinoma of endolymphatic sac origin).
synonyms: ["Aggressive papillary middle ear tumor","Aggressive papillary middle ear tumour","Endolymphatic sac tumour","Heffner tumor","Heffner tumour","Low-grade adenocarcinoma of endolymphatic sac origin"]

name: Renal necrosis
description: Cell death (necrosis) affecting one or more parts of the kidney.

name: Abnormality of buccal fat pad
description: An abnormality of a buccal fat pad.

name: Cough
description: A sudden, audible expulsion of air from the lungs through a partially closed glottis, preceded by inhalation.

name: Pulmonary cyst
description: A round circumscribed space within a lung that is surrounded by an epithelial or fibrous wall of variable thickness. A cyst usually has a thin and regular wall (less than 2 mm) and contains air, although some may contain fluid.

name: Muscle fibrillation
description: Fine, rapid twitching of individual muscle fibers with little or no movement of the muscle as a whole. If a motor neuron or its axon is destroyed, the muscle fibers it innervates undergo denervation atrophy. This leads to hypersensitivity of individual muscle fibers to acetyl choline so that they may contract spontaneously. Isolated activity of individual muscle fibers is generally so fine it cannot be seen through the intact skin, although it can be recorded as a short-duration spike in the EMG.

name: Metaphyseal cupping of metacarpals
description: Metaphyseal cupping affecting the metacarpal bones.
synonyms: ["HP:0006131","Cupping of wide portion of long bone of hand","Metacarpal/metaphyseal cupping"]

name: Coronary artery aneurysm
description: Enlargement of the diameter (cross-section) of a coronary artery as defined by a focal dilation of a segment at least 1.5 times larger than the reference vessel.
synonyms: ["Coronary arterial dilatation","Coronary artery dilatation","Coronary artery ectasia"]

name: Recurrent respiratory infections
description: An increased susceptibility to respiratory infections as manifested by a history of recurrent respiratory infections.
synonyms: ["HP:0002782","HP:0002873","Frequent respiratory infections","Multiple respiratory infections","Recurrent respiratory infections","respiratory infections, recurrent","Susceptibility to respiratory infections"]

name: Oral synechia
description: Fibrous band between the mucosal surfaces of the upper and lower alveolar ridges.

name: Malignant gastrointestinal tract tumors
synonyms: ["Malignant gastrointestinal tract tumours","Malignant GI tract tumors","Malignant GI tract tumours"]

name: Sebaceous gland carcinoma
description: A carcinoma that arises in a sebaseous gland (an exocrine gland of the skin that secretes sebum, a waxy substance)

name: Curved 3rd toe phalanx
description: A deviation from the normal straight form of one or more phalanges of the third toe.
synonyms: ["Curved bones of 3rd toe","Curved phalanges of the 3rd toe"]

name: Family history
description: Information about close relatives of an individual who is the proband of a study or who is being investigated with the goal of identifying a medical diagnosis. Usually, the family history includes information from three generations of relatives, including children, brothers and sisters, parents, aunts and uncles, nieces and nephews, grandparents, and cousins.

name: Irregular epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger
description: Irregular radiographic opacity of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger.
synonyms: ["Irregular end part of the outermost bone of little finger","Irregular end part of the outermost bone of pinkie finger","Irregular end part of the outermost bone of pinky finger"]

name: Abnormal cochlea morphology
description: An abnormality of the cochlea.

name: Restrictive behavior
description: Behavior characterized by an abnormal limitation to few interests and activities.

name: Severe hearing impairment
description: A severe form of hearing impairment.

name: Renal tubular epithelial cell sloughing
description: At least one free floating cell in the tubular lumen without attachment to adjacent cells or basement membrane in a tubular cross section without detachment. These cells must not aggregate into a tubular shape and completely fill the lumen, if so, it should be classified as a cast.

name: Anti-isoleucyl tRNA-synthetase antibody positivity
description: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against isoleucyl tRNA-synthetase.

name: Renal tubular viral cytopathic changes
description: Viral cytopathic changes consist of smudgy basophilic intranuclear inclusions with enlarged nuclei of infected cells. Distal tubules are more commonly involved than proximal tubules. There is associated acute tubular injury, often with frank tubular necrosis and destruction, with acute interstitial nephritis, often with a pleomorphic infiltrate composed of lymphocytes, histiocytes, plasma cells, and variable numbers of neutrophils, with interstitial edema and hemorrhage. Tubular destruction may be associated with necrotizing interstitial granulomas. Severe granulomatous tubulointerstitial nephritis appears to be characteristic of adenoviral infection and is quite rare in other viral infections. Focal wedge-shaped necrosis may occur in renal parenchyma. Immunostaining for adenovirus shows strong nuclear and cytoplasmic staining in infected cells.

name: Kaposi's sarcoma
description: A systemic disease which can present with cutaneous lesions with or without internal involvement. Tumors are caused by Human herpesvirus 8 (HHV8), also known as Kaposi's sarcoma-associated herpesvirus (KSHV).

name: Steppage gait
description: An abnormal gait pattern that arises from weakness of the pretibial and peroneal muscles due to a lower motor neuron lesion. Affected patients have footdrop and are unable to dorsiflex and evert the foot. The leg is lifted high on walking so that the toes clear the ground, and there may be a slapping noise when the foot strikes the ground again.

name: Dyslexia
description: A learning disorder characterized primarily by difficulties in learning to read and spell. Dyslectic children also exhibit a tendency to read words from right to left and to confuse letters such as b and d whose orientation is important for their identification. Children with dyslexia appear to be impaired in phonemic skills (the ability to associate visual symbols with the sounds they represent).

name: Preauricular skin tag
description: A rudimentary tag of skin often containing ear tissue including a core of cartilage and located just anterior to the auricle (outer part of the ear).
synonyms: ["HP:0008575","HP:0100278","Ear tag","Periauricular skin tag","Preauricular acrochordon","Preauricular fibroepithelial polyp","Preauricular skin tags","Preauricular tag","Preauricular tags","Skin tag in front of the ear","Skin tag on the posterior cheek"]

name: Reduced xanthine dehydrogenase level
description: An abnormal reduction in xanthine dehydrogenase level.

name: Posterior vitreous detachment
description: Separation of the vitreous humor from the retina.

name: Multiple muscular ventricular septal defects
description: A type of muscular ventricular septal defect characterized by the presence of multiple small defects in the ventricular septum.

name: Antepartum hemorrhage
description: Significant maternal hemorrhage/bleed in the second half of pregnancy and prior to the birth of the baby.

name: Intimal thickening in the coronary arteries
Confusion
description: Lack of clarity and coherence of thought, perception, understanding, or action.

name: Pontine tegmental cap
description: An abnormal curved or vaulted (capped) structure covering the middle third of the dorsal pontine tegmentum and projecting into the fourth ventricle.

name: Monorchism
description: Having only one testis in the scrotum.

name: Thickened glomerular basement membrane
description: Prominent glomerular basement membrane (GBM), reflecting an increase in thickness (subjective estimate) of the basal lamina of the glomerulus of the kidney.

name: Polyclonal elevation of circulating IgE
description: A heterogeneous increase in IgE mmunoglobulins characterized by a diffuse band on serum electrophoresis.

name: Long phalanx of finger
description: Increased length of multiple or a single phalanx of finger.

name: Polar cataract
description: A type of Congenital cataract in which the opacities occupy the subcapsular cortex at the anterior or posterior pole of the lens.

name: Chondrosarcoma
description: A slowly growing malignant neoplasm derived from cartilage cells.

name: Dental crowding
description: Changes in alignment of teeth in the dental arch
synonyms: ["Crowded teeth","Dental crowding","Dental overcrowding","Inadequate arch length for tooth size","Overcrowding of teeth","Tooth mass arch size discrepancy","Tooth size discrepancy"]

name: Separation insecurity
description: Fears of rejection by and/or separation from significant others, associated with fears of excessive dependency and complete loss of autonomy.

name: Hypoplasia of the premaxilla
description: An abnormality of the premaxilla (the embryonic structure that forms the anterior part of the maxilla) causing it to appear relatively small in size compared to the other parts of the maxilla or other facial structures.
synonyms: ["Decreased size of premaxilla","Decreased size of the primary palate bone","Hypoplasia of the intermaxillary bone","Hypoplasia of the primary palate bone","Premaxillary bone deficiency","Premaxillary underdevelopment","Primary palate bone deficiency","Small premaxilla","Small primary palate bone","Underdevelopment of premaxilla","Underdevelopment of the premaxilla","Underdevelopment of the primary palate bone"]

name: White hair
description: Hypopigmented hair that appears white.

name: Nonopposable triphalangeal thumb
description: A form of triphalangeal thumb that cannot be placed opposite the fingers of the same hand.

name: Cutaneous finger syndactyly
description: A soft tissue continuity in the A/P axis between two fingers that extends distally to at least the level of the proximal interphalangeal joints, or a soft tissue continuity in the A/P axis between two fingers that lies significantly distal to the flexion crease that overlies the metacarpophalangeal joint of the adjacent fingers.
synonyms: ["HP:0001214","HP:0005637","HP:0006054","HP:0006220","Cutaneous syndactyly of fingers","Cutaneous syndactyly of hands","Webbed fingers","Webbed skin of fingers"]

name: Duodenal gastric metaplasia
description: Foci of gastric-type mucus-secreting cells interspersed between duodenal enterocytes. These foci of gastric epithelial cells contain Periodic acid-Schiff (PAS)-positive neutral mucin and lack a brush border.

name: Perioral erythema
description: Erythema (Redness of the skin caused by hyperemia of the capillaries in the lower layers of the skin) localized to the region surrounding the mouth.

name: Anti-H2B antibody positivity
description: The presence of autoantibodies in the blood circulation that react against histone H2B.

name: Abnormal cerebral morphology
description: Any structural abnormality of the telencephalon, which is also known as the cerebrum.
synonyms: ["Abnormality of the cerebrum","Abnormality of the telencephalon","Cerebral lesion"]

name: Alacrima
description: Absence of tear secretion.
synonyms: ["Absence of tears in the eyes","Absent lacrimal fluids","Absent tear secretion"]

name: Recurrent Serratia marcescens infections
description: Increased susceptibility to Serratia marcescens infections, as manifested by recurrent episodes of Serratia marcescens infection.

name: Acantholysis
description: The loss of intercellular connections, such as desmosomes, resulting in loss of cohesion between keratinocytes.

name: Absent distal phalanges
description: Aplasia (absence) of the distal phalanges.

name: Neoplasm of the pancreas
description: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the pancreas.
synonyms: ["HP:0004511","Cancer of the pancreas","Neoplasia of the pancreas","Pancreatic cancer","Pancreatic tumor","Pancreatic tumour"]

name: Abnormal fingertip morphology
description: An abnormal structure of the tip (end) of a finger.

name: Abnormal von Willebrand factor multimer distribution
description: Deviation from the normal von Willebrand factor multimer pattern.

name: Hypoperistalsis
description: Reduced or inadequate peristalsis, with resultant slow passage of contents through the digestive tract.

name: Smooth septal thickening on pulmonary HRCT
description: Thickening of the interlobular septa of the lungs as seen on a high-resolution computed tomography scan with a smooth appearance of the interlobular septa.

name: Extrafoveal choroidal neovascularization
description: A type of choroidal neovascularization in which the nearest edge of the area of neovascularization is located 200 to 1500 micrometers from the center of the fovea.

name: Bitemporal hollowing
description: Depression of profile in both temporal regions.

name: Increased level of propylene glycol in blood
description: An increase in the level of propylene glycol in the blood.

name: Thrombophlebitis
description: Inflammation of a vein associated with venous thrombosis (blood clot formation within the vein).

name: Extrapulmonary tuberculosis
description: A type of tubercular infection located outside of the lung, which is the most common location of tuberculosis. There are two types of clinical manifestation of tuberculosis (TB) are pulmonary TB (PTB) and extrapulmonary TB (EPTB). The former is most common. EPTB refers to TB involving organs other than the lungs (e.g., pleura, lymph nodes, abdomen, genitourinary tract, skin, joints and bones, or meninges). A patient with both pulmonary and EPTB is classified as a case of PTB.

name: Small epiphyses of the proximal phalanges of the hand
synonyms: ["Small end part of the innermost hand bones"]

name: Renal medullary hyperechogenicity
description: Increased echogenecity of the medullary region of the kidney.

name: Atrial arrhythmia
description: A type of supraventricular tachycardia in which the atria are the principal site of electrophysiologic disturbance.

name: Anti-bactericidal/permeability-increasing protein antibody positivity
description: The presence of autoantibodies in the blood circulation that react against bactericidal/permeability-increasing protein (BPI). BPI is an endotoxin-binding host protein with important antibacterial effects against Gram-negative bacteria, such as Pseudomonas aeruginosa.  BPI is a 55 kDalton protein that is most abundant in the azurophilic granules of neutrophils. BPI also acts as a target antigen for antineutrophil cytoplasmic autoantibodies.

name: Increased CSF glutamine concentration
description: Abnormally increased levels of glutamine in cerebrospinal fluid.

name: Hyperlysinemia
description: An increased concentration of lysine in the blood.

name: Hip contracture
synonyms: ["Flexion contracture of hips","Flexion contractures of hips","Hip contractures","Hip flexion contractures"]

name: Anti-ITPR1 antibody
description: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against inositol 1,4,5-trisphosphate receptor 1 (ITPR1).

name: High-grade vesicoureteral reflux
description: Vesicoureteral reflux with dilation of the renal calyces (Grade III - V).

name: Decreased level of thrombomodulin
description: Thrombomodulin is a cofactor in the thrombin induced activation of Protein C. In the case of deficiency there will be less Protein C and tendency to clot

name: Podocyte myelin figures
description: Lamellated intracytoplasmic lipid inclusions within podocytes.

name: Lacticaciduria
description: An increased concentration of lactic acid in the urine.
synonyms: ["High urine lactic acid levels","Increased urine lactate"]

name: Iris atrophy
description: Loss of iris tissue (atrophy)

name: Bracket epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 2nd finger
description: An abnormality of the distal phalanx of the second finger in which the epiphysis surrounds a phalangeal bone, having a bracket-like form and reaching from the proximal side of a phalanx to the distal side.
synonyms: ["Bracket shaped end part of the outermost bone of the index finger"]

name: Abnormal C-reactive protein level
description: Any deviation from the normal concentration of C-reactive protein in the blood circulation.

name: Death in infancy
description: Death within the first 24 months of life.

name: Focal clonic seizure
description: A focal clonic seizure is a type of focal motor seizure characterized by sustained rhythmic jerking, that is regularly repetitive.
synonyms: ["Focal clonic seizures","Localised clonic seizure","Localized clonic seizure","Partial clonic seizure","Segmental clonic seizure"]

name: Elevated circulating sacchoropine concentration
description: An increased concentration of saccharopine in the blood circulation. L-saccharopine is the N(6)-(1,3-dicarboxypropan-1-yl) derivative of L-lysine.

name: Increased circulating globulin level
description: An abnormally elevated concentration of globulins in the blood.

name: Thigh hypertrophy
description: Muscle hypertrophy affecting the thighs.

name: Long metacarpals
description: An abnormally increased length of the metacarpal bones.
synonyms: ["Elongated long bone of hand","Increased length of metacarpals"]

name: Nasolacrimal sac epithelial papillary carcinoma
description: The malignant epithelial neoplasm with papillary growths in the nasolacrimal sac.

name: EEG with central focal spikes
description: EEG with focal sharp transient waves of a duration less than 80 msec in the central region.

name: Alopecia of scalp
synonyms: ["HP:0200115","Absence of scalp hair","Baldness","Missing scalp hair","Pathologic hair loss from scalp","Scalp hair loss"]

name: Jaw swelling
description: Abnormal enlargement in the upper jaw (maxilla) or in the lower jaw (mandible).

name: Migraine without aura
description: Repeated headache attacks lasting 4-72 h fulfilling at least two of the following criteria: 1) unilateral location, 2) pulsating quality, 3) moderate or severe pain intensity, and 4) aggravation by or causing avoidance of routine physical activity such as climbing stairs. Headache attacks are commonly accompanied by nausea, vomiting, photophobia, or phonophobia.

name: Fragmentation of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 4th toe
synonyms: ["Fragmentation of the end part of the innermost bone of the 4th toe"]

name: Dimple on nasal tip
description: An abnormal indentation of the skin in the region of the nasal tip.
synonyms: ["Dimple on nasal tip","Dimpled tip of nose"]

name: Overtubulated long bones
description: Overconstriction, or narrowness of the diaphysis and metaphysis of long bones.

name: Accessory oral frenulum
description: Extra fold of tissue extending from the alveolar ridge to the inner surface of the upper or lower lip.
synonyms: ["Accessory oral frenum","Extra oral frenulum","Extra oral frenum","Multiple oral frenula","Supernumerary oral frenulum","Supernumerary oral frenum"]

name: Fixed head retroflexion
description: Head is bent in the posterior direction in a permanent fashion.

name: Bladder carcinoma
description: The presence of a carcinoma of the urinary bladder.

name: Nodular-random pattern on pulmonary HRCT
description: A nodular pattern on pulmonary high-resolution computed tomography that has an apparently random pattern.

name: Bilateral intracerebral calcifications
description: Deposition of calcium salts on both sides of the brain.

name: Decreased beta-galactosidase activity
description: Abnormally decreased rate of beta-galactosidase activity. Beta-galactosidase activity can be measured in leukocyte, fibroblast, or plasma.
synonyms: ["HP:0003644","HP:0008300","Beta-galactosidase deficiency in fibroblasts and white blood cells","Beta-galactosidase-1 deficiency","Decreased beta galactosidase activity"]

name: Small cerebellar cortex
description: Reduced size of the cerebellar cortex.

name: Abnormal circulating nitrogen compound concentration
description: Any deviation from the normal concentration of a nitrogen compound in the blood circulation.

name: Erectile dysfunction
description: A multidimensional but common male sexual dysfunction that involves an alteration in any of the components of the erectile response, including organic, relational and psychological.

name: Enlarged platelet dense granules
description: Increased size of platelet dense granules.

name: Increased serum testosterone level
description: An elevated circulating testosterone level in the blood.
synonyms: ["High serum testosterone level","High serum testosterone levels","Increased serum testosterone levels","Increased testosterone"]

name: Reduced respiratory ciliary beating frequency
description: An abnormal reduction in the number of beats per unit time of the respiratory cilia.

name: Small epiphyses of the upper limbs
synonyms: ["Small end part of upper limb bones"]

name: Neck pterygia
description: Pterygia affecting the neck.

name: Swollen lip
description: Enlargement of the lip typically due to fluid buildup or inflammation.

name: Triangular shaped middle phalanges of the hand
synonyms: ["HP:0009876","Triangular shaped middle finger bones of the hand"]

name: Abnormal CSF phenylalanine concentration
description: Any deviation from the normal concentration of phenylalanine in the cerebrospinal fluid.

name: Gonosomal inheritance
description: A mode of inheritance that is observed for traits related to a gene encoded on the sex chromosomes.

name: Progressive sclerosis of skull base
description: Progressively increasing bone density of the skull base without significant changes in bony contour.

name: 3-hydroxyisovaleric aciduria
description: Concentration of 3-hydroxyisovaleric acid in the urine above the normal range.

name: Anencephaly
description: Anencephaly is a developmental anomaly characterized by a fetus that has no calvarium, with a lack of most or all of the fetus' brain tissue. Anencephaly belongs to a collective group known as neural tube defects (NTD) and is a result of the neural tube failing to close in its rostral end during fetal development.

name: Broad metacarpal epiphyses
description: Increased side-to-side width of the metacarpal epiphyses.
synonyms: ["Broad end part of long bone of hand"]

name: Shortening of all metacarpals
description: Abnormal reduction in length of all metacarpal bones.

name: Cleft of chin
description: Incomplete fusion of the chin, resulting from a developmental defect and manifesting as a midline cleft or fissure of the chin.

name: obsolete Radially deviated index finger phalanges
Partial absence of toe
description: The absence of a phalangeal segment of a toe or hallux.

name: Lymphoma
description: A cancer originating in lymphocytes and presenting as a solid tumor of lymhpoid cells.

name: Gemination
description: The development of two teeth from a single tooth bud, leading to a larger fused tooth.
synonyms: ["Gemination of tooth","Splitting of crown of tooth"]

name: Abnormal core 1 O-glycan level
description: An abnormal in the concentration of core 1 O-glycans on glycoproteins.

name: Air crescent
description: An air crescent is a collection of air in a crescentic shape that separates the wall of a cavity from an inner mass. The air crescent sign is often considered characteristic of either Aspergillus colonization of preexisting cavities or retraction of infarcted lung in angioinvasive aspergillosis. However, the air crescent sign has also been reported in other conditions, including tuberculosis, Wegener granulomatosis, intracavitary hemorrhage, and lung cancer.

name: Olivary degeneration
description: Degeneration of the olivary bodies, prominent oval structures in the medulla oblongata.

name: Symphalangism of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd toe with the 2nd metatarsal
synonyms: ["Fused innermost bone of 2nd toe with the 2nd long bone of foot"]

name: Abnormal location of the eyebrow
description: Anomalous anatomical placement of the eyebrow.

name: Latex allergy
description: Latex allergy is an IgE-mediated immediate hypersensitivity response to natural rubber latex (NRL) protein with a variety of clinical signs ranging from contact urticaria, angioedema, asthma, and anaphylaxis.

name: Prominent antihelix
description: The presence of an abnormally prominent antihelix.

name: Abnormal plasma cell count
description: An abnormal number of plasma cells in the blood circulation. Plasma cells are the the effector cells dedicated to the production of a high amount of antibodies.

name: Duplication of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger
description: Partial or complete duplication of the distal phalanx of little finger.
synonyms: ["Duplication of the outermost little finger bone","Duplication of the outermost pinkie finger bone","Duplication of the outermost pinky finger bone","Partial/complete duplication of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger"]

name: Cerebral berry aneurysm
description: A small, sac-like aneurysm (outpouching) of a cerebral blood vessel.

name: Respiratory failure
description: A severe form of respiratory insufficiency characterized by inadequate gas exchange such that the levels of oxygen or carbon dioxide cannot be maintained within normal limits.

name: Chorangioma
description: Hamartoma-like growth in the placenta consisting of blood vessels.

name: Supernumerary testes
description: The presence of more than two testes.

name: Glucagonoma
description: An endocrine tumor of the pancreas that secretes excessive amounts of glucagon.

name: Vaginal dryness
description: Persistent vaginal dryness.

name: Necrolytic migratory erythema
description: Acral or periorificial lesions that evolve in recurrent crops, with an annular and migratory distribution.

name: Absent dorsal skin creases over affected joints
Pyuria
description: The presence of 10 or more white cells per cubic millimeter in a urine specimen, 3 or more white cells per high-power field of unspun urine, a positive result on Gram staining of an unspun urine specimen, or a urinary dipstick test that is positive for leukocyte esterase.

name: Bipedal edema
description: A palpable swelling in both feet and ankles caused by palpable swelling caused by an increase in interstitial fluid volume (excess fulid).

name: Triangular epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 4th toe
synonyms: ["Triangular end part of the outermost bone of the 4th toe"]

name: Posterior uveitis
description: Inflammation of the uveal tract in which the primary site of inflammation is the retina or choroid.

name: Global proximal tubulopathy
description: A type of proximal renal tubulopathy characterized by resorption defects leading to glycosuria, aminoaciduria, tubular proteinuria, renal hypophosphatemia, and urate tubular hyporeabsorption with bicarbonate loss and resulting acidosis.

name: Protein-losing enteropathy
description: Abnormal loss of protein from the digestive tract related to excessive leakage of plasma proteins into the lumen of the gastrointestinal tract.

name: Parathyroid agenesis
description: Aplasia of the parathyroid gland.

name: Dysgenesis of the hippocampus
description: Structural abnormality of the hippocampus related to defective development.

name: Absent metatarsal bone
description: A developmental abnormality characterized by the absence (aplasia) of a metatarsal bone.
synonyms: ["Absent long bone of foot","Aplasia of the metatarsal bones"]

name: Abnormal circulating apolipoprotein concentration
description: A deviation from the normal concentration in blood of an apolipoprotein, i.e., of a protein that binds lipids to form lipoprotein and is thereby responsible for the transport of lipids in the blood and lymph circulation.

name: Bronchocentric granulomatosis
description: Granulomatous inflammation that surrounds the bronchi and bronchioles, replacing bronchial walls and mucosa. In bronchocentric granulomatosis, the lumen of the airway contains necrotic debris, and palisaded histiocytes surround the lumen.

name: Exaggerated median tongue furrow
description: Increased depth of the median tongue furrow.
synonyms: ["Deep central lingual furrow","Deep central lingual groove","Deep central tongue furrow","Deep central tongue groove","Deep median lingual furrow","Deep median lingual groove","Deep median tongue furrow","Deep median tongue groove","Exaggerated median lingual furrow"]

name: Delayed closure of the anterior fontanelle
description: A delay in closure (ossification) of the anterior fontanelle, which generally undergoes closure around the 18th month of life.
synonyms: ["Delayed closure anterior fontanel","Delayed closure of anterior fontanelle","Delayed closure of the bregma sutures","Delayed closure of the soft spot on the skull","Late closure of anterior fontanelle","Late closure of large anterior fontanel","Late closure of soft spot on the skull","Late closure of the bregma sutures","Later than typical closing of soft spot of skull","Persistent anterior fontanelle"]

name: Angulated antihelix
description: Antihelical ridge that forms an acute angle between the antitragus and its bifurcation (stem) instead of a gently curving arc.

name: Oligomenorrhea
description: Infrequent menses (less than 6 per year or more than 35 days between cycles).

name: Arthralgia of the hip
description: Joint pain affecting the hip.

name: Mesangial fibril deposition
description: Extracellular mesangial accumulation of slender proteinaceous fibers.

name: Abnormal circulating lysine concentration
description: Any deviation from the normal concentration of lysine in the blood circulation.

name: Primitive neuroectodermal tumor
description: A tumor that originates in cells from the primitive neural crest. This group of tumors is characteirzed by the presence of primitive cells with elements of neuronal and/or glial differentiation.

name: obsolete Joint dislocations in young adult
Recurrent genital herpes
description: Recurrent episodes of genital herpes, typically characterized by stages of erythema, papules, short-lived vesicles, painful ulcers, and crusts on the skin of the genitals and surrounding area, and that typically resolve over a period of 2 to 3 weeks.

name: Preretinal hemorrhage
description: An accumulation of blood between the neurosensory retina and the retinal pigment epithelium (RPE) arising from the choroidal or retinal circulation.

name: Hair shafts flattened at irregular intervals and twisted through 180 degrees about their axes
Periodic hypokalemic paresis
description: Episodes of muscle weakness associated with reduced levels of potassium in the blood.

name: Delayed ossification of the trapezoid bone
description: Formation of bone tissue of trapezoid is less than expected for age.

name: Shortened QT interval
description: Decreased time between the start of the Q wave and the end of the T wave as measured by the electrocardiogram (EKG).

name: Atrichia
description: The most dramatic and severe form of hair loss characterized by an absence of hair follicles.

name: Coarctation of the descending aortic arch
description: Narrowing or constriction of the aorta localized to the region of the descending trunk of arch of aorta.

name: Aplasia of the middle phalanx of the hand
description: Absence of one or more middle phalanx of a finger.
synonyms: ["HP:0005778","Absent middle bones of hand","Absent middle phalanges","Missing middle phalanges"]

name: Ectopic pancreatic tissue
description: The presence of pancreatic tissue outside the normal pancreas, in many cases along the foregut and proximal midgut.

name: Myofibrillar myopathy
description: Myofibrillar structural changes characterized by abnormal intracellular accumulation of the intermediate filament desmin and other proteins.

name: Intralobar nephroblastomatosis
description: Presence of persistent islands of renal blastema in the postnatal kidney, anywhere within a renal lobe (a portion of a kidney consisting of a renal pyramid and the renal cortex above it).

name: Patchy sclerosis of the middle phalanx of the 3rd toe
synonyms: ["Uneven increase in bone density in the middle bone of the 3rd toe"]

name: Abnormal mitral valve annulus morphology
description: Any structural anomaly of the annulus of the mitral valve. The annulus is a ring composed of fibrous and myocardial tissue and is the structure onto which the cusps of the valve attach.

name: Fructose intolerance
description: Reduced intestinal absorption of fructose. Breath testing after ingestion of fructose has been widely adopted as a standard method of identifying fructose malabsorption and intolerance. A dose of 25 g of fructose dissolved in a 10% solution is generally accepted as the appropriate dose of fructose for clinical use of H2 and CH4 breath testing. High levels of hydrogen in exhaled breath subsequent hours indicate fructose intolerance. Presence of malabsorption and reproduction of symptoms during a breath test provides the best objective evidence and symptom correlation for fructose intolerance.

name: Hypoautofluorescent retinal lesion
description: Decreased amount of autofluorescence in the retina as ascertained by fundus autofluorescence imaging.

name: Vascular neoplasm
description: A benign or malignant neoplasm (tumour) originating in the vascular system.

name: Palmar warts
description: Multiple verrucous lesions on the skin of the palm. These lesions are raised, have a thickened and rough surface, and may display prominent black dots (thrombosed capillaries). Palmar warts are caused by caused by human papillomavirus (HPV).

name: Autoimmune hypoparathyroidism
description: A type of hypoparathyroidism with circulating antiparathyroid or anti-calcium sensing receptor antibodies indicative of autoimmunity.

name: Breast carcinoma
description: The presence of a carcinoma of the breast.

name: Periportal emperipolesis
description: The engulfing of lymphocytes by hepatocytes, which typically occurs in the interface hepatitis area.

name: Reduced protein C activity
description: An abnormality of coagulation related to a decreased concentration of vitamin K-dependent protein C. Protein C is activated to protein Ca by thrombin bound to thrombomodulin. Activated protein C degrades factors VIIIa and Va.

name: Abnormal cerebellar cortex morphology
description: Any structural anomaly of the cortex of the cerebellum.

name: Bilateral microphthalmos
description: A developmental anomaly characterized by abnormal smallness of both eyes.
synonyms: ["HP:0001143","HP:0001585","Abnormally small eyeball on both sides","Decreased size of eyeballs","Decreased size of globes of eyes","Microphthalmia, bilateral"]

name: Right unicoronal synostosis
description: Unicoronal synostosis affecting only the right coronal suture.

name: Abnormal macular morphology
description: A structural abnormality of the macula lutea, which is an oval-shaped highly pigmented yellow spot near the center of the retina.

name: Abnormal CD4-positive, CD25-positive, alpha-beta regulatory T cell morphology
description: A structural anomaly of a CD4-positive, CD25-positive, alpha-beta T cell. These cells are regulatory T cells.

name: Abnormality of the humeral diaphysis
description: An anomaly of the humeral diaphysis.
synonyms: ["Abnormality of shaft of long bone in upper arm"]

name: Congenital Horner syndrome
description: A type of Horner syndrome with congenital onset.

name: Hypothalamic gliosis
description: Focal proliferation of glial cells in the hypothalamus.

name: Pointed proximal second through fifth metacarpals
description: All of the metacarpal bones of the hand have a pointed proximal appearance.

name: Macular hyperpigmentation
description: Increased amount of pigmentation in the macula lutea.

name: Blind vagina
description: The vagina ends in a blind pouch or sac rather than being connected to the internal genitalia.

name: Horizontal nystagmus
description: Nystagmus consisting of horizontal to-and-fro eye movements.

name: Bronchopulmonary sequestration
description: The presence of microscopic cystic masses of nonfunctioning pulmonary tissue that lack an obvious communication with the tracheobronchial tree.

name: Increased spinal bone density
description: Increased bone density affecting the bones of the spine (vertebral column).
synonyms: ["Increased density of spinal bone","Ivory spinal bone"]

name: Nephrocalcinosis
description: Nephrocalcinosis is the deposition of calcium salts in renal parenchyma.

name: Neurofibrosarcoma
description: A form of malignant cancer of the connective tissue surrounding nerves. Given its origin and behavior, it is classified as a sarcoma.
synonyms: ["Malignant peripheral nerve sheath tumor","Malignant peripheral nerve sheath tumour","Malignant schwannoma","Neurosarcoma"]

name: Abnormal circulating calcium concentration
description: Any deviation from the normal concentration of calcium in the blood circulation.
synonyms: ["HP:0040077","Abnormal blood calcium concentration","Abnormal blood calcium levels","Abnormal circulating Ca concentration","Abnormal circulating Ca2+ concentration"]

name: Bacterial cell casts
description: A type of urinary cast that contain bacteria. Bacterial casts can be difficult to identify and can be distinguished from other types of casts using phase contrast microscopy. Bacterial casts are diagnostic of acute pyelonephritis or intrinsic renal infection.

name: Symphalangism affecting the distal phalanx of the hallux
Short distal phalanx of the thumb
description: Hypoplastic (short) distal phalanx of the thumb.
synonyms: ["HP:0004085","HP:0004087","Hypoplastic terminal thumb phalanx","Hypoplastic/small distal phalanx of the thumb","Short outermost bone of the thumb","Short terminal thumb phalanx","Short thumb terminal phalanx","Small terminal thumb phalanx"]

name: Increased skull ossification
description: An increase in the magnitude or amount of ossification of the skull.
synonyms: ["Hyperossification of skull","Hyperostosis of skull","Sclerosis of bones of skull","Sclerosis of skull"]

name: Tall stature
description: A height above that which is expected according to age and gender norms.
synonyms: ["HP:0001527","HP:0003515","HP:0003516","Accelerated linear growth","Increased body height","Increased linear growth","Tall stature"]

name: Plantar telangiectasia
description: Telangiectases (small dilated blood vessels) located on the skin of sole of foot.

name: Claustrophobia
description: An abnormal fear of being in a closed or narrow space with no escape.

name: Short term memory impairment
description: A deficit in the retention of pieces of information (memory chunks) for a relatively short time (usually up to 30 seconds).

name: Ureteral atresia
description: A developmental defect defined by the failure of the formation of the lumen (tube) of the ureter.

name: Vascular calcification
description: Abnormal calcification of the vasculature.

name: Calcium carbonate crystalluria
description: The presence of calcium carbonate crystals in the urine.

name: Aplasia of the bladder
description: Aplasia (absence) of the urinary bladder.

name: Medial arterial calcification
description: Calcification, that is, pathological deposition of calcium salts in the tunica media of arteries.

name: Increased CSF N-acetylaspartic acid concentration
description: An abnormally increased concentration of N-acetylaspartic acid in the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF).
synonyms: ["Increased N-acetyl aspartate levels in CSF","Increased N-acetyl aspartic acid levels in CSF","Increased N-acetyl-L-aspartic acid levels in CSF","Increased N-acetylaspartate levels in CSF","Increased NAA levels in CSF"]

name: Ivory epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb
description: Sclerosis of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb, leading to an increased degree of radiopacity (white or ivory appearance) in X-rays.
synonyms: ["Increased bone density of end part of the innermost bone of the thumb"]

name: Triangular shaped distal phalanges of the toes
synonyms: ["Triangular shaped outermost bone of the toes"]

name: Absent epiphysis of the 1st metatarsal
description: Failure to form (agenesis) of the epiphysis of the 1st metatarsal.
synonyms: ["Absent end part of the 1st long bone of foot"]

name: EEG with generalized slow activity grade 1
description: Slowing at frequencies between 7.5 and 8.5 Hz.

name: Duplication of the distal phalanx of the 2nd finger
description: Partial or complete duplication of the distal phalanx of index finger.
synonyms: ["HP:0004144","Partial/complete duplication of the distal phalanx of the 2nd finger","Partial/complete duplication of the outermost bone of the index finger"]

name: Fragmentation of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger
synonyms: ["Fragmentation of end part of innermost long bone of index finger"]

name: Upper eyelid laxity
description: Abnormally lax upper eyelid associated with tissue relaxation.

name: Abnormally low T cell receptor excision circle level
description: Reduced level of T cell receptor excision circle (TRECs) as measured by the TREC assay. Late in maturation, 70% of thymocytes that will ultimately express alpha/beta-T cell receptors form a circular DNA TREC from the excised TCRdelta gene that lies within the TCRalpha genetic locus. The circles are stable but do not increase following cell division and, therefore, become diluted as T cells proliferate. A quantitative polymerase chain reaction (PCR) reaction across the joint of the circular DNA provides the TREC copy number, a marker of newly-formed, antigenically-nave thymic emigrant T cells.

name: Cartilaginous tracheobronchomalacia
description: Softening of the tracheal and/or bronchial cartilage resulting in segmental tracheal and/or bronchial weakness.

name: Delayed fine motor development
description: A type of motor delay characterized by a delay in acquiring the ability to control the fingers and hands.

name: Delayed tarsal ossification
description: Delayed maturation and calcification of any of the tarsal bones, seven bones of the foot comprising the calcaneus, talus, cuboid, navicular, and the cuneiform bones.

name: Abnormal pigmentation of the oral mucosa
description: An abnormality of the pigmentation of the mucosa of the mouth.
synonyms: ["Abnormal color of the oral mucosa","Abnormal colour of the oral mucosa","Abnormal pigmentation of oral cavity","Abnormal pigmentation of oral mucous membrane","Abnormal pigmentation of the oral mucosa/gingivae"]

name: Benign prostatic hyperplasia
description: The presence of non-malignant hyperplasia of the prostate.

name: Anal atresia
description: Congenital absence of the anus, i.e., the opening at the bottom end of the intestinal tract.

name: Irregular epiphyses of the distal phalanges of the hand
synonyms: ["Irregular end part of the outermost hand bones"]

name: Aplasia of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger
description: Absence of the distal phalanx of the little (5th) finger.
synonyms: ["Absent outermost little finger bone","Absent outermost pinkie finger bone","Absent outermost pinky finger bone"]

name: Right bundle branch block
description: A conduction block of the right branch of the bundle of His. This manifests as a prolongation of the QRS complex (greater than 0.12 s) with delayed activation of the right ventricle and terminal delay on the EKG.

name: Duplication of the middle phalanx of the 2nd finger
description: Partial or complete duplication of the middle phalanx of index finger.
synonyms: ["Partial/complete duplication of the middle bones of the index finger","Partial/complete duplication of the middle phalanx of the 2nd finger"]

name: Ivory epiphyses of the 5th finger
description: Sclerosis of the epiphyses of the 5th finger, leading to an increased degree of radiopacity (white or ivory appearance) in X-rays.
synonyms: ["Increased bone density of end part of the little finger","Increased bone density of end part of the pinkie finger","Increased bone density of end part of the pinky finger"]

name: Carotid artery occlusion
description: Complete obstruction of a carotid artery.

name: Increased CSF/serum albumin ratio
description: An increase above normal limits of the ratio of the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) albumin concentration to serum albumin concentration.

name: Abnormal hip bone morphology
description: An abnormality of the hip bone.
synonyms: ["Abnormality of the hip bone","Abnormality of the hips"]

name: Decreased pulmonary fissure count
description: Lack of one or more of the normal pulmonary fissures.

name: Focal impaired awareness sensory seizure with vestibular features
description: A focal sensory seizure with vestibular features in which awareness is partially or fully impaired at some point during the seizure.

name: Low levels of vitamin D
description: A reduced concentration of Vitamin D.

name: Flat distal femoral epiphysis
description: An abnormal flattening of the distal epiphysis of femur.
synonyms: ["Flat end part of outermost thighbone","Flattened distal femoral epiphyses"]

name: Bifid ribs
description: A bifid rib refers to cleavage of the sternal end of a rib, usually unilateral. Bifid ribs are usually asymptomatic, and are often discovered incidentally by chest x-ray.

name: Celiac artery dissection
description: A separation (dissection) of the layers of the celiac artery wall.

name: Abnormal sweat homeostasis
description: An abnormality of the composition of sweat or the levels of its components.

name: Absent middle phalanx of 3rd finger
description: Absence of the middle phalanx of the middle (3rd) finger.
synonyms: ["HP:0004173","Absent middle bone of middle finger","Absent middle phalanx of middle finger","Aplasia of the middle phalanx of the 3rd finger"]

name: Megaloblastic anemia
description: Anemia characterized by the presence of erythroblasts that are larger than normal (megaloblasts).

name: Abnormality of the cervical spine
description: Any abnormality of the cervical vertebral column.
synonyms: ["HP:0004587","Abnormal cervical spine","Abnormality of cervical vertebra","Abnormality of the cervical vertebrae","Cervical spine abnormalities","Cervical vertebral abnormalities","Disorder of cervical vertebra"]

name: Anterior chamber red blood cells
description: The presence of erythrocyte in the aqueous humor of the anterior chamber of the eye.

name: Cervicomedullary schisis
description: Fissure within the spinal cord of the neck.

name: Abnormal renal artery morphology
description: Any structural abnormality of the renal artery.
synonyms: ["Abnormal kidney artery","Abnormality of the renal artery"]

name: Anti-hexokinase-1 antibody positivity
description: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against hexokinase-1.

name: obsolete Focal aware cognitive seizure with impaired responsiveness
Elevated placental alkaline phosphatase
description: An abnormally increased level of alkaline phosphatase, placental type in the blood.

name: Yellow subcutaneous tissue covered by thin, scaly skin
Neurite dystrophy
description: Dystrophic neurites are abnormal neuronal processes characterized microscopically by aberrant sprouting, dystrophic expansion, and accumulation of various cellular organelles and cytoskeletal/signaling proteins.

name: Varicocele
description: A varicocele is a widening of the veins along the spermatic cord, leading to enlarged, twisted veins in the scrotum, and manifested clinically by a painless testicle lump, scrotal swelling, or bulge in the scrotum.

name: Mesomelic leg shortening
description: Shortening of the middle parts of the leg in relation to the upper and terminal segments.
synonyms: ["Mesomelia of the lower limbs","Mesomelic lower limb shortening"]

name: Elevated urinary 4-hydroxybutyric acid
description: An increased amount of 4-hydroxybutyric acid in the urine.

name: Visceral epithelial hyaline droplets
description: Round to ovoid, Periodic acid-Schiff (PAS)-positive, fuchsinophilic cytoplasmic inclusions within visceral epithelial cells.

name: Parasagittal parieto-occipital polymicrogyria
description: Polymicrogyria in parasagittal and mesial aspects of parieto-occipital cortex.

name: Abnormal timing of light-adapted single flash electroretinogram
Absent pubic hair
description: Absence of pubic hair.

name: Curved proximal phalanx of the 4th finger
Flexion contracture of digit
description: A bent (flexed) finger or toe joint that cannot be straightened actively or passively. It is thus a chronic loss of joint motion due to structural changes in muscle, tendons, ligaments, or skin that prevents normal movement of joints.

name: Abnormal cortical peritubular capillary lumen morphology
description: Abnormal structural characteristics of the interior space of the peritubular capillary in the cortex of the kidney.

name: Commissural lip pit
description: A depression located at an oral commissure.
synonyms: ["Commissural labial pits","Commissural pit","Lip pits at corners of the mouth","Pits at the corners of the lips"]

name: Irregular epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb
description: Uneven radiographic opacity of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb.
synonyms: ["Irregular end part of thumb outermost bone"]

name: Celiac artery compression
description: Compression of the celiac artery.

name: Osteolytic defects of the hand bones
Abnormal urine sodium concentration
description: An abnormal concentration of sodium in the urine.
synonyms: ["Abnormal urine Na concentration","Abnormal urine Na+ levels"]

name: Osteolytic defect of thumb phalanx
description: Dissolution or degeneration of bone tissue of one or more phalanges of the thumb.
synonyms: ["Osteolytic defects of the phalanges of the thumb"]

name: Type II pneumocyte hyperplasia
description: Increase in the number of type II pneumocytes.

name: Complete duplication of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd toe
description: Complete duplication of proximal phalanx of second toe.
synonyms: ["Complete duplication of the innermost 2nd toe bone","Complete duplication of the proximal phalanx of the second toe"]

name: Abnormal timing of light-adapted flicker electroretinogram
Reduced circulating leukotriene C4 concentration
description: An abnormally decreased concentration of leukotriene C4 in the blood circulation.

name: Skin tags
description: Cutaneous skin tags also known as acrochorda or fibroepithelial polyps are small benign tumours that may either form secondarily over time primarily in areas where the skin forms creases, such as the neck, armpit or groin or may also be present at birth, in which case they usually occur in the periauricular region.

name: Tricuspid valve prolapse
description: One or more of the leaflets (cusps) of the tricuspid valve bulges back into the right atrium upon contraction of the right ventricle.

name: Tessier number 8 facial cleft
description: The frontozygomatic or Number 8 cleft is found in both Treacher Collins syndrome and the Goldenhar variant of hemifacial microsomia. Skeletal defects are more prominent in Treacher Collins syndrome, whereas the soft tissue clefting is more typical in cases of ''Goldenhar syndrome''. Soft tissue clefting presents as a dermatocele, a true lateral eyelid coloboma with absence of the outer canthus, and anomalies of the globe itself, especially epibulbar cysts in patients with Goldenhar syndrome. The frontozygomatic bony cleft produces absence of the lateral orbital rim; this border now is formed by the hypoplastic greater wing of the sphenoid. The absence of bony support for the outer canthus produces lateral canthal dystopia and the characteristic antimongoloid slant of the palpebral fissures. Secondary to the bony deficiency in the lateral orbital wall and floor, there is soft tissue continuity between the orbit, temporal fossa, and infratemporal region. Preauricular hairline indicators delineate the Number 8 cleft as the first of the northbound clefts. Complete absence of the bony lateral orbital wall and rim constitute the skeletal element of the Number 8 cleft. The lateral border of the orbit is formed by the greater wing of the sphenoid from which small spicules of bone, which represent the rudimentary zygoma, may be found in Treacher Collins syndrome. The symmetry of the facial anomalies is reflected in the apparently normal symmetric anterior and middle cranial fossae.

name: Unilateral vocal cord paralysis
description: A loss of the ability to move the vocal fold on one side.

name: Absent muscle fiber delta sarcoglycan
description: Immunohistochemistry shows complete lack of delta sarcoglycan protein in the muscle biopsy.

name: Renal angiomyolipoma
description: A benign renal neoplasm composed of fat, vascular, and smooth muscle elements.

name: Webbed neck
description: Pterygium colli is a congenital skin fold that runs along the sides of the neck down to the shoulders. It involves an ectopic fibrotic facial band superficial to the trapezius muscle. Excess hair-bearing skin is also present and extends down the cervical region well beyond the normal hairline.

name: Spinal hypomyelination
description: Reduced amount of myelin in the spinal cord resulting from defective myelinogenesis.

name: Low alkaline phosphatase
description: Abnormally reduced serum levels of alkaline phosphatase.

name: Abnormality of the optic nerve
description: Abnormality of the optic nerve.

name: Struvite nephrolithiasis
description: Presence of struvite (magnesium ammonium phosphate) containing calculi (kidney stones).

name: Partial duplication of the distal phalanges of the hand
description: A partial duplication, depending on severity leading to a broad or bifid appearance, affecting one or more of the distal phalanges of the hand. As opposed to a complete duplication there is still a variable degree of fusion between the duplicated bones.
synonyms: ["HP:0006196","Bifid terminal phalanges of the hand","Partial duplication of the outermost bone of the hand"]

name: Upgaze palsy
description: A limitation of the ability to direct one's gaze above the horizontal meridian.

name: Abnormal common tendinous ring morphology
description: Any anomaly of the ring of fibrous tissue that surrounds the optic nerve at its entrance at the apex of the orbit. The common tendinous ring, also known as the annulus of Zinn or annular tendon, is the origin for five of the seven extraocular muscles.

name: Mitral valve prolapse
description: One or both of the leaflets (cusps) of the mitral valve bulges back into the left atrium upon contraction of the left ventricle.

name: Exacerbated by methylxanthine ingestion
description: Applied to a sign or symptom that is worsened by ingestion of food containing a methylxanthine compound (for instance, coffee, caffeine, chocolate).

name: Broad middle phalanx of finger
description: Increased width of the middle phalanx of finger.
synonyms: ["Broad middle finger bones","Broad middle phalanges of finger","Broad middle phalanges of the hand"]

name: Cortical radial artery intima/media liquefactive necrosis
description: A type of cortical radial artery intima/media necrosis in which the dead (necrotic) tissue breaks down such that cellular detail is no longer recognized.

name: Myelofibrosis
description: Replacement of bone marrow by fibrous tissue.

name: Death in middle age
description: Death between the age of 40 and 60 years.

name: Abnormal testis morphology
description: An anomaly of the testicle (the male gonad).
synonyms: ["Abnormality of the testis","Anomaly of the testes"]

name: Intrauterine growth retardation
description: An abnormal restriction of fetal growth with fetal weight below the tenth percentile for gestational age.
synonyms: ["HP:0001515","HP:0008862","HP:0008892","HP:0008931","In utero growth retardation","Intrauterine growth failure","Intrauterine growth restriction","Intrauterine growth retardation, IUGR","Intrauterine retardation","IUGR","Prenatal growth deficiency","Prenatal growth failure","Prenatal growth retardation","Prenatal onset growth retardation","Prenatal-onset growth retardation","Small for gestational age infant"]

name: Abnormal bronchoalveolar lavage fluid morphology
description: Abnormal type or counts of nucleated immune cells and acellular components in bronchoalveolar lavage (BAL) fluid. BAL us performed with a fiberoptic bronchoscope in the wedged position within a selected bronchopulmonary segment. BAL is commonly used to inform the differential diagnosis of interstitial lung disease or to monitor therapeutic interventions.

name: Absent ossification of cervical vertebral bodies
description: A lack of bone mineralization of one or more body of cervical vertebra.

name: Abnormal growth hormone level
description: Any deviation from the normal level of growth hormone (GH) in the blood circulation. GH or somatotropin is a peptide hormone that stimulates growth, cell reproduction, and cell regeneration. Its secretion from the pituitary is regulated by the neurosecretory nuclei of the hypothalamus, which can release Growth hormone-releasing hormone (GHRH or somatocrinin) and Growth hormone-inhibiting hormone (GHIH or somatostatin) into the hypophyseal portal venous blood surrounding the pituitary. GH is secreted in a pulsatile manner, which is one of the reasons why an isolated measurement of its blood concentration is not meaningful.

name: Muscle fiber necrosis
description: Abnormal cell death involving muscle fibers usually associated with break in, or absence of, muscle surface fiber membrane and resulting in irreversible damage to muscle fibers.

name: Subsolid pulmonary nodule
description: Pulmonary subsolid nodules (SSNs) refer to pulmonary nodules with pure ground-glass nodules and part-solid ground-glass nodules. A ground-glass nodule (GGN) is the morphologic description of a pulmonary nodule category on thin-section chest computed tomography (CT). During the past decade, the natural history, management strategy and long-term prognosis in the case of GGNs have attracted attention.

name: Abnormal electroretinogram
description: Any abnormality of the electrical responses of various cell types in the retina as measured by electroretinography.

name: Reduced hypoxanthine-guanine phosphoribosyltransferase level
description: Abnormally decreased level of the enzyme that catalyzes conversion of hypoxanthine to inosine monophosphate and guanine to guanosine monophosphate via transfer of the 5-phosphoribosyl group from 5-phosphoribosyl 1-pyrophosphate.
synonyms: ["Reduced 6-hydroxypurine phosphoribosyltransferase level","Reduced 6-mercaptopurine phosphoribosyltransferase level","Reduced GMP pyrophosphorylase level"]

name: Decreased specific antibody response to polysaccharide vaccine
description: A reduced ability to synthesize postvaccination antibodies against polysaccharides in vaccines, as measured by antibody titer determination following vaccination.

name: Decreased thalamic volume
description: A reduction in the quantity of space occupied by the thalamus.

name: Reticulate pigmentation of oral mucosa
description: A net-like pattern of increased pigmentation of the oral cavity.
synonyms: ["Mottled pigmentation of oral mucosa","Reticulate pigmentation of oral mucous membrane"]

name: Abnormal upper motor neuron morphology
description: Any structural anomaly that affects the upper motor neuron.

name: Cone-shaped epiphysis of the middle phalanx of the 2nd toe
synonyms: ["Cone-shaped end part of the middle bone of the 2nd toe"]

name: Absent nail of hallux
description: Absent nail of big toe.
synonyms: ["Absent big toe nail","Absent nail of big toe"]

name: Ameliorated by ethanol ingestion
description: Applies to a sign or symptom that is improved or made more bearable by drinking alcohol (ethanol).

name: Focal aware epileptic spasm
description: A type of focal-onset epileptic spasm in which awareness is preserved throughout the seizure.

name: Increased circulating IgG1 level
description: An abnormally increased concentration of the IgG1 subtype in the blood circulation.

name: Inlet ventricular septal defect
description: A ventricular septal defect that involves the inlet of the right ventricular septum immediately inferior to the AV valve apparatus.
synonyms: ["Atrioventricular canal type ventricular septal defect","Type 3 ventricular septal defect"]

name: Aplasia of the vestibule
description: Complete absence of the vestibule of the inner ear.

name: Abnormal cortical radial artery morphology
description: Any structural anomaly of the radial arteries that branch off at right angles from the arcuate artery and carry blood toward the cortex of the kidney.

name: Hypoplastic colon
description: Underdevelopment of the colon.

name: Abnormal male reproductive system physiology
description: An abnormal functionality of the male genital system.

name: Abnormality of the curvature of the cornea
Abnormal pulmonary artery morphology
description: An abnormality of the structure of the pulmonary artery.

name: Clinical course
description: The course a disease typically takes from its onset, progression in time, and eventual resolution or death of the affected individual.

name: Arterial calcification
description: Pathological deposition of calcium salts in one or more arteries.

name: Very rare
description: Present in 1% to 4% of the cases.

name: Spinal cord tumor
description: A neoplasm affecting the spinal cord.
synonyms: ["HP:0009712","Spinal cord tumor","Spinal cord tumour","Tumor of the spinal cord","Tumour of the spinal cord"]

name: Abnormality of the maxilla
description: An abnormality of the Maxilla (upper jaw bone).
synonyms: ["Abnormality of the upper jaw bone","Abnormality of the upper jaw bones"]

name: Abnormal CSF tryptophan concentration
description: Any deviation from the normal concentration of tryptophan in the cerebrospinal fluid.

name: Horizontal jerk nystagmus
description: Nystagmus consisting of horizontal to-and-fro eye movements, in which the movement in one direction is faster than in the other.

name: Contractures of the proximal interphalangeal joint of the 5th toe
description: The proximal interphalangeal joint of the fifth toe cannot be straightened actively or passively.
synonyms: ["Camptodactyly of the 5th toe","Camptodactyly of the fifth toe"]

name: Portal inflammation
description: Infiltration of portal fields by inflammatory cells.

name: Broad proximal phalanx of the 5th finger
description: Increased width of the proximal phalanx of the 5th finger.
synonyms: ["Broad innermost little finger bone","Broad innermost pinkie finger bone","Broad innermost pinky finger bone","Wide proximal phalanx of the 5th finger"]

name: Recurrent meningitis
description: An increased susceptibility to meningitis as manifested by a medical history of recurrent episodes of meningitis.

name: Proximal femoral focal deficiency
description: Proximal femoral focal deficiency is a deformity manifested by hypoplasia of a variable portion of the femur with shortening of the entire limb.

name: GM1-ganglioside accumulation
description: Cellular accumulation of GM1 gangliosides.

name: Reduced quantity of Von Willebrand factor
description: Decreased quantity of von Willebrand factor.

name: Abnormality of primary teeth
description: Any abnormality of the primary tooth.
synonyms: ["Abnormality of baby teeth","Abnormality of deciduous teeth","Abnormality of milk teeth"]

name: Decreased RV/TLC ratio
description: An abnormally low ratio of residual volume (RV) to total lung capacity (TLC) on pulmonary function testing. RV is the amount of air remaining after maximal expiration and TLC is the total amount of air in the lungs at full inspiration. These volumes cannot be determined by spirometry, but can be measured by inert gas dilution, nitrogen washout, and body plethysmography.

name: Synotia
description: A congenital malformation characterized by the union or approximation of the ears in front of the neck, often accompanied by the absence or defective development of the lower jaw.

name: Stippled calcification of humeral metaphysis
synonyms: ["Speckled calcification in metaphysis of long bone of upper arm"]

name: Cutaneous atresia of the external auditory canal
Anomalous origin of one pulmonary artery from ascending aorta
description: Anomalous origin of one pulmonary artery from the ascending aorta with the contralateral pulmonary artery arising from the right ventricle.

name: Peripheral cyanosis
description: Bluish discoloration of the distal extremities (hands, fingertips, toes), and can sometimes involve circumoral and periorbital areas. Mucous membranes are generally not involved.

name: Hemangioblastoma
description: A hemangioblastoma is a benign vascular neoplasm that arises almost exclusively in the central nervous system. Hemangioblastomas consist of a tightly packed cluster of small blood vessels forming a mass of up to 1 or 2 cm in diameter.

name: Decreased urine output
description: A decreased rate of urine production.

name: Punctate periventricular T2 hyperintense foci
description: Multiple pointlike areas of high T2 signal observed upon magnetic resonance imaging of the periventricular cerebral white matter.

name: Unlayered lissencephaly
description: A type of lissencephaly whereby upon neuropathological examination the cortical plate is severely disorganized with a festooned-like pattern and with neither lamination nor clear demarcation between white and grey matter.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the 5th toe
synonyms: ["Absent/small little toe","Absent/small pinkie toe","Absent/small pinky toe","Absent/underdeveloped pinky toe"]

name: Elevated CSF biopterin level
description: Increased concentration of biopterin in the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF).

name: Hypodysplasia of the corpus callosum
description: Developmental defect characterized by a small and malformed corpus callosum.

name: Renal arteriole endoarterial hypercellularity
description: Abnormal and excessive number of cells (hypercellularity) in the lining (endothelium) of the arterioles of the kidney.

name: Steroid-sensitive nephrotic syndrome
description: A type of nephrotic syndrome in which complete remission (albumin urine dipstick negative/trace or proteinuria <4mg/m2/d or urinary protein to creatinine ratio <200mg/g (<20 mg/mmol) for 3 consecutive days) is achieved within initial 4 weeks of corticosteroid therapy.

name: Broad foot
description: A foot for which the measured width is above the 95th centile for age; or, a foot that appears disproportionately wide for its length.

name: Corneal keratic precipitates
description: An inflammatory cellular deposit deposited on the corneal endothelium and visible as spots on the cornea.

name: Pruritus on foot
description: Pruritus is an itch or a sensation that makes a person want to scratch. This term refers to an abnormally increased sensation of itching over the skin of the foot.

name: Chin with vertical crease
description: Vertical crease fold situated below the vermilion border of the lower lip and above the fatty pad of the chin with the face at rest.
synonyms: ["Chin with vertical crease","Chin with vertical furrow","Chin with vertical groove","Chin with vertical sulcus","Chin, vertical crease","Cleft chin","Vertical chin skin cleft","Vertical menton crease"]

name: Erythema
description: Redness of the skin, caused by hyperemia of the capillaries in the lower layers of the skin.

name: Symphalangism of the proximal phalanx of the 5th toe with the 5th metatarsal
synonyms: ["Fused innermost pinky toe bone with the 5th long bone of foot"]

name: Hypogonadism
description: A decreased functionality of the gonad.

name: Plasmacytosis
description: An abnormally increased number of plasma cells in tissues, exudates, or blood

name: Fractured distal phalanx of pedal digit 3
description: A partial or complete breakage of the distal phalanx of pedal digit 3.

name: Amyotrophy of the musculature of the pelvis
description: Muscular atrophy affecting the muscles of the pelvis.

name: Increased airway neuroendocrine cells
description: Presence of increased numbers of bombesin-immuno-positive neuroendocrine cells (NECs) within distal airways. There are no formal criteria for an increase (which is also dependend on the sensitivity of the staining method), findings of neuroendocrine cells in at least 70% of bronchioles by lung biopsy and at least 10% NECs in an individual airway are consistent with the diagnosis of Neuroendocrine cell hyperplasia of infancy in the appropriate clinical setting. Increases are also seen in other clicnial settings. Neuroendocrine neoplasms of the lung encompass NE tumors (NETs), which split into typical and atypical carcinoids, and NE carcinomas (NECs).

name: Thrombocytosis
description: Increased numbers of platelets in the peripheral blood.
synonyms: ["Increased number of platelets in blood","Increased platelet count"]

name: Fragmentation of the epiphyses of the 2nd toe
synonyms: ["Fragmentation of the end part of the 2nd toe bone"]

name: Tracheomegaly
description: Marked widening of the trachea.

name: Calf muscle hypertrophy
description: Muscle hypertrophy affecting the calf muscles.
synonyms: ["HP:0003703","HP:0009024","Calf hypertrophy","Increased size of calf muscles","Muscular hypertrophy of the calf muscles"]

name: Plasmacytoma
description: A discrete mass of neoplastic monoclonal plasma cells either in the bone marrow or in an extramedullary location.

name: Perifoveal ring of hyperautofluorescence surrounded by abnormal autofluorescence
Gynecomastia
description: Abnormal development of large mammary glands in males resulting in breast enlargement.

name: Hypoplasia of latissimus dorsi muscle
description: Underdevelopment of the latissimus dorsi muscle, which is involved in adduction, extension, internal rotation, and transverse extension of the shoulder and assists in movement of the scapula.

name: Complete duplication of the distal phalanx of the 3rd finger
description: Complete duplication of the distal phalanx of middle finger
synonyms: ["Complete duplication of the outermost bone of the 3rd finger"]

name: Precocious puberty in females
description: The onset of puberty before the age of 8 years in girls.

name: Aspartic aciduria
description: A increased concentration of aspartic acid in the urine.

name: Convex nasal ridge
description: Nasal ridge curving anteriorly to an imaginary line that connects the nasal root and tip. The nose appears often also prominent, and the columella low.
synonyms: ["Beaked nose","Beaklike protrusion","Convex dorsum of nose","Convex nasal dorsum","Hooked nose","Polly beak nasal deformity"]

name: High-pitched cry
description: A type of crying in an abnormally high-pitched voice.

name: Seizure precipitated by febrile infection
description: Any form of seizure occurring at the time of a fever (temperature at or above 38.0 degrees Celcius) without infection of the central nervous system, and without an alternative cause such as severe metabolic derangement, occurring at any age.

name: Maceration
description: A softening and breaking down of skin resulting from prolonged exposure to moisture. Macerated skin becomes soft and wrinkly and takes on a whitish hue.

name: Cerebral cortical hemiatrophy
description: Atrophy of one side of the brain, characterized by findings including thinning of the cerebral cortex, reduced volume of the cerebral white matter with abnormal myelination, and enlargement of the ispilateral fourth ventricle.

name: Unilateral renal atrophy
description: A unilateral form of atrophy of the kidney.
synonyms: ["Kidney degeneration on one side","Unilateral kidney wasting"]

name: EEG with central sharp slow waves
description: EEG with sharp slow waves in the central region. Sharp slow waves are focal sharp transient waves of a duration between 80 and 200 msec followed by a slow wave.

name: Basal ganglia edema
description: Swelling within the basal ganglia due to the accumulation of fluid.
synonyms: ["Basal ganglia oedema","Edema of the basal ganglia","Oedema of the basal ganglia"]

name: Parkinsonism with favorable response to dopaminergic medication
description: Parkinsonism is a clinical syndrome that is a feature of a number of different diseases, including Parkinson disease itself, other neurodegenerative diseases such as progressive supranuclear palsy, and as a side-effect of some neuroleptic medications. Some but not all individuals with Parkinsonism show responsiveness to dopaminergic medication defined as a substantial reduction of amelioration of the component signs of Parkinsonism (including mainly tremor, bradykinesia, rigidity, and postural instability) upon administration of dopaminergic medication.
synonyms: ["Parkinsonism with favourable response to dopaminergic medication"]

name: Abnormal blood oxygen level
description: An abnormality of the partial pressure of oxygen in the arterial blood.
synonyms: ["Abnormal blood O2 level","Abnormal blood oxygen levels","Abnromal O2 blood concentration"]

name: Thromboembolism
description: The formation of a blood clot inside a blood vessel that subsequently travels through the blood stream from the site where it formed to another location in the body, generally leading to vascular occlusion at the distant site.
synonyms: ["Blood clot in blood vessel","Thromboembolic disease","Thromboembolic events"]

name: Neutrophilia in absence of infection
description: An increased number of neutrophils circulating in the blood in the absence of an infection. Factors contributing to neutrophilia could include inflammation or congenital disorders.

name: Blood group B
description: ABO phenotype B, corresponding to the genotype BO or BB.

name: Distal amyotrophy
description: Muscular atrophy affecting muscles in the distal portions of the extremities.
synonyms: ["HP:0002484","HP:0002934","HP:0003486","HP:0003699","HP:0006786","HP:0006864","HP:0008937","HP:0008958","HP:0009015","HP:0009040","HP:0009065","Amyotrophy of distal limb muscles","Distal amyotrophy, especially of the hands and feet","Distal limb muscle atrophy","Distal muscle atrophy","Distal muscle atrophy, upper and lower limbs","Distal muscle degeneration","Distal muscle wasting","Distal muscular atrophy","Muscle atrophy, distal"]

name: Beaded septum sign
description: Irregular and nodular thickening of interlobular septa reminiscent of a row of beads.

name: Atherosclerosis
description: A condition characterized by patchy atheromas or atherosclerotic plaques which develop in the walls of medium-sized and large arteries and can lead to arterial stenosis with reduced or blocked blood flow.
synonyms: ["Atherosclerotic cardiovascular disease","Narrowing and hardening of arteries","Plaque build-up in arteries"]

name: Skeletal muscle hyperechogenicity
description: An increased echo intensity of muscle tissue on sonography, defined as an increased amount of returning echoes per square area of muscle tissue.
