On cross-section, normal muscle appears as a relatively anechoic structure with hyperechoic speckles within the tissue representing perimysial septa, giving it a starry night appearance. The boundaries of each muscle are delineated by the presence of hyperechoic fascia. In muscle disorders, one of the hallmark findings is replacement of healthy muscle with fat and fibrosis, manifested by an increase in echogenicity from higher sound transitions in the muscle. This increase in echogenicity is most distinct in conditions that lead to chronic pathology, such as long-standing muscle inflammation, dystrophy, or denervation.

name: Recurrent systemic pyogenic infections
description: Increased susceptibility to systemic pyogenic infections, as manifested by recurrent episodes of systemic pyogenic infections.

name: Cervical spondylosis
description: The presence of arthrosis, i.e., of degenerative joint disease, affecting the cervical vertebral column.

name: Laterally sloping humeral metaphysis
synonyms: ["Laterally sloping metaphysis of long bone of upper arm"]

name: Sharp
description: Applied to pain that is described as sharp, i.e., sudden and severe.

name: Sparse axillary hair
description: Reduced number or density of axillary hair.
synonyms: ["HP:0004514","HP:0004518","HP:0004545","Limited armpit hair","Little underarm hair","Sparse axillary and pubic hair","Sparse scalp, axillary, and pubic hair","sparse to absent axillary hair"]

name: Abnormal circulating fetuin A concentration
description: Any deviation from the normal concentration of fetuin A in the blood circulation.

name: Nuchal cord
description: A complication of pregnancy and delivery in which the umbilical cord wraps around the fetal neck once or multiple times.

name: obsolete Concentric narrowing of visual field
Emotional hypersensitivity
description: Heightened emotional reactivity to environmental stimuli, including emotions of others.

name: Abnormal dental enamel morphology
description: An abnormality of the dental enamel.
synonyms: ["HP:0006322","Abnormal tooth enamel","Abnormality of dental enamel","Enamel abnormalities","Enamel abnormality"]

name: Decreased immunoglobulin level in body fluid
description: An reduction from normal levels of immunoglobulins in body fluids, such as mucous.

name: Small epiphyses of the toes
synonyms: ["Small end part of the toe bones"]

name: Talipes calcaneovarus
description: A congenital deformity characterized by a dorsiflexed, inverted, and adducted foot, i.e., a combination of talipes calcaneus and talipes varus.

name: Abnormal circulating carboxylic acid concentration
description: Any deviation from the normal concentration of a carboxylic acid in the blood circulation.

name: Partial absence of cerebellar vermis
description: Congenital absence of a part of the vermis of cerebellum.

name: Reduced drug efficacy
description: Decreased response to a drug intervention in comparison to the expected response.

name: Retinal arterial occlusion
description: Blockage of the retinal artery, generally associated with interruption of blood flow and oxygen delivery to the retina.

name: Triggered by vestibular stimulation
description: Applies to a sign or symptom that is provoked or brought about by vestibular stimulation, including head turning, cold calorics, postural changes, or rotating chair.
synonyms: ["Vestibular stimulation triggered attacks","Vestibular stimulation triggered symptoms"]

name: Recurrent ear infections
description: Increased susceptibility to ear infections, as manifested by recurrent episodes of ear infections.

name: Agenesis of pulmonary vessels
description: A developmental defect characterized by the lack of formation of the pulmonary blood vessels.

name: Increased micromegakaryocyte count
description: The presence of abnormally high numbers of micromegakaryocytes in the bone marrow. Micromegakaryocytes are mononuclear diploid cells, with a nucleus similar in size to that of a myeloblast or promyelocyte with the cell being less than 30 micrometers in diameter.

name: Abnormal toenail morphology
description: An anomaly of the toenail.
synonyms: ["Abnormality of the toenail","Abnormality of the toenails"]

name: Aplasia of the tarsal bones
description: Absence of the tarsal bones.

name: Retinopathy of prematurity threshold
description: A retinopathy with a 50% likelihood of progressing to retinal detachment. Threshold disease is considered to be present when stage 3 retinopathy of prematurity (ROP) is present in either zone I or zone II, with at least 5 continuous or 8 total clock hours of disease, and the presence of plus disease.

name: Increased ratio of VWF propeptide to VWF antigen
description: An increased VWF propeptide to VWF antigen indicates that deficiency of VWF is not due to impaired synthesis but due to rapid clearance. The VWF propeptide is measured by ELISA.

name: Renal interstitial edema
description: Edema is characterized but the acute swelling of the stroma, with expansion of the interstitial space without the a concurrent increase in interstitial cells or extracellular matrix. Histologically this change is appreciated as interstitial areas of lower optical density.

name: Slurred speech
description: Abnormal coordination of muscles involved in speech.

name: Dysgammaglobulinemia
description: Selective deficiency of one or more, but not all, classes of immunoglobulins.

name: Schwannoma
description: A benign nerve sheath tumor composed of Schwann cells.

name: Red-brown urine
description: An abnormal red-brown color of the urine.

name: Dilated fourth ventricle
description: An abnormal dilatation of the fourth cerebral ventricle.

name: Metopic synostosis
description: Premature fusion of the metopic suture.

name: Gingival recession
description: The loss of gum tissue. The result is that gum tissue is recessed and its position on the tooth is lowered, exposing the roots of the teeth.

name: Generalized amyloid deposition
description: A diffuse form of amyloidosis.

name: Low alkaline phosphatase of renal origin
description: An abnormally reduced level of kidney isoforms of alkaline phosphatase in the blood.

name: Abnormal circulating nicotinurate concentration
description: Any deviation from the normal concentration of nicotinurate in the blood.
synonyms: ["Abnormal circulating N-nicotinoylglycine level","Abnormal circulating nicotinurate level"]

name: Pilocytic astrocytoma
description: The most common form of astrocytoma (WHO Grade I) in childhood. These typically have MAPK signalling pathway abnormalities.

name: Cholesterol gallstones
description: Gallstones composed primarily of cholesterol, usually about 2-3 cm in length with an oval form and a yellow or green/brown color.

name: Fractured epiphysis of middle phalanx of manus
description: A partial or complete breakage of the epiphysis of middle phalanx of manus.
synonyms: ["bone epiphysis of middle phalanx of manus"]

name: Central diabetes insipidus
description: A form of diabetes insipidus related to a failure of vasopressin (AVP) release from the hypothalamus.

name: Giant platelets
description: Giant platelets are larger than 7 micrometers and usually 10 to 20 micrometers. The term giant platelet is used when the platelet is larger than the size of the average red cell in the field. (Description adapted from College of American Pathologists, Hematology Manual, 1998).

name: Reticular pattern on pulmonary HRCT
description: On pulmonary high-resolution computed tomography, reticular pattern is characterised by innumerable interlacing shadows suggesting a mesh.

name: Partial duplication of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger
description: Partial duplication of the second proximal phalanx of hand, seen on x-rays as a broad and/or bifid phalanx.
synonyms: ["Partial duplication of the proximal bones of the index finger"]

name: Anti-ARHGAP26 antibody
description: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against Rho GTPase-activating protein 26 (ARHGAP26).

name: Abnormal proportion of CD8-positive T cells
description: Any abnormality in the proportion of CD8 T cells relative to the total number of T cells.
synonyms: ["Abnormal proportion of CD8+ T cells","Abnormal proportion of CD8-positive, alpha-beta T cells"]

name: Multiple renal cysts
description: The presence of many cysts in the kidney.

name: Cerebral artery calcification
description: An accumulation of calcium and phosphate in arteries with mineral deposits in the intimal or medial layer of the vessel wall in a cerebral artery.

name: Tubulointerstitial viral infiltration
description: Infiltration of viruses into renal tubulointerstitial tissues as demonstrated on renal biopsy by viral inclusions which can be seen on routine stains or with immunohistochemistry.

name: Increased urinary porphobilinogen
description: Increased concentration of porphobilinogen in the urine.

name: Impairment of the the acoustic reflex
Progressive leg bowing
description: Progressive bending or abnormal curvature of the leg.

name: Infantile axial hypotonia
description: Muscular hypotonia (abnormally low muscle tone) affecting the musculature of the trunk and with onset in infancy.

name: Short 2nd metacarpal
description: Short second metacarpal bone because of developmental hypoplasia.

name: Elevated circulating linoleylcarnitine concentration
description: Increased concentration of linoleylcarnitine in the blood circulation.

name: Increased circulating isovaleric acid concentration
description: Increased concentration of isovaleric acid, a C5, branched-chain saturated fatty acid, in the blood concentration.

name: Large vessel vasculitis
description: A type of vasculitis (inflammation of blood vessel walls) affecting large arteries such as the aorta and branches of the aorta.

name: Abnormality of upper limb joint
synonyms: ["Abnormality of the joints of the upper limbs","Abnormality of upper limb joint"]

name: Bullet-shaped distal phalanx of the 3rd finger
description: Bullet-shaped phalanx refers to a short and wide phalanx that tapers distally . Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction. This term is used if the distal phalanx of the 3rd finger is affected.
synonyms: ["Bullet-shaped outermost bone of the middle finger"]

name: Biceps hypoplasia
description: Underdevelopment of the biceps muscle.

name: Decreased circulating calcifediol concentration
description: A reduced concentration of calcifediol in the blood. Calcifediol is also known as calcidiol, 25-hydroxycholecalciferol and 25-Hydroxyvitamin D3.
synonyms: ["Decreased 25-hydroxyvitamin D3","Low serum 25-hydroxycholecalciferol","Low serum calcidiol","Low serum calcifediol"]

name: Hematemesis
description: The vomiting of blood.

name: Curved proximal phalanx of the hallux
description: A deviation from the normal straight form of the proximal phalanx of the big toe.
synonyms: ["Curved innermost bone of the big toe"]

name: Muscle fiber actin filament accumulation
description: Accumulation in muscle cells of filaments composed of actin.

name: Supernumerary naris
description: The presence of more than two nostrils.

name: Abnormal circulating ceruloplasmin concentration
description: Any deviation of the concentration of ceruloplasmin in the blood from the normal range.

name: Sclerosis of the proximal phalanx of the 5th finger
synonyms: ["Increased bone density in innermost little finger bone","Increased bone density in innermost pinkie finger bone","Increased bone density in innermost pinky finger bone"]

name: Fiber type grouping
description: An abnormal distribution of muscle fiber types in muscle tissue. Human skeletal muscle contains at least two fiber types recognizable by histochemical techniques. In transverse sections of normal skeletal muscle, type 1 and type 2 fibers are distributed in a random fashion. Grouping of fibers of the same type can be seen in certain peripheral neuropathies, thought to be due to reinnervation of denervated muscle fibers by sprouting axons. With grouping, motor units enlarge. The fibers of a motor unit, which are normally scattered, come to lie adjacent to one another. Histochemical examination shows groups of muscle fibers of the same histochemical type.

name: Exertional dyspnea
description: Perceived difficulty to breathe that occurs with exercise or exertion and improves with rest.
synonyms: ["Exertional breathlessness","Exertional dyspnoea","Shortness of breathing upon physical activity"]

name: Prolonged bleeding time
description: Prolongation of the time taken for a standardized skin cut of fixed depth and length to stop bleeding.

name: Focal aware autonomic seizure with pupillary dilation/constriction
description: A focal autonomic seizure with pupillary dilation / constriction characterized by retained awareness throughout the seizure.

name: Weak grip
description: Reduced grip strength. Gripping is the motion by which the hand tightly grasps an object or other hand.

name: Granulomatous cholangitis
description: Cholangitis characterized by the accumulation of granulomas. Granulomas are aggregates of modified macrophages (epithelioid cells) and other inflammatory cells that accumulate after chronic exposure to antigens. The underlying trigger may be exposure to noxious agents that cannot be biochemically degraded or to immune dysfunction. The ultimate result is a release of a variety cytokines that stimulate mononuclear cells that fuse to form multinucleated giant cells with a surrounding rim of lymphocytes and fibroblasts.

name: Decreased circulating IgE
description: An abnormally decreased level of immunoglobulin E (IgE) in blood.

name: Flat acetabular roof
description: Flattening of the superior part of the acetabulum, which is a cup-shaped cavity at the base of the hipbone into which the ball-shaped head of the femur fits. The acetabular roof thereby appears horizontal rather than arched, as it normally does.
synonyms: ["HP:0003171","HP:0008832","HP:0008834","Flat acetabular roofs","Flattened acetabular roof","Horizontal acetabulae","Horizontal acetabular roof","Horizontal acetabular roofs"]

name: Type V atherosclerotic lesion
description: Type V lesions are defined as lesions in which prominent new fibrous connective tissue has formed. When the new tissue is part of a lesion with a lipid core (type IV), this type of morphology may be referred to as fibroatheroma or type Va lesion. A type V lesion in which the lipid core and other parts of the lesion are calcified may be referred to as type Vb. A type V lesion in which a lipid core is absent and lipid in general is minimal may be referred to as type Vc. With these lesions, arteries are variously narrowed, generally more than with type IV. Importantly, as with type IV lesions, type V lesions may develop fissures, hematoma, and/or thrombus (type VI lesion), and for this reason too they are clinically relevant.

name: Abnormal renal tubular epithelial morphology
description: Any structural anomaly of the renal tubular epithelial cells (RTEC), a layer of cells in the outer layer of the renal tubule. These cells play a role in the absorption of substances such as glucose and amino from the primary urine.

name: Abnormal dermoepidermal hemidesmosome morphology
description: An abnormal structure or appearance of hemidesmosomes, multiprotein complexes that facilitate the stable adhesion of basal epithelial cells to the underlying basement membrane.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia involving bones of the feet
Irregular epiphyses of the elbow
synonyms: ["Irregular end part of the elbow bone"]

name: Maternal seizure
description: A seizure during pregnancy.

name: Hepatic infarction
description: Hepatic infarction is defined as areas of coagulative necrosis from hepatocyte cell death caused by local ischemia. Liver infarctions appear as hypoechoic nonvascular regions on conventional and Doppler sonography.

name: Subhyaloid hemorrhage
description: A localized detachment of the vitreous from the retina due to the accumulation of blood. When localized in the macular area, it results in sudden profound loss of vision. Subhyaloid premacular hemorrhage is typically characterized by a circumscribed, round or dumb-bell shaped, bright red mound of blood beneath the internal limiting membrane (ILM) or between the ILM and hyaloid face, in or near to the central macular area.

name: Harlequin phenomenon
description: The Harlequin phenomenon consists of a sudden change in skin colour, resulting in two different body colours, one on each half of the body.

name: Hypoplasia of right ventricle
description: Underdevelopment or reduced size of the heart right ventricle, often due to a reduced number of cells.
synonyms: ["HP:0004951","Heart right ventricle hypoplasia","Small right heart chamber","Underdeveloped right heart chamber"]

name: Impaired collagen-induced platelet aggregation
description: Abnormal response to collagen or collagen-mimetics as manifested by reduced or lacking aggregation of platelets upon addition collagen or collagen-mimetics.

name: Anterior beaking of thoracic vertebrae
description: Anterior tongue-like protrusions of thoracic vertebral bodies.

name: Breast aplasia
description: Failure to develop and congenital absence of the breast.
synonyms: ["Absent breast","Congenital absence of breast","Mammary gland aplasia"]

name: Decreased circulating ferritin concentration
description: Abnormally reduced concentration of ferritin, a ubiquitous intracellular protein that stores iron, in the blood.
synonyms: ["Decreased plasma ferritin","Decreased serum ferritin","Low ferritin level","Reduced serum ferritin"]

name: Spasmus nutans
description: The combination of pendular nystagmus, head nodding, and torticollis.

name: Congenital pyloric atresia
description: Congenital atresia of the pylorus.

name: Partial duplication of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd toe
description: Partial duplication of proximal phalanx of second toe.
synonyms: ["Partial duplication of the innermost 2nd toe bone","Partial duplication of the proximal phalanx of the second toe"]

name: Laryngeal cyst
description: Presence of a cyst (sac-like structure) located in the larynx.

name: Apically displaced anterolateral papillary muscle
description: Abnormal location of the insertion of the anterolateral papillary muscle near to the apex of the left ventricle. This feature may be appreciated by noting that this muscle is usually not seen in the apical level of the parasternal short-axis echocardiographic view,

name: Focal aware autonomic seizure with urge to urinate/defecate
description: A focal autonomic seizure with urge to urinate / defecate characterized by retained awareness throughout the seizure.

name: Urethrovaginal fistula
description: The presence of a fistula between the vagina and the urethra.

name: Skin nodule
description: Morphologically similar to a papule, but greater than either 10mm in both width and depth, and most frequently centered in the dermis or subcutaneous fat.
synonyms: ["Growth of abnormal tissue on or under the skin"]

name: Oophoritis
description: An inflammation of the ovary or ovaries.

name: Bifid sacrum
description: Presence of a bifid sacral bone.

name: Bifid tragus
description: Increased height of the tragal ridge with a shallow indentation at the apex, giving the appearance of a double peak.

name: Cone-shaped epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 4th finger
description: A cone-shaped appearance of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the ring finger of the hand, producing a 'ball-in-a-socket' appearance. This epiphysis is located at the proximal end of the phalanx and is normally nearly flat. The related entity 'angel-shaped' epiphysis refers to a pronounced cone-shaped epiphysis in combination with a pseudoepiphysis at the distal end of the phalanx.
synonyms: ["Cone-shaped end part of the innermost bone of the ring finger"]

name: Symphalangism affecting the proximal phalanges of the toes
Broad radial metaphysis
description: Increase in width (breadth) of the radial metaphysis.

name: Subcutaneous neurofibromas
description: The presence of Neurofibromas in the subcutis.

name: Decreased platelet glycoprotein VI
description: Decreased cell membrane concentration of glycoprotein VI.

name: Tongue atrophy
description: Wasting of the tongue.
synonyms: ["Atrophy of the tongue","Lingual atrophy","Lingual wasting","Wasting of the tongue"]

name: Hypoplasia of the odontoid process
description: Developmental hypoplasia of the dens of the axis.
synonyms: ["HP:0003299","HP:0004613","HP:0008481","Hypoplastic odontoid process","Odontoid hypoplasia","Small odontoid peg","Small odontoid process"]

name: Malignant hyperthermia
description: Malignant hyperthermia is characterized by a rapid increase in temperature to 39-42 degrees C in response to inhalational anesthetics such as halothane or to muscle relaxants such as succinylcholine.
synonyms: ["HP:0004896","Malignant hyperthermia with anaesthesia","Malignant hyperthermia with anesthesia"]

name: Lacrimal duct stenosis
description: Narrowing of a tear duct (lacrimal duct).
synonyms: ["HP:0007669","Narrowing of the tear duct","Nasolacrimal duct stenosis"]

name: Multifocal subretinal deposits
description: Deposits accumulating between the outer retina and the retinal pigment epithelium and that are distributed with multiple foci.

name: Total colonic aganglionosis
description: A type of aganglionic megacolon in which the aganglionic segment comprises the entire colon.

name: Mild fetal ventriculomegaly
description: A kind of ventriculomegaly occurring in the fetal period and usually diagnosed by prenatal ultrasound. Cerebral ventriculomegaly is defined by atrial measurements 10 mm or more. Mild ventriculomegaly (MVM) is defined as measurements between 10 and 15 mm. Measurements are obtained from an axial plane at the level of the thalamic nuclei just below the standard image to measure the BPD (PMID:16100637).

name: Abnormal spinal meningeal morphology
description: Any abnormality of the spinal meninges, the system of membranes (dura mater, the arachnoid mater, and the pia mater) which envelops the spinal cord.

name: Aplasia of the fallopian tube
description: Aplasia, that is failure to develop, of the fallopian tube.

name: Transient
description: Short-lived and not permanent. This term applies to a phenotypic abnormality that is temporary and of short duration.

name: Focal impaired awareness head nodding automatism seizure
description: A type of focal automatism in which awareness is partially or fully impaired at some point during the seizure and is seizure characterized by involuntary head nodding at onset.

name: Aplasia of the ovary
description: Aplasia, that is failure to develop, of the ovary.

name: Prolonged euglobulin clot lysis time
description: Abnormally increased length of time required for an in vitro clot to dissolve in the absence of the normal plasmin inhibitors. This test is a clinical assay used to measure fibrinolysis. The euglobulin fraction of plasma is precipitated and used to form clot by addition of thrombin; after clot forms the rate of clot breakdown (fibrinolysis) can be monitored.

name: Contracture of the proximal interphalangeal joint of the 3rd finger
description: Chronic loss of joint motion of the proximal interphalangeal joint of the 3rd finger due to structural changes in non-bony tissue.
synonyms: ["Camptodactyly of the 3rd finger","Camptodactyly of the third finger"]

name: Talipes equinovarus
description: Talipes equinovarus (also called clubfoot) typically has four main components: inversion and adduction of the forefoot; inversion of the heel and hindfoot; equinus (limitation of extension) of the ankle and subtalar joint; and internal rotation of the leg.
synonyms: ["Club feet","Club foot","Clubbing of feet","Clubfeet","Clubfoot","Equinovarus","Foot, talipes equinovarus","Pes equinovarus","Pes equinus","Talipes varus"]

name: Abnormal urine isobutyrylglycine concentration
description: Abnormal concentration of isobutyrylglycine in the urine.

name: Decreased amplitude of sensory action potentials
description: A reduction in the amplitude of sensory nerve action potential. This feature is measured by nerve conduction studies.

name: Low cholesterol esterification rate
description: A reduction in the rate of cholesterol esterification.

name: Hypopnea
description: Hypopnea is referring to breathing that is abnormally shallow.

name: Fragmentation of the epiphysis of the middle phalanx of the 3rd toe
synonyms: ["Fragmentation of the end part of the middle bone of the 3rd toe"]

name: Narrow nasal septum
description: Abnormally narrow nasal septum.
synonyms: ["Decreased width of nasal septum","Narrow nasal septum","Narrow septum of nose","Thin nasal septum","Thin septum of nose"]

name: Sparse eyebrow
description: Decreased density/number of eyebrow hairs.

name: Vascular malformation of the lip
description: An anomaly of blood vessels located in the lip.

name: Prolonged bleeding following procedure
description: Prolonged or protracted bleeding following an invasive procedure or intervention.

name: Small epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb
description: Abnormally small size of the epiphysis located at the proximal end of the proximal phalanx of the thumb with respect to age-dependent norms.
synonyms: ["Small end part of thumb innermost long bone"]

name: Recurrent fever
description: Periodic (episodic or recurrent) bouts of fever.
synonyms: ["HP:0004903","HP:0005962","HP:0005966","HP:0005980","Episodic fever","Hyperthermia, episodic","Increased body temperature, episodic","Intermittent fever"]

name: Glomerular capillary collapse
description: Collapse is generally accompanied by other descriptors such as hypertrophy and hyperplasia of overlying glomerular epithelial cells, halo, protein droplets in podocytes and glomerular parietal epithelial cells (PECs).

name: Fractured epiphysis of fifth metacarpal bone
description: A partial or complete breakage of the epiphysis of fifth metacarpal bone.

name: Duodenal aganglionosis
description: A lack of intestinal ganglion cells (i.e., an aganglionic section of bowel) affecting the duodenum.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the mandible
description: Absence or underdevelopment of the mandible.

name: Elevated circulating o-phosphoserine concentration
description: An abnormally increased level of o-phosphoserine in the blood circulation. o-phosphoserine is a derivative of serine.

name: Thin calvarium
description: The presence of an abnormally thin calvarium.

name: Glomerular basement membrane amyloid spicule
description: Amyloid spicules are projections of typically silver-positive material from the outer aspect of the glomerular capillary wall, perpendicular to the glomerular basement membrane (GBM), most often caused by amyloidosis with the latter confirmed by additional stains.

name: Total anomalous pulmonary venous return
description: Total anomalous pulmonary venous return refers to a congenital malformation in which all four pulmonary veins do not connect normally to the left atrium, but instead drain abnormally to the right atrium.
synonyms: ["HP:0005153","HP:0005175","Total anomalous pulmonary venous connection","Total anomalous pulmonary venous drainage"]

name: Progeroid facial appearance
description: A degree of wrinkling of the facial skin that is more than expected for the age of the individual, leading to a prematurely aged appearance.
synonyms: ["HP:0000335","HP:0005333","Aged facial appearance","Premature aged appearance","Prematurely aged face","Prematurely aged facial appearance","Wizened face"]

name: False perception of self-motion
description: A perception that one's body is moving or swaying despite lack of motion of the body.

name: Epicanthus
description: A fold of skin starting above the medial aspect of the upper eyelid and arching downward to cover, pass in front of and lateral to the medial canthus.
synonyms: ["HP:0000624","HP:0007930","Epicanthal fold","Epicanthal folds","Epicanthic folds","Eye folds","Palpebronasal fold","Plica palpebronasalis","Prominent eye folds"]

name: Orbital rhabdomyosarcoma
description: A mesenchymal tumour that is considered to be the commonest primary orbital malignancy in children. Histologically, it may be differentiated into embryonal, alveolar, and pleomorphic types. It is usually intraconal or within the superior orbit.

name: Vocal cord paresis
description: Decreased strength of the vocal folds.
synonyms: ["HP:0001603","HP:0001616","HP:0008745","Hoarse voice due to vocal cord paresis","Vocal cord paresis in severe cases","Weakness of the vocal cords"]

name: Focal impaired awareness vocal automatism seizure
description: A type of focal automatism seizure in which awareness is partially or fully impaired at some point during the seizure and is characterized by the production of single or repetitive meaningless vocal sounds such as shrieks or grunts at onset.

name: Abolished vibration sense
description: A complete loss of the ability to perceive vibration.

name: Dagger-shaped pulp calcifications
description: Dagger-shaped calcifications in the dental pulp.
synonyms: ["Dagger shaped pulp denticles","Dagger shaped pulp stones"]

name: Closed comedo
description: A comedo in which the top of the pore is not stretched open and thus does not expose the clogged portion (which would appear black), hence the name whitehead.

name: Rocker bottom foot
description: The presence of both a prominent heel and a convex contour of the sole.
synonyms: ["HP:0001835","HP:0004693","HP:0010218","Congenital vertical talus","Rocker bottom feet","Rocker bottom foot","Rocker-bottom feet","Rockerbottom feet"]

name: Urethrocele
description: The prolapse of the female urethra into the vagina.

name: Increased anti-animal dander IgE antibody level
description: Increased level of IgE antibody against animal dander, tiny scales shed from animal skin or hair, such as from pet dogs or cats.

name: Coma
description: Complete absence of wakefulness and content of conscience, which manifests itself as a lack of response to any kind of external stimuli.

name: Pulmonary artery intimal thickening
description: Increased thickness of the intimal layer of the pulmonary artery. Throughout the pulmonary arterial tree, the thin intima consists of a non-fenestrated monolayer of endothelial cells lining the vessel lumen, as well as a sub-endothelial interstitium that extends to the internal elastic lamina. Intimal thickness in human lung ranges from 1-16% of total wall thickness. Pulmonary artery intimal thickening can be defined as a relative intima thickness to the thickness of the vessel wall of over 10%.

name: Absent glenoid fossa
description: Lack of development of the glenoid fossa, also known as the glenoid cavity, which is the articular surface of the scapula that articulates with the head of the humerus.

name: Pseudoarthrosis
description: A pathologic entity characterized by a developmental defect in a long bone leading to bending and pathologic fracture, with inability to form a normal bony callus with subsequent fibrous nonunion, leading to the pseudarthrosis (or \"false joint\").

name: Horseshoe lung
description: A horseshoe lung is an uncommon congenital abnormality caused by the partial fusion of the bases of both lungs behind the pericardial sac.

name: Abnormality of T cell physiology
description: A functional anomaly of T cells.

name: Periapical tooth abscess
description: A tooth abscess that occurs at the tip of the root (apex) of a tooth.

name: Cervical vertebral agenesis
description: Agenesis of one or more vertebrae of the cervical vertebral column.

name: Ewing sarcoma
description: A malignant tumor of the bone which always arises in the medullary tissue, occurring more often in cylindrical bones.

name: Ambiguous genitalia, female
description: Ambiguous genitalia in an individual with XX genetic gender.

name: Abnormality of the phalanges of the 4th toe
Abnormal proportion of central memory CD4-positive, alpha-beta T cells
description: An abnormal proportion of central memory CD4-positive, alpha-beta memory T cells compared to the total number of T cells in the blood. These cells have the phenotype of CCR7-positive, CD127-positive, CD45RA-negative, CD45RO-positive, and CD25-negative.

name: Thin corpus callosum
description: An abnormally thin corpus callous, due to atrophy, hypoplasia or agenesis. This term is intended to be used in situations where it is not known if thinning of the corpus callosum (for instance, as visualized by magnetic resonance tomography) is due to abnormal development (e.g. a leukodystrophy) or atrophy following normal development (e.g. neurodegeneration).
synonyms: ["Small corpus callosum","Thinning of the corpus callosum"]

name: Pseudoepiphysis of the 3rd metacarpal
description: The normal epiphysis of the third metacarpal is localised at the distal end of the metacarpal bone. This term aplies if an accesory epiphysis, located at the proximal end of the metacarpal bone, is present.

name: Postlingual sensorineural hearing impairment
description: A form of sensorineural hearing impairment with onset after the acquisition of speech.

name: Myelocystocele
description: Myelocystocele is characterized by a large, ependyma-lined, cystic dilation of the caudal end of the central canal of the spinal cord; it projects dorsally through a lamina defect, with overlying varying amounts of lipomatous subcutaneous tissue. Myelocystoceles are associated with a tethered cord and meningocele, which communicates with the spinal subarachnoid space, but not with the central canal cyst.

name: Marcus Gunn pupil
description: An aberrant pupillary response characterized by (i) Constriction of pupils of both eyes when the light stimulus is applied to the normal eye, and (ii) Dilatation of pupils of both eyes when the light stimulus is rapidly transferred from the normal eye (after brief light exposure to the normal eye) to the affected eye.
synonyms: ["Relative afferent pupil defect","Relative afferent pupillary defect"]

name: Dysgyria with normal cortical thickness
description: An abnormal gyral pattern characterized by abnormalities of sulcal depth or orientation but with a normal thickness of the cortex.

name: Edema of the dorsum of hands
description: An abnormal accumulation of fluid beneath the skin on the back of the hands.
synonyms: ["HP:0007528","Edema of dorsum of hands","Oedema of dorsum of hands","Oedema of the dorsum of hands"]

name: Decreased post-bronchodilator forced vital capacity
description: An abnormal reduction in the amount of air a person can expel following maximal insipiration, with the test being performed after the administration of a bronchodilating medication.
synonyms: ["Decreased post bronchodilator forced vital capacity","Decreased postbronchodilator forced vital capacity"]

name: Frontal upsweep of hair
description: Upward and/or sideward growth of anterior hair.
synonyms: ["Cowlick","Frontal Cowlick","Frontal upsweep of hair","Upswept frontal hair"]

name: Epigastric pain
description: Pain that is localized to the region of the upper abdomen immediately below the ribs.

name: Renal arteriole leukocytic endoarterial hypercellularity
description: A type of renal arteriole endoarterial hypercellularity due to increased number of white blood cells (leukocytes).

name: Abnormal capillary morphology
description: A structural anomaly of the tiny blood vessels that connect arterioles with venules and whose walls act as semipermeable membranes that mediate the diffusion of fluids and gases between the blood circulation and body tissues.

name: Hypoganglionosis
description: Sparse and small myenteric ganglia

name: Abnormal molar morphology
description: An abnormality of morphology of molar tooth.
synonyms: ["Abnormal shape of molar tooth","Abnormality of molar morphology"]

name: Exercise-induced asthma
description: Asthma attacks following exercise.

name: Carcinoid tumor
description: A tumor formed from the endocrine (argentaffin) cells of the mucosal lining of a variety of organs including the stomach and intestine. These cells are from neuroectodermal origin.

name: Cerebellar vermis hypoplasia
description: Underdevelopment of the vermis of cerebellum.
synonyms: ["Cerebellar vermal hypoplasia","Hypoplasia of the cerebellar vermis","Hypoplastic cerebellar vermis"]

name: Failure to thrive in infancy
synonyms: ["HP:0008863","HP:0008925","Failure to thrive in first year of life","Faltering weight in infancy","Weight faltering in infancy"]

name: Hyperperistalsis
description: Excessively active peristalsis (wave of contraction of the tubular organs of the gastrointestinal tract) marked by excessive rapidity of the passage of food through the stomach and intestine.

name: Mucosal telangiectasiae
description: Telangiectasia of the mucosa, the mucous membranes which are involved in absorption and secretion that line cavities that are exposed to the external environment and internal organs.

name: Disseminated dermatophytosis
description: A type of invasive dermatophyte infection characterized by vascular involvement and dissemination to other organs.

name: Coronary sinus enlargement
description: Abnormal increase in size of the coronary sinus.

name: Recurrent
description: Applies to a sign, symptom or manifestation that occurs multiple times separated by intervals in which the sign, symptom, or manifestation is not present.

name: Fused lumbar vertebrae
description: A congenital anomaly characterized by a joining (fusion) of two or more lumbar vertebral bodies with one another.

name: Camptodactyly of finger
description: The distal interphalangeal joint and/or the proximal interphalangeal joint of the fingers cannot be extended to 180 degrees by either active or passive extension.
synonyms: ["HP:0005651","HP:0005662","HP:0005713","HP:0005801","HP:0005821","HP:0006195","HP:0006218","HP:0006240","HP:0009698","Camptodactyly of hands","Camptodactyly of proximal interphalangeal joint","Contractures of the proximal interphalangeal joints of the fingers","Flexion contractures of proximal interphalangeal joints","Permanent flexion of the finger","Proximal interphalangeal finger joint contractures"]

name: Fragmentation of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 5th toe
synonyms: ["Fragmentation of the end part of the outermost bone of the little toe","Fragmentation of the end part of the outermost bone of the pinkie toe","Fragmentation of the end part of the outermost bone of the pinky toe"]

name: Congenital stationary night blindness
description: A nonprogressive (i.e., stationary) form of difficulties with night blindness with congenital onset.
synonyms: ["HP:0007684","HP:0007861","HP:0007953","Congenital night blindness","Night blindness since birth","Static congenital hemeralopia"]

name: Patchy sclerosis of distal toe phalanx
description: Patchy (irregular) increase in bone density of one or more of the distal phalanges of the toes. This can take on many forms depending on severity and distribution as can be seen on x-rays.
synonyms: ["Patchy sclerosis of the distal phalanges of the toes","Uneven increase in bone density in outermost toe bone"]

name: Pretesticular azoospermia
description: Absence of any measurable level of sperm in his semen, due to a hypothalamic or pituitary abnormality diagnosed with hypo-gonadotropic-hypogonadism. The diagnosis is made on the basis of low LH and FSH levels and low or normal testosterone levels.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the ulna
description: Absence or underdevelopment of the ulna.
synonyms: ["HP:0005097","HP:0006372","HP:0006410","Absence/underdevelopment of inner forearm bone","Absent-hypoplastic ulnae","Absent/small ulna","Hypoplasia or unilateral/bilateral absence of ulna","ulnar hypoplasia/aplasia"]

name: Abnormality of the epiphyses of the 3rd toe
synonyms: ["Abnormality of the end part of the 3rd toe bone"]

name: Total anosmia
description: Inability to detect any qualitative olfactory sensation.

name: Renal cortical necrosis
description: Patchy or diffuse ischemic destruction of all the elements of renal cortex resulting from significantly diminished renal arterial perfusion. Coagulative necrosis may be present, involving all tubular segments and glomeruli. Nuclei may be pale and pyknotic, or may no longer be apparent. Thrombi may be present in vessels at the edge of the infarct.

name: Osteolytic defects of the distal phalanx of the 5th toe
synonyms: ["Osteolytic defects of the outermost bone of the 5th toe"]

name: Broad nasal tip
description: Increase in width of the nasal tip.
synonyms: ["HP:0004501","HP:0005269","Broad nasal tip","Broad tip of nose","Broad, upturned nose","Increased breadth of nasal tip","Increased breadth of tip of nose","Increased width of nasal tip","Increased width of tip of nose","Nasal tip, broad","Nasal tip, wide","Wide tip of nose"]

name: Fractured skeleton of manual acropodium
description: A partial or complete breakage of the skeleton of manual acropodium.

name: obsolete Abnormal concentration of calcium in blood
Exercise-induced myoglobinuria
description: Presence of myoglobin in the urine following exercise.

name: Absence of pectoralis minor muscle
description: Aplasia (congenital absence) of the pectoralis minor.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the phalanges of the 3rd toe
synonyms: ["Absent/small bones of 3rd toe","Absent/underdeveloped bones of 3rd toe"]

name: Decreased forced expiratory flow 25-75%
description: A reduction compared to the predicted value of the forced expiratory flow over the middle one-half of the FVC; the average flow from the point at which 25% of the FVC has been exhaled to the point at which 75% of the FVC has been exhaled.

name: Facial erythema
description: Redness of the skin of the face, caused by hyperemia of the capillaries in the lower layers of the skin.

name: Sudden loss of visual acuity
description: Severe loss of visual acuity within hours or days. This is characteristic of Leber hereditary optic neuropathy.

name: Moyamoya phenomenon
description: A noninflammatory, progressive occlusion of the intracranial carotid arteries owing to the formation of netlike collateral arteries arising from the circle of Willis.

name: Hypoargininemia
description: A decreased concentration of arginine in the blood.

name: Elevated CSF neurofilamant light chain
description: Definition: Neurofilament light chain (NfL) is a neuronal cytoplasmic protein highly expressed in large calibre myelinated axons. Its levels increase in cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) and blood proportionally to the degree of axonal damage in a variety of neurological disorders, including inflammatory, neurodegenerative, traumatic and cerebrovascular diseases.

name: Hypoplasia of the upper eyelids
synonyms: ["Decreased size of upper eyelid","Small upper eyelid","Underdevelopment of upper eyelid"]

name: Thinning and bulging of the posterior fossa bones
synonyms: ["Thinning and bulging of posterior fossa bones","Thinning and bulging of posterior skull bones"]

name: Electronegative electroretinogram
description: A dark-adapted bright flash electroretinogram in which the b-wave that is of markedly lower amplitude than the associated a-wave (source: Holder GE., Inherited Chorioretinal Dystrophies: A Textbook and Atlas; 2014; p.17; ISBN 978-3-540-69466-3).
synonyms: ["Electronegative ERG","Electroretinogram: reduced b-wave amplitude","Reduced amplitude of dark-adapted bright flash electroretinogram b-wave","Reduced electroretinogram rod b-wave","Reduced ERG amplitude of b-wave"]

name: Elevated circulating aspartate aminotransferase concentration
description: An abnormally high concentration in the circulation of aspartate aminotransferase (AST).
synonyms: ["Aspartate aminotransferase increased","Elevated serum aspartate aminotransferase","Elevated serum AST","Elevated serum glutamic oxaloacetic transaminase"]

name: Impaired task monitoring
description: Impaired ability to keep track of one's problem-solving success or failure, and to identify and correct mistakes during performance of a goal.

name: Vaginal adenosis
description: Vaginal adenosis is defined by the presence of metaplastic cervical or endometrial epithelium within the vaginal wall, thought to be derived from persistent Mllerian (synonymous with paramesonephric) epithelium islets in postembryonic life.

name: Tibialis muscle weakness
description: Muscle weakness affecting the tibialis anterior muscle.

name: Epicanthus tarsalis
description: A type of epicanthus in which a primarily upper lid fold is present.

name: Synostosis involving the 1st metatarsal
synonyms: ["Fusion involving the 1st long bone of foot"]

name: Hydromyelia
description: Dilation of central canal from incomplete fusion of the posterior columns or persistence of the primitive large canal of the embryo.

name: Ocular albinism
description: An abnormal reduction in the amount of pigmentation (reduced or absent) of the iris and retina.

name: Cone-shaped epiphyses of the 5th finger
description: A cone-shaped appearance of the epiphyses of the 5th finger of the hand, producing a 'ball-in-a-socket' appearance. The related entity 'angel-shaped' epiphysis refers to a pronounced cone-shaped epiphysis in combination with a pseudoepiphysis at the distal end of a phalanx.
synonyms: ["Cone-shaped end part of the little finger bones","Cone-shaped end part of the pinkie finger bones","Cone-shaped end part of the pinky finger bones"]

name: Renal tubular epithelial necrosis
description: Coagulative necrosis of tubular epithelial cells, defined as cells with increased cytoplasmic eosinophilia and nucleus that has a condensed chromatin pattern with fuzzy nuclear contour or has barely visible nuclear basophilic staining. The extent of cortical tubular necrosis is scoredsemiquantitatively as none, mild (less than 25% tubules with necrosis), moderate (25-50 percent), and severe (over 50%).

name: Talipes valgus
description: Outward turning of the heel, resulting in clubfoot with the person walking on the inner part of the foot.

name: Left aortic arch with retroesophageal right subclavian artery
description: Aortic arch crosses the left mainstem bronchus. The first branch is the right carotid artery, the second branch is the left carotid artery, the third branch is the subclavian artery, the fourth branch is the right subclavian artery arising from the posteromedial aspect of the distal aortic arch and continuing posterior to the esophagus to the right hand side of the body.

name: obsolete Cataracts develop in second or third decade
Stiff tongue
description: Increased rigidity and reduced mobility of the tongue.

name: 4-hydroxyphenylacetic aciduria
description: Increased concentration of 4-hydroxyphenylacetic acid in the urine.

name: Uveitis
description: Inflammation of one or all portions of the uveal tract.

name: Stippling of the epiphyses of the 5th finger
description: The presence of abnormal punctate (speckled, dot-like) calcifications in the epiphyses of the 5th finger.
synonyms: ["Speckled calcifications in end part of little finger bone","Speckled calcifications in end part of pinkie finger bone","Speckled calcifications in end part of pinky finger bone"]

name: Reticulonodular pattern on pulmonary HRCT
description: Co-occurrence of reticular and micronodular patterns on pulmonary high-resolution computed tomography.

name: Abnormal circulating luteinizing hormone concentration
description: An anomaly of the circulating level of luteinizing hormone (LH).
synonyms: ["Abnormal circulating luteinizing hormone level","Abnormal luteinizing hormone level","Increased circulating lutropin"]

name: Intermittent thrombocytopenia
description: Reduced platelet count that occurs sporadically, i.e., it comes and goes.

name: Archibald's sign
description: Shortening of the fourth and fifth metacarpals when the fist is clenched.

name: Hypoglutamatemia
description: A decreased amount of glutamate in the blood.
synonyms: ["Decreased blood glutamate concentrations","Low blood glutamate levels"]

name: Bilateral cleft palate
description: Nonmidline cleft palate on the left and right sides.

name: Increased circulating troponin T concentration
description: An increased concentration of tropnin T in the blood, which is a cardiac regulatory protein that controls the calcium mediated interaction between actin and myosin. Raised cardiac troponin concentrations are now accepted as the standard biochemical marker for the diagnosis of myocardial infarction.

name: Infantile sensorineural hearing impairment
description: A form of sensorineural hearing impairment with infantile onset.

name: Granular macular appearance
description: Mottled (spotted or blotched with different shades) pigmentary abnormality of the macula lutea.

name: Transient hearing impairment
description: Hearing loss that occurs acutely and resolves completely.

name: Absent right sided atrioventricular connection
description: A defect where there is no connection between the right atrium and right ventricle.

name: Reduced response to gonadotropin-releasing hormone stimulation test
description: Failure of the gonadotropin-releasing hormone (GnRH) stimulation test to induce an appropriate increased in luteinizing hormone (LH), follicle-stimulating hormone (FSH) levels.

name: Increased corneal thickness
description: A increased anteroposterior thickness of the cornea.

name: Lipogranulomatosis
description: Yellow nodules of lipoid material are deposited in the skin and mucosae. This gives rise to granulomatous reactions.

name: Abnormal circulating arginine concentration
description: Any deviation from the normal concentration of arginine in the blood circulation.

name: Hypoplastic fifth toenail
description: Underdeveloped nails of the fifth toes.

name: Preeclampsia
description: Pregnancy-induced hypertension in association with significant amounts of protein in the urine.

name: Retinal vasculitis
description: Inflammation of retinal blood vessels as manifested by perivascular sheathing or cuffing, vascular leakage and/or occlusion.

name: Extra concha fold
description: Folds or ridges within the concha that are distinct from the crus helix.

name: Cutaneous amyloidosis
description: The presence of amyloid deposition in the superficial dermis.

name: Short sternum
description: Decreased inferosuperior length of the sternum.

name: Abnormal amyloid beta 40 peptide CSF concentration
description: Any deviation from the normal concentration of amyloid beta 42 peptide in the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF). Amyloid beta is a peptide of 36-43 amino acids that is processed from the Amyloid precursor protein. ABeta40, which is 40 amino acids in length, is the shorter form.

name: Bowel urgency
description: A sudden, irresistible need to have a bowel movement.

name: Malaise
description: A feeling of general discomfort, weakness, or lack of health.

name: Pulmonary tuberculosis
description: A lung infection by Mycobacterium tuberculosis a slightly curved non-motile, aerobic, non-capsulated and non-spore forming strains of mycobacteria.

name: Aplasia of the abdominal wall musculature
description: Absence of the abdominal musculature.

name: Neoplasm of the skeletal system
description: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the skeleton.

name: Absent nares
description: The nostrils (the paired channels of the nose) are not present.

name: Deep-set nails
description: Deeply placed nails.

name: Abnormal renal morphology
description: Any structural anomaly of the kidney.
synonyms: ["HP:0000792","HP:0004726","HP:0004735","HP:0008712","Abnormal kidney morphology","Abnormally shaped kidney","Kidney malformation","Kidney structure issue","Renal malformation","Structural anomalies of the renal tract","Structural kidney abnormalities","Structural renal anomalies"]

name: Frontal release signs
description: Primitive reflexes traditionally held to be a sign of disorders that affect the frontal lobes.

name: Glomerulonephritis
description: Inflammation of the renal glomeruli.

name: Fractured proximal phalanx of pedal digit 1
description: A partial or complete breakage of the proximal phalanx of pedal digit 1.

name: Cortical myoclonus
description: Cortical myoclonus mainly affects the distal upper limbs and face, which reflects the largest cortical representations of these body areas. It is often focal, but may be multifocal, bilateral or generalized, as a consequence of intracortical and transcallosal spreading of abnormal activity. It typically occurs on voluntary action and may affect speech and gait. Cortical myoclonic jerks are stimulus sensitive, typically to touch, but sensitivity to visual stimuli is also described. Most patients with cortical myoclonus have both positive myoclonus and NM, occurring either independently or together as a complex of the two kinds of myoclonus. If cortical myoclonus is prolonged and lasts for hours, days or weeks, it is called epilepsia partials continua and is considered to be a rare form of focal epileptic status. Focal cortical myoclonus almost always points to an underlining lesion of the sensori-motor cortex, which produces hyperexcitability (e.g. vascular, inflammatory or neoplastic).

name: Postaxial polysyndactyly of foot
description: Combined syndactyly and polydactyly of the foot on the lateral side (i.e., on the side of the little toe).

name: Increased disialylated core 1 O-glycan level
description: An abnormal increase in the concentration of disialylated core 1 O-glycans on glycoproteins.

name: Anti-RNA-polymerase-III-autoantibody positivity
description: The presence of autoantibodies in the serum that react to RNA-polymerase III.

name: Slender metacarpals
description: Decreased width of the metacarpal bones (that is, reduced diameter).

name: Triggered by sleep deprivation
description: Applies to a sign or symptom that is provoked or brought about by a lack of sufficient sleep.
synonyms: ["Sleep deprivation triggered symptoms","Triggered by sleep deprivation"]

name: Neoplasm of head and neck
description: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the head and neck region with origin in the lip, oral cavity, nasal cavity, paranasal sinuses, pharynx, or larynx.
synonyms: ["Head and neck tumor","Head and neck tumour"]

name: Heterotropia
description: Manifest deviation of the visual axes not controlled by fusion.

name: Skin appendage neoplasm
description: A benign or malignant neoplasm that arises from the hair follicles, sebaceous glands, or sweat glands.
synonyms: ["Skin adnexal neoplasm","Skin adnexal tumor","Skin adnexal tumour"]

name: Agenesis of mandibular central incisor
description: Agenesis of lower secondary incisor or lower primary incisor.
synonyms: ["Failure of development of mandibular central incisor"]

name: Feather allergy
description: Hypersensitivity in form of an adverse immune reaction against feathers.
synonyms: ["Allergy to feathers","Feather allergy","IgE-mediated feather allergy","Immunoglobulin E-mediated feather allergy"]

name: Decreased distal sensory nerve action potential
description: A reduction in the amplitude of sensory nerve action potential in distal nerve segments. This feature is measured by nerve conduction studies.

name: Stippling of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 5th toe
description: The presence of abnormal punctate (speckled, dot-like) calcifications in the epiphyses of the proximal phalanx of the 5th toe.
synonyms: ["Speckled calcifications in the end part of the innermost bone of the little toe","Speckled calcifications in the end part of the innermost bone of the pinkie toe","Speckled calcifications in the end part of the innermost bone of the pinky toe"]

name: Displaced tracheal bronchus
description: Accessory bronchus originating from trachea replacing one of the segmental branches of the anatomically normal upper lobe bronchus.

name: Trichilemmoma
description: A benign tumour originating from the outer root sheath of the hair follicle.

name: Curved phalanges of the 5th finger
description: Curved phalanges of the 5th (little) finger.
synonyms: ["Curved little finger bone","Curved pinkie finger bone","Curved pinky finger bone"]

name: Eosinophilic microabscess formation in the esophagus
description: The formation of small localized collection of eosinophiles (an eosinophilic microabscess) in the esophagus. Usually clusters of greater than or equal to 4 eosinophils are seen, that appear as exudates or white spots or white plaques.
synonyms: ["Eosinophilic micro-abscess formation in the esophagus","Eosinophilic micro-abscess formation in the oesophagus","Eosinophilic microabscess formation in the oesophagus"]

name: Elevated systolic blood pressure
description: Abnormal increase in systolic blood pressure.

name: Increased libido
description: Elevated sexual desire.

name: Pleural cyst
description: A closed sac-like structure originating from the pleura that contains a liquid, gaseous, or semisolid substance.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the distal phalanx of the 4th toe
synonyms: ["Absent/small outermost bone of 4th toe","Absent/underdeveloped outermost bone of 4th toe"]

name: Anti-signal recognition particle antibody positivity
description: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against anti-signal recognition particle.

name: Abnormal circulating IgG level
description: An abnormal deviation from normal levels of IgG immunoglobulin in blood.

name: Arcuate artery lumen cholesterol emboli
description: Needle-like or slit-like clefts within the interior space of arcuate arteries of the kidney. Cholesterol emboli are visualized as clear spaces (cholesterol clefts) where the cholesterol crystals have been dissolved by routine processing. Acute lesions can be accompanied by inflammation and fibrin.

name: Increased sialylated N-glycan level
description: An abnormal increase in the concentration of sialylated N-glycans on glycoproteins.
synonyms: ["Increased concentration of sialylated N-glycans on glycoproteins"]

name: Gingival hyperkeratosis
description: Hyperkeratosis of the gingiva.

name: Bracket epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 3rd toe
synonyms: ["Bracket shaped end part of the outermost bone of the 3rd toe"]

name: Pituitary adenoma
description: A benign epithelial tumor derived from intrinsic cells of the adenohypophysis (anterior pituitary).
synonyms: ["Noncancerous tumor in pituitary gland","Noncancerous tumour in pituitary gland","Pituitary gland adenoma"]

name: Fingernail dysplasia
description: An abnormality of the development of the fingernails.

name: Multifocal splenic abscess
description: Multiple abscess lesions in the spleen.

name: Proximal/middle symphalangism of 2nd toe
description: Bony fusion of the middle and proximal phalanges of the 2nd toe.
synonyms: ["HP:0100479","Fused middle and innermost bones of 2nd toe","Symphalangism of the middle and proximal phalanges of the 2nd toe"]

name: Joint hyperflexibility
description: Increased mobility and flexibility in the joint due to the tension in tissues such as ligaments and muscles.
synonyms: ["Joints move beyond expected range of motion"]

name: Sputum eosinophilia
description: An increased proportion of eosinophils in sputum in the differentiated cell count.

name: Abnormality of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 4th toe
synonyms: ["Abnormality of the end part of the innermost bone of the 4th toe"]

name: Abnormality of lateral rectus extra-ocular muscle
description: An abnormality of a lateral rectus extra-ocular muscle.

name: Nail dystrophy
description: Onychodystrophy (nail dystrophy) refers to nail changes apart from changes of the color (nail dyschromia) and involves partial or complete disruption of the various keratinous layers of the nail plate.

name: Recurrent abscess formation
description: An increased susceptibility to abscess formation, as manifested by a medical history of recurrent abscesses.

name: C1-C2 subluxation
description: A partial dislocation of the atlantoaxial joints.

name: Lenticonus
description: A conical projection of the anterior or posterior surface of the lens, occurring as a developmental anomaly.

name: Displacement of the urethral meatus
description: A displacement of the external urethral orifice from its normal position (in males normally placed at the tip of glans penis, in females normally placed about 2.5 cm behind the glans clitoridis and immediately in front of that of the vagina).
synonyms: ["Displacement of the external urethral orifice","Displacement of the male external urethral orifice"]

name: Nail bed telangiectasia
description: Telangiectases in the area of the nails.

name: Severe expressive language delay
description: A severe delay in the acquisition of the ability to use language to communicate needs, wishes, or thoughts.

name: Congenital hypothyroidism
description: A type of hypothyroidism with congenital onset.

name: Focal aware sensory seizure with cephalic sensation
description: A seizure characterized by a sensation in the head such as light-headedness or headache.

name: Absent epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 5th toe
synonyms: ["Absent end part of the innermost bone of the little toe","Absent end part of the innermost bone of the pinkie toe","Absent end part of the innermost bone of the pinky toe"]

name: Tibialis atrophy
description: Atrophy of the tibialis muscle.

name: Dilatation of the bladder
description: The presence of a dilated urinary bladder.

name: Hypertrophy of the urinary bladder
description: Abnormal enlargement of the urinary bladder.

name: Insulin receptor antibody positivity
description: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against the insulin receptor.

name: Increased level of 3-hydroxy-3-methylglutaric acid in urine
description: An increase in the level of 3-hydroxy-3-methylglutaric acid in the urine.

name: Spinocerebellar tract disease in lower limbs
Structural foot deformity
description: A foot deformity resulting due to an abnormality affecting the bones of the foot (as well as muscle and soft tissue). In contrast if only the muscle and soft tissue are affected the term positional foot deformity applies.

name: Anuria
description: Absence of urine, clinically classified as below 50ml/day.

name: Abnormal ocular adnexa physiology
description: A functional anomaly of the adjacent structures (i.e., adnexa) of the eye, defined as the lacrimal apparatus, the extraocular muscles and the eyelids, eyelashes, eyebrows and the conjunctiva.

name: Abnormal morphology of the proximal phalanx of the 4th toe
Thickened elastic fibers in the dermis
description: An increase of the diameter of elastic fibers in the dermis.

name: Complete duplication of hallux phalanx
description: Complete duplication of one or more phalanx of big toe.
synonyms: ["Complete duplication of big toe bones","Complete duplication of the phalanges of the hallux"]

name: Nocturnal seizures
description: Seizures that occur while the affected individual is sleeping.

name: Pilomatrixoma
description: Pilomatricoma is an asymptomatic slowly growing benign cutaneous tumor, differentiating towards the hair matrix of the hair follicle. It is covered by normal or hyperemic skin, and usually varies in size from 0.5 to 3 cm.

name: Abnormal 4th finger morphology
synonyms: ["Abnormality of the 4th finger","Abnormality of the ring finger"]

name: Bartholin gland carcinoma
description: A cancer arising in a cell of the Bartholin gland, a racemose gland located slightly posterior to the opening of the vagina.

name: Polyneuropathy
description: A generalized disorder of peripheral nerves.

name: Palmoplantar hyperkeratosis
description: Abnormal thickening of the skin localized to the palm of the hand and the sole of the foot.
synonyms: ["Hyperkeratosis of palms and soles","Hyperkeratosis of the palms and soles","Palmoplantar keratoses","Palmoplantar keratosis","Thick palms and soles","Thickened palms and soles","Thickening of the outer layer of the skin of the palms and soles"]

name: Levotransposition of the great arteries
description: A type of transposition of the great arteries (TGA) in which aorta is in front of and primarily to the left of the pulmonary artery.

name: Type II atherosclerotic lesion
description: Type II atherosclerotic lesions include the fatty streak lesion, the first grossly visible lesion, and are characterized by layers of macrophage foam cells and lipid droplets within intimal smooth muscle cells and minimal coarse-grained particles and heterogeneous droplets of extracellular lipid.

name: Post-vaccination rotavirus infection
description: Infection with live attenuated rotavirus vaccine following vaccination.

name: Absent outer dynein arms
description: Absence of the outer dynein arms of respiratory motile cilia, which normally are situated outside of the peripheral microtubules of motile cilia. This feature is usually appreciated by electron microscopy.

name: Abnormal tubular basement membrane morphology
description: Abnormal structure of the basement membrane of the renal tubulus.

name: Temporal pattern
description: The speed at which disease manifestations appear and develop.

name: Multiple mucosal neuromas
description: Multiple painful, dome-shaped, translucent pink to skin-colored papules on oral mucosa. Histologically, the lesions may demonstrate dermal proliferation of well-demarcated nerve bundles associated with abundant mucin and surrounded by a distinct perineural sheath.

name: Myelitis
description: Inflammation of the spinal cord.

name: Abnormality of neutrophil morphology in CSF
description: An abnormal form or size of neutrophils in the cerebrospinal fluid.
synonyms: ["Abnormality of neutrophil morphology in cerebrospinal fluid"]

name: Amenorrhea
description: Absence of menses for an interval of time equivalent to a total of more than (or equal to) 3 previous cycles or 6 months.

name: Pulmonary edema
description: Fluid accumulation in the lungs.
synonyms: ["Excess fluid in lungs","Lung edema","Lung oedema","Pulmonary oedema","Wet lung"]

name: Lattice corneal dystrophy
description: The presence of fine, branching linear opacities in Bowman's layer in the central area that may spread to the periphery in the clinical course. The deep corneal stroma may be involved but the process does not reach Descemet's membrane. Recurrent corneal erosion may occur. Histologic examination reveals amyloid deposits in the collagen fibers of the cornea.

name: Anti-glutamic acid decarboxylase antibody positivity
description: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against glutamic acid decarboxylase.

name: Increased circulating beta-2-microglobulin level
description: Elevated concentration of beta-2-microglobulin in the blood.

name: Triangular epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 4th finger
description: A triangular appearance of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the ring finger of the hand. This epiphysis is located at the proximal end of the phalanx and is normally nearly flat.
synonyms: ["Delta-shaped epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 4th finger","Triangular end part of the outermost bone of ring finger"]

name: Increased globoside Gb3 level
description: An abnormal increase in the concentration of glycolipid globoside Gb3.

name: Cerebral cavernous malformation
description: A cerebral cavernous malformation (also known as cavernoma, cavernous angioma, cavernous hemangioma) is a collection of structurally abnormal slow-flow capillaries predominantly in the central nervous system. These are multiple mulberry-like distended caverns of dilated thin-walled capillaries without the normal intervening brain parenchymal architecture. Often, individual cavernomas are surrounded by hemosiderin representing remote oozing due to the abnormal capillaries.

name: Increased vertical cup-to-disc ratio - 1.0
description: Ratio of the height of the cup of the optic nerve head to the height of the disc is 1.0 (The normal cup-to-disc ratio is 0.3).

name: Hypoplasia of the small intestine
description: Underdevelopment of the small intestine.

name: Lumbar hypertrichosis
description: Excessive, increased hair growth located in the lumbar region.

name: Diffuse subcortical band heterotopia
description: Longitudinal bands of gray matter located deep to the cerebral cortex and separated from it by a thin layer of normal appearing white matter visible along the whole brain.

name: Abnormal basal ganglia MRI signal intensity
description: A deviation from normal signal on magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of the basal ganglia.

name: Crystalluria
description: The presence of crystals in the urine.

name: Abnormal alveolar type II pneumocyte morphology
description: Any structural abnormality of alveolar type 2 (ATII) cells.
synonyms: ["Abnormal alveolar epithelial type II cell morphology","Abnormal pulmonary type II cell morphology","Abnormal type II pneumocyte morphology"]

name: Palmoplantar cutis laxa
description: Loose, wrinkled skin of hands and feet.
synonyms: ["HP:0001016","Excessive wrinkled skin of palms and soles","Furrowed palms and soles","Increased wrinkles of palms and soles","Wrinkled palms and soles","Wrinkled skin of hands and feet"]

name: Pyropoikilocytosis
description: A form of severe hemolytic anemia characterized by erythrocyte morphology reminiscent of that seen in patients after a thermal burn.

name: Hepatoblastoma
description: A kind of neoplasm of the liver that originates from immature liver precursor cells and macroscopically is composed of tissue resembling fetal or mature liver cells or bile ducts.

name: Pancreatic squamous cell carcinoma
description: A subtype of ductal pancreatic carcinoma that is thought to originate from squamous metaplasia of pancreatic ductal epithelium.

name: Hypoplasia of fetal nasal bone
description: On prenatal ultrasound, the nasal bone is a thin echogenic line within the bridge of the fetal nose. The fetus is imaged facing the transducer with the fetal face strictly in the midline. The angle of insonation is 90 degrees, with the longitudinal axis of the nasal bone as the reference line. Calibres are placed at each end of the nasal bone. Absence of the nasal bone or measurements below 2.5th percentile are considered significant (PMID:16100637).
synonyms: ["Hypoplasia of foetal nasal bone","Underdeveloped fetal nose bone","Underdeveloped foetal nose bone"]

name: Pulmonary lymphangiectasia
description: Abnormal dilatation of the pulmonary lymphatic vessels. Lymphatic fluid in the lung is derived from normal leakage of fluid out of the blood capillaries in the lung. In pulmonary lymphangiectasia, the pulmonary lymphatics are not properly connected and become dilated with fluid.

name: Recurrent cerebral hemorrhage
description: Recurrent bleeding into the parenchyma of the brain.

name: Aplasia/hypoplasia of the humerus
description: Absence (due to failure to form) or underdevelopment of the humerus.
synonyms: ["Absent/small long bone in upper arm","Absent/underdeveloped long bone in upper arm"]

name: Long foot
description: Increased back to front length of the foot.

name: Cerebral germinoma
description: The presence of a germ cell tumor of the cerebrum.

name: Multifocal epileptiform discharges
description: An abnormality in cerebral electrical activity recorded along the scalp by electroencephalography (EEG) and being identified at multiple locations (foci).

name: EEG with spike-wave complexes (2.5-3.5 Hz)
description: The presence of complexes of spikes and waves (2.5-3.5 Hz) in electroencephalography (EEG).

name: Proximal placement of hallux
description: Proximal mislocalization of the big toe from its normal position.
synonyms: ["Proximal placement of big toe","Proximally placed halluces"]

name: Distal femoral bowing
description: A bending or abnormal curvature of the distal portion of the femur.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the capital femoral epiphysis
description: Absence or underdevelopment of the proximal epiphysis of the femur.
synonyms: ["Absent/small end part of innermost thighbone","Absent/underdeveloped end part of innermost thighbone"]

name: Partial duplication of the phalanges of the 5th finger
description: A partial duplication, depending on severity leading to a broad or bifid appearance, affecting one or more of the phalanges of the 5th finger. As opposed to a complete duplication there is still a variable degree of fusion between the duplicated bones.
synonyms: ["Partial duplication of the little finger bone","Partial duplication of the pinkie finger bone","Partial duplication of the pinky finger bone"]

name: Malabsorption
description: Impaired ability to absorb one or more nutrients from the intestine.

name: Femoral bowing
description: Bowing (abnormal curvature) of the femur.

name: Abnormality of circulating catecholamine level
description: An abnormal catecholamine concentration in the blood.

name: Absence of the reflex of the tensor tympani muscle
Aminoaciduria
description: An increased concentration of an amino acid in the urine.
synonyms: ["HP:0002903","HP:0008335","HP:0200014","High urine amino acid levels","Hyperaminoaciduria","Increased levels of animo acids in urine"]

name: Honeycomb lung
description: Honeycombing represents destroyed and fibrotic lung tissue containing numerous cystic airspaces with thick fibrous walls, representing the late stage of various lung diseases, with complete loss of acinar architecture. The cysts range in size from a few millimeters to several centimeters in diameter, have variable wall thickness, and are lined by metaplastic bronchiolar epithelium. On chest radiographs, honeycombing appears as closely approximated ring shadows, typically 3-10 mm in diameter with walls 1-3 mm in thickness, that resemble a honeycomb; the finding implies end-stage lung disease. On CT scans, the appearance is of clustered cystic air spaces, typically of comparable diameters on the order of 3-10 mm but occasionally as large as 2.5 cm. Honeycombing is usually subpleural and is characterized by well-defined walls. It is a CT feature of established pulmonary fibrosis. Because honeycombing is often considered specific for pulmonary fibrosis and is an important criterion in the diagnosis of usual interstitial pneumonia, the term should be used with care, as it may directly impact patient care.

name: Motor regression
description: Loss of previously achieved motor skills, as manifested by loss of developmental motor milestones.

name: EEG with frontal sharp slow waves
description: EEG with sharp slow waves in the frontal region. Sharp slow waves are focal sharp transient waves of a duration between 80 and 200 msec followed by a slow wave.

name: Hyperlipidemia
description: An elevated lipid concentration in the blood.

name: Decreased fucosylation of O-linked protein glycosylation
description: A reduction of the addition of fucose sugar units to O-linked glycans.

name: Small foramen magnum
description: An abnormal narrowing of the foramen magnum.
synonyms: ["HP:0005468","Foramen magnum stenosis","Little foramen magnum","Narrow foramen magnum"]

name: Accelerated atherosclerosis
description: Atherosclerosis which occurs in a person with certain risk factors (e.g., SLE, diabetes, smoking, hypertension, hypercholesterolaemia, family history of early heart disease) at an earlier age than would occur in another person without those risk factors.

name: Abnormality of the spinocerebellar tracts
description: An abnormality of the spinocerebellar tracts, a set of axonal fibers originating in the spinal cord and terminating in the ipsilateral cerebellum. The spinocerebellar tract convey information to the cerebellum about limb and joint position (proprioception). They comprise the ventral spinocerebellar tract, the anterior spinocerebellar tract, and the posterior spinocerebellar tract.

name: Elevated circulating growth hormone concentration
description: Acromegaly is a condition resulting from overproduction of growth hormone by the pituitary gland in persons with closed epiphyses, and consists chiefly in the enlargement of the distal parts of the body. The circumference of the skull increases, the nose becomes broad, the tongue becomes enlarged, the facial features become coarsened, the mandible grows excessively, and the teeth become separated. The fingers and toes grow chiefly in thickness.
synonyms: ["HP:0008856","Elevated circulating somatotropin concentration","Growth hormone excess","Somatotropin excess"]

name: Abnormality of lateral pterygoid muscle
description: An abnormality of a lateral pterygoid muscle.

name: Barking cough
description: A cough with a characteristic sound that has been compared to a seal's bark.

name: Absent pulse
description: The pulsation of an artery where the pulse is taken (e.g. the radial artery at the wrist) cannot be detected on physical examination.

name: Neoplasm of the gallbladder
description: The presence of a neoplasm of the gallbladder.

name: Agonadism
description: Absence of sex glands (gonads are the organs that produce gametes; testis in males and ovary in females).

name: Abnormal brain lactate level by MRS
description: A deviation from normal of the level of lactate in the brain identified by magnetic resonance spectroscopy (MRS).
synonyms: ["Abnormal lactate level by magnetic resonance spectroscopy"]

name: Abnormal circulating aromatic amino acid concentration
description: Any deviation from the normal concentration of a aromatic amino acid in the blood circulation.
synonyms: ["Abnormality of aromatic amino acid family metabolism"]

name: Cerebellar atrophy
description: Cerebellar atrophy is defined as a cerebellum with initially normal structures, in a posterior fossa with normal size, which displays enlarged fissures (interfolial spaces) in comparison to the foliae secondary to loss of tissue. Cerebellar atrophy implies irreversible loss of tissue and result from an ongoing progressive disease until a final stage is reached or a single injury, e.g. an intoxication or infectious event.

name: Pleural rub
description: An abnormal breath sound that is nonmusical, short and explosive. It is grating, rubbing, creaky, or leathery in character and present in both phases of respiration. Typically the expiratory component mirrors the inspiratory component. It occurs due to inflamed pleural surface rubbing each other during breathing. Clinically, it is important to differentiate it from crackles

name: Sandal gap
description: A widely spaced gap between the first toe (the great toe) and the second toe.
synonyms: ["Gap between 1st and 2nd toes","Gap between first and second toe","Increased space between first and second toes","Sandal gap between first and second toes","Space between great toe and second toe","Wide space between 1st, 2nd toes","Wide space between first and second toes","Wide-spaced big toe","Widely spaced 1st-2nd toes","Widely spaced first and second toes","Widened gap 1st-2nd toes","Widened gap first and second toe"]

name: Carotid sinus syncope
description: An exaggerated response to carotid sinus baroreceptor stimulation resulting in syncope from transient diminished cerebral perfusion.

name: Hemangioma of the lip
description: A vascular malformation located in the lip that is related to vascular endothelial cell hyperplasia.

name: Tetralogy of Fallot with pulmonary stenosis
