description: The commonest form of tetralogy of Fallot characterized by pulmonary stenosis, overriding aorta, ventricular septum defect, and right ventricular hypertrophy, without pulmonary atresia, absent pulmonary valve, atrioventricular canal defect or absent subarterial conus.

name: Cortical radial artery lymphocyte hypercellularity
description: A type of cortical radial artery endoarterial leukocyte hypercellularity due to the presence of increased number of lymphocytes in the lumen of cortical radial arteries.
synonyms: ["Endoarterial hypercellularity within interlobular artery consisting of lymphocytes"]

name: Fragmentation of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb
description: Epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb having multiple bony fragments.
synonyms: ["Fragmentation of end part thumb outermost long bone"]

name: Subperiosteal bone formation
description: The formation of new bone along the cortex and underneath the periosteum of a bone.

name: Axial myopia
description: A form of myopia related to an axial length above the norm and too long for the refractive power of the whole optical system of the eye.

name: Abnormal morphology of the cortex of the humerus
description: Any abnormality affecting the cortex of the humerus.

name: Inferior chorioretinal coloboma
description: Absence of a region of the retina, retinal pigment epithelium, and choroid at the lower part of the fundus.

name: Abnormal timing of flash visual evoked potentials
Abnormal hepatic glycogen storage
description: Change in normal glycogen storage content.

name: Perineal hemangioma
description: Hemangioma, a benign tumor of the vascular endothelial cells, located in the perineal region, i.e., the region between the anus and the genitals.

name: Chronic decreased circulating IgD
description: A lasting reduction beneath the normal level of total immunoglobulin D (IgD) in the blood.

name: Branch retinal artery occlusion
description: Blockage of a branch of the retinal artery. This can cause loss of a section of visual field.

name: Interstitial cardiac fibrosis
description: A type of myocardial fibrosis characterized by excessive diffuse collagen accumulation concentrated in interstitial spaces.

name: Abdominal mass
description: An abnormal enlargement or swelling in the abdomen.

name: Thyroid hyperplasia
description: Hyperplasia of the thyroid gland.

name: Neoplasm of the heart
description: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the heart.

name: Progressive distal muscular atrophy
description: Progressive muscular atrophy affecting muscles in the distal portions of the extremities.

name: Cardiomyocyte inclusion bodies
description: Nuclear or cytoplasmic aggregates of stainable substances within cardiomyocytes.

name: Increased upper to lower segment ratio
description: Elevated ratio between the upper and the lower segment of the body, where the lower segment is defined as the length between the top of pubic symphysis to floor, and the upper segment is defined as the top of head to top of pubic symphysis.

name: Elevated circulating dodecanoylcarnitine concentration
description: Increased concentration of dodecanoylcarnitine in the blood circulation.
synonyms: ["Elevated circulating O-dodecanoylcarnitine concentration","Elevated plasma dodecanoylcarnitine, C12:0"]

name: Multidrug-resistant nephrotic syndrome
description: A form of nephrotic syndrome that does not respond to any immunosuppresive treatment.

name: Suck reflex
description: A type of primitive reflex that is elicited by lightly touching or tapping on the lips with an object such as a tongue blade, reflex hammer, or the examiner's finger. At times the reflex is obtained merely by approaching the lips with an object. A positive suck reflex consists of sucking movements by the lips when they are stroked or touched.

name: Intermittent jaundice
description: Jaundice that is sometimes present, sometimes not.
synonyms: ["Intermittent icterus","Intermittent yellow skin","Intermittent yellowing of skin"]

name: Polypoidal choroidal vasculopathy
description: The presence of aneurysmal polypoidal lesions in the choroidal vasculature. The aneurysmal dilatations, also known as polyps, may be found at subfoveal, juxtafoveal, extrafoveal, peripapillary or even peripheral regions. These polypoidal dilatations may be visible as reddish-orange subretinal nodules during ophthalmoscopic examination. The polypoidal lesions are best detected on indocyanine green angiography (ICGA) and might be associated with a branching vascular network (BVN) of neovascularization.

name: Osteolytic defects of the middle phalanx of the 5th finger
description: Dissolution or degeneration of bone tissue of the middle phalanx of the 5th finger.

name: Type II transferrin isoform profile
description: Abnormal transferrin isoform profile consistent with a type II congenital disorder of glycosylation.
synonyms: ["Abnormal isoelectric focusing of serum transferrin, type II pattern","Isoelectric focusing of serum transferrin consistent with CDG type II","Type 2 transferrin isoform profile"]

name: Short ear
description: Median longitudinal ear length less than two SD above the mean determined by the maximal distance from the superior aspect to the inferior aspect of the external ear.

name: obsolete Corticospinal tract disease in lower limbs
Type I transferrin isoform profile
description: Abnormal transferrin isoform profile consistent with a type I congenital disorder of glycosylation. In the traditional nomenclature for congenital disorders of glycosylation, absence of entire glycans was designated type I, and loss of one or more monosaccharides as type II.
synonyms: ["Abnormal isoelectric focusing of serum transferrin, type I pattern","Isoelectric focusing of serum transferrin consistent with CDG type I","Type 1 transferrin isoform profile"]

name: Rootless teeth
synonyms: ["Absence of tooth root","Agenesis of tooth root","Aplasia of tooth root","Missing tooth root","Rootless teeth","Teeth without roots"]

name: Enlarged epiphyses of the proximal phalanges of the hand
synonyms: ["Enlarged end part of the innermost hand bones"]

name: Abnormality of levator labii superioris alaeque nasi muscle
description: An abnormality of the levator labii superioris alaeque nasi muscle.

name: Increased LH response to gonadotropin-releasing hormone stimulation test
description: An abnormally high amount of luteinizing hormone (LH) is released upon gonadotropin-releasing hormone stimulation test.

name: Abnormality of the palatine bone
description: An abnormality of the palatine bone.

name: Sparse eyelashes
description: Decreased density/number of eyelashes.
synonyms: ["HP:0002284","HP:0004519","HP:0004531","HP:0004555","HP:0004777","HP:0007853","Hypotrichosis of eyelashes","Partial absence of eyelashes","Scant eyelashes","Scanty eyelashes","Sparse eyelashes","Thin eyelashes"]

name: Abnormality of the distal phalanx of the 4th finger
synonyms: ["Abnormality of the outermost bone of ring finger"]

name: Impaired ability to dress oneself
description: This applies to an individual who needs help with dressing or needs to be completely dressed.

name: Symphalangism of middle phalanx of 5th finger
description: Fusion of the middle phalanx of the 5th finger with another bone.
synonyms: ["Fused middle bones of little finger","Fused middle bones of pinkie finger","Fused middle bones of pinky finger"]

name: Bullet-shaped distal toe phalanx
description: An abnormal morphology of one or more distal phalanges of the toes, with a short and wide phalanx that tapers distally. Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction.
synonyms: ["Bullet-shaped distal phalanges of the toes","Bullet-shaped outermost bone of the toe"]

name: Lacunar stroke
description: A stroke related to a small infarct (2-20 mm in diameter) in the deep cerebral white matter, basal ganglia, or pons, that is presumed to result from the occlusion of a single small perforating artery supplying the subcortical areas of the brain.

name: Enlarged epiphyses of the 4th toe
synonyms: ["Enlarged end part of the 4th toe bone"]

name: Abnormal pulmonary vein morphology
description: An abnormality of the structure of the pulmonary veins.

name: Supraventricular tachycardia with a manifest accessory pathway on the right free wall
Mitochondrial myopathy
description: A type of myopathy associated with mitochondrial disease and characterized by findings on biopsy such as ragged red muscle fibers.

name: Irregular iliac crest
description: Irregularity of the iliac crest, which is the superior border of the wing of the ilium.

name: Adult onset
description: Onset of disease manifestations in adulthood, defined here as at the age of 16 years or later.
synonyms: ["HP:0003585","HP:0003598","HP:0003627","HP:0003662","HP:0003669","Onset in adulthood","Onset in early adulthood","Symptoms begin in adulthood"]

name: Increased circulating A-type natriuretic peptide level
description: A measurable elevation in circulating levels of Atrial natriuretic peptide hormone, a protein which plays an important role in the regulation of body fluid volume and blood pressure.

name: Platystencephaly
description: Extreme width of the skull in the occipital region, with anterior narrowing and prognathism.

name: Patchy sclerosis of hallux phalanx
description: Patchy (irregular) increase in bone density of one or more phalanges of the big toe. This can take on many forms depending on severity and distribution as can be seen on x-rays.
synonyms: ["Patchy sclerosis of the phalanges of the hallux","Uneven increase in bone density in big toe bone"]

name: Portal hypertension
description: Increased pressure in the portal vein.

name: Broad ischia
description: Increased width of the ischium, which forms the lower and back part of the hip bone.

name: Abnormal hypothalamus morphology
description: Any structural anomaly of the hypothalamus.
synonyms: ["HP:0002443","Abnormal shape of hypothalamus","Abnormality of hypothalamus morphology","Abnormality of the hypothalamus"]

name: Anti-cytosolic-5-nucleotidase-1A antibody positivity
description: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against cytosolic-5-nucleotidase-1A (cN1A).

name: Elevated circulating ribitol concentration
description: An increase above the normal concentration of ribitol in the blood.

name: Biliary tract abnormality
description: An abnormality of the biliary tree.

name: Nystagmus-induced head nodding
description: Head movements associated with nystagmus, that may represent an attempt to compensate for the involuntary eye movements and to improve vision.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia involving the femoral head and neck
synonyms: ["Absent/small head and neck of thighbone","Absent/underdeveloped head and neck of thighbone"]

name: Irregular myelin loops
description: Presence of irregular redundant loops of focally folded myelin in a peripheral nerve.

name: Limb duplication
description: Congenital duplication of all or part of a limb.

name: Pruritis on abdomen
description: Pruritus is an itch or a sensation that makes a person want to scratch. This term refers to an abnormally increased sensation of itching over the skin of the abdomen.

name: Fetal ascites
description: Accumulation of fluid in the peritoneal cavity during the fetal period.

name: Bracket epiphyses of the toes
synonyms: ["Bracket shaped end part of the toe bones"]

name: Laryngeal hemangioma
description: A hemangioma, a benign tumor of the vascular endothelial cells, that is located in the glottic or supraglottic regions.

name: Axial muscle stiffness
description: Stiffness (a condition in which muscles cannot be moved quickly without accompanying pain or spasm) of the axial musculature.

name: Tetraamelia
description: Amelia of all four limbs.

name: Cutaneous syndactyly of toes
description: A soft tissue continuity in the anteroposterior axis between adjacent foot digits that involves at least half of the proximodistal length of one of the two involved digits; or, a soft tissue continuity in the A/P axis between two digits of the foot that does not meet the prior objective criteria.
synonyms: ["HP:0001990","HP:0004707","HP:0010555","Cutaneous syndactyly of feet","soft tissue syndactyly of toes","Webbed skin of toes"]

name: Patchy sclerosis of 2nd toe phalanx
description: Patchy (irregular) increase in bone density of one or more of the phalanges of the second toe. This can take on many forms depending on severity and distribution as can be seen on x-rays.
synonyms: ["Patchy sclerosis of the phalanges of the 2nd toe","Uneven increase in bone density in 2nd toe bone"]

name: Tubulonodular pericallosal lipoma
description: A type of pericallosal lipoma with a rounded or lobular appearance and a diameter that is usually above 2 cm. They are anteriorly situated and are associated with extensive callosal and often fronto-facial anomalies. A tubulonodular pericallosal lipoma can extend into the choroid plexus or lateral ventricles.

name: Polyhydramnios
description: The presence of excess amniotic fluid in the uterus during pregnancy.

name: EEG with centrotemporal epileptiform discharges
description: Focal epileptiform EEG discharges recorded in the centrotemporal region.

name: Tonic seizure
description: A tonic seizure is a type of motor seizure characterised by unilateral or bilateral limb stiffening or elevation, often with neck stiffening.

name: Fibrofolliculoma
description: Fibrofolliculoma is a clinically asymptomatic, 2-4 mm, skin-colored, dome-shaped smooth papule. It usually arises in the form of multiple lesions in adults in different areas such as the scalp, forehead, face, and neck. According to histology, the lesion is a fibrotic hamartoma characterized by infundibular epithelial proliferation and perifollicular fibrous proliferation.

name: Antecubital pterygium
description: Pterygium affecting the elbow. This is a cutaneous web that can lead to severe flexion contracture of the elbow joint. Antecubital pterygium can be unilateral, bilateral, symmetric, or asysmmetric.

name: Abnormal nipple morphology
description: An abnormality of the nipple.

name: Increased mid-arm muscle circumference
description: Elevation of the midupper arm circumference midway between the acromion and olecranon processes of the ulna with the use of a steel or fiberglass tape. This measure is a proxy for the muscle mass of the upper arm and can be used as a part of the assessment of nutritional status in children.

name: Absent epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 3rd toe
synonyms: ["Absent end part of the innermost bone of the 3rd toe"]

name: Increased circulating IgG4 level
description: An abnormally increased concentration of the IgG4 subtype in the blood circulation.

name: Hypoplastic dermoepidermal hemidesmosomes
description: Underdeveloped hemidesmosomes at the dermoepidermal junction. Hemidesmosomes are the specialized junctional complexes, that contribute to the attachment of epithelial cells to the underlying basement membrane in stratified and other complex epithelia, such as the skin.

name: Preaxial foot polydactyly
description: Duplication of all or part of the first ray.
synonyms: ["HP:0009607","HP:0010050","Partial/complete duplication of the phalanges of the big toe","Polydactyly affecting the hallux","Preaxial hallucal polydactyly","Preaxial polydactyly of feet","Preaxial polydactyly of foot","Preaxial polydactyly of the feet","Preaxial polydactyly, feet"]

name: Elevated total serum tryptase
description: An abnormally elevated concentration of total tryptase (alpha and beta tryptase) in the blood circulation.

name: obsolete Abnormal ossification of hand bones
Keratitis
description: Inflammation of the cornea.

name: Low-set, posteriorly rotated ears
description: Ears that are low-set (HP:0000369) and posteriorly rotated (HP:0000358).

name: Intrapartum fever
description: The occurence of maternal fever during labor.
synonyms: ["Maternal fever during labor","Maternal fever during labour"]

name: Palmoplantar hypohidrosis
description: Decreased sweating on the palms and soles.

name: Abnormal dermatoglyphics
description: An abnormality of dermatoglyphs (fingerprints), which are present on fingers, palms, toes, and soles.

name: Abnormality of mentalis muscle
description: An abnormality of a mentalis muscle.

name: obsolete Chronic obstructive airway disease from birth
Abnormality of the epiphyses of the 2nd toe
synonyms: ["Abnormality of the end part of the 2nd toe bone"]

name: Balanced double aortic arch
description: A type of double aortic arch in which the two branches are of equal size. In most cases of double aortic arch, the right aortic arch is larger and located higher than the left aortic arch.

name: Cauliflower deformity of dermal collagen fibrils
description: An anomaly of collagen fibers of the skin that is said to resemble a cauliflower and can be appreciated by electron microscopy.

name: Hamartoma
description: A disordered proliferation of mature tissues that is native to the site of origin, e.g., exostoses, nevi and soft tissue hamartomas. Although most hamartomas are benign, some histologic subtypes, e.g., neuromuscular hamartoma, may proliferate aggressively such as mesenchymal cystic hamartoma, Sclerosing epithelial hamartoma, Sclerosing metanephric hamartoma.

name: Ivory epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger
description: Sclerosis of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the little finger, leading to an increased degree of radiopacity (white or ivory appearance) in X-rays.
synonyms: ["HP:0004229","Increased bone density of end part of the outermost little finger bone","Increased bone density of end part of the outermost pinkie finger bone","Increased bone density of end part of the outermost pinky finger bone","Ivory epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the little finger","Ivory epiphysis of the terminal phalanx of the little finger"]

name: Insulin insensitivity
description: Decreased sensitivity toward insulin.

name: Focal aware seizure
description: A type of focal-onset seizure in which awareness is preserved. Awareness during a seizure is defined as the patient being fully aware of themself and their environment throughout the seizure, even if immobile.
synonyms: ["Focal aware seizures","Focal seizure with retained awareness","Focal seizure without impairment of awareness","Focal seizure without impairment of consciousness or awareness","Focal seizures without impairment of consciousness or awareness","Partial seizure with retained awareness","Partial seizure without impairment of awareness","Simple partial seizure","Simple partial seizures"]

name: Second degree atrioventricular block
description: An intermittent atrioventricular block with failure of some atrial impulses to conduct to the ventricles, i.e., some but not all atrial impulses are conducted through the atrioventricular node and trigger ventricular contraction.

name: Renal hamartoma
description: A disordered proliferation of mature tissues that are native to the kidneys.

name: Abnormal brain choline/creatine ratio by MRS
description: A deviation from normal in the ratio of choline to creatine in the brain identified by magnetic resonance spectroscopy (MRS).

name: Angulated muscle fibers
description: Normal muscle fibers are polygonal-shaped in cross section, are multinucleated, and have minimal amounts of endomysial connective tissue. In contrast, angulated (also known as angular) muscle fibers have long and narrow vertices (corners) with sharp edges and a pointed tip.

name: Increased anti-dairy protein IgE antibody level
description: Increased level of IgE antibody against dairy proteins, including casein, alpha-lactalbumin, beta-lactoglobulin or bovine serum albumin contained in cow, sheep or goat milk and milk products.

name: Reduced amygdala volume
description: A decrease in the volume (size) of the amygdyla.

name: Elevated prostate-specific antigen level
description: An increased concentration of prostate specific antigen (PSA) in the circulation.

name: Eye poking
description: Repetitive pressing, poking, and/or rubbing in the eyes.

name: Abnormal pulse
description: An anomaly of the rhythmic throbbing of an artery that reflects the widening of the artery as blood flows through it and is caused by successive contractions of the heart.

name: Microvesicular hepatic steatosis
description: A form of hepatic steatosis characterized by the presence of small, lipid-laden vesicles in the affected hepatocytes.

name: Abnormal epidermis stratum granulosum morphology
description: An abnormal structure of the stratum granulosum, which is is a thin layer of cells in the epidermis lying above the stratum spinosum and below the stratum corneum.

name: Focal impaired awareness hyperkinetic seizure
description: A focal hyperkinetic seizure in which awareness is partially or fully impaired at some point during the seizure.

name: Osteolytic defects of the phalanges of the 2nd toe
Anti-H2A antibody positivity
description: The presence of autoantibodies in the blood circulation that react against histone H2A.

name: Cerebellar edema
description: Swelling from fluid accumulation (serous fluid infiltration into the interstitial space) in the cerebellum.
synonyms: ["Cerebellar oedema","Edema of the cerebellum","Oedema of the cerebellum"]

name: Fatigable weakness of chewing muscles
description: A type of weakness of the muscles involved in chewing that occurs after a muscle group is used and lessens if the muscle group has some rest. That is, there is diminution of strength with repetitive muscle actions.

name: Fetal choroid plexus cysts
description: Fetal choroid plexus cysts (CPCs) are sonographically discrete, small cysts found in the choroid plexus within the lateral cerebral ventricles of the developing fetus at 14 to 24 weeks gestation. Imaging of the choroid plexus is performed in the transverse plane of the fetal head at the same level that the lateral cerebral ventricle is evaluated. The choroid plexus should be inspected bilaterally for the presence of cysts. The size of CPCs is not of clinical relevance (PMID:16100637).

name: Increased urinary 1-methylhistidine
description: Increased concentration of 1-methylhistidine in the urine.

name: Mottled pigmentation
description: Patchy and irregular skin pigmentation.

name: Laryngeal web
description: A membrane-like structure that extends across the laryngeal lumen close to the level of the vocal cords.

name: Abnormal sex hormone-binding globulin level
description: A deviation from the normal concentration in the circulation of sex hormone-binding globulin, a circulating glycoprotein that transports testosterone and other steroids in the blood.

name: Tracheal tug on inspiration
description: Downward movement of the trachea during inspiration due to downward traction on the tracheobronchial tree.

name: Abnormal B cell count
description: A deviation from the normal count of B cells, i.e., the cells that are formed in the bone marrow, migrate to the peripheral lymphatic system, and mature into plasma cells or memory cells.
synonyms: ["Abnormal number of B cells","Abnormal numbers of B cells","Abnormality of B cell count","Abnormality of B cell numbers"]

name: Azoospermia
description: Absence of any measurable level of sperm in his semen.

name: Cone-shaped epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 4th finger
description: A cone-shaped appearance of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the ring finger of the hand, producing a 'ball-in-a-socket' appearance. This epiphysis is located at the proximal end of the phalanx and is normally nearly flat. The related entity 'angel-shaped' epiphysis refers to a pronounced cone-shaped epiphysis in combination with a pseudoepiphysis at the distal end of the phalanx.
synonyms: ["Cone-shaped end part of the outermost bone of the ring finger"]

name: Acute respiratory acidosis
description: Sudden onset of impairment in ventilation such that the removal of carbon dioxide by the respiratory system is less than the production of carbon dioxide in the tissues, leading to an elevation of the partial pressure of carbon dioxide (PaCO2) above the normal limits (more than 45 mm Hg) with an accompanying acidemia (pH less than 7.35).

name: Ivory epiphysis of the thumb
description: Sclerosis of one or more of the epiphyses of the thumb, leading to an increased degree of radiopacity (white or ivory appearance) in X-rays.
synonyms: ["Increased bone density of end part of the thumb","Ivory epiphyses of the thumb"]

name: Abnormality of the middle phalanx of the 5th toe
synonyms: ["Abnormality of the middle bone of the little toe","Abnormality of the middle bone of the pinkie toe","Abnormality of the middle bone of the pinky toe"]

name: Notched primary central incisor
description: The presence of a V-shaped indentation (notch) in the primary central incisor.
synonyms: ["Notched front baby tooth","Notched front deciduous tooth","Notched front primary tooth","Syphilitic primary incisor"]

name: Isolated systolic hypertension
description: Elevated systolic blood pressure without an elevated blood pressure.

name: Basilar invagination
description: Projection of the tip of the dens more than 5 mm above a line joining the hard palate to the posterior lip of the foramen magnum (Chamberlain's line) or the tip of the dens is greater than 7 mm above McGregor's line (the back of the hard palate to the lowest point of the occipital squama).

name: Abnormal lip pigmentation
description: Abnormal coloring of the lip, whereby the lip discolored, blotchy, or darker or lighter than normal.

name: Secretory adrenocortical adenoma
description: An hormonally active adrenocortical adenoma, that is, an adenoma that secretes excessive amounts of adrenal hormones.

name: Abnormality of optic chiasm morphology
description: A structural abnormality of the optic chiasm.The optic chiasm, located below the hypothalamus, is a partial crossing of the optic nerves.

name: Unilateral alveolar cleft of maxilla
description: One sided alveolar cleft of the maxilla.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the ear
description: The presence of aplasia or developmental hypoplasia of the ear.

name: Atlantoaxial dislocation
description: Partial dislocation of the atlantoaxial joint.

name: Altman type I sacrococcygeal teratoma
description: A type of sacrococcygeal teratoma that is predominantly external and projects from the sacrococcygeal region and presents with distortion of the buttocks.

name: Abnormality of gonadotropin-releasing hormone level
description: A deviation from the normal circulating concentration of the normal gonadotropin-releasing hormone level secreted from the pituitary gland.

name: Fragmentation of the epiphyses of the middle phalanges of the hand
description: Fragmented appearance of the epiphyses of the middle phalanges of the hand.
synonyms: ["Fragmentation of the end part of the middle hand bones"]

name: Geographic tongue
description: An anomaly of the tongue characterized by loss (atrophy) of filiform papillae of the tongue, leaving areas of erythema (redness), surrounded by a serpiginous, white, hyperkeratotic border. The name geographic tongue refers to an appearance that is said to be similar to a map.
synonyms: ["Annulus migrans","Benign migratory glossitis","Glossitis areata exfoliativa","Lingual erythema migrans","Wandering rash of the tongue"]

name: Tooth abscess
description: A pocket of pus located within a region of a tooth.

name: Disseminated molluscum contagiosum
description: The presense of molluscum contagiosum lesions across multiple areas of the body.

name: Vertebral artery calcification
description: An accumulation of calcium and phosphate in arteries with mineral deposits in the intimal or medial layer of the vessel wall in the vertebral artery.

name: Neck hypertonia
description: Increased passive stiffness or tightness of the neck musculature.

name: Hypohidrosis
description: Abnormally diminished capacity to sweat.
synonyms: ["HP:0007551","HP:0007571","Decreased ability to sweat","Decreased sweating","Inadequate sweating","Oligohidrosis","Sweating, decreased"]

name: Ambiguous genitalia, male
description: Ambiguous genitalia in an individual with XY genetic gender.

name: Compression-fractured cervical vertebra
description: A fracture of the cervical vertebra that is caused by a loss of bone mass (osteoporosis) that occurs as part of aging.
synonyms: ["Compression fractured cervical vertebra","Wedge fractured cervical vertebra"]

name: Sclerotic cranial sutures
description: An increased density in the cranial sutures following obliteration.

name: Reduced level of N-acetylglucosaminyltransferase II
description: An abnormality of glycoprotein metabolism related to a decreased level of alpha-1,6-mannosylglycoprotein 2-beta-N-acetylglucosaminyltransferase activity.

name: Abnormal cell morphology
description: Any anomaly of cell structure.

name: Tetraplegia
description: Paralysis of all four limbs, and trunk of the body below the level of an associated injury to the spinal cord. The etiology of quadriplegia is similar to that of paraplegia except that the lesion is in the cervical spinal cord rather than in the thoracic or lumbar segments of the spinal cord.

name: Tibial metaphyseal irregularity
description: Irregularity of the normally smooth surface of a metaphysis of a tibia.

name: Death in early adulthood
description: Death between the age of 16 and 40 years.

name: Abnormal number of permanent teeth
description: The presence of an altered number of of permanent teeth.
synonyms: ["Abnormal complement of permanent teeth","Abnormal number of adult teeth","Abnormal number of permanent teeth","Abnormal number of secondary dentition","Abnormal permanent tooth count"]

name: Malar flattening
description: Underdevelopment of the malar prominence of the jugal bone (zygomatic bone in mammals), appreciated in profile, frontal view, and/or by palpation.
synonyms: ["HP:0000312","HP:0000332","HP:0004642","HP:0004658","HP:0004671","HP:0005319","HP:0005443","HP:0005455","HP:0100846","Decreased size of malar bone","Depressed malar region","Flat cheekbone","Malar hypoplasia","Underdevelopment of malar bone","Zygomatic flattening"]

name: Limb-girdle muscle weakness
description: Weakness of the limb-girdle muscles (also known as the pelvic and shoulder girdles), that is, lack of strength of the muscles around the shoulders and the pelvis.
synonyms: ["HP:0008971","Limb girdle weakness","Muscle weakness, limb-girdle","Muscular weakness, limb-girdle"]

name: Cone-shaped epiphyses of the distal phalanges of the hand
synonyms: ["Cone-shaped end part of the outermost hand bones"]

name: Ebstein anomaly of the tricuspid valve
description: Ebstein's anomaly refers to an abnormally placed and deformed tricuspid valve characterized by apical displacement of the septal and posterior tricuspid valve leaflets, leading to atrialization of the right ventricle with a variable degree of malformation and displacement of the anterior leaflet.
synonyms: ["HP:0006674","Ebstein's anomaly","Ebstein's anomaly of the tricuspid valve","Ebstein's malformation"]

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the proximal phalanx of the 3rd finger
synonyms: ["Absent/small innermost bone of middle finger","Absent/underdeveloped innermost bone of middle finger"]

name: Fragmentation of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 3rd finger
description: Fragmented appearance of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 3rd finger.
synonyms: ["Fragmentation of end part of the outermost bone of the middle finger"]

name: Anterior pituitary agenesis
description: Absence of the anterior pituitary gland resulting from a developmental defect.
synonyms: ["Absent pituitary gland","Aplasia of the pituitary gland"]

name: Aortic smooth muscle cell disorganization
description: Nonparallel arrangement/disarray of smooth muscle cells of the aortic media creating focal/multifocal disarray or sometimes nodular aggregates of smooth muscle cells.

name: Visual acuity light perception with projection
Sclerosis with transverse striations in metaphyses of the upper limbs
Abnormality of the middle phalanx of the 2nd finger
synonyms: ["HP:0004131","Abnormal middle index finger bone","Abnormality of middle 2nd finger phalanx"]

name: Increased mannose-binding protein level
description: An abnormal elevation above the normal concentration of mannose-binding protein in the blood circulation.

name: Retinal peau d'orange
description: A pebbly orange appearance of the fundus that is said to resemble the skin of an orange.

name: Mild hypermetropia
description: A form of hypermetropia with not more than +2.00 diopters.

name: Orthopnea
description: A sensation of breathlessness in the recumbent position, relieved by sitting or standing.

name: Myoclonic status epilepticus without coma
description: A type of myoclonic status epilepticus in the absence of coma.

name: Lower eyelid edema
description: Edema in the region of the Lower eyelid.
synonyms: ["Cellulitis of lower eyelid","Fullness of lower eyelid","Lower eyelid oedema","Puffiness of lower eyelid","Swelling of lower eyelid"]

name: 3-4 finger cutaneous syndactyly
description: A soft tissue continuity in the A/P axis between fingers 3 and 4.

name: Abnormal inferior vena cava morphology
description: Any structural anomaly of the principal vein draining blood from the lower portion of the body.

name: Hyperfibrinogenemia
description: Increased concentration of fibrinogen in the blood.

name: Abnormal dermoepidermal junction morphology
description: Any anomaly of the structure of the acellular zone that is between the dermis and the epidermis and which functions to bind the epidermis to the dermis and to serve as a selective barrier allowing the control of molecular and cellular exchanges between the two compartments.

name: Pansynostosis
description: Craniosynostosis of all calvarial sutures.

name: Recurrent plantar mycosis
description: A history of repeated fungal infections located on the sole of the foot, usually manifested by scaling, maceration, and itching.

name: Subacute
description: Somewhat rapid onset and change of disease manifestations.

name: Unusual infection by anatomical site
description: An unusual infection classified by the affected body part.

name: obsolete Abnormality of the retinal pigment epithelium
Patchy sclerosis of the distal phalanx of the 2nd finger
description: Uneven (irregular) increase in bone density of the distal phalanx of the second finger.
synonyms: ["Uneven increase in bone density in the outermost bone of the 2nd finger"]

name: Elevated circulating palmitoleylcarnitine concentration
description: An elevated level of propionylcarnitine in the circulation. Propionylcarnitine is present in high abundance in the urine of patients with Methylmalonyl-CoA mutase (MUT) deficiency.
synonyms: ["HP:0033463","Elevated circulating O-propionylcarnitine concentration","Elevated plasma palmitoleylcarnitine, C16:1","Elevated plasma propionylcarnitine, C3:0","Elevated propionylcarnitine level"]

name: Abnormality of the 1st metacarpal
description: A structural anomaly of the first metacarpal.
synonyms: ["Abnormality of the 1st long bone of hand"]

name: Abnormality of mitochondrial metabolism
description: A functional anomaly of mitochondria.

name: Pulmonary venous occlusion
description: Substantial narrowing or blockage of small pulmonary veins as a result of disorganized smooth muscle hypertrophy and collagen matrix deposition.

name: Abnormality of thumb phalanx
description: A structural anomaly of one or more phalanges of the thumb.
synonyms: ["HP:0004063","HP:0004064","Abnormality of the thumb bones","Abnormality of thumb phalanges"]

name: Bracket epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 5th finger
description: An abnormality of the proximal phalanx of the fifth finger in which the epiphysis surrounds a phalangeal bone, having a bracket-like form and reaching from the proximal side of a phalanx to the distal side.
synonyms: ["Bracket shaped end part of the innermost bone of the little finger","Bracket shaped end part of the innermost bone of the pinkie finger","Bracket shaped end part of the innermost bone of the pinky finger"]

name: Abnormal motor evoked potentials
description: An anomaly identified by motor evoked potentials (MEPs). MEPs are measured following single-pulse or repetitive transcranial magnetic stimulation and can be used for the assessment of the excitability of the motor cortex and the integrity of conduction along the central and peripheral motor pathways.

name: Increased density of long bone diaphyses
synonyms: ["Increased density of shaft of long bone"]

name: Brisk reflexes
description: Tendon reflexes that are noticeably more active than usual (conventionally denoted 3+ on clinical examination). Brisk reflexes may or may not indicate a neurological lesion. They are distinguished from hyperreflexia by the fact that hyerreflexia is characterized by hyperactive repeating (clonic) reflexes, which are considered to be always abnormal.

name: Alveolar septal thickening
description: Increased width of the alveolar septum, which is the structure that separates neighboring alveoli. This finding can be appreciated on histology.

name: Posterior fossa cyst
description: A discrete posterior fossa cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) collection that does not communicate directly with the fourth ventricle.

name: Increased proportion of CD8-positive, alpha-beta TEMRA T cells
description: An increased proportion of CD8-positive, alpha-beta effector memory RA TEMRA T cells compared to the total number of T cells in the blood. These cells have the phenotype CD45RA-positive, CD45RO-negative, and CCR7-negative.
synonyms: ["Increased proportion of effector memory CD8-positive, alpha-beta T cells, terminally differentiated"]

name: Basilar impression
description: Abnormal elevation of the floor of the posterior fossa including occipital condyles and foramen magnum.

name: Abnormality of bone mineral density
description: This term applies to all changes in bone mineral density which (depending on severity) can be seen on x-rays as a change in density and or structure of the bone. Changes may affect all bones of the organism, just certain bones or only parts of bones and include decreased mineralisation as may be seen in osteoporosis or increased mineralisation and or ossification as in osteopetrosis, exostoses or any kind of atopic calicfications of different origin and distribution. The overall amount of mineralization of the bone-organ can be measured as the amount of matter per cubic centimeter of bones, usually measured by densitometry of the lumbar spine or hip. The measurements are usually reported as g/cm3 or as a Z-score (the number of standard deviations above or below the mean for the patient's age and sex). Note that measurement with this method does not reflect local changes in other bones, and as such might not be correct with regard the hole bone-organ.

name: Triangular shaped distal phalanx of the 2nd finger
description: Triangular shaped distal phalanx of the 2nd finger. A triangular or so called delta shaped phalanx is a typical result after a bracket epiphysis of the affected phalanx.
synonyms: ["Triangular shaped outermost bone of the 2nd finger"]

name: Pseudobulbar paralysis
description: Bilateral impairment of the function of the cranial nerves 9-12, which control musculature involved in eating, swallowing, and speech. Pseudobulbar paralysis is characterized clinically by dysarthria, dysphonia, and dysphagia with bifacial paralysis, and may be accompanied by Pseudobulbar behavioral symptoms such as enforced crying and laughing.

name: Vaginal neoplasm
description: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the vagina.

name: Exercise-induced muscle fatigue
description: An abnormally increased tendency towards muscle fatigue induced by physical exercise.

name: Increased proportion of transitional B cells
description: An elevation in the normal proportion of transitional B cells (CD19+/CD38high/IgMhigh) in circulation relative to the total number of B cells. B cells originate from precursors in the bone marrow, and the first cells which migrate to the peripheral blood have been classified as transitional B cells.

name: Costochondral pain
description: Chest wall pain in the area of the costochondral junctions.

name: Stereotypy
description: A stereotypy is a repetitive, simple movement that can be voluntarily suppressed. Stereotypies are typically simple back-and-forth movements such as waving of flapping the hands or arms, and they do not involve complex sequences or movement fragments. Movement is often but not always rhythmic and may involve fingers, wrists, or more proximal portions of the upper extremity. The lower extremity is not typically involved. Stereotypies are more commonly bilateral than unilateral.
synonyms: ["HP:0008758","HP:0008759","Repetitive movements","Repetitive or self-injurious behavior","Repetitive or self-injurious behaviour","Stereotyped behavior","Stereotyped behaviour","Stereotyped, repetitive behavior","Stereotyped, repetitive behaviour","Stereotypic behavior","Stereotypic behaviors","Stereotypic behaviour","Stereotypic behaviours","Stereotypical motor behavior","Stereotypical motor behaviors","Stereotypical motor behaviours"]

name: Sclerosis of the distal phalanx of the 4th toe
synonyms: ["Increased bone density in the outermost bone of the 4th toe"]

name: Hemosiderin-laden macrophages in bronchoalveolar fluid
description: Hemosiderin-laden macrophages (HLM) in bronchoalveolar lavage (BAL) fluid were originally known as adiagnostic biomarker of alveolar hemorrhage, but have also been observed in idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis (IPF) with histopathological pattern of usual interstitial pneumonia (UIP).
synonyms: ["Accumulation of hemosiderin laden alveolar macrophages","Siderophages in bronchoalveolar fluid"]

name: Pelvic organ prolapse
description: Weakness in the supporting structures of the pelvic floor allowing the pelvic viscera to descend or one or more of the pelvic organs drop from their normal position.

name: Pulmonary artery adventitial fibrosis
description: Increased amount of collagen, proteoglycans, and other extracellular matrix proteins resulting in scarring and thickening in the adventia of the pulmonary arterial tree.

name: Total absence von Willebrand factor multimers
description: Complete absence of all von Willebrand factor multimers.

name: Anti-Complement factor H antibody positivity
description: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against complement factor H.

name: Global glomerulosclerosis
description: Obliteration of the glomerular capillary lumen by increased collagenous matrix, with or without hyalinosis or foam cells. Sclerosis involves 100% of the glomerular tuft. Relative to other patent glomeruli in the sample, glomerular size is preserved, or increased/decreased by no more than 50%.

name: Increased complex N-glycan level
description: An abnormal increase in the concentration of complex N-glycans on glycoproteins.
synonyms: ["Increased concentration of complex N-glycans on glycoproteins"]

name: Abnormality of male external genitalia
description: An abnormality of male external genitalia.

name: Focal friction-related palmoplantar hyperkeratosis
description: Hyperkeratosis affecting the palm of the hand and the sole of the foot in areas exposed to friction.

name: Abnormal biotinidase level
description: An abnormality in the biotinidase level, an enzyme that releases biotin from biocytin, the product of biotin-dependent carboxylases degradation.

name: Minimal change glomerulonephritis
description: The presence of minimal changes visible by light microscopy but flattened and fused podocyte foot processes on electron microscopy in a person with nephrotic range proteinuria.

name: Internuclear ophthalmoplegia
description: An abnormality of conjugate lateral gaze in which the affected eye shows impairment of adduction. The pathognomonic clinical sign of internuclear ophthalmoplegia is an impaired adduction while testing horizontal saccades on the side of the lesion in the ipsilateral medial longitudinal fascicule.

name: Anti-Ri antibody
description: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against Ri, ,an antineuronal antibody.

name: Sickled erythrocytes
description: An irreversible distortion of the morphology of an erythrocyte such that the cells are elongated and curved, resembling the blade of a sickle (the hand-held agricultural tool traditionally used to harvest grains).

name: Irregular epiphyses of the hallux
synonyms: ["Irregular end part of big toe bone"]

name: Aorto-ventricular tunnel
description: Aorto-ventricular tunnel is a congenital, extracardiac channel which connects the ascending aorta above the sinutubular junction to the cavity of the left, or (less commonly) right ventricle.

name: Inappropriate sinus tachycardia
description: Inappropriate sinus tachycardia is a nonparoxysmal tachyarrhythmia characterized by an increased resting heart rate (HR) and/or an exaggerated HR response to minimal exertion or a change in body posture. HR is constantly above the physiological range with no appropriate relation to metabolic or physiological demands.

name: Bulbar urethral stricture
description: A type of urethral stricture affecting the bulbar urethra, which is the part of the urethra that traverses the root of the penis.

name: Retinal arteriolar constriction
description: Decreased retinal arteriolar diameters, which may decrease blood flow and slow oxygen delivery to regions of the retina.
synonyms: ["HP:0007952","HP:0008510","Constricted retinal arterioles","Narrow retinal arterioles","Retinal arteriolar narrowing"]

name: Aplastic/hypoplastic toenail
description: Absence or underdevelopment of the toenail.

name: Abnormality of limb bone morphology
description: Any abnormality of bones of the arms or legs.
synonyms: ["Abnormal shape of limb bone","Arm and/or leg bone differences","Limb abnormality"]

name: Neurogenic bladder
description: A type of bladder dysfunction caused by neurologic damage. Neurogenic bladder can be flaccid or spastic. Common manifestatios of neurogenic bladder are overflow incontinence, frequency, urgency, urge incontinence, and retention.
synonyms: ["Lack of bladder control due to nervous system injury"]

name: Premature fusion of phalangeal epiphyses
description: Fusion of the epiphysis and metaphysis of one or more phalanges prior to the normal age or stage of growth.
synonyms: ["Premature fusion of end part of digital bone"]

name: Macular dystrophy
description: Macular dystrophy is a nonspecific term for premature retinal cell aging and cell death, generally confied to the macula in which no clear extrinsic cause is evident.

name: Fractured epiphysis of first metatarsal bone
description: A partial or complete breakage of the epiphysis of first metatarsal bone.

name: Choroidal neovascularization
description: Choroidal neovascularization (CNV) is the creation of new blood vessels in the choroid layer of the eye.

name: Abnormal cerebellum morphology
description: Any structural abnormality of the cerebellum.
synonyms: ["Abnormality of the cerebellum","Cerebellar abnormalities","Cerebellar abnormality","Cerebellar anomaly","Cerebellar signs"]

name: Ulnar deviation of the hand
description: Divergence of the longitudinal axis of the hand at the wrist in a posterior (ulnar) direction (i.e., towards the little finger).
synonyms: ["Ulnar deviation of hands","Ulnar deviation of the hands"]

name: Small proximal tibial epiphyses
description: Reduced size of the proximal epiphysis of the tibia.
synonyms: ["Small end part of innermost shankbone","Small end part of innermost shinbone"]

name: Abnormal astrocyte morphology
description: An abnormality of astrocytes.

name: Renal tubular epithelial cell apoptosis
description: Increased apoptosis (programmed cell death) of tubular epithelial cells. The cells arre rounded with increased eosinophilia and contain fragmented, densely basophilic nuclear debris.

name: Periodic hyperkalemic paralysis
description: Episodes of muscle weakness associated with elevated levels of potassium in the blood.

name: Abnormal circulating unsaturated fatty acid concentration
description: A deviation from the normal concentration of an unsaturated fatty acid in the blood circulation.

name: Microretrognathia
description: A form of developmental hypoplasia of the mandible in which the mandible is mislocalised posteriorly.

name: Ectopia pupillae
description: A malposition of the pupil owing to a developmental defect of the iris.

name: Abnormal proportion of immature gamma-delta T cells
description: Abnormal proportion of immature gamma-delta T cells relative to the total number of T cells.
synonyms: ["Abnormal proportion of immature gamma-delta T lymphocytes","Abnormal proportion of immature gamma-delta T-cells","Abnormal proportion of immature gamma-delta T-lymphocytes"]

name: Jaw pain
description: An unpleasant sensation characterized by physical discomfort (such as pricking, throbbing, or aching) localized to the jaw.

name: Recurrent aphthous stomatitis
description: Recurrent episodes of ulceration of the oral mucosa, typically presenting as painful, sharply circumscribed fibrin-covered mucosal defects with a hyperemic border.

name: Acute phase response
description: Presence of one or more manifestations of the acute phase response. Acute phase proteins (APP) are blood proteins primarily synthesized by hepatocytes as part of the acute phase response (APR). The APR is part of the early-defense or innate immune system, which is triggered by different stimuli including trauma, infection, stress, neoplasia, and inflammation. The APR results in a complex systemic reaction with the goal of reestablishing homeostasis and promoting healing.

name: Defective T cell proliferation
description: A reduced ability of a T cell population to expand by cell division following T cell activation.

name: Fluctuating hepatomegaly
description: Intermittently increased size of the liver.

name: EEG with constitutional variants
description: An EEG with constitutional variants contains waves that are rare or unusual but not generally pathologic.

name: Absent pubertal growth spurt
description: The abrupt and transient increase in the annual growth rate normally observed in adolescent individuals does not occur.

name: Supernumerary tooth
description: The presence of one or more teeth additional to the normal number.
synonyms: ["HP:0000672","Extra teeth","Hyperdontia","Increased number of teeth","Increased tooth count","Supernumerary teeth","Supplemental dentition","Supplemental teeth","Tooth, supernumerary"]

name: Partial development of the penile shaft
Absent urinary urothione
description: Lack of urothione (the urinary metabolite of molybdenum cofactor) in the urine.

name: Anti-asialoglycoprotein receptor antibody positivity
description: Presence of autoantibodies against the asialoglycoprotein receptor (ASGPR) in the blood circulation.

name: Foot polydactyly
description: A kind of polydactyly characterized by the presence of a supernumerary toe or toes.
synonyms: ["HP:0009135","Duplication of bones of the toes","Polydactyly of feet","Polydactyly of the foot"]

name: Mobitz I atrioventricular block
description: Progressive PR interval prolongation with the subsequent occurrence of a single nonconducted P wave that results in a pause. The pause that follows the nonconducted impulse is less than fully compensatory (less than the sum of two normal sinus intervals).

name: Chalazion
description: A chronic epithelioid cell granulomatous inflammation of the meibomian gland caused by inflammation of a blocked meibomian gland. A chalazion or meibomian cyst appears as a painless tuberous swelling in the upper lid without loss of eyelashes.

name: Synostosis involving the 3rd metacarpal
synonyms: ["Fusion involving the 3rd long bone of hand"]

name: Partial absence of specific antibody response to Haemophilus influenzae type b (Hib) vaccine
description: A reduced ability to synthesize postvaccination antibodies against a Haemophilus influenzae type b (Hib) antigen, as measured by antibody titer determination following vaccination.

name: Abnormal humeral ossification
description: An anomaly of the process of formation of bone in the humerus.
synonyms: ["Abnormal maturation of long bone in upper arm"]

name: Abnormality of the musculature
description: Abnormality originating in one or more muscles, i.e., of the set of muscles of body.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia involving the metacarpal bones
description: Aplasia or Hypoplasia affecting the metacarpal bones.
synonyms: ["HP:0006007","Absent or hypoplastic metacarpals","Absent/small long bones of hand","Absent/underdeveloped long bones of hand","Aplastic/hypoplastic metacarpals","Hypoplastic metacarpals","Hypoplastic/absent metacarpal bones","Hypoplastic/absent metacarpals","Metacarpal aplasia/hypoplasia"]

name: Focal impaired awareness undressing automatism seizure
description: A type of focal automatism in which awareness is partially or fully impaired at some point during the seizure and is seizure characterized by involuntary undressing at onset.

name: Congenital abnormal hair pattern
description: A congenital abnormality of the distribution of hair growth.

name: Thyroid hemiagenesis
description: Absence of a lobe of the thyroid gland related to a failure of its embryologic development.

name: Abnormality of the epiphyses of the middle phalanges of the hand
synonyms: ["Abnormality of the end part of the middle hand bones"]

name: Edema of the dorsum of feet
description: An abnormal accumulation of fluid beneath the skin on the back of the feet.
synonyms: ["Edema of dorsum of feet","Oedema of dorsum of feet","Oedema of the dorsum of feet"]

name: Decreased activity of mitochondrial ATP synthase complex
description: A reduction in the activity of the mitochondrial proton-transporting ATP synthase complex, which makes ATP via oxidative phosphorylation, and is sometimes described as Complex V of the electron transport chain.

name: Conical incisor
description: An abnormal conical morphology of the incisor tooth.
synonyms: ["HP:0000673","HP:0006345","HP:0011066","Cone shaped front tooth","Conoid incisor","Peg shaped incisors","Peg-shaped incisors","Shark tooth incisor"]

name: Straddling atrioventricular valve
description: Anomalous insertion of the chordae tendinae or papillary muscles into the contralateral ventricle in the presence of a ventricular septum defect.

name: Recurrent interdigital mycosis
description: A history of repeated fungal infections located between the fingers or toes, usually manifested by scaling, maceration, and itching. The toes are more commonly affected than the fingers.

name: Premature skin wrinkling
description: The presence of an increased degree of wrinkling (irregular folds and indentations) of the skin as compared with age-related norms.

name: Internally nucleated skeletal muscle fibers
description: An abnormally increased proportion of nuclei of sarcomeres with an internal localization. Individual muscle fibers are syncytia, formed by embryonic fusion of many myoblasts or later, myosatellite cells. Each muscle fiber contains many nuclei, peripherally positioned immediately adjacent to the sarcolemmal membrane. In healthy muscle only 3-5% of fibers contain nuclei that are located internally, within the cell, but many disease processes lead to internal nuclei.

name: Congenital ichthyosiform erythroderma
description: An ichthyosiform abnormality of the skin with congenital onset.

name: Abnormal distribution of cell junction proteins in buccal mucosal cells
description: An anomalous amount or location of cell junction proteins such as plakoglobin or Cx43.

name: Type I truncus arteriosus
description: Truncus arteriosus (single great artery leaving the base of the heart, giving rise to the coronary, pulmonary, and systemic arteries) with a short pulmonary trunk arises from the truncus arteriosus, giving rise to both pulmonary arteries.
synonyms: ["Persistent truncus arteriosus type I","Type 1 truncus arteriosus"]

name: Low voltage EEG
description: EEG with an amplitude less than 30 microvolts without observable occipital alpha rhythm (8-13 Hz).

name: Parotitis
description: Inflammation of the parotid gland.

name: Aplasia cutis congenita over parietal area
description: A developmental defect resulting in the congenital absence of skin on the scalp in the parietal area.

name: Hypoplastic female external genitalia
description: Underdevelopment of part or all of the female external reproductive organs (which include the mons pubis, labia majora, labia minora, Bartholin glands, and clitoris).

name: Decreased circulating chenodeoxycholic acid concentration
description: A reduced concentration of chenodeoxycholic acid in the blood circulation.

name: Increased circulating fetuin A concentration
description: An elevation above normal of fetuin A in the blood circulation.

name: Morgagni diaphragmatic hernia
description: An anterior retrosternal or parasternal hernia that can result in the herniation of liver or intestines into the chest cavity.

name: Decreased circulating IgA level
description: Decreased levels of immunoglobulin A (IgA).
synonyms: ["HP:0005358","HP:0005399","HP:0005431","HP:0008350","Decreased IgA","Decreased immunoglobulin A","Gamma-A globulin deficiency","IgA deficiency","Low levels of immunoglobulin A","Reduced IgA levels"]

name: Subcutaneous hemorrhage
description: This term refers to an abnormally increased susceptibility to bruising (purpura, petechiae, or ecchymoses).

name: Hypocapnia
description: Abnormally reduced blood carbon dioxide (CO2) level.

name: Madelung deformity
description: An anomaly related to partial closure, or failure of development of the ulnar side of the distal radial growth plate, which results in an arrest of epiphyseal growth of the medial and volar portions of the distal radius. This leads to shortening of the radius and relative overgrowth of the ulna.

name: Abnormal central microtubular pair morphology of respiratory motile cilia
description: A structural anomaly of the two central microtubules of motile cilia with a 9+2 microtubuluar configuration.

name: Toe clinodactyly
description: Bending or curvature of a toe in the tibial direction (i.e., towards the big toe).

name: Elevated circulating uracil concentration
description: Concentration of uracil in the blood is above the normal range.

name: Vertigo
description: An abnormal sensation of spinning while the body is actually stationary.

name: Imperforate atrioventricular valve
description: An atrioventricular valve that has failed to open (atretic).

name: Parietal meningocele
description: A herniation of meninges through a congenital bone defect in the skull in the parietal region.

name: Alexia
description: An acquired type of sensory aphasia where damage to the brain leads to the loss of the ability to read.

name: Oligodactyly
description: A developmental defect resulting in the presence of fewer than the normal number of digits.

name: Dilatation of the renal pelvis
description: The presence of dilatation of the renal pelvis.

name: Polyembolokoilamania
description: Habitual insertion of foreign bodies into bodily orifices.

name: Abnormal serum bile acid concentration
description: A deviation from the normal concentration of serum bile acid concentration.

name: Discrete 2 to 5-mm hyper- and hypopigmented macules
Ulnar radial head dislocation
description: A dislocation of the head of the radius from its socket in the elbow joint in an ulnar direction.

name: Fractured manual digit bone
description: A partial or complete breakage of the manual digit bone.

name: Bifid nose
description: Visually assessable vertical indentation, cleft, or depression of the nasal bridge, ridge and tip.
synonyms: ["Bifid nasal bridge","Indentation or clefting of the nose"]

name: Deviation of the 5th finger
description: Displacement of the 5th finger from its normal position.
synonyms: ["HP:0006036","Displaced little finger","Displaced pinkie finger","Displaced pinky finger","Laterally displaced fifth finger"]

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the hallux
description: Absence or underdevelopment of the big toe.

name: Partial diaphragmatic absence of pericardium
description: Lack of a part of the pericardium over the diaphragmatic surface of the heart. It is a congenital defect, not the result of a pericardectomy. Pericardium is present on other parts of the heart.

name: Opportunistic bacterial infection
description: An infection that is caused by a bacterium that would generally not be able to cause an infection in a host with a normal immune system. Such bacteria take advantage of the opportunity, so to speak, that is provided by a weakened immune system.

name: Irregular epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 5th finger
description: Irregular radiographic opacity of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 5th finger.
synonyms: ["Irregular end part of the innermost little finger bone","Irregular end part of the innermost pinkie finger bone","Irregular end part of the innermost pinky finger bone"]

name: Spurred humeral metaphysis
synonyms: ["Spurred metaphysis of long bone of upper arm"]

name: Hypoplasia of the eccrine sweat glands
Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the external ear
description: The presence of aplasia or developmental hypoplasia of all or part of the external ear.

name: Triggered by heavy meal
description: Applies to a sign or symptom that is provoked or brought about by eating large quantities of food, for instance, by a heavy meal.

name: Nephrosclerosis
description: Nephrosclerosis refers to thickening or scarring (\"sclerosis\") resulting from damage to the renal arterioles, also referred to as arteriosclerosis of the kidney arteries.
synonyms: ["Scarring of kidney arteries","Thickening of kidney artiries"]

name: obsolete Focal cognitive seizure with deja vu/jamais vu
description: A focal cognitive seizure characterized by memory phenomena such as feelings of familiarity (deja vu) and unfamiliarity (jamais vu) as the initial semiological manifestation.

name: Dysharmonic delayed bone age
description: A type of dysharmonic skeletal maturation in which there is a delay in skeletal maturation whose degree differs markedly in different bones.

name: Distal tibial bowing
description: A bending or abnormal curvature of the distal portion of the tibia.
synonyms: ["Bowing of the distal tibia","Tibial bowing at ankle"]

name: Increased Z-disc width
description: Abnormally increased width of the Z-disk of the sarcomere, resulting from splitting or opening of the Z-disc (c.f., Figure 2 of PMID:28732005).

name: Abnormality of the optic disc
description: A morphological abnormality of the optic disc, i.e., of the portion of the optic nerve clinically visible on fundoscopic examination.

name: Ocular pain
description: An unpleasant sensation characterized by physical discomfort (such as pricking, throbbing, or aching) localized to the eye.

name: High maternal serum alpha-fetoprotein
description: Increase in the levels of maternal serum alpha-fetoprotein levels during pregnancy.
synonyms: ["High maternal serum alpha-fetoprotein MoM","High MSAFP MoM","Increased maternal serum alpha-fetoprotein level","MSAFP MoM>2.5"]

name: Increased circulating argininosuccinic acid
description: An increased level of the non-proteinogenic amino acid argininosuccinic acid in the blood circulation.

name: Anisopoikilocytosis
description: A type of poikilocytosis characterized by the presence in the blood of erythrocytes of varying sizes and abnormal shapes.

name: Unilateral renal agenesis
description: A unilateral form of agenesis of the kidney.
synonyms: ["Absent kidney on one side","Missing one kidney","Single kidney","Unilateral kidney agenesis"]

name: Episodic upper airway obstruction
description: Intermittent episodes of increased resistance to the passage of air in the upper airway.

name: Focal emotional seizure with pleasure
description: Focal emotional seizure with pleasure is characterized by the presence of a positive emotional experience with pleasure, bliss, joy, enhanced personal well-being, heightened self-awareness or ecstasy.

name: Abnormal nervous system electrophysiology
description: An abnormality of the function of the electrical signals with which nerve cells communicate with each other or with muscles as measured by electrophysiological investigations.

name: Abnormality of the humeral epiphysis
description: An anomaly of the humeral epiphysis.
synonyms: ["Abnormality of end part of the long bone of the upper arm","Abnormality of the humeral epiphyses"]

name: Elevated hemoglobin A1c
description: An increased concentration of hemoglobin A1c (HbA1c), which is the product of nonenzymatic attachment of a hexose molecule to the N-terminal amino acid of the hemoglobin molecule. This reaction is dependent on blood glucose concentration, and therefore reflects the mean glucose concentration over the previous 8 to 12 weeks. The HbA1c level provides a better indication of long-term glycemic control than one-time blood or urinary glucose measurements.
synonyms: ["Elevated glycated haemoglobin","Elevated glycated hemoglobin","Elevated glycosylated haemoglobin","Elevated glycosylated hemoglobin","Elevated haemoglobin A1c","Elevated HbA1c","Increased HbA1c levels"]

name: Usual interstitial pneumonia
description: Temporal and spatial heterogeneity in lungs based on presence of fibrosis and honeycombing.

name: Socially inappropriate behavior
description: Behavior that is not in line with social norms.

name: Fibroblast metachromasia
description: Increased cytoplasmic staining of fibroblasts with toluidine blue.

name: Triggered by stress
description: Applies to a sign or symptom that is provoked or brought about by a physical, mental, or emotional factor associated with bodily or mental tension.

name: Absent epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd toe
synonyms: ["Absent end part of the innermost bone of the 2nd toe"]

name: Positive urine opioid test
description: Detection of opioids or opioid metabolites in urine.

name: Apical hypertrabeculation of the left ventricle
description: An increased number and density of the trabeculae in the apex (tip) of the left ventricle.

name: Severe constriction of peripheral visual field
description: Peripheral visual field constriction with 10-19 degrees central field preserved.

name: Periodic fever
description: Episodic fever that recurs at regular intervals.

name: Round epiphyses of the upper limbs
synonyms: ["Round end part of upper limb bones"]

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the thymus
description: Absence or underdevelopment of the thymus.

name: Astrocytoma
description: Astrocytoma is a neoplasm of the central nervous system derived from astrocytes. Astrocytes are a type of glial cell, and thus astrocytoma is a subtype of glioma.

name: Dilatation of superior mesenteric artery
description: Abnormal outpouching or sac-like dilatation in the wall of the superior mesenteric artery .

name: Granulomatous arteriolitis of the arteriolar intima/media
description: A type of renal intimal/medial arteriolitis characteriezed by circumscribed inflammatory lesions comprised primarily of macrophages present in inflamed arteries.

name: Abnormality of eye movement
description: An abnormality in voluntary or involuntary eye movements or their control.
synonyms: ["HP:0006860","Abnormal extraocular movement","Abnormal extraocular movements","Abnormal eye motility","Abnormal eye movement","Abnormal eye movements","Abnormal motility of the globe of the eye","Abnormal movement of the globe of the eye","Abnormal ocular movements","Abnormality of eye movement","Eye movement abnormalities","Eye movement issue","Ocular movement abnormalities","Oculomotor abnormalities"]

name: Hypercapnia in cord blood
description: Abnormally elevated blood carbon dioxide (CO2) level in the cord blood.

name: Partial duplication of the distal phalanx of the 2nd toe
description: Partial duplication of the distal phalanx of second toe.
synonyms: ["Partial duplication of the outermost bone of the 2nd toe"]

name: Foveal hyporeflective spaces on macular OCT
Deformed rib cage
description: Malformation of the rib cage.

name: Abnormal pulmonary valve physiology
description: Any functional anomaly of the pumonary valve.

name: Increased circulating gonadotropin level
description: Overproduction of gonadotropins (FSH, LH) by the anterior pituitary gland.
synonyms: ["HP:0030340","Elevated gonadotropins","Elevated serum gonadotropins","Gonadotropin excess","Increased circulating gonadotropin level"]

name: Elevated urine keto acid level
description: Increased amount of a keta acid in the urine.

name: Absent epiphysis of the middle phalanx of the 4th toe
synonyms: ["Absent end part of the middle bone of the 4th toe"]

name: Kernicterus
description: Damage to cerebral nuclei caused in infants by highly increased levels of unconjugated bilirubin. The basal ganglia and brainstem nuclei could be shown to have a yellow staining historically in infants who died of kernicterus, that is, kernicterus is strictly speaking a pathological diagnosis. The presence of kernicterus may be inferred in infants with characteristic acute or chronic bilirubin-induced neurological dysfunction.

name: Umbilical hernia
description: Protrusion of abdominal contents through a defect in the abdominal wall musculature around the umbilicus. Skin and subcutaneous tissue overlie the defect.

name: obsolete Transposition of the great arteries with intact ventricular septum
Radial deviation of the 3rd finger
description: Displacement of the 3rd finger towards the radial side (i.e., towards the thumb).

name: Bronchial wall thickening
description: Radiological appearance of increased density around the walls of a bronchus or large bronchiole. This feature is thought to be related to edema involving the bronchial wall as well as the peribronchial interstitial space. If the cross section of a bronchus is captured in a radiograph or computed tomography image, it is said to have the appearance of a donut because of the central lucency representing the airway of the bronchus surrounded by a circular region of increased density.

name: Susceptibility to chickenpox
description: Increased susceptibility to chicken pox, as manifested by recurrent episodes of chicken pox.

name: Sick sinus syndrome
description: An abnormality involving the generation of the action potential by the sinus node and is characterized by an atrial rate inappropriate for physiological requirements. Manifestations include severe sinus bradycardia, sinus pauses or arrest, sinus node exit block, chronic atrial tachyarrhythmias, alternating periods of atrial bradyarrhythmias and tachyarrhythmias, and inappropriate responses of heart rate during exercise or stress.

name: Glossoptosis
description: Posterior displacement of the tongue into the pharynx, i.e., a tongue that is mislocalised posteriorly.
synonyms: ["Lingual retraction","Posterior displacement of the tongue","Retraction of the tongue"]

name: Agenesis of permanent maxillary lateral incisor
description: Agenesis of one or more upper lateral secondary incisor.
synonyms: ["Agenesis of permanent upper lateral incisor","Failure of development of permanent maxillary lateral incisor","Failure of development of permanent upper lateral incisor"]

name: Perirenal hematoma
description: A collection of clotted blood surrounding the kidney.

name: Acidosis
description: Abnormal acid accumulation or depletion of base.

name: Stereotypical hand wringing
description: Habitual clasping and squeezing of the hands.

name: Multiple bladder diverticula
description: Presence of a many diverticula (sac or pouch) in the wall of the urinary bladder.

name: Abnormal foveal morphology on macular OCT
Glomerular hyalinosis away from the vascular and tubular poles
description: Accumulation of amorphous, eosinophilic, glassy, periodic acid-Schiff (PAS)-positive, silver-negative material in the glomerulus at neither tip nor perihilar/vascular poles. Both the vascular and the tubular pole are present in the glomerular cross section.

name: Febrile seizure (within the age range of 3 months to 6 years)
description: A febrile seizure is any type of seizure (most often a generalized tonic-clonic seizure) occurring with fever (at least 38 degrees Celsius) but in the absence of central nervous system infection, severe metabolic disturbance or other alternative precipitant in children between the ages of 3 months and 6 years.
synonyms: ["HP:0002175","HP:0007102","Febrile convulsion","Febrile seizures","Fever induced seizures","Seizures, febrile, in early childhood","Seizures, generalized, associated with fever"]

name: Truncus arteriosus
description: A single arterial trunk arises from the cardiac mass. The pulmonary arteries, aorta and coronary arteries arise from this single trunk with no evidence of another outflow tract.

name: Aplasia cutis congenita over the scalp vertex
description: A developmental defect resulting in the congenital absence of skin on the scalp vertex, often just lateral to the midline.
synonyms: ["Absent cutis congenita of vertex","Aplasia cutis congenita of vertex"]

name: Hypoplasia of the maxilla
description: Abnormally small dimension of the Maxilla. Usually creating a malocclusion or malalignment between the upper and lower teeth or resulting in a deficient amount of projection of the base of the nose and lower midface region.
synonyms: ["HP:0004644","Decreased size of maxilla","Decreased size of upper jaw","Deficiency of upper jaw bones","Hypoplasia of upper jaw bones","Hypoplastic maxillary bones","Maxillary deficiency","Maxillary hypoplasia","Maxillary micrognathia","Maxillary retrognathia","Maxillary retrusion","Micromaxilla","Small maxilla","Small upper jaw","Small upper jaw bones","Upper jaw deficiency","Upper jaw retrusion"]

name: Fasting hyperinsulinemia
description: An increased concentration of insulin in the blood in the fasting state, i.e., not as the response to food intake.

name: Spontaneous hematomas
description: Spontaneous development of hematomas (hematoma) or bruises without significant trauma.

name: Mild microcephaly
description: Decreased occipito-frontal (head) circumference (OFC). For the microcephaly OFC must be between -3 SD and -2 SD compared to appropriate, age matched, normal standards (i.e. -3 SD <= OFC < -2 SD).

name: Ivory epiphysis of the 1st metatarsal
description: The epiphysis of the 1st metatarsal appears hard and dense like ivory. An ivory epiphysis has a uniformly dense appearance on radiographs.
synonyms: ["Increased bone density of end part of the 1st long bone of foot"]

name: Abnormal PR segment
description: An anomaly of the PR segment, which begins at the endpoint of the P wave and ends at the onset of the QRS complex. The PR segment is normally flat and isoelectric.

name: Restlessness
description: A state of unease characterized by diffuse motor activity or motion subject to limited control, nonproductive or disorganized behavior, and subjective distress.

name: Decreased circulating gonadotropin concentration
description: A reduction of the circulating level of a gonadotropin, that is, of a protein hormone secreted by gonadotrope cells of the anterior pituitary of vertebrates. The primary gonadotropins are luteinizing hormone (LH) and follicle-stimulating hormone (FSH).

name: Dust mite allergy
description: Hypersensitivity in form of an adverse immune reaction against dust mites.
synonyms: ["Allergy to dust mites","Dust mite allergy","IgE-mediated dust mite allergy","Immunoglobulin E-mediated dust mite allergy"]

name: Increased circulating NT-proBNP concentration
description: An elevated level of circulating N-terminal part of the prohormone of B-type natriuretic peptide (BNP).

name: Renal arteriole intimal/medial multilamellation
description: Myointimal hyperplasia arranged in multiple concentric layers in the inner or middle layer of the arterioles of the kidney.
synonyms: ["Multilamellation (onion skinning) within renal arteriole intima/media","Renal arteriole intima/media multilamellation","Renal arteriole intimal/medial onion skinning"]

name: Knee pain
description: An unpleasant sensation characterized by physical discomfort (such as pricking, throbbing, or aching) localized to the knee.

name: Periorbital fullness
description: Increase in periorbital soft tissue.
synonyms: ["Periorbital puffiness","Periorbital swelling","Puffiness around eye","Puffy eyes","Swelling around the eyes"]

name: Double first metacarpals
description: Duplication of the metacarpal I bones.

name: Abnormal circulating serine concentration
description: Any deviation from the normal concentration of serine in the blood circulation.

name: Abnormal uvula morphology
description: Abnormality of the uvula, the conic projection from the posterior edge of the middle of the soft palate.
synonyms: ["Abnormality of palatine uvula","Abnormality of the uvula"]

name: Increased radioactive iodine uptake
description: An elevated amount of uptake on the radioactive iodine uptake (RAIU) test, which utilizes a radioisotope of iodine to measure how much iodine the thyroid gland absorbs from the blood. The radioactive marker is measured 4-6 hours and in some cases also 24 hours after administration of the radioactive marker.

name: Cortical sclerosis of the iliac wing
description: Increased density related to increased bone mass in the outermost layer (edge) of the iliac wing.

name: Stippling of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 5th toe
description: The presence of abnormal punctate (speckled, dot-like) calcifications in the epiphyses of the distal phalanx of the 5th toe.
synonyms: ["Speckled calcifications in the end part of the outermost bone of the little toe","Speckled calcifications in the end part of the outermost bone of the pinkie toe","Speckled calcifications in the end part of the outermost bone of the pinky toe"]

name: Muscle specific kinase antibody positivity
description: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against muscle specific kinase (anti-MuSK Ab).

name: Abnormal 3rd finger phalanx morphology
description: Abnormality of the phalanges of the 3rd (middle) finger.
synonyms: ["HP:0004155","Abnormality of 3rd finger phalanges","Abnormality of middle finger phalanges","Abnormality of the middle finger bones","Abnormality of the phalanges of the 3rd finger"]

name: Rosette
description: A halo or spoke-wheel arrangement of cells surrounding a central core or hub. The central hub may consist of an empty-appearing lumen or a space filled with cytoplasmic processes. The cytoplasm of each of the cells in the rosette is often wedge-shaped with the apex directed toward the central core; the nuclei of the cells participating in the rosette are peripherally positioned and form a ring or halo around the hub.

name: Abnormal blood phosphate concentration
description: An abnormality of phosphate homeostasis or concentration in the body.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the testes
description: Absence or underdevelopment of the testes.

name: Abnormal bone ossification
description: Any anomaly in the formation of bone or of a bony substance, or the conversion of fibrous tissue or of cartilage into bone or a bony substance.
