name: Abnormality of the orbital region
synonyms: ["HP:0000284","Abnormality of the eye region","Abnormality of the region around the eyes"]

name: Loss of facial adipose tissue
description: Loss of normal subcutaneous fat tissue in the face.
synonyms: ["Decreased amount of facial adipose tissue","Decreased amount of facial fat","Decreased volume of facial adipose tissue","Loss of facial fat","Loss of facial subcutaneous adipose tissue","Loss of subcutaneous adipose tissue from face"]

name: Cystic angiomatosis of bone
description: Disseminated multifocal hemangiomatous or lymphangiomatous lesions of the skeleton. The lesions are lytic, well-defined, round or oval lesions within the medullary cavity, and they have an intact cortex, and manifest variable peripheral sclerosis and may exhibit endosteal scalloping.

name: Bracket epiphysis of the middle phalanx of the 2nd finger
description: An abnormality of the middle phalanx of the second finger in which the epiphysis surrounds a phalangeal bone, having a bracket-like form and reaching from the proximal side of a phalanx to the distal side.
synonyms: ["Bracket shaped end part of the middle long bone of the index finger"]

name: Decreased Arden ratio of electrooculogram
description: An abnormal reduction in the Arden ratio, which is the ratio between the light peak and the dark trough of the smoothed (physiologic) EOG record.

name: Elevated urinary N-butyrylglycine
description: An increased level of N-butyrylglycine in the urine.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the tibia
description: Absence or underdevelopment of the tibia.
synonyms: ["Absent/hypoplastic tibia","Absent/small shankbone","Absent/small shinbone","Absent/underdeveloped shankbone","Absent/underdeveloped shinbone","Aplastic/hypoplastic tibia"]

name: Parasomnia
description: An undesirable physical event or experience that occurs during entry into sleep, during sleep, or during arousal from sleep.

name: Anti-Su antigen/argonaute 2 antibody positivity
description: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against Su antigen/argonaute 2.

name: Abnormal sperm motility
description: An anomaly of the mobility of ejaculated sperm.

name: Exodeviation
description: A manifest or latent ocular deviation in which one or both eyes tends to deviate temporally.

name: Rod-cone dystrophy
description: An inherited retinal disease subtype in which the rod photoreceptors appear to be more severely affected than the cone photoreceptors. Typical presentation is with nyctalopia (due to rod dysfunction) followed by loss of mid-peripheral field of vision, which gradually extends and leaves many patients with a small central island of vision due to the preservation of macular cones.

name: Premature epimetaphyseal fusion in radius
description: Stop of growth at the epiphyseal plate the hyaline cartilage plate in the metaphysis at one or more long bones in the radius, at an earlier than normal age, resulting in growth arrest and shortening of the involved bone.

name: EEG with hyperventilation-induced generalized epileptiform discharges
description: Generalized epileptiform discharges induced by hyperventilation (overbreathing) in cerebral electrical activity recorded along the scalp by electroencephalography (EEG).

name: Anti-H3-H4 antibody positivity
description: The presence of autoantibodies in the blood circulation that react against the H3-H4 histone dimer.

name: Palmoplantar erythema
description: Redness of the skin of the palm of the hand and the sole of the foot caused by hyperemia of the capillaries in the lower layers of the skin.

name: Pseudoepiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 2nd toe
Multiple prenatal fractures
description: The presence of bone fractures in the prenatal period that are diagnosed at birth or before.
synonyms: ["HP:0002811","HP:0005761","Congenital bone fractures","Multiple fractures present at birth","Multiple fractures, present at birth","Numerous multiple fractures present at birth","Numerous multiple fractures that are present at birth"]

name: Abnormality of the epiphyses of the distal phalanx of finger
description: Any anomaly of distal epiphysis of phalanx of finger.
synonyms: ["Abnormality of the end part of the outermost bone of finger"]

name: Absent epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 5th toe
synonyms: ["Absent end part of the outermost bone of the little toe","Absent end part of the outermost bone of the pinkie toe","Absent end part of the outermost bone of the pinky toe"]

name: Abdominal obesity
description: Excessive fat around the stomach and abdomen.

name: Short middle phalanx of the 4th finger
description: Hypoplastic/small middle phalanx of the 4th finger, also known as the ring finger.
synonyms: ["HP:0004205","HP:0004206","Brachymesophalangy IV (finger)","Hypoplastic/small middle phalanx of ring finger","Hypoplastic/small middle phalanx of the 4th finger","Short middle bone of 4th finger","Short middle phalanx of ring finger"]

name: Abnormal amyloid beta peptide CSF concentration
description: Any anomaly in the concentration of a cleaved APP amyloid beta protein fragment in the cerebrospinal fluid.

name: Hematological neoplasm
description: Neoplasms located in the blood and blood-forming tissue (the bone marrow and lymphatic tissue).

name: Abnormal periosteum morphology
description: An anomalous structure of the periosteum, i.e., of the membrane that covers the outer surface of bones.

name: Vomiting
description: Forceful ejection of the contents of the stomach through the mouth by means of a series of involuntary spasmic contractions.

name: Hyponatremia
description: An abnormally decreased sodium concentration in the blood.

name: Abnormality of cytokine secretion
description: An abnormality in the production or cellular release of a cytokine (i.e., any of the non-antibody proteins made by inflammatory leukocytes and some non-leukocytic cells that affect the behavior of other cells).

name: Bracket epiphyses of the 3rd finger
description: An abnormality of the third finger in which the epiphysis surrounds a phalangeal bone, having a bracket-like form and reaching from the proximal side of a phalanx to the distal side.
synonyms: ["Bracket shaped end part of middle finger bone"]

name: Decreased CSF 5-methyltetrahydrofolate concentration
description: A reduced concentration of 5-methyltetrahydrofolate(2-) in the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF). 5-methyltetrahydrofolate is the active folate metabolite.

name: Elevated intracellular cystine
description: An increased concentration of cystine within cells. This finding can be demonstrated on leukocytes, but is not specific to blood cells.

name: Abnormal muscle fiber dystrophin expression
description: A deviation from normal in the amount of dystrophin in muscle fiber tissue. Dystrophin is located at the muscle sarcolemma in a membrane-spanning protein complex that connects the cytoskeleton to the basal lamina.

name: obsolete Vocal cord paralysis (caused by tumor impingement)
Eyelid myokymia
description: Involuntary, fine, continuous, undulating contractions of the eyelid.

name: Uterine leiomyoma
description: The presence of a leiomyoma of the uterus.

name: Widely patent fontanelles and sutures
description: An abnormally increased width of the cranial fontanelles and sutures.

name: Fallopian tube torsion
description: A twisting of the Fallopian tube. Sudden onset with sharp, colicky pelvic pain associated with nausea, vomiting, bowel, and bladder symptoms is the usual presentation.

name: Testicular seminoma
description: The presence of a seminoma, an undifferentiated germ cell tumor of the testis.

name: Increased urine sebacic acid concentration
description: Elevated concentration of sebacic acid in the urine.

name: Secondary vesicoureteral reflux
description: Vesicoureteral reflux induced by increased bladder pressures in patients with voiding dysfunction e.g. in case of congenital posterior urethral valves or neurogenic bladder dysfunction.

name: Esophageal ulceration
description: Defect in the epithelium of the esophagus, essentially an open sore in the lining of the esophagus.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the proximal phalanx of the 4th finger
synonyms: ["HP:0004203","Absent/small innermost ring finger bone","Absent/underdeveloped innermost ring finger bone"]

name: Optic disc hypoplasia
description: Underdevelopment of the optic disc, that is of the optic nerve head, where ganglion cell axons exit the eye to form the optic nerve.

name: Nasolacrimal duct obstruction
description: Blockage of the lacrimal duct.

name: Macular schisis
description: Splitting of the retina in the macular region.

name: Nevus roseus
description: A variant of port-wine stain characterized by a pale red or even pink tone, in contrast to the darker hue of the port-wine stain. By analogy with the term port-wine stain, this variant rose-wine stain, or nevus roseus. Nevus roseus, however, cannot be definitely diagnosed until adulthood as port-wine stains are sometimes pink in children. While the natural history of port-wine stains includes hypertrophy, darkening, and nodularity, nevus roseus remains unchanged for life.

name: Sclerotic scapulae
description: Increased density of the bony tissue of the scapula.

name: Bullet-shaped distal phalanx of the 4th toe
description: An abnormal morphology of the distal phalanx of the fourth toe, with a short and wide phalanx that tapers distally. Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction.

name: Oval macrocytosis
description: Enlarged, oval-shaped erythrocytes (red blood cells).

name: Weakness of the intrinsic hand muscles
Long distal phalanx of finger
description: Increased length of the distal phalanx of finger.

name: Abnormal CSF amyloid level
description: Abnormal concentration of amyloid in the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF).

name: Tessier number 10 facial cleft
description: In a Number 10 Tessier cleft there is an upper central orbital cleft with a cleft of the middle one-third of the upper eyelid, which often results in total ablepharia. The eyebrow is disrupted, being virtually absent medially, whereas the lateral portion angles upward toward the frontal hairline. There may be ocular anomalies, including colobomata of the iris. The skeletal cleft is through the midportion of the supraorbital rim, the adjacent frontal bone, and the orbital roof lateral to the supraorbital nerve. A frontal encephalocele frequently occupies the frontal bony cleft. The palpebral fissure is grossly elongated with an amblyopic eye displaced inferiorly and laterally. There is also a divergent squint of the right eye. The eyebrow is deficient medially and becomes thinned out laterally , where it is contiguous with a broad downward and forward projection of the frontotemporal hairline (this may be seen in both the Number 9 and 10 clefts.) A broad frontal encephalocele bulges forward from the middle one-third of the right forehead, supraorbital ridge, and orbital roof. The bony cleft, through which the frontal encephalocele presents, involves the anterior half of the orbital roof, the supraorbital rim, and two-thirds of the vertical height of the frontal bone lateral to the supraorbital nerve. The bony orbit is inferiorly displaced and widened with the lateral orbital wall shortened and laterally deviated. Similar distortion of the anterior cranial fossa is evident, being broader and more flattened on the affected side. The calvarium above the level of the cleft and the cranial base below is symmetric.

name: Chronic active hepatitis
description: Chronic hepatitis associated with recurrent clinical exacerbations, extrahepatic manifestations, and progression to cirrhosis.

name: Decreased VLDL cholesterol concentration
description: A reduction in the amount of very-low-density lipoprotein cholesterol in the blood.

name: Focal undressing automatism seizure
description: A type of focal automatism seizure characterized by involuntary undressing at onset.

name: Hypereosinophilia
description: A severely increased count of eosinophils in the blood defined as a blood eosinophil count of at least 1.5 billion cells per liter.

name: Focal aware orofacial automatism seizure
description: A type of focal automatism seizure characterized by orofacial automatisms at onset and during which awareness is fully retained throughout.

name: Congenitally corrected transposition of the great arteries with ventricular septal defect
description: A congenitally corrected transposition of the great arteries with a ventricular septal defect: a hole between the two bottom chambers (ventricles) of the heart. The ventricular septal defect is centered around the most superior aspect of the ventricular septum.

name: Absent fetal nasal bone
description: The nasal bone is considered absent when it is not visualized on a midsagittal view of the profile. In the second trimester, a true midsagittal view of the fetal profile is obtained and magnified to fill the majority of the image space. The nasal bone appears as an echogenic linear structure below the skin edge. The optimal angle of insonation is 45 degrees to the longitudinal axis of the fetal nasal bone. If the angle of insonation is 0 or 180 degrees, the nasal bone may appear artificially absent. The presence or absence of the nasal bone may be determined at the time of the 11- to 14-week ultrasound examination and used as part of the risk assessment for aneuploidy.
synonyms: ["Absence of fetal nasal bone","Unossified nasal bone"]

name: Congenital extraocular muscle anomaly
description: Congenital abnormality of the extraocular muscles.

name: Interlobular intima/media venosclerosis
description: Thickening of the intima with fibrosis and/or duplication of the elastic lamina in interlobular veins of the kidney.

name: Ivory epiphyses of the 3rd finger
description: Sclerosis of the epiphyses of the 3rd finger, leading to an increased degree of radiopacity (white or ivory appearance) in X-rays.
synonyms: ["Increased bone density of end part of the middle finger bone"]

name: Fatty casts
description: A type of acellular urinary casts that contain lipid droplets, oval fat bodies or cholesterol crystals, and are often associated with the free forms of these elements. Their identification may require the use of polarised light microscopy, under which fatty particles embedded into the cast matrix appear as Maltese crosses.

name: Dialeptic seizure
description: A dialeptic seizure is a type of seizure characterised predominantly by reduced responsiveness or awareness and with subsequent at least partial amnesia of the event.
synonyms: ["Behavioral arrest seizure with impairment of awareness irrespective of onset","Behavioural arrest seizure with impairment of awareness irrespective of onset","Unknown onset behavioral arrest seizure with impairment of awareness","Unknown onset behavioural arrest seizure with impairment of awareness"]

name: Lupus nephritis
description: Lupus nephritis is a type of glomerulonephritis that constitutes one of the most severe organ manifestations of systemic lupus erythematosus. Lupus nephritis is subclassified in six distinct classes, that represent different manifestations and severities of renal involvement and guide the therapeutic management.

name: Abnormality of the peripheral nervous system
description: Any abnormality of the part of the nervous system that consists of the nerves and ganglia outside of the brain and spinal cord.

name: Digital pitting scar
description: Pinhole-sized concave depressions with hyperkeratosis in the skin of a finger or toe.

name: Exercise-induced rhabdomyolysis
description: Rhabdomyolysis induced by exercise.

name: Absent frontal sinuses
description: Aplasia of frontal sinus.
synonyms: ["HP:0005452","HP:0005475","Absence of frontal sinuses","Absent frontal sinus","Missing frontal sinus"]

name: Abnormality of the amniotic fluid
description: Abnormality of the amniotic fluid, which is the fluid contained in the amniotic sac surrounding the developing fetus.

name: Anal pain
description: Pain in and around the anus or rectum (perianal region).

name: Fragmentation of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd toe
synonyms: ["Fragmentation of the end part of the innermost bone of the 2nd toe"]

name: Peripapillary chorioretinal atrophy
description: Chorioretinal atrophy concentrated around the optic papilla (i.e., the optic nerve head).

name: Inguinal abscess
description: A circumscribed area of pus or necrotic debris in the groin (inguinal region).

name: Fourth cranial nerve palsy
description: Paralysis of the fourth cranial (trochlear) nerve manifested as weakness of the superior oblique muscle which causes vertical diplopia that is maximal when the affected eye is adducted and directed inferiorly.

name: Talar aplasia
description: Absent talus owing to a congenital defect.

name: Severe viral infection
description: An unusually severe viral infection.

name: Abnormality of the ulna
description: An abnormality of the ulna bone of the forearm.

name: Fibrous dysplasia of the bones
description: Tumor-like growths that consist of replacement of the medullary bone with fibrous tissue, causing the expansion and weakening of the areas of bone involved. Especially when involving the skull or facial bones, the lesions can cause externally visible deformities. The skull is often, but not necessarily, affected, and any other bone or bones may be involved. Fibrous dysplasia can either effect isolated bones (Monostotic fibrous dysplasia) or also generalized all bones of the body (Polyostotic fibrous dysplasia).

name: Cutis marmorata
description: A reticular discoloration of the skin with cyanotic (reddish-blue appearing) areas surrounding pale central areas due to dilation of capillary blood vessels and stagnation of blood within the vessels. Cutis marmorata generally occurs on the legs, arms and trunk and is often more severe in cold weather.

name: Abnormal uridine diphosphate glucose-4-epimerase level in plasma
description: An abnormality in uridine diphosphate glucose-4-epimerase level in plasma. Uridine diphosphate glucose-4-epimerase catalyzes the reaction: UDP-glucose = UDP-galactose.

name: Homer Wright rosette
description: A type of rosette in which the central lumen or hub is filled with fiber-like processes.

name: Abnormal EKG
description: Abnormal rhythm of the heart.

name: Aphasic status epilepticus
description: Aphasic status epilepticus is a type of focal non-convulsive status epilepticus without coma characterized by a cognitive (rather than motor) language deficit.

name: Posterior polar cataract
description: A polar cataract that affects the posterior pole of the lens.

name: Fibular bowing
description: A bending or abnormal curvature of the fibula.

name: Partial duplication of the distal phalanx of the 3rd toe
description: Partial duplication of distal phalanx of third toe.
synonyms: ["Partial duplication of the distal phalanx of the third toe","Partial duplication of the outermost bone of the 3rd toe"]

name: Absent scaphoid
description: Congenital absence of the scaphoid..

name: Nonossified fifth metatarsal
description: The presence of a fifth metatarsal bone that has not undergone ossification at an age when ossification is usually visible.

name: Increased core 1 O-glycan level
description: An abnormal increase in the concentration of core 1 O-glycans on glycoproteins.

name: Decreased light- and dark-adapted electroretinogram amplitude
description: Descreased amplitude of eletrical response upon electroretinography.
synonyms: ["HP:0007636","HP:0007689","HP:0007845","Decreased amplitudes on flash visual electroretinogram","Decreased electroretinogram","Decreased electroretinogram amplitude","Decreased electroretinogram response","Decreased ERG amplitude","Flattened or absent electroretinogram","Reduced electroretinogram","Reduced ERG","Reduced or abolished electroretinogram"]

name: Microprolactinoma
description: A pituitary prolactin cell adenoma of less than 10 mm diameter.

name: Glomerular endocapillary hypercellularity
description: Hypercellularity due to increased number of cells within glomerular capillary lumina, causing narrowing of the lumina.

name: Iodine contrast allergy
description: Allergy to iodine contrast media used in radiological studies.

name: Calcium nephrolithiasis
description: The presence of calcium-containing calculi (stones) in the kidneys.
synonyms: ["Ca kidney stone","Ca nephrolithiasis","Ca2+ kidney stone","Ca2+ nephrolithiasis","Calcium kidney stone"]

name: Cystic pattern on pulmonary HRCT
description: On pulmonary high-resolution computed tomography, the cystic pattern is composed by well-defined, round and circumscribed air-containing parenchymal spaces with a well-defined wall and interface with normal lung. The wall of the cysts may be uniform or varied in thickness, but usually is thin (less than 2 mm) and occurs without associated emphysema.

name: Abnormality of tibia morphology
description: Abnormality of the tibia (shinbone).
synonyms: ["Abnormality of the shankbone","Abnormality of the shinbone"]

name: Contracture of the interphalangeal joint of the hallux
description: The interphalangeal joint of the big toe cannot be straightened actively or passively.

name: Chronic lymphatic leukemia
description: A chronic lymphocytic/lymphatic/lymphoblastic leukemia (CLL) is a neoplastic disease characterized by proliferation and accumulation (blood, marrow and lymphoid organs) of morphologically mature but immunologically dysfunctional lymphocytes. A CLL is always a B-cell lymphocytic leukemia as there are no reports of cases of T-cell lymphocytic leukemias.
synonyms: ["HP:0006734","HP:0006760","Chronic lymphatic leukaemia","Chronic lymphocytic leukaemia","Chronic lymphocytic leukemia"]

name: Reduced leukocyte alkaline phosphatase
description: Decreased alkaline phosphatase measured within leukocytes.

name: Intercrural pterygium
description: A pterygium (or pterygia) in the intercrural (groin) region.

name: Hydroa vacciniforme
description: In response to the spring sun distinct inflamed reddened skin develops on the ears, nose, cheeks, fingers, backs of the hands, and the lower arms, on which blisters with serous or hemorrhagic content develop. These dry out with the formation of a blackish scab. After shedding of the scab, depressed, varioliform, often hypopigmented scars remain. In addition, hyper- and hypopigmentation are present together, resulting in a polymorphous skin presentation.
synonyms: ["Acute vesiculation and crusting and scarring following sun exposure"]

name: Thyroid hypoplasia
description: Developmental hypoplasia of the thyroid gland.

name: Abnormal pulmonary valve cusp morphology
description: Any structural anomaly of the pulmonary valve leaflets.

name: Chronic metabolic acidosis
description: Longstanding metabolic acidosis.

name: Distal lower limb muscle weakness
description: Reduced strength of the distal musculature of the legs.
synonyms: ["HP:0003485","HP:0009035","Distal muscle weakness in lower limbs","Muscle weakness, lower limb, distal"]

name: Abnormal hypoxanthine-guanine phosphoribosyltransferase level
description: Altered level of the enzyme that catalyzes conversion of hypoxanthine to inosine monophosphate and guanine to guanosine monophosphate via transfer of the 5-phosphoribosyl group from 5-phosphoribosyl 1-pyrophosphate.
synonyms: ["Abnormal 6-hydroxypurine phosphoribosyltransferase level","Abnormal GMP pyrophosphorylase level","Abnormal GPRT level"]

name: Alternating hypertropia
description: A type of vertical tropia in which, when one eye is fixing, the other eye is deviated upwards.

name: Interlobular vein intima/media necrosis
description: Cell death (necrosis) in the inner or middle layer of the interlobular vein of the kidney.

name: Hypodontia
description: The absence of five or less teeth from the normal series by a failure to develop.
synonyms: ["Failure of development of between one and six teeth"]

name: Decreased lacrimation
description: Abnormally decreased lacrimation, that is, reduced ability to produce tears.

name: Delayed menarche
description: First period after the age of 15 years.

name: Copper accumulation in liver
description: An anomalous build up of copper (Cu) in the liver.

name: Reticular
description: Applies to an abnormality whose distribution and appearance resembles a net or network-like structure.

name: Lower limb undergrowth
description: Leg shortening because of underdevelopment of one or more bones of the lower extremity.
synonyms: ["HP:0003087","HP:0005884","HP:0006399","Hypoplasia involving bones of the lower limbs","Hypoplasia of the lower limbs","Lower limb undergrowth","Underdeveloped lower limb bones"]

name: Abnormality of skeletal muscle fiber size
description: Any abnormality of the size of the skeletal muscle cell.

name: Odontoma
description: The presence of an odontoma.

name: Anomalous trichromacy
description: Individuals with anomalous trichromacy possess three types of cones, but one of the three types of cones has an abnormal spectral sensitivity compared to normal cones.

name: Anti-H1 antibody positivity
description: The presence of autoantibodies in the blood circulation that react against histone H1.

name: Dilatation of the sinus of Valsalva
description: Abnormal outpouching or sac-like dilatation of one of the anatomic dilations of the ascending aorta, which occurs just above the aortic valve.

name: Increased salivary cortisol level
description: Abnormally elevated concentration of cortisol in saliva.

name: Increased cerebral lipofuscin
description: Lipofuscin (age pigment) is a brown-yellow, electron-dense, autofluorescent material that accumulates progressively over time in lysosomes of postmitotic cells, such as neurons and cardiac myocytes. This term pertains if there is an increase in the accumulation of lipofuscin (also known as autofluorescent lipoprotein) more than expected for the age of the patient.

name: Elevated circulating parathyroid hormone level
description: An abnormal increased concentration of parathyroid hormone.
synonyms: ["Elevated circulating PTH level","Elevated serum parathyroid hormone","Elevated serum parathyroid hormone level","Elevated serum pth","Increased serum parathyroid hormone"]

name: Sterile arthritis
description: An inflammatory arthritis characterized by purulent synovial fluid with neutrophil accumulation, but with negative cultures.

name: Lateral femoral bowing
description: A lateral bending or abnormal curvature of the femur.

name: Anterior chamber flare grade 3+
description: Marked anterior chamber flare (iris and lens details hazy).

name: Irregular epiphysis of the middle phalanx of the 5th finger
description: Irregular radiographic opacity of the epiphysis of the middle phalanx of the 5th finger.
synonyms: ["Irregular end part of the middle bone of the little finger","Irregular end part of the middle bone of the pinkie finger","Irregular end part of the middle bone of the pinky finger"]

name: Cavernous hemangioma
description: The presence of a cavernous hemangioma. A hemangioma characterized by large endothelial spaces (caverns) is called a cavernous hemangioma.
synonyms: ["Cavernous angioma","Cavernous haemangioma","Collection of dilated blood vessels that forms mass"]

name: Vaginal pruritus
description: A sensation of itching in the vagina.

name: Hyperreflexia
description: Hyperreflexia is the presence of hyperactive stretch reflexes of the muscles.

name: Perivascular fibrosis
description: The presence of thick collagen bundles around blood vessels, often in an onion-skin type whorling pattern.

name: Keratoconjunctivitis sicca
description: Dryness of the eye related to deficiency of the tear film components (aqueous, mucin, or lipid), lid surface abnormalities, or epithelial abnormalities. Keratoconjunctivitis sicca often results in a scratchy or sandy sensation (foreign body sensation) in the eyes, and may also be associated with itching, inability to produce tears, photosensitivity, redness, pain, and difficulty in moving the eyelids.

name: Abnormality of molar
description: An abnormality of molar tooth.

name: Abnormal ossification of the sacrum
description: Abnormal bone tissue formation (ossification) affecting the sacrum.

name: Anti-type I liver-kidney microsomal antibody positivity
description: The presence of type I liver-kidney microsomal autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation.
synonyms: ["Anti-liver kidney microsomal type 1 antibody positivity","Anti-LKM1 antibody positivity"]

name: Abnormality of the metaphysis
description: An abnormality of one or more metaphysis, i.e., of the somewhat wider portion of a long bone that is adjacent to the epiphyseal growth plate and grows during childhood.
synonyms: ["HP:0006506","Abnormality of the wide portion of a long bone"]

name: Macroorchidism
description: The presence of abnormally large testes.

name: Blepharitis
description: Inflammation of the eyelids.

name: Triangular epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger
synonyms: ["HP:0004130","Triangular end part of innermost long bone of index finger","Triangular epiphysis of proximal index finger phalanx"]

name: obsolete Hepatic abscesses due to immunodeficiency
Perioral hyperpigmentation
description: Increased pigmentation, either focal or generalized, of the skin surrounding the vermilion of the lips.
synonyms: ["Darkening of skin around the mouth","Increased pigmentation around the mouth"]

name: Dermatographic urticaria
description: An exaggerated whealing tendency when the skin is stroked, that is, formation of red, itchy bumps and lines on the skin as a result of pressure on the skin (for instance, stroking the skin with a pen or tongue depressor).

name: Focal sensory seizure with cephalic sensation
description: A seizure characterized by a sensation in the head such as light-headedness or headache as its first clinical manifestation.
synonyms: ["Cephalic aura","Focal seizure with cephalic sensation","Partial seizure with cephalic sensation"]

name: Extraadrenal pheochromocytoma
description: Pheochromocytoma not originating from the adrenal medulla but from another source such as from chromaffin cells in or about sympathetic ganglia.

name: Pancreatitis
description: The presence of inflammation in the pancreas.

name: Translamellar aortic medial fibrosis
description: A type of aortic medial fibrosis in which the increase in collagen is more scar-like, altering the arrangement of the lamellar units.

name: Bell-shaped thorax
description: The rib cage has the shape of a wide mouthed bell. That is, the superior portion of the rib cage is constricted, followed by a convex region, and the inferior portion of the rib cage expands again to have a large diameter.

name: Temporomandibular joint ankylosis
description: Bony fusion of the mandibular condyle to the base of the skull, resulting in limitation of jaw opening.
synonyms: ["Ankylosis of temporomandibular joint","Freezing of jaw joint","Freezing of the temporomandibular joint","Rigidity of the temporomandibular joint","Temporomandibular joint fusion"]

name: Arcuate artery intima/media coagulative necrosis
description: A type of arcuate artery intima/media necrosis in which the necrotic tissue retains the outlines of the dead (necrotic) structures.

name: Abnormality of the premaxilla
description: An abnormality of the premaxilla, the most anterior part of the maxilla that usually bears the central and lateral incisors and includes the anterior nasal spine and inferior aspect of the piriform rim. The premaxilla contains the bone and teeth of the primary palate.
synonyms: ["Abnormality of the intermaxillary bone","Abnormality of the intermaxillary segment of the maxilla","Abnormality of the premaxillary bone","Abnormality of the primary palate bone"]

name: Abnormality of the humerus
description: An abnormality of the humerus (i.e., upper arm bone).

name: Plantar crease between first and second toes
description: The presence of unusually deep creases (ridges/wrinkles) on the skin of sole of foot located between the first and second toe.

name: CSF lymphocytic pleiocytosis
description: An increased lymphocyte count in the cerebrospinal fluid.

name: Renal dysplasia
description: The presence of developmental dysplasia of the kidney.

name: Dorsal hirsutism
description: Abnormally increased hair growth in the lskin of the back.

name: Hyporeflexia
description: Reduction of neurologic reflexes such as the knee-jerk reaction.

name: Cerebrospinal fluid rhinorrhoea
description: Drainage of cerebrospinal fluid through the nose. This can occur when there is a fistula between the dura and the skull base and discharge of cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) from the nose.

name: Abnormal platelet volume
description: Anomalous size of platelets. Most normal sized platelets are 1.5 to 3 micrometers in diameter. Large platelets are 4 to 7 micrometers. Giant platelets are larger than 7 micrometers and usually 10 to 20 micrometers.

name: Abnormal iliac artery morphology
description: Any structural anomaly of the iliac artery.

name: Diaphyseal sclerosis
description: An elevation in bone density in one or more diaphyses. Sclerosis is normally detected on a radiograph as an area of increased opacity.
synonyms: ["HP:0005611","Craniodiaphyseal osteosclerosis","Diaphyseal osteosclerosis","Increased bone density in shaft of long bone"]

name: Increased amyloid beta 40 peptide CSF concentration
description: An elevation above the normal concentration of amyloid beta 40 peptide in the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF).

name: Abnormal total hemolytic complement activity
description: Any deviation from the normal total hemolytic complement activity in the circulation.

name: Abnormality of intrinsic muscle of tongue
description: An abnormality of an intrinsic muscle of tongue.

name: Focal aware cognitive seizure with forced thinking
description: A focal cognitive seizure with forced thinking characterized by retained awareness throughout the seizure.

name: Glioblastoma multiforme
description: A tumor arising from glia in the central nervous system with macroscopic regions of necrosis and hemorrhage. Microscopically, glioblastoma multiforme is characterized by regions of pseudopalisading necrosis, pleomorphic nuclei and cells, and microvascular proliferation.

name: Neoplasm of the oral cavity
description: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the oral cavity.

name: Increased urinary disaccharide excretion
description: Increased concentration of disaccharide in the urine.

name: Patchy sclerosis of the proximal phalanx of the 3rd toe
synonyms: ["Uneven increase in bone density in the innermost bone of the 3rd toe"]

name: Cone-shaped epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 3rd toe
synonyms: ["Cone-shaped end part of the outermost bone of the 3rd toe"]

name: Fast-growing nails
description: Nails whose growth is quicker than normal.

name: Abnormal central response of multifocal electroretinogram
Clumsiness
description: Lack of physical coordination resulting in an abnormal tendency to drop items or bump into objects.

name: Congenital contracture
description: One or more flexion contractures (a bent joint that cannot be straightened actively or passively) that are present at birth.

name: Progressive loss of facial adipose tissue
synonyms: ["Atrophy of facial adipose tissue","Facial fat atrophy","Facial fat wasting","Loss of subcutaneous adipose tissue from face, progressive","Progressive loss of facial fat","Progressive loss of facial subcutaneous adipose tissue","Progressive loss of subcutaneous adipose tissue from face"]

name: EEG with changes in voltage
description: EEG with abnormal amplitude.

name: Anomalous origin of the circumflex artery from the right sinus of Valsalva
description: The circumflex coronary artery originates from the right aortic sinus of Valsalva.

name: Short nail
description: Decreased length of nail.

name: Gastric varix
description: Extreme dilation of the submucusoal veins in the stomach.

name: Abnormal functional residual capacity
description: A deviation from normal values for the functional residual capacity, which is defined as the volume remaining in the lungs after a normal, passive exhalation.

name: Increased urinary taurine
description: Increased concentration of taurine in the urine.

name: Abnormal male germ cell morphology
description: A structural anomaly of a male reproductive cell.

name: Abnormal red nucleus morphology
description: Any structural anomaly of the red nucleus, a part of the midbrain involved in control of movement.

name: Aphthous ulcer
description: Oral aphthous ulcers typically present as painful, sharply circumscribed fibrin-covered mucosal defects with a hyperemic border.

name: Cardiac hemangioma
description: Abnormal proliferation of blood vessels within the cardiac cavities attached to the endocardium.

name: Multiple cutaneous leiomyomas
description: The presence of multiple leiomyomas of the skin.

name: Abnormality of levator veli palatini muscle
description: An abnormality of a levator veli palatini.

name: Typical atrial flutter
description: Typical atrial flutter is an organised atrial tachycardia. It can also be defined as a macroreentrant tachycardia confined to the right atrium. This arrhythmia has a 200-260 ms cycle length, although it may fluctuate depending on patient's previous treatment or ablation, congenital heart disease, etc. Ventricular rate response will be limited by the atrioventricular node conductions, usually presenting a 2:1 or 3:1 response, during atrial flutter. Typical (counter clockwise) flutter is associated with the common flutter pattern: a regular continuous undulation with dominant negative deflections in inferior leads II, III and aVF, often described also as a saw tooth pattern, and flat atrial deflections in leads I and aVL. Atrial deflections in V1 can be positive, biphasic or negative.

name: Ossifying fibroma of the jaw
description: A benign central bone tumor of the jaw composed of fibrous connective tissue within which bone is formed.

name: Hypernatriuria
description: An increased concentration of sodium(1+) in the urine.

name: Congenital stationary night blindness with normal fundus
Michaelis-Gutmann bodies
description: Basophilic intracytoplasmic inclusions in macrophages. The inclusions have a small, round laminated appearance. Electron microscopy of Michaelis-Gutmann bodies exhibits partially digested bacteria.

name: Storage in hepatocytes
description: Hepatocytes (liver parenchymal cells) exhibit a bloated appearance because of expansion of the cytoplasm by accumulated material.

name: Retinopathy of prematurity zone I
description: Retinopathy which extends from the center of the optic disc to twice the distance from the center of the optic disc to the center of the macula.

name: Pilonidal sinus
description: A sinus in the coccygeal region (the region of the intergluteal cleft). A pilonidal sinus often contains hair and skin debris.

name: Cardiac sarcoma
description: A malignant soft tissue neoplasm that arises from the heart.

name: Decreased phosphoribosylpyrophosphate synthetase level
description: Abnormally reduced level of the enzyme phosphoribosyl pyrophosphatesynthetase, which catalyzes the synthesis of PP-ribose-P from ATP and ribose-5-phosphate.

name: obsolete Defective dehydrogenation of isovaleryl CoA and butyryl CoA
Type II cryptotia
description: A type of cryptotia associated with reduction in size of the antihelix and inferior crus that are affected.

name: Duplicated odontoid process
description: The presence of two distinct odontoid processes. The odontoid process, also known as the dens of the axis, is a protuberance of the C2 vertebral body around which the first vertebra rotates.

name: Rightward direction of ventricular apex
description: Abnormal plane of direction of the heart from the base to the apex towards the right. Left sided is normal.

name: Humeroradial synostosis
description: An abnormal osseous union (fusion) between the radius and the humerus.
synonyms: ["HP:0003936","Fusion of upper and lower arm bones","Humeral radial synostosis","Humeral-radial synostosis","Radiohumeral synostosis of elbow","Synostosis of radius and humerus"]

name: Laryngeal hypoplasia
description: Underdevelopment of the larynx.

name: Cortical radial artery intimal mucoid edema
description: Accumulation of edematous extracellular matrix in the intima of the cortical radial artery (also known as the interlobular artery) of the kidney. This material resembles mucus and stains pale blue on hematoxylin and eosin staining.
synonyms: ["Intimal mucoid edema within interlobular arterial intima/media"]

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia involving the musculature of the extremities
synonyms: ["Absent/small muscles of extremities","Absent/underdeveloped muscles of extremities"]

name: 2-3 finger syndactyly
description: Syndactyly with fusion of fingers two and three.

name: Increased serum leptin
description: An increased concentration of leptin in the blood.

name: Latent hypermetropia
description: A term to describe when farsightedness is masked when the accommodative muscles are used to increase the focusing power of the eye.

name: Female anorgasmia
description: The persistent of recurrent difficulty, delay in, or absence of attaining orgasm following sufficient sexual stimulation and arousal.

name: Reduced forced expiratory volume in one second
description: An abnormal reduction in the amount of air a person can forcefully expel in one second.

name: Redundant skin
description: Loose and sagging skin often associated with loss of skin elasticity.
synonyms: ["HP:0007391","Loose redundant skin","Redundant skin folds","Sagging, redundant skin"]

name: Abnormality of the vitamin B3 metabolism
Leukocyte cylindruria
description: Presence of leukocyte casts (cylindrical structures produced by the kidney in certain disease states) in the urine.

name: Decreased size of nerve terminals
description: A reduction in the size of nerve terminals.

name: Absent foot
description: The total absence of the foot, with no bony elements distal to the tibia or fibula.

name: Abnormal vertebral pedicle morphology
description: Abnormal morphology of a vertebral pedical.

name: Neurodevelopmental delay
description: Neurodevelopmental delay (NDD) refers to delays in the maturation of the brain and central nervous system; infants and young children with NDD may experience delays in the development of one or more skills including gross motor abilities, fine-motor coordination, language abilities and ability to solve increasingly complex problems.

name: Symphalangism affecting the middle phalanges of the toes
Vaginal fistula
description: The presence of a fistula of the vagina.

name: Intestinal polyp
description: A discrete abnormal tissue mass that protrudes into the lumen of the intestine and is attached to the intestinal wall either by a stalk, pedunculus, or a broad base.

name: Liver kidney microsome type 1 antibody positivity
description: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against P450 2D6, a cytochrome P450 mono-oxygenase. Anti-LKM-1 antibodies are considered to be a diagnostic marker of autoimmune hepatitis type 2 (AIH2).

name: Vaginal hernia
description: The presence of a hernia of the vagina.

name: obsolete Radially deviated terminal index finger phalanx
Abnormal LDL cholesterol concentration
description: Any deviation from the normal concentration of low-density lipoprotein cholesterol in the blood circulation.
synonyms: ["Abnormal LDL-C concentration","Abnormal LDL-C level","Abnormal LDLc concentration"]

name: Abnormal earlobe morphology
description: An abnormality of the lobule of pinna.
synonyms: ["Abnormal earlobe","Abnormal lobe of ear","Abnormality of auricular lobule","Abnormality of ear lobe","Abnormality of earlobe","Abnormality of lobulus auriculae"]

name: Acute hepatic failure
description: Hepatic failure refers to the inability of the liver to perform its normal synthetic and metabolic functions, which can result in coagulopathy and alteration in the mental status of a previously healthy individual. Hepatic failure is defined as acute if there is onset of encephalopathy within 8 weeks of the onset of symptoms in a patient with a previously healthy liver.

name: Generalized neonatal hypotonia
description: Muscular hypotonia (abnormally low muscle tone) manifesting in the neonatal period and affecting the entire musculature.
synonyms: ["Generalised low muscle tone in neonate","Generalised neonatal hypotonia","Generalized low muscle tone in neonate","Hypotonia, neonatal, generalised","Hypotonia, neonatal, generalized"]

name: Hypergonadotropic hypogonadism
description: Reduced function of the gonads (testes in males or ovaries in females) associated with excess pituitary gonadotropin secretion and resulting in delayed sexual development and growth delay.

name: Hypoplasia of the gallbladder
description: The presence of a hypoplastic gallbladder.

name: Abnormal VLDL cholesterol concentration
description: Any deviation from the normal concentration of very-low-density lipoprotein cholesterol in the blood.

name: Hypokalemia
description: An abnormally decreased potassium concentration in the blood.

name: Microtropia
description: A small angle heterotropia (usually of 10 diopters or less) in which a form of binocular single vision occurs.

name: Interrupted aortic arch
description: Non-continuity of the arch of aorta with an atretic point or absent segment.

name: Triangular epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 3rd finger
description: A triangular appearance of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 3rd finger of the hand. This epiphysis is located at the proximal end of the phalanx and is normally nearly flat.
synonyms: ["Delta-shaped epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 3rd finger","Triangular end part of innermost long bone of the middle finger"]

name: Short middle phalanx of the 2nd finger
description: Hypoplasia (congenital reduction in size) of the middle phalanx of the second finger, also known as the index finger.
synonyms: ["HP:0004133","Brachymesophalangy II (finger)","Hypoplastic middle index finger phalanx","Hypoplastic/small middle phalanx of the 2nd finger","Short middle bone of index finger"]

name: Glutaric aciduria
description: An increased concentration of glutaric acid in the urine.

name: Elevated carcinoma antigen 125 level
description: An increased blood concentration of carcinoma antigen 125 (CA-125). CA-125, also known as mucin 16, can exhibit increased blood levels in certain types of cancer.

name: Autonomic erectile dysfunction
description: Impotence (inability to develop or maintain an erection) resulting from abnormal functioning of the autonomic nervous system.

name: Highly elevated creatine kinase
description: An increased CPK level between 4X and 50X above the upper normal level.
synonyms: ["Highly elevated CPK","Highly elevated creatine phosphokinase","Highly elevated serum CK","Highly elevated serum CPK","Highly elevated serum phosph-CK"]

name: Spontaneous conjunctival filtering bleb
description: Avascular cystic elevations of the superior conjunctiva not related to ocular surgery or trauma.

name: Pulmonary sequestration
description: The presence of a piece lung tissue which is not attached to the pulmonary blood supply and does not communicate with the other lung tissue (not connected to the standard bronchial airways and not performing a function in respiration).

name: Abnormal circulating biopterin concentration
description: A deviation from the normal concentration of biopterin in the blood circulation.

name: Hoarse voice
description: Hoarseness refers to a change in the pitch or quality of the voice, with the voice sounding weak, very breathy, scratchy, or husky.

name: obsolete Bracket epiphyses of the 4th finger
Increased connective tissue
description: The presence of an abnormally increased amount of connective tissue.

name: Plagiocephaly
description: Asymmetric head shape, which is usually a combination of unilateral occipital flattening with ipsilateral frontal prominence, leading to rhomboid cranial shape.
synonyms: ["HP:0001121","Asymmetry of the posterior cranium","Asymmetry of the posterior head","Asymmetry of the posterior skull","Flat head","Flat head syndrome","Flattening of cranial vault","Flattening of cranium","Flattening of skull","Rhomboid shaped cranium","Rhomboid shaped head","Rhomboid shaped skull"]

name: Febrile seizure outside the age of 3 months to 6 years
description: Any type of seizure (most often a generalized tonic-clonic seizure) occurring with fever (at least 38.0 degrees Celsius) but in the absence of central nervous system infection, severe metabolic disturbance or other alternative precipitant in people beyond the typical arrange of 3 months-6 years with no prior history of afebrile seizure.

name: Disseminated histoplasmosis
description: Histoplasmosis infection involving multiple sites of the body. Disseminated histoplasmosis can involve various organs, including reticuloendothelial organs, gastrointestinal tract, adrenal glands, central nervous system, endovascular structures, kidney, and skin. It typically presents with systemic symptoms like fever, generalized fatigue, night sweats, weight loss, and the symptoms related to the specific organ involved. Severe disseminated disease can manifest as septic shock, multi organ failure, and ARDS.

name: Bullet-shaped proximal toe phalanx
description: An abnormal morphology of one or more of the proximal phalanges of the toes, with a short and wide phalanx that tapers distally. Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction.
synonyms: ["Bullet-shaped innermost toe bone","Bullet-shaped proximal phalanges of the toes","Bullet-shaped proximal phalanges of toe"]

name: EEG abnormality
description: Abnormality observed by electroencephalogram (EEG), which is used to record of the brain's spontaneous electrical activity from multiple electrodes placed on the scalp.

name: Ph-positive acute lymphoblastic leukemia
description: A subset of acute lymphoblastic leukemia that results from a reciprocal translocation between the ABL-1 oncogene and a breakpoint cluster region (BCR), resulting in a fusion gene, BCR-ABL, that encodes an oncogenic protein with constitutively active tyrosine kinase activity.
synonyms: ["Ph-positive acute lymphoblastic leukaemia","Philadelphia-positive acute lymphoblastic leukaemia","Philadelphia-positive acute lymphoblastic leukemia"]

name: Hyperthyroidism
description: An abnormality of thyroid physiology characterized by excessive secretion of the thyroid hormones thyroxine (i.e., T4) and/or 3,3',5-triiodo-L-thyronine zwitterion (i.e., triiodothyronine or T3).

name: Impaired phorbol myristate acetate-induced platelet aggregation
description: Abnormal response to phorbol myristate acetate (PMA) as manifested by reduced or lacking aggregation of platelets upon addition of PMA.

name: Interlobular vein intima/media venulitis
description: Inflammation of the interlobular veins of the kidney which may affect only the intima or may be transmural.

name: Patchy sclerosis of the 1st metatarsal
synonyms: ["Uneven increase in bone density of the 1st long bone of foot"]

name: Flexner-Wintersteiner rosette
description: The tumor cells that form the Flexner-Wintersteiner rosette circumscribe a central lumen that contains small cytoplasmic extensions of the encircling cells; however, unlike the center of the Homer Wright rosette, the central lumen does not contain the fiber-rich neuropil.

name: Metopic suture patent to nasal root
description: The frontal suture divides the two halves of the frontal bone in infants and usually fuses by the age of six years. The suture runs from the bregma (the point on the skull at which the coronal suture is intersected perpendicularly by the sagittal suture) to the nasion or nasal root. This term applies if the suture is widely patent from bregma to nasal root.

name: Shoulder muscle aplasia
description: Absence of shoulder muscles.

name: Subependymal giant-cell astrocytoma
description: A demarcated, largely intraventricular tumor in the region of the foramen of Monro composed of spindle to large plump or ganglion-like cells with eosinophilic to amphophilic cytoplasm and somewhat pleomorphic nuclei with occasional prominent nucleoli. These tumors are almost always associated with tuberous sclerosis.

name: Bilateral vestibular Schwannoma
description: A bilateral vestibular Schwannoma (acoustic neurinoma).

name: Impaired convulxin-induced platelet aggregation
description: Abnormal response to convulxin as manifested by reduced or lacking aggregation of platelets upon addition of convulxin.

name: Abnormal location of ears
description: Abnormal location of the ear.
synonyms: ["Abnormal location of ears","External ear position defect"]

name: Multiple bony cystic lesions
description: Presence of multiple cystic changes in multiple areas or multiple bones.

name: Elevated brain choline level by MRS
description: An increase in the level of choline-containing compounds in the brain identified by magnetic resonance spectroscopy (MRS).

name: Calcification of muscles
description: Deposition of calcium salts in muscle tissue.

name: obsolete Peripheral visual field constriction with 30-39 degrees central field preserved
Asymmetry of the mouth
description: The presence of an asymmetric mouth.
synonyms: ["Asymmetry of the mouth","Canted mouth","Crooked mouth","Tilted mouth","Uneven mouth"]

name: Elevated urinary 2-hydroxybutyric acid
description: An increased amount of 2-hydroxybutyric acid in the urine.

name: Sclerosis of finger phalanx
description: An elevation in bone density in one or more phalanges of the fingers. Sclerosis is normally detected on a radiograph as an area of increased opacity.
synonyms: ["Increased bone density in the finger bone","Sclerosis of the phalanges of the hand"]

name: Chronotropic incompetence
description: Inability of the heart to increase its rate commensurate with increased activity or demand.

name: Reduced tendon reflexes
description: Diminution of tendon reflexes, which is an invariable sign of peripheral nerve disease.
synonyms: ["HP:0001316","Absent or decreased deep tendon reflexes","Decreased deep tendon reflexes","Decreased tendon reflexes","Decreased to absent deep tendon reflexes","Decreased/absent deep tendon reflexes","Depressed tendon reflexes","Diminished deep tendon reflexes","Diminished or absent deep tendon reflexes","Diminished or absent tendon reflexes","Hypoactive to absent deep tendon reflexes","Impaired tendon reflexes","Reduced/absent deep tendon reflexes","Weak or absent deep tendon reflexes"]

name: Increased urinary neutrophil gelatinase-associated lipocalin
description: An increased concentration of neutrophil gelatinase-associated lipocalin in the urine (there is no generally accepted threshold, but some studies choose a threshold of above 150 nanogram per milliliter).

name: Abnormal proportion of exhausted T cells
description: A deviation from the normal proportion of exhausted T cell relative to T cell in the blood.

name: Precocious puberty in males
description: The onset of puberty before the age of 9 years in boys.
synonyms: ["Early onset of puberty in males","Male precocious puberty"]

name: Multiple mononeuropathy
description: A type of peripheral neuropathy that happens when there is damage to two or more different nerve areas characterized by peripheral neuropathy of both the motor and sensory nerves of at least two different nerve trunks. Different nerves are affected either simultaneously or sequentially.

name: Abnormality of the tongue muscle
synonyms: ["Abnormality of lingual muscle","Abnormality of the tongue muscle"]

name: Amyloid deposition in the vitreous humor
description: Deposition of hyaline extracellular material (amyloid) into the vitreous humor, which can manifest as vitreous opacities and reduced visual acuity.
synonyms: ["Amyloid deposition in the vitreous humour","Vitreous amyloid deposits"]

name: Thickened glomerular basement membranes with electron dense deposits
Increased CSF alanine concentration
description: Abnormally increased levels of alanine in cerebrospinal fluid.

name: Akinesia
description: Inability to initiate changes in activity or movement and to perform ordinary volitional movements rapidly and easily.

name: Multiple mitochondrial DNA deletions
description: The presence of multiple deletions of mitochondrial DNA (mtDNA).

name: Edematous chorionic villi
description: Swelling of the chorionic villi owing to fluid accumulation.

name: Cold-sensitive myotonia
description: An involuntary and painless delay in the relaxation of skeletal muscle following contraction or electrical stimulation that is induced by exposure to cold.

name: Systemic lupus erythematosus
description: A chronic, relapsing, inflammatory, and often febrile multisystemic disorder of connective tissue, characterized principally by involvement of the skin, joints, kidneys, and serosal membranes.

name: Abnormality of the intrinsic pathway
description: An abnormality of the intrinsic pathway (also known as the contact activation pathway) of the coagulation cascade.

name: Hamartoma of the orbital region
description: A hamartoma (disordered proliferation of mature tissues) which can originate from any tissue of the orbital region.

name: Post-transfusion thrombocytopenia
description: Sudden onset of thrombocytopenia (reduced platelet count) within 5-10 days of the transfusion of blood products. The clinical presentation is post-transfusion purpura (PTP), wigth severe thrmbocytopenia, epistaxis, and hemorrhages.

name: Blood xenobiotic
description: The presence of a xenobiotic in blood.

name: Spinocerebellar atrophy
description: Atrophy affecting the cerebellum and the spinocerebellar tracts of the spinal cord.

name: Abnormality of the hepatic vasculature
description: An abnormality of the hepatic vasculature.
synonyms: ["Abnormality of liver blood vessels","Abnormality of the liver vasculature"]

name: Bladder pain
description: An unpleasant sensation characterized by physical discomfort (such as pricking, throbbing, or aching) localized to the urinary bladder. Bladder pain may be more pronounced with a full bladder and relieved upon urination, but this is not always the case.

name: Peritoneal abscess
description: The presence of an abscess of the peritoneum.

name: Upper lip pit
description: Depression located on the vermilion of the upper lip, usually paramedian.

name: Absent mastoid
description: A developmental anomaly in which the mastoid process fails to form and is thus found to be congenitally absent.
synonyms: ["HP:0200110","Absent mastoids","Failure of development of mastoid","Mastoid agenesis"]

name: Streaky metaphyseal sclerosis
description: The presence of streaks (bands) of abnormally increased density of metaphyseal bone.
synonyms: ["Streak increase in bone density in wide portion of wide bone"]

name: Abnormal bronchoalveolar fluid protein level
description: Any deviation from the normal concentration of protein in the bronchoalveolar fluid.
synonyms: ["Abnormal biochemical composition of broncho-alveolar fluid","Abnormal level of proteins in the broncho-alveolar fluid"]

name: Premature closure of the ductus arteriosus
description: A prenatal partial or complete closure of the ductus arteriosus (i.e., prior to delivery).
synonyms: ["Fetal arterial duct narrowing-closure","Fetal ductus arteriosus narrowing-closure","Fetal PAD narrowing-closure","Fetal PDA narrowing-closure","Idiopathic constriction of the fetal ductus arteriosus","PCDA"]

name: Duplication of the distal phalanx of the 4th toe
description: Partial or complete duplication of the distal phalanx of fourth toe.
synonyms: ["Duplication of the distal phalanx of the fourth toe","Duplication of the outermost bone of the 4th toe","Partial/complete duplication of the distal phalanx of the 4th toe"]

name: Open mouth
description: A facial appearance characterized by a permanently or nearly permanently opened mouth.
synonyms: ["Gaped jawed appearance","Gaped mouthed appearance","Open mouth","Slack jawed appearance"]

name: Abnormality of central retinal artery
description: An abnormality of a central retinal artery.

name: Small abnormally formed scapulae
synonyms: ["HP:0006629","Small abnormally formed scapula","Small abnormally formed shoulder blade"]

name: Genetic anticipation with paternal anticipation bias
description: A type of genetic anticipation observed predominantly upon transmission from affected males.

name: Abnormality of the distal fibular epiphysis
description: Any abnormality of the distal epiphysis of the fibula.
synonyms: ["Abnormality of the outermost end part of calf bone"]

name: Hypoplasia of the ulna
description: Underdevelopment of the ulna.
synonyms: ["HP:0002998","HP:0005842","HP:0006388","HP:0006444","Hypoplastic ulna","Short ulna","Short ulnae","Ulnar hypoplasia","Underdeveloped inner large forearm bone","Underdeveloped ulna"]

name: Gastroenteritis-related afebrile seizure
description: Afebrile (less than 38.0 degrees Celcius), brief, and generalized seizures accompanying gastroenteritis without an alternative cause.

name: Increased cup-to-disc ratio
description: An elevation in the ratio of the diameter of the cup of the optic disc to the total diameter of the disc. The optic disc has an orange-pink rim with a pale centre (the cup) that does not contain neuroretinal tissue. An increase in this ratio therefore may indicate a decrease in the quantity of healthy neuroretinal cells.
synonyms: ["Elevated cup to disc ratio","Increased cup disc ratio"]

name: 4-5 metacarpal synostosis
synonyms: ["Fused 4th-5th long bones of hand","Fused 4th-5th metacarpals","Fused fourth and fifth metacarpals","Ring finger and little finger metacarpal synostosis","Synostosis of the fourth and fifth metacarpal bones"]

name: Computed tomographic halo sign
description: CT finding of ground-glass opacity surrounding a nodule or mass. It was first described as a sign of hemorrhage around foci of invasive aspergillosis. The halo sign is nonspecific and may also be caused by hemorrhage associated with other types of nodules or by local pulmonary infiltration by neoplasm.

name: Male pseudohermaphroditism
description: Hermaphroditism refers to a discrepancy between the morphology of the gonads and that of the external genitalia. In male pseudohermaphroditism, the genotype is male (XY) and the external genitalia are imcompletely virilized, ambiguous, or complete female. If gonads are present, they are testes.

name: Femoroacetabular impingement
description: Femoroacetabular impingement (FAI) results from one or more bony abnormalities that lead to abnormal contact between the acetabulum and the femoral head or neck. The femoral abnormality is proposed to cause compression and shear stresses in the region between the labrum and cartilage, anterosuperiorly. These stresses cause a separation between the labrum and cartilage as the labrum is pushed outwards and the cartilage is pushed centrally. This eventually leads to articular degeneration and eventually global hip osteoarthritis.

name: CNS foam cells
description: The presence of foam cells, a type of macrophage that localizes to fatty deposits on blood vessel walls, in the central nervous system.

name: Absent muscle dystrophin expression
description: Lack of dystrophin in muscle tissue. Immunohistochemistry reveals absent dystrophin protein in the muscle biopsy.

name: Prominent S wave in lead I
description: Increased amplitude (0.1 mV or more) and/or duration (40 ms or more) of the S wave as measured in lead I of the electrocardiogram.

name: Aquagenic urticaria
description: A form of physical urticaria, in which contact with water, regardless of its temperature and source, evokes pruritic follicular wheals on the skin.

name: Small epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the hallux
synonyms: ["Small end part of the innermost bone of the big toe"]

name: Fractured proximal phalanx of digit 5
description: A partial or complete breakage of the proximal phalanx of digit 5.

name: Synostosis involving the 1st metacarpal
description: Fusion of the 1st metacarpal with another bone. In contrast to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2 to 5, the proximal phalanx of the thumb is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits.
synonyms: ["HP:0005614","HP:0010032","First metacarpophalangeal joint synostosis","Fusion involving 1st long bone of hand","Symphalangism affecting the 1st metacarpal"]

name: Increased glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase level in dried blood spot
description: An increase in the level of glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase in a dried blood spot.
synonyms: ["Increased G6PD level in dried blood spot","Increased glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase level in DBS"]

name: Contracture of the distal interphalangeal joint of the 2nd toe
description: The distal interphalangeal joint of the 2nd toe cannot be straightened actively or passively.
synonyms: ["Contracture of the distal interphalangeal joint of the second toe"]

name: Limb-girdle muscle atrophy
description: Muscular atrophy affecting the muscles of the limb girdle.

name: Small epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 5th finger
description: Abnormally small size of the epiphysis located at the proximal end of the proximal phalanx of the 5th finger with respect to age-dependent norms.
synonyms: ["Small end part of the innermost bone of little finger","Small end part of the innermost bone of pinkie finger","Small end part of the innermost bone of pinky finger"]

name: Chronic intestinal candidiasis
description: Persistent overgrowth of Candida albicans in the gastrointestinal tract.

name: Abnormality of higher mental function
description: Cognitive, psychiatric or memory anomaly.

name: Short clavicles
description: Reduced length of the clavicles.

name: Female reproductive system neoplasm
description: A neoplasm that affects the female reproductive system.

name: Anti-topoisomerase I antibody positivity
description: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against topoisomerase I.
synonyms: ["Anti-Scl-70 antibody positivity","Top1 antibody positivity","Topoisomerase (DNA) I antibody positivity"]

name: Saccadic intrusion
description: An involuntary abnormality of fixation in which there is an abnormal saccade away from fixation followed by a delayed corrective saccade.

name: Unicoronal synostosis
description: Synostosis affecting only one of the coronal sutures.
synonyms: ["Unilateral coronal suture craniosynostosis","Unilateral coronal suture synostosis"]

name: Cleft maxillary alveolus
description: Alveolar cleft is a tornado-shaped bone defect in the maxillary arch. Alveolar cleft occurs in response to divergence from normal development during frontonasal prominence growth, contact, and fusion. The most common alveolar portion of the cleft is located between the lateral incisor and the canine.

name: Impaired ability to plan
description: Impaired ability to anticipate future events, implement instructions or goals, and develop appropriate steps ahead of time in order to carry out a task or activity.

name: EEG with focal spike waves
description: EEG with focal sharp transient waves of a duration less than 80 msec followed by a slow wave.

name: Posterior synechiae of the anterior chamber
description: Adhesions between the iris and the lens.

name: Prolonged
description: Applied to an abnormality whose duration is extended over a longer period of time than is expected or usual (e.g., prolonged fever lasts longer than one usually sees with an infection).

name: Pulmonary valve defects
description: Any defect in the valve connecting the heart and the pulmonary artery.

name: Long segment coarctation of the aorta
description: Coarctation of the aorta is a narrowing or constriction of a long segment of the arch of the aorta.

name: Abnormal sella turcica morphology
description: Abnormality of the sella turcica, a saddle-shaped depression in the sphenoid bone at the base of the human skull.
synonyms: ["Abnormality of the sella turcica","Anomaly of the sella turcica"]

name: Abnormal cricoid cartilage morphology
description: Any structural abnormality of a cricoid cartilage, that is, of the ring-shaped cartilage of the larynx.

name: Fava bean-induced hemolytic anemia
description: A kind of hemolytic anemia that is induced by the ingestion of fava beans.
synonyms: ["Fava bean-induced hemolytic anaemia","Hemolytic anaemia following ingestion of fava beans","Hemolytic anemia following ingestion of fava beans"]

name: Recurrent deep organ abscess formation
description: Repeated episodes of the formation of abscesses in organs. An abscess is a circumscribed area of pus or necrotic debris in the parenchyma or an organ.

name: Hypoglycemia
description: A decreased concentration of glucose in the blood.

name: Anti-laminin 332 antibody positivity
description: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against laminin-332.

name: Bowing of the vocal cords
description: Bowing (abnormal curvature) of the vocal folds.

name: Lacrimation abnormality
description: Abnormality of tear production.

name: Interlobular vein intima/media liquefactive necrosis
description: A type of interlobular vein intima/media necrosis in which the dead (necrotic) tissue breaks down such that cellular detail is no longer recognized.

name: Enteric intraneuronal nuclear inclusion bodies
description: Aggregates of stainable substances (proteins) in the nuclei of enteric neurons.

name: Neoplasm of the small intestine
description: The presence of a neoplasm of the small intestine.

name: EEG with occipital epileptiform discharges
description: Focal epileptiform EEG discharges recorded in the occipital region.

name: Thoracic aortic aneurysm
description: An abnormal localized widening (dilatation) of the thoracic aorta.

name: Neutrophilic infiltration of the skin
description: A predominantly neutrophilic infiltrate of the dermis and or epidermis (i.e., a large number of neutrophils inferred to have migrated into the skin).

name: Anorectal abscess
description: An abscess located at the junction of the anal canal and the rectum.

name: Double outlet right ventricle with subaortic ventricular septal defect without pulmonary stenosis
description: A double outlet right ventricle with a ventricular spetal defect (a hole between the two bottom chambers (ventricles) of the heart), that is considered to be closely related to the aortic origin. There is not associated pulmonary stenosis, the abnormal narrowing or constriction of the pulmonary artery, in the main pulmonary artery and/or in the left or right pulmonary artery branches.
synonyms: ["DORV with subaortic VSD without pulmonary stenosis"]

name: Tree-in-bud pattern
description: The tree-in-bud pattern represents centrilobular branching structures that resemble a budding tree. The pattern reflects a spectrum of endo- and peribronchiolar disorders, including mucoid impaction, inflammation, and/or fibrosis (See Figure 70 of PMID:18195376).

name: Vocal cord dysfunction
description: Any functional anomaly of the vocal cord.

name: Reduced C-reactive protein level
description: An abnormal decrease of the C-reactive protein level in serum.

name: Paroxysmal rectal pain
description: Excruciating burning pain in the rectal area that may be triggered by defecation.

name: Bracket epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd toe
synonyms: ["Bracket shaped end part of the innermost bone of the 2nd toe"]

name: Abnormal glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase level in dried blood spot
description: An anomaly in the level of glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase in a dried blood spot.
synonyms: ["Abnormal G6PD level in dried blood spot","Abnormal glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase level in DBS"]

name: Entrapment neuropathy
description: Malfunction of a peripheral nerve resulting from mechanical compression of the nerve roots from internal or external causes and leading to a conduction block or axonal loss.

name: Anti-U3 RNP antibody positivity
description: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against U3 RNP.

name: Areflexia
description: Absence of neurologic reflexes such as the knee-jerk reaction.
synonyms: ["HP:0001314","Absent deep tendon reflexes","Absent reflexes","Absent tendon reflexes","Deep tendon reflexes absent","Loss of deep tendon reflexes"]

name: Peroneal muscle atrophy
description: Atrophy of the peroneous muscles, peroneus longus (also known as Fibularis longus), Peroneus brevis (also known as fibularis brevis, and Peroneus tertius (also known as fibularis tertius).

name: Recurrent otitis media
description: Increased susceptibility to otitis media, as manifested by recurrent episodes of otitis media.
synonyms: ["HP:0008622","HP:0008623","HP:0008624","Frequent otitis media","Multiple episodes of otitis media","Otitis media, recurrent","Recurrent episodes of otitis media","Recurrent middle ear infection","Susceptibility to otitis media"]

name: Neonatal seizure with bilateral symmetric automatism
description: Neonatal seizure with bilateral asymmetric automatism is a type of neonatal electro-clinical seizure where the electrographic event is correlated with a coordinated motor activity, typically oral, usually with impaired awarness, occurring at both sides of the body symmetrically.

name: Aglossia
description: Absence of the tongue owing to a developmental abnormality.
synonyms: ["Absence of tongue","Failure of development of tongue","Missing tongue"]

name: Myofiber disarray
description: A nonparallel arrangement of cardiac myocytes.

name: Horner syndrome
description: An abnormality resulting from a lesion of the sympathetic nervous system characterized by a combination of unilateral ptosis, miosis, and often ipsilateral hypohidrosis and conjunctival injection.

name: Small intestinal perforation
description: A hole (perforation) in the wall of the small intestine.

name: Retinal arterial tortuosity
description: The presence of an increased number of twists and turns of the retinal artery.

name: Carpal synostosis
description: Synostosis (bony fusion) involving one or more bones of the carpus (scaphoid, lunate, triquetrum, trapezium, trapezoid, capitate, hamate, pisiform).
synonyms: ["HP:0001192","HP:0005799","Carpal bone fusion","Carpal fusion","Fused carpal bones","Fused wrist bones","Fusion of carpal bones","Synostosis involving the carpal bones"]

name: Serpiginous cutaneous lesion
description: A skin lesion with a snake- or serpent-like distribution.

name: Infantile constant exotropia
description: Constant exotropia occurring before 6 months of age.; often associated with a large angle of deviation and ocular/CNS abnormalities.

name: Decreased T3/T4 ratio
description: A ratio of serum triiodothyronine (T3) to thyroxine (T4) in the blood that is lower than normal.

name: Paucity of anterior horn motor neurons
Perioral eczema
description: A type of eczema that occurs in the lips and perioral area.

name: Limited neck range of motion
synonyms: ["Limited cervical range of motion","Limited neck range of motion"]

name: Abnormal glomerular mesangial matrix morphology
description: Any structural anomaly of the glomerular matrix. Mesangial cells generate and embed in their own extracellular matrix. The mesangial matrix is different in composition from the glomerular basement membrane. Its constituents are type IV collagen (but only the alpha1 and alpha2 chains); type V collagen; laminin A, B1, and B2; and considerable amounts of fibronectin, heparan sulfate and chondroitin sulfate proteoglycans, entactin, and nidogen. Furthermore, small amounts of the proteoglycans decorin and biglycan are found in the mesangial matrix.

name: Triangular shaped distal phalanx of the 5th finger
description: Triangular shaped distal phalanx of the 5th (little) finger. A triangular or so called delta shaped phalanx is a typical result after a bracket epiphysis of the affected phalanx.
synonyms: ["Triangular shaped outermost little finger bone","Triangular shaped outermost pinkie finger bone","Triangular shaped outermost pinky finger bone"]

name: Symphalangism affecting the middle phalanx of the 3rd toe
Minifascicle formation
description: A nerve fascicle or fasciculus is a small bundle of axons, enclosed by the perineurium. A minifascule refers to a group of thinly myelinated and unmyelinated axons surrounded by a delicate perineurium, and with a smaller diameter than a normal nerve fascicle.

name: Asymmetrical distribution of flash visual evoked potentials
synonyms: ["Crossed asymmetry of flash visual evoked potentials"]

name: Retinal microaneurysm
description: A localized dilation of microvasculature formed due to disruption of the internal elastic lamina of a retinal capillary blood vessel. The lesions present as small circular, red dots having distinct margins and are no larger than a blood vessel width at the disk margin. This expansion disturbs the normal flow pattern, changing shear force and pressure along the vessel. Shear force plays a key role in promoting the differentiation and proliferation of endothelial cells.

name: Abnormal renal cortex morphology
description: An abnormality of the cortex of the kidney.

name: Acephalic spermatozoa
description: Spermatozoa with very small cranial ends devoid of any nuclear material, that is, lacking a typical sperm head.

name: Ulnar deviation of the 4th finger
description: Displacement of the 4th finger towards the ulnar side (i.e., towards the ring finger).

name: Focal aware verbal automatism seizure
description: A type of focal automatism seizure characterized by the production of single or repetitive words, phrases, or brief sentences at onset and during which awareness is fully retained throughout.

name: Poliosis
description: Circumscribed depigmentation of the hair of the head or the eyelashes.

name: Thin skin
description: Reduction in thickness of the skin, generally associated with a loss of suppleness and elasticity of the skin.

name: anti-LAD-1 antibody positivity
description: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against LAD-1, which is the soluble 120 kDa ectodomain of BP180.

name: Absent epiphysis of the middle phalanx of the 3rd toe
synonyms: ["Absent end part of the middle bone of the 3rd toe"]

name: Extrahepatic biliary duct atresia
description: Atresia in the extrahepatic bile duct.

name: Joint contractures involving the joints of the feet
description: Contractures of one ore more joints of the feet meaning chronic loss of joint motion due to structural changes in non-bony tissue.

name: Amygdala microinfarct
description: An infarct located in the almond-shaped body of basal nuclei anterior to the inferior horn of the lateral ventricle of the brain, within the temporal lobe that can only be observed microscopically.

name: Broad proximal phalanx of the 3rd finger
description: Increased width of the proximal phalanx of the 3rd finger.

name: Sense of impending doom
description: A feeling that something life-threatening or tragic is about to occur.

name: Stable
description: This modifier can be applied to a phenotypic feature that does not vary in severity or amount over time.
