name: Cardiomyocyte degeneration
description: Deterioration of cardiomyocyte characterized by abnormal features such as loss of myofilaments, occurrence of cellular sequestration, decreased mitochondrial sizes and cellular debris.

name: Colitis
description: Colitis refers to an inflammation of the colon and is often used to describe an inflammation of the large intestine (colon, cecum and rectum). Colitides may be acute and self-limited or chronic, and broadly fit into the category of digestive diseases.

name: Genital neoplasm
description: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the genital system.

name: Delusions
description: A false belief that is held despite evidence to the contrary.

name: Mesangial fibrillary deposits
description: Extracellular mesangial aggregates composed of randomly arranged, straight, non-branching fibrils that are thicker than amyloid fibrils (average diameter about 20 nm) and are often admixed with smudgy, electron-dense material.

name: Hypocalcification of dental enamel
description: A form of hypomineralization of enamel characterized by reduced calcification.

name: Patchy alopecia
description: Transient, non-scarring hair loss and preservation of the hair follicle located in in well-defined patches.

name: Nonprogressive restrictive external ophthalmoplegia
description: Nonprogressive restriction of movement of the external ocular muscles such that the eyes of affected individuals are partially or completely fixed in a strabismic position. Residual eye movements are significantly limited.

name: Bracket epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 4th toe
synonyms: ["Bracket shaped end part of the outermost bone of the 4th toe"]

name: Muscle stiffness
description: A condition in which muscles cannot be moved quickly without accompanying pain or spasm.

name: Hypotyrosinemia
description: An decreased concentration of tyrosine in the blood.
synonyms: ["Decreased tyrosine in blood","Low blood tyrosine concentration"]

name: Metaphyseal chondrodysplasia
description: An abnormality of skeletal development characterized by a disturbance of the metaphysis and its histological structure with relatively normal epiphyses and vertebrae.

name: Postauricular skin tag
description: A rudimentary tag of ear tissue often containing a core of cartilage and located just in back of the auricle (outer part of the ear).
synonyms: ["Postauricular acrochordon","Postauricular fibroepithelial polyp","Skin tag behind the ear"]

name: Chorea
description: Chorea (Greek for 'dance') refers to widespread arrhythmic involuntary movements of a forcible, jerky and restless fashion. It is a random-appearing sequence of one or more discrete involuntary movements or movement fragments. Movements appear random because of variability in timing, duration or location. Each movement may have a distinct start and end. However, movements may be strung together and thus may appear to flow randomly from one muscle group to another. Chorea can involve the trunk, neck, face, tongue, and extremities.

name: Increased anti-meat allergen IgE antibody level
description: Increased level of IgE antibody against meat, such as mammalian meat, including beef or pork, or poultry, like duck or chicken.

name: Abnormal ventricular myocardium morphology
description: A structural anomaly of the muscle layer of the heart wall of a cardiac ventricle.

name: Hyponasal speech
description: Hyponasal speech is when there is an abnormally reduced nasal airflow during speech often in a setting of nasal obstruction or congestion.

name: Hamartomatous stomach polyps
description: Polyp-like protrusions which are histologically hamartomas located in the stomach.

name: Abnormality of chromosome stability
description: A type of chromosomal aberration characterised by reduced resistance of chromosomes to change or deterioration.

name: EEG with focal epileptiform discharges
description: EEG discharges recorded in particular areas of a localized (focal) abnormality in cerebral electrical activity recorded along the scalp by electroencephalography (EEG).

name: Hemiatrophy
description: Undergrowth of the limbs that affects only one side.

name: Extralobar sequestration
description: A kind of bronchopulmonary sequestration that is completely discrete from the normal lung and is surrounded by separate pleura.

name: Postaxial polydactyly
description: A form of polydactyly in which the extra digit or digits are localized on the side of the fifth finger or fifth toe.

name: Anterior wedging of L2
description: An abnormality of the shape of the lumbar vertebra L2 such that it is wedge-shaped (narrow towards the front).

name: Decreased glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase level in blood
description: A decrease in the level of glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase in the blood.

name: Highly arched eyebrow
description: Increased height of the central portion of the eyebrow, forming a crescent, semicircular, or inverted U shape.
synonyms: ["HP:0001584","HP:0004533","HP:0007681","HP:0007804","HP:0008505","Arched eyebrows","Broad, arched eyebrows","High, rounded eyebrows","High-arched eyebrows","Highly arched eyebrow","Thick, flared eyebrows"]

name: Penile hypospadias
description: Location of the urethral opening on the inferior aspect of the penis.

name: Abnormality of the nasal cavity
description: Abnormality of the nasal cavity (the cavity includes and starts at the nares and reaches all the way through to the and includes the choanae, the posterior nasal apertures).

name: Brachioradialis hyperreflexia
description: Increased intensity of the brachioradialis reflex.

name: Malformation of mandibular premolar
description: An abnormality of the morphology of secondary premolar tooth.
synonyms: ["Malformation of lower premolar","Malformation of mandibular bicuspid"]

name: Autosomal dominant inheritance
description: A mode of inheritance that is observed for traits related to a gene encoded on one of the autosomes (i.e., the human chromosomes 1-22) in which a trait manifests in heterozygotes. In the context of medical genetics, an autosomal dominant disorder is caused when a single copy of the mutant allele is present. Males and females are affected equally, and can both transmit the disorder with a risk of 50% for each child of inheriting the mutant allele.

name: Complete duplication of the phalanges of the 3rd finger
description: A complete duplication affecting one or more of the phalanges of the 3rd finger. As opposed to a partial duplication were there is still a variable degree of fusion between the duplicated bones, a complete duplication leads to two separate bones appearing side to side (radio-ulnar axis) as seen on x-rays. A duplication leading to an accesory bone appearing in the proximo-distal axis on x-rays, this is actually a different entity called a Pseudoepiphyses (see according terms) sometimes also referred to as Hyperphalangism.

name: Abnormality of ophthalmic artery
description: Abnormality of the first branch of the internal carotid artery.

name: Myocardial necrosis
description: Irreversible damage to heart tissue (myocardium) due to lack of oxygen after a heart attack (myocardial infarction).

name: Abnormality of the cerebrospinal fluid
description: An abnormality of the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF).

name: Xanthomatosis
description: The presence of multiple xanthomas (xanthomata) in the skin. Xanthomas are yellowish, firm, lipid-laden nodules in the skin.
synonyms: ["Xanthomata","Yellow bumps of fatty deposits on skin"]

name: Small epiphyses of the 2nd toe
synonyms: ["Small end part of the 2nd toe bone"]

name: Lymphatic vessel neoplasm
description: A benign or malignant neoplasm arising from the lymphatic vessels.

name: Growth delay
description: A deficiency or slowing down of growth pre- and postnatally.
synonyms: ["HP:0001434","HP:0001512","HP:0001514","HP:0001517","HP:0001532","HP:0008847","HP:0008870","HP:0008886","HP:0008893","HP:0008926","Delayed growth","Growth deficiency","Growth delay","Growth failure","Growth retardation","Poor growth","Retarded growth"]

name: Bitot spots of the conjunctiva
description: Keratinization of the bulbar conjunctiva near the limbus (corneoscleral junction), resulting in a raised spot.

name: Abnormality of the coagulation cascade
description: An abnormality of the coagulation cascade, which is comprised of the contact activation pathway (also known as the intrinsic pathway) and the tissue factor pathway (also known as the extrinsic pathway) as well as cofactors and regulators.

name: Squamous Papilloma
description: A benign epithelial neoplasm characterized by a papillary growth pattern and a proliferation of neoplastic squamous cells without morphologic evidence of malignancy.

name: Reduced CSF dopamine level
description: Decreased concentration of dopamine in the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF).

name: Symphalangism affecting the phalanges of the 3rd toe
Glomerular hyaline subepithelial deposits
description: A type of glomerular subepithelial deposit characterized by a moderately electron-dense, generally homogenous, amorphous-appearing extracellular material located between the outer (epithelial) aspect of the glomerular basement membrane (GBM) and the visceral epithelial cell, with varying degrees of incorporation into the GBM. This feature is associated with a prominent GBM reflecting an diffuse and relativly uniform increase in thickness (subjective estimate).

name: Unroofed coronary sinus
description: Unroofed coronary sinus (CS) is a rare congenital cardiac anomaly in which there is partial (either focal or fenestrated) or complete absence of the roof of the CS, which results in a communication between the CS and the LA. Unroofed CS is the rarest type of atrial septal defect. It is often associated with persistent left superior vena cava (LSVC) and other forms of complex congenital heart disease, usually heterotaxia syndromes. The morphological types have been classified into 4 groups: Type I, completely unroofed with persistent LSVC; type II, completely unroofed without persistent LSVC; type III, partially unroofed mid portion; and type IV, partially unroofed terminal portion.

name: Symphalangism of middle phalanx of 3rd finger
description: Fusion of the middle phalanx of the 3rd finger with another bone.

name: Abnormal posterior circulating artery morphology
description: Any structural anomaly of the posterior circulating artery (PCOM).

name: Abnormal foot morphology
description: An abnormality of the skeleton of foot.
synonyms: ["HP:0010216","HP:0010611","Abnormal feet structure","Abnormality of the feet","Abnormality of the foot","Foot deformities","Foot deformity"]

name: Anterior rib punctate calcifications
description: Deposition of calcium salts in point-like foci within the anterior portion of one or more ribs.

name: Premature anterior fontanel closure
description: Early closure (ossification) of the anterior fontanelle, which generally undergoes closure around the 18th month of life.

name: Acral ulceration
description: A type of digital ulcer that manifests as an open sore on the surface of the skin at the tip of a finger or toe.

name: Internal ophthalmoplegia
description: Paralysis of the iris and ciliary apparatus.

name: Chronic tinea infection
description: The term tinea means fungal infection, whereas dermatophyte refers to the fungal organisms that cause tinea. This term refers to a tinea infection that is chronic or recalcitrant to treatment and may be reflective of an immune defect.

name: Diffuse alveolar hemorrhage
description: A type of of pulmonary hemorrhage that originates from the pulmonary microcirculation, including the alveolar capillaries, arterioles, and venules. It presents with hemoptysis, anemia, diffuse lung infiltration, and acute respiratory failure. The diagnosis is confirmed by the observation of the accumulation of red blood cells, fibrin, or hemosiderin-laden macrophage in the alveolar space on pathologic biopsy. Hemosiderin, a product of hemoglobin degradation, appears at least 48-72 hours after bleeding and is helpful in distinguishing diffuse alveolar hemorrhage from surgical trauma. Mild interstitial thickening, organizing pneumonia, or diffuse alveolar damage can also be seen.

name: Abnormal chylomicron concentration
description: Any deviation from the normal circulating concentration of chylomicrons.

name: Squamous cell carcinoma of the vulva
description: A cancer that originates in the squamous cells that line the surface of the vulva.

name: Recurrent fungal infections
description: Increased susceptibility to fungal infections, as manifested by multiple episodes of fungal infection.

name: Localized hirsutism
description: Abnormally increased hair growth with a localized distribution.
synonyms: ["Localised abnormal hair growth","Localised hirsutism","Localized abnormal hair growth"]

name: Hydroureter
description: The distention of the ureter with urine.

name: Decreased number of large peripheral myelinated nerve fibers
description: A reduced number of large myelinated nerve fibers.
synonyms: ["HP:0006868","HP:0007031","HP:0007315","Decreased number of large peripheral myelinated nerve fibres","Depletion of large myelinated fibers","Depletion of large myelinated fibres","Loss of large myelinated fibers","Loss of large myelinated fibres","Loss of larger myelinated nerve fibers","Loss of larger myelinated nerve fibres"]

name: Macular hypopigmented whorls, streaks, and patches
Abnormal mitral valve leaflet morphology
description: Any structural anomaly of the leaflets (also known as cusps) of the mitral valve.

name: Anti-beta-2-Glycoprotein I IgM antibody positivity
description: Presence of IgM antibodies against beta 2 glycoprotein I in the circulation. Beta-2 glycoprotein I (beta2GPI) is the principal target of autoantibodies in the antiphospholipid syndrome.

name: Abnormal salivary cortisol level
description: Any deviation from the normal concentration of cortisol in saliva.

name: Abnormal circulating aspartate family amino acid concentration
description: Any deviation from the normal concentration of an aspartate family amino acid in the blood circulation.

name: Subungual fibromas
description: The presence of fibromata beneath finger or toenails.

name: Chronic disseminated intravascular coagulation
description: A chronic form of disseminated intravascular coagulation in which a persistent weak or intermittent activating stimulus is present and destruction and production of coagulation factors and platelets are balanced.

name: Neurofibromas
description: The presence of multiple cutaneous neurofibromas.

name: Small epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 5th toe
synonyms: ["Small end part of the outermost bone of the little toe","Small end part of the outermost bone of the pinkie toe","Small end part of the outermost bone of the pinky toe"]

name: Bracket epiphyses of the hallux
synonyms: ["Bracket shaped end part of big toe bone"]

name: Dysgraphia
description: A writing disability in the absence of motor or sensory deficits of the upper extremities, resulting in an impairment in the ability to write regardless of the ability to read and not due to intellectual impairment.

name: Anti-side-chain cleavage enzyme antibody positivity
description: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against cytochrome P450 cholesterol side-chain cleavage enzyme (P450scc), which is encoded by CYP11A1 cytochrome P450 family 11 subfamily A member 1 (Gene ID:1583).

name: Saccular abdominal aortic aneurysm
description: An eccentric abnormal localized widening (dilatation) of the abdominal aorta that involves only a portion of the circumference of the vessel wall.

name: Abnormal CD25 upregulation upon TCR activation
description: Any abnormality in the upregulation of CD25 on T cells after activation via the T cell receptor (TCR). CD25 is the alpha chain of the IL2 receptor. Ligation of the T cell antigen receptor leads to the induction of CD25 expression.

name: Isolation of the left subclavian artery
description: The loss of continuity between the left subclavian artery and the aorta, with persistent connection to the homolateral pulmonary artery through the patent (PDA) or nonpatent ductus arteriosus.

name: Marcus Gunn jaw winking synkinesis
description: Unilateral ptosis with associated upper eyelid contraction and contraction of either the external or the internal pterygoid muscle. It is thought to occur because of congenital miswiring of a branch of the fifth cranial nerve into the branch of the third cranial nerve supplying the levator muscle. In Marcus Gunn jaw winking synkinesis, elevation and even retraction of the affected eyelid is triggered by chewing, suction, lateral mandible movement, smiling, sternocleidomastoid contraction, protruding tongue, Valsalva manoeuvre and even by breathing.

name: Neoplasm of the inner ear
description: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the inner ear.

name: Dentin dysplasia
description: This is a bundled term as dentin dysplasia is composed of short roots with pointed ends and taurodontism and intrapulpal calcifications.

name: Decreased miniature endplate potentials
description: An abnormal reduction in the amplitude of the miniature endplate potentials, i.e. the postsynaptic response to transmitter released from an individual vesicle at the neuromuscular junction.
synonyms: ["Decreased MEPP","Small miniature endplate currents","Small miniature endplate potentials"]

name: Broad middle phalanges of the toes
Oropharyngeal squamous cell carcinoma
description: A squamous cell carcinoma that originates in the oropharnyx.

name: Glabellar reflex
description: A type of primitive reflex that is elicited by repetitive tapping on the forehead. Normal subjects usually blink in response to the first several taps, but if blinking persists, the response is abnormal and considered to be a sign of frontal release. Persistent blinking is also known as Myerson's sign.

name: Hypoplasia of the fallopian tube
description: Developmental hypoplasia of the fallopian tube.

name: Type IV atherosclerotic lesion
description: In type IV atherosclerotic lesions a dense accumulation of extracellular lipid occupies an extensive but well-defined region of the intima. This type of extracellular lipid accumulation is known as the lipid core. A fibrous tissue increase is not a feature, and complications such as defects of the lesion surface and thrombosis are not present. The type IV lesion is also known as atheroma. Type IV is the first lesion considered advanced in this classification because of the severe intimal disorganization caused by the lipid core. The characteristic core appears to develop from an increase and the consequent confluence of the small isolated pools of extracellular lipid that characterize type III lesions. The increase in lipid is believed to result from continued insudation from the plasma. Type IV lesions, when they first appear in younger people, are found in the same locations as adaptive intimal thickenings of the eccentric type. Thus, atheroma is, at least initially, an eccentric lesion.

name: Abnormal skeletal muscle morphology
description: A structural abnormality of a skeletal muscle.
synonyms: ["HP:0003735","Abnormal muscle morphology","Abnormality of muscle morphology","Abnormally shaped muscle","Issue with muscle structure"]

name: Abnormal caudate nucleus morphology
description: Any structural abnormality of the caudate nucleus.

name: Obstructive sleep apnea
description: A condition characterized by obstruction of the airway and by pauses in breathing during sleep occurring many times during the night. Obstructive sleep apnea is related to a relaxation of muscle tone (which normally occurs during sleep) leading to partial collapse of the soft tissues in the airway with resultant obstruction of the air flow.

name: Tongue fasciculations
description: Fasciculations or fibrillation affecting the tongue muscle.
synonyms: ["HP:0003727","Lingual fasciculations","Lingual fibrillations","Lingual twitching","Tongue fasciculation","Tongue fasciculations/fibrillations","Tongue twitching","Twitching of the tongue"]

name: Chronic cutaneous wound
description: A cutaneous wound that has failed to proceed through the orderly and timely process to produce an atomic and functional integrity, or proceeded through the repair process without establishing a sustained anatomic and functional result.

name: Abnormal amplitude of pattern onset/offset visual evoked potentials
Ivory epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 3rd finger
description: Sclerosis of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 3rd finger, leading to an increased degree of radiopacity (white or ivory appearance) in X-rays.
synonyms: ["Increased bone density of end part of the outermost middle finger bone"]

name: Bilateral renal atrophy
description: A two-sided form of atrophy of the kidney.

name: T-cell lymphoma/leukemia
description: A type of T-cell lymphoma in which cancerous T-cells may present in the blood (leukemia), lymph nodes (lymphoma), skin or in multiple areas.

name: Stippling of the epiphysis of the 1st metatarsal
synonyms: ["Speckled calcifications in the end part of the 1st long bone of foot"]

name: Chronic pancreatitis
description: A chronic form of pancreatitis.

name: Oligospermia
description: Reduced count of spermatozoa in the semen, defined as a sperm count below 20 million per milliliter semen.

name: Positive blood acetaminophen test
description: Detection of acetaminophen in the blood.
synonyms: ["Positive blood paracetamol test","Positive blood Tylenol test"]

name: Microcephalic sperm head
description: Decreased size of the head of sperm.

name: Abnormal eating behavior
description: Abnormal eating habit with excessive or insufficient consumption of food or any other abnormal pattern of food consumption.

name: Vitreomacular adhesion
description: Perifoveal vitreous separation with remaining vitreomacular attachment and unperturbed foveal morphologic features. It is an OCT finding that is almost always the result of normal vitreous aging, which may lead to pathologic conditions.

name: Abnormality of the anterior pituitary
description: An abnormality of the adenohypophysis, which is also known as the anterior lobe of the pituitary gland.

name: Triangular epiphyses of the 4th toe
synonyms: ["Triangular end part of the 4th toe bone"]

name: Increased urinary fucosylated oligosaccharide
description: An abnormal increase in the concentrationl of small fucosylated oligosaccharides in the urine.
synonyms: ["Increased concentration of fucosylated oligosaccharides in urine"]

name: Hyperlysinuria
description: An increased concentration of lysine in the urine.

name: Mucinous gastric carcinoma
description: A poorly differentiated type of gastric carcinoma with a substantial amount of extracellular mucus (over 50% of tumor volume) within the tumor.

name: Type 2 congenital pulmonary airway malformation
description: A type of congenital pulmonary airway malformation that is characterized by multiple evenly spaced cysts (sponge-like appearance).

name: Neoplasm of the adrenal gland
description: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the adrenal gland.

name: Mesangial microfibril deposition
description: Unbranched noncollagenous microfibrils within the mesangial matrix, composed of proteins not present within the glomerular basement membrane (GBM), most notably fibrillin-1, that attach to mesangial cells and GBM structural proteins.

name: Membranous cataract
description: A form of cataract in which the lens substance has shrunk, leaving a collapsed, flattened capsule with little or no cortex or epithelium on the lens.

name: Short thumb
description: Hypoplasia (congenital reduction in size) of the thumb.
synonyms: ["HP:0001183","HP:0001186","HP:0001589","HP:0005699","HP:0006151","HP:0009628","Hypoplastic thumb","Hypoplastic thumbs","Hypoplastic/small thumb","Short thumb","Short thumbs","Small thumbs","Thumb brachydactyly","Thumb hypoplasia"]

name: Posteriorly placed anus
description: Posterior malposition of the anus.

name: Lower extremity peripheral arterial calcification
description: An accumulation of calcium and phosphate in arteries with mineral deposits in the intimal or medial layer of the vessel wall of the leg.

name: Decreased tear drainage
description: A form of watery eye associated with obstruction of the nasolacrimal system. This may arise at the level of the punctum, the canaliculi, the sac or the nasolacrimal duct.

name: Agenesis of primary maxillary lateral incisor
description: Agenesis of one or more maxillary lateral incisor, comprising the maxillary lateral primary incisor.
synonyms: ["Agenesis of deciduous maxillary lateral incisor","Failure of development of deciduous maxillary lateral incisor","Failure of development of primary maxillary lateral incisor"]

name: Aplasia of the phalanges of the 5th toe
synonyms: ["Absent little toe bones","Absent pinkie toe bones","Absent pinky toe bones"]

name: Reticular pigmentary degeneration
description: A type of retinal reticular pigmentation that forms a polygonal, netlike arrangement of hyperpigmented lines forming geometric patterns in the fundus.

name: Triangular shaped proximal phalanx of the hallux
synonyms: ["Triangular shaped innermost bone of big toe"]

name: Cyclodeviation
description: Cyclodeviation is defined as the rotation of an eyeball along the anteroposterior axis and cyclotropia as a misalignment of cyclodeviation between the two eyes.

name: Recurrent paroxysmal headache
description: Repeated episodes of headache with rapid onset, reaching a peak within minutes and of short duration (less than one hour) with pain that is throbbing, pulsating, or bursting in quality.

name: Impaired urinary acidification
description: The kidney contributes towards acid-base homeostasis by excreting H+ ions and retaining bicarbonate. This process is known as acidification of the urine. The pH of urine ranges normally from 4.5 to 8. The inability to reduce the pH of the urine in a situation where it would be otherwise expected is known as an acidification defect.

name: Ocular anterior segment dysgenesis
description: Abnormal development (dysgenesis) of the anterior segment of the eye globe. These structures are mainly of mesenchymal origin.
synonyms: ["HP:0007696","HP:0007699","HP:0008040","Anterior chamber cleavage defect","Anterior chamber cleavage disorder","Anterior chamber malformation","Anterior chamber mesodermal anomalies","Anterior segment developmental abnormality","Anterior segment dysgenesis","Anterior segment mesencyhmal dysgenesis","Anterior segment ocular dysgenesis"]

name: Profound
description: Having an extremely high degree of severity. For quantitative traits, a deviation of more than five standard deviations from the appropriate population mean.

name: Snowflake vitreoretinal degeneration
description: The appearance of yellow/white crystalline-like (hence the name) spots in the retina and thickening of the peripheral part of the vitreous.

name: Elevated urinary uromodulin
description: An increased amount of uromodulin (also known as Tamm Horsfall protein) in the urine.

name: Brachioradialis hyporeflexia
description: Reduced intensity of the brachioradialis tendon reflex.

name: Abnormality of the shoulder girdle musculature
Abnormal platelet morphology
description: An anomaly in platelet form, ultrastructure, or intracellular organelles.

name: Alternating esotropia
description: Esotropia in which either eye may be used for fixation.

name: Precocious puberty with Sertoli cell tumor
Hypoinsulinemia
description: A decreased concentration of insulin in the blood.

name: Fetal pericardial effusion
description: An abnormal accumulation of fluid in which the heart is partially or completely surrounded by fluid that is seen in all views and the thickness of the fluid as observed by prenatal ultrasound is above age-dependent norms.

name: Avascular necrosis of the capital femoral epiphysis
description: Avascular necrosis of the proximal epiphysis of the femur occurring in growing children and caused by an interruption of the blood supply to the head of the femur close to the hip joint. The necrosis is characteristically associated with flattening of the femoral head, for which reason the term coxa plana has been used to refer to this feature in the medical literature.
synonyms: ["HP:0003280","HP:0006448","HP:0010887","Osteochondrosis of the femoral head","Osteonecrosis of the femoral head","Perthes-like femoral head changes"]

name: Increased urine neutrophil count
description: Abnormally increased count of neutrophils in urine.

name: Increased urinary multiantennary sialylated oligosaccharide
description: An abnormal increase in the concentration of multiantennary sialylated oligosaccharides in the urine.
synonyms: ["Increase concentration of multiantennary sialylated oligosaccharides in urine"]

name: Partial IgA deficiency
description: Detectable but decreased IgA levels that are more than 2 standard deviations below normal age-adjusted means.

name: Emotional blunting
description: Lack of emotional reactivity and empathy for situations or persons, sometime also for family members.

name: Hemorrhagic ovarian cyst
description: An abdominal mass formed by bleeding into a follicular ovarian cyst or corpus luteum cyst.

name: Peripheral axonal neuropathy
description: An abnormality characterized by disruption of the normal functioning of peripheral axons.

name: Focal-onset seizure
description: A focal-onset seizure is a type of seizure originating within networks limited to one hemisphere. They may be discretely localized or more widely distributed, and may originate in subcortical structures.
synonyms: ["HP:0002358","HP:0040168","Focal onset seizure","Focal seizure","Focal seizures","Focal-onset seizures","Partial seizure","Partial seizures","Seizure affecting one half of brain"]

name: Retinal hamartoma
description: A hamartoma (a benign, focal malformation consisting of a disorganized mixture of cells and tissues) of the retina.

name: Branchial sinus
description: A congenital branchial sinus is a remnant of the embryonic branchial arches and their intervening clefts and pouches that has failed to regress completely. Sinuses typically have their external orifice inferior to the ramus of the mandible. They may traverse the parotid gland, and run in close vicinity to the facial nerve in the external auditory canal.

name: Rosette-forming glioneuronal tumor
description: A tumor of the central nervous system that has components of both neurocytic and glial areas, whereby usually the glial component of the tumour predominates. Rossette-forming glioneuronal tumors (RGNT) have biphasic cytoarchitecture with two elements; neurocytic rosettes resembling Homer-Wright rosettes, and astrocytic component resembling a pilocytic astrocytoma. RGNTs are low-grade tumors that lack histopathological signs of malignancy.

name: Pretibial blistering
description: A type of blistering that affects the skin of the tibial region.

name: Triangular epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 3rd toe
synonyms: ["Triangular end part of the innermost bone of the 3rd toe"]

name: Resting tremor
description: A resting tremor occurs when muscles are at rest and becomes less noticeable or disappears when the affected muscles are moved. Resting tremors are often slow and coarse.

name: Pituitary dwarfism
description: A type of reduced stature with normal proportions related to dysfunction of the pituitary gland related to either an isolated defect in the secretion of growth hormone or to panhypopituitarism, i.e., a deficit of all the anterior pituitary hormones.

name: Methamphetamine addiction
description: Addiction to methamphetamine.

name: Hyposegmentation of neutrophil nuclei in CSF
description: Hyposegmented (hypolobulated) or bilobed neutrophil nuclei in the cerebrospinal fluid.
synonyms: ["Hyposegmentation of neutrophil nuclei in cerebrospinal fluid"]

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the middle phalanx of the 5th finger
description: Absence or underdevelopment (hypoplasia) of the middle phalanx of the little (5th) finger.
synonyms: ["HP:0006242","Absent/hypoplastic middle phalanx of 5th finger","Absent/small middle bone of pinky finger","Absent/underdeveloped middle bone of little finger","Absent/underdeveloped middle bone of pinkie finger","Absent/underdeveloped middle bone of pinky finger"]

name: Abnormality of intestinal smooth muscle morphology
description: A structural anomaly of the nonstriated, involuntary muscle tissue of the intestine.

name: Abnormal renal arteriole endothelium morphology
description: Any structural anomaly of the lining (endothelium) of the arterioles of the kidney.

name: Thromboembolic stroke
description: A cerebrovascular accident (stroke) that occurs because of thromboembolism.

name: Abnormal muscle physiology
description: A functional abnormality of a skeletal muscle.
synonyms: ["Abnormality of muscle physiology","Issue with muscle function"]

name: Excessive cerumen
description: An increased quantity of earwax.

name: Aortic rupture
description: Tearing of the aortic wall generally associated with profuse internal bleeding.

name: Triangular epiphyses of the 2nd toe
synonyms: ["Triangular end part of the 2nd toe bone"]

name: Accumulation of muscle fiber desmin
description: Immunohistochemistry shows accumulation of desmin protein in the muscle biopsy.
synonyms: ["Accumulation of muscle fibre desmin","Muscle fiber desmin-reactive inclusion bodies","Muscle fibre desmin-reactive inclusion bodies"]

name: Unhappy demeanor
description: A conspicuously unhappy disposition characterized by negative assumptions, self-defeating talk, fear of failure, and negative ruminations about past events.

name: Pectus excavatum of inferior sternum
description: Pectus excavatum (defect of the chest wall characterized by depression of the sternum) affecting primarily the inferior region of the sternum.

name: Abnormal phalangeal joint morphology of the hand
synonyms: ["HP:0004266","Abnormality of phalangeal joints of the hand","Abnormality of the small joints of the hand"]

name: Spastic hemiparetic gait
description: Spastic hemiparesis is characterized by a dominance of the tonus in the upper limb flexor muscles: the arm is held in an adducted posture and is bent and rotated inwards, the forearm is pronated and the hand and the fingers are flexed. The leg is slightly bent at the hip, the knee cannot be extended fully at the end of the stance phase and the foot is inverted and in a plantar flexed position. Gait is slow, with a wide base and asymmetrical with a shortened weight-bearing phase on the paretic side. During the swing phase, the paretic leg performs a lateral movement (circumduction) which is characteristic of this gait disorder, also termed Wernicke-Mann gait. Spastic gait problems typically worsen on attempts to walk faster.

name: Focal sensory seizure
description: A focal sensory seizure is a type seizure beginning with a subjective sensation.

name: Elongated femoral neck
description: Increased length of the neck of the femur.

name: Intermittent painful muscle spasms
description: History of repeated intermittent involuntary muscle contractions that were painful.

name: Abnormal neutrophil count
description: A deviation from the normal range of neutrophil cell counts in the circulation.

name: Chorioretinal scar
description: Fibrous connective tissue resulting from incomplete healing of a wound (i.e., a scar) located in the choroid and retina or the eye.

name: Stress urinary incontinence
description: Involuntary urine leakage synchronous with exertion, or actions such as sneezing, or coughing.

name: Small intestinal dysmotility
description: Abnormal small intestinal contractions, such as spasms and intestinal paralysis related to the loss of the ability of the gut to coordinate muscular activity because of endogenous or exogenous causes.

name: Weakness of long finger extensor muscles
Food intolerance
description: A detrimental reaction to a food, beverage, food additive, or compound found in foods that produces symptoms in one or more body organs and systems that is not mediated by an immune reaction.

name: Paratracheal lymphadenopathy
description: Enlargement of lymph nodes surrounding the trachea.

name: Anterior chamber flare grade 4+
description: Intense anterior chamber flare (fibrin/plastic aqueous).

name: Focal non-convulsive status epilepticus without coma
description: Focal non-convulsive status epilepticus without coma is a type of status epilepticus without prominent motor signs, which is electrographically focal. It is a prolonged focal non-motor seizure.

name: Large placenta
description: Increased size of the placenta.

name: Ultra-low vision
description: Best corrected visual acuity worse than 1.90 logMAR (roughly 20/1590).

name: Abnormal ureter physiology
description: A functional abnormality of the ureter. The ureter is the duct by which urine passes from the kidney to the bladder.

name: Rotator cuff tear
description: The term rotator cuff describes the tendons connecting the infraspinatus, supraspinatus, teres minor, and subscapularis muscles to the humeral head.Traumatic tears of the rotator cuff tend to occur at the tendon-bone junction of the supraspinatus and greater tuberosity of the humerus whereas degenerative tears tend to be seen posteriorly at the junction of the supraspinatus and infraspinatu A rotator cuff tear is when one or more of these tendons tears or detaches from the humerus.

name: Question mark ear
description: Cleft between the helix and the lobe.
synonyms: ["Constricted ear","Cosman ear","Question mark ear","Question mark ears"]

name: Peripapillary atrophy
description: Thinning in the layers of the retina and retinal pigment epithelium around the optic nerve.

name: Increased intraabdominal fat
description: An abnormal increase in the amount of intraabdominal fat tissue.

name: Decreased specific antibody response to infection
description: A reduced ability to synthesize antibodies against antigens from an infectious agent or pathogen (such as bacteria, viruses, parasites, etc.), as measured by antibody titer determination following infection.

name: Periostosis
description: Abnormal deposition of periosteal bone.

name: Lip hyperpigmentation
synonyms: ["Darkening of skin of the lips","Hyperpigmentation of lip vermillion","Increased pigmentation on the lips"]

name: Delayed epiphyseal ossification
synonyms: ["HP:0005862","Delayed epiphyseal maturation","Delayed epiphyseal ossification","Delayed opacification of the epiphyses","Epiphyseal ossification delay"]

name: Abnormal vena cava morphology
description: An abnormality of the structure of the veins that return deoxygenated blood from the body into the heart, i.e., the superior vena cava and the inferior vena cava.

name: Terminal insomnia
description: A type of insomnia characterized by waking up (too) early in the morning.

name: Enuresis nocturna
description: Enuresis occurring during sleeping hours.

name: Unicuspid aortic valve
description: The presence of an aortic valve with one instead of the normal three cusps (flaps).

name: Pseudoepiphysis of the middle phalanx of the 2nd finger
description: A secondary ossification center in the middle phalanx of the second finger that is distinct from the normal epiphysis that does not contribute to the longitudinal growth of a tubular bone.

name: Proximal humeral metaphyseal irregularity
description: Irregularity of the normally smooth surface of the metaphysis at the proximal end of the humerus (at the shoulder).

name: Somatic sensory dysfunction
description: An abnormality of the primary sensation that is mediated by peripheral nerves (pain, temperature, touch, vibration, joint position). The word hypoesthesia (or hypesthesia) refers to a reduction in cutaneous sensation to a specific type of testing.

name: Renal interstitial mononuclear cell infiltration
description: Presence of interstitial mononuclear leukocytes, i.e., white blood ceclls with a single round nucleus, including lymphocytes and monocytes but not including granulocytes (which have multilobed nuclei).

name: Abnormal oocyte morphology
description: An abnormal structure of the female germ cell (egg cell).

name: Abnormal pulmonary fissure count
description: A deviation from the normal number of pulmonary fissures.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the triceps
description: Absence or underdevelopment of the triceps muscle.

name: Abnormality morphology of the macular vasculature
description: Any structural anomaly of the blood vessels of the macula.

name: Coronary artery sandwich anomaly
description: Origin of the right coronary artery (RCA) from the left sinus of Valsalva or of the left main (LM) or left anterior descending (LAD) coronary artery from the right sinus of Valsalva, with the additional feature that the artery passes between the two great arteries. This carries a risk of the artery being compressed by these two vessels,
synonyms: ["Anomalous coronary artery with aortic origin and course between the great arteries"]

name: Cerebral white matter hypoplasia
description: Underdevelopment of the cerebral white matter.

name: Tetralogy of Fallot with absent subarterial conus
Agnosia
description: Inability to recognize objects not because of sensory deficit but because of the inability to combine components of sensory impressions into a complete pattern. Thus, agnosia is a neurological condition which results in an inability to know, to name, to identify, and to extract meaning from visual, auditory, or tactile impressions.

name: Senile plaques
description: Senile plaques are extracellular deposits of amyloid in the gray matter of the brain.

name: Decreased glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase level in red blood cells
description: A decrease in the level of glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase in red blood cells.
synonyms: ["Decreased G6PD level in RBCs","Decreased G6PD level in red blood cells"]

name: Duffy blood group
description: The Duffy blood group system is based on the presence of a glycoprotein termed Fy that is on the surface of erythrocytes and some other cells. There are two Duffy antigens named Fya and Fyb, and thus there are four Duffy phenotypes: a+b+, a+b-, a-b+,a-b-.

name: Bradyopsia
description: Difficulty in seeing moving objects.

name: Coat hanger sign of ribs
description: An abnormal morphology of the ribs consisting of shorted, abnormally curved ribs. On posteroanterior chest radiography, the ribs show a curvature resembling that of a coat hanger (clothes hanger).

name: Abnormality of the genital system
description: An abnormality of the genital system.

name: Decreased activity of mitochondrial complex I
description: A reduction in the activity of the mitochondrial respiratory chain complex I, which is part of the electron transport chain in mitochondria.

name: Decreased CSF/serum albumin ratio
description: A reduction below normal limits of the ratio of the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) albumin concentration to serum albumin concentration.

name: Esophageal varix
description: Extreme dilation of the submucusoal veins in the lower portion of the esophagus.
synonyms: ["Enlarged vein in esophagus","Enlarged vein in oesophagus"]

name: Hand dimple
description: A cutaneous indentation resulting from tethering of the skin to underlying structures (bone) of the hand.

name: Bicuspid aortic valve with right-left cusp fusion
description: A type of bicuspid aortic valve (BAV) characterized by a single raphe between the right and left cusps (RL fusion pattern). This results in two leaflefts with an anterior-posterior leaflet orientation (also called the typical pattern). There is thus one completely developed noncoronary cusp, two completely developed commissures, and one raphe between the underdeveloped left and right coronary cusps extending to the corresponding malformed commissure.

name: Abnormality of somatosensory evoked potentials
description: An abnormality of somatosensory evoked potentials (SSEP), i.e., of the electrical signals of sensation going from the body to the brain in response to a defined stimulus. Recording electrodes are placed over the scalp, spine, and peripheral nerves proximal to the stimulation site. Clinical studies generally use electrical stimulation of peripheral nerves to elicit potentials. SSEP testing determines whether peripheral sensory nerves are able to transmit sensory information like pain, temperature, and touch to the brain. Abnormal SSEPs can result from dysfunction at the level of the peripheral nerve, plexus, spinal root, spinal cord, brain stem, thalamocortical projections, or primary somatosensory cortex.

name: Cognitive epileptic aura
description: A purely subjective manifestation of an epileptic seizure pertaining to altered cognition.

name: Prominent nasal bridge
description: Anterior positioning of the nasal root in comparison to the usual positioning for age.
synonyms: ["HP:0000432","HP:0000442","HP:0004498","HP:0005287","Elevated nasal bridge","High nasal bridge","Prominent bridge of nose","Prominent nasal bridge","Prominent nasal root","Protruding bridge of nose","Protruding nasal bridge"]

name: Toe syndactyly
description: Webbing or fusion of the toes, involving soft parts only or including bone structure. Bony fusions are referred to as \"bony\" Syndactyly if the fusion occurs in a radio-ulnar axis. Fusions of bones of the toes in a proximo-distal axis are referred to as \"Symphalangism\".
synonyms: ["HP:0001828","HP:0005677","Foot syndactyly","Fused toes","Syndactyly of feet","Syndactyly of toes","Webbed toes"]

name: Absent bronchoalveolar surfactant-protein C
description: Significantly decreased level or failed detection of surfactant protein C in broncho-alveolar lavage fluid. Comment: Pulmonary surfactant is a highly surface-active mixture of proteins and lipids that is synthesized and secreted onto the alveoli by type II epithelial cells. The protein part of surfactant constitutes of four types of surfactant proteins (SP), SP-A, SP-B, SP-C and SP-D. SP-A and SP-D are hydrophilic proteins that regulate surfactant metabolism and have immunologic functions, whereas SP-B and SP-C are hydrophobic molecules, which play a direct role in the organization of the surfactant structure in the interphase and in the stabilization of the lipid layers during the respiratory cycle. Lack of SP-C may result of surfactant metabolism dysfunction and is also observed in patients with other diffuse parenchymal lung diseaes, pathogenetically related to the alveolar surfactant region.

name: Aplasia of the vagina
description: Aplasia of the vagina.

name: Abnormal cortical radial artery lumen morphology
description: Abnormal structural characteristics of the interior space of the cortical radial arteries of the kidney.

name: Shoulder dystocia
description: Shoulder dystocia occurs when the fetal anterior shoulder impacts against the maternal symphysis following delivery of the vertex.

name: Renal chloride wasting
description: High urine chloride in the presence of hypochloridemia.
synonyms: ["Kidney chloride wasting","Renal Cl wasting","Renal Cl- wasting"]

name: Abnormality of renin-angiotensin system
description: An abnormality of the renin-angiotensin system.

name: Symphalangism of the 5th finger
description: Fusion of two or more bones of the 5th finger.
synonyms: ["Fifth finger symphalangism","Fused little finger bones","Fused pinkie finger bones","Fused pinky finger bones","Symphalagism of the little finger"]

name: Opsoclonus
description: Bursts of large-amplitude multidirectional saccades without intersaccadic interval

name: Brainstem dysplasia
description: A developmental structural anomaly of the stalk-like part of the brain that comprises the midbrain (aka mesencephalon), the pons (aka pons Varolii), and the medulla oblongata, and connects the cerebral hemispheres with the cervical spinal cord.

name: Abnormality of the columella
description: An abnormality of the columella.

name: Glomerular hyalinosis at the tubular pole
description: Accumulation of amorphous, eosinophilic, glassy, periodic acid-Schiff (PAS)-positive, silver-negative material in the glomerulus at the tip/tubular pole.

name: Adenocarcinoma of the large intestine
description: A malignant epithelial tumor with a glandular organization that originates in the large intestine.

name: Increased body weight
description: Abnormally increased body weight.

name: Ovarian carcinoma
description: A malignant neoplasm originating from the surface ovarian epithelium.

name: Anti-reticulin antibody positivity
description: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against reticulin.

name: Calcinosis
description: Formation of calcium deposits in any soft tissue.
synonyms: ["Calcium buildup in soft tissues of body"]

name: Glomerular synechial adhesion
description: An area of basement membrane continuity between the glomerular tuft and Bowman's capsule, without intervening crescent and not adjacent to an area of segmental sclerosis.

name: Lack of gonadotropin-releasing hormone pulsatility
description: Secretion of gonadotropin-releasing hormone that does not occur in a pulsatile fashion.

name: Decreased HDL3a concentration
description: A reduction below the normal concentration of the HDL3a subfraction in the blood circulation. An HDL3a particle is defined as an HDL particle with a size of 8.2-8.79 nm.

name: Thickened Achilles tendon
description: An abnormal thickening of the Achilles tendon.

name: Hypomethioninemia
description: A decreased concentration of methionine in the blood.

name: Pulmonary pneumatocele
description: A pneumatocele is a thin walled, gas-filled space in the lung. It is most frequently caused by acute pneumonia, trauma, or aspiration of hydrocarbon fluid and is usually transient. The mechanism is believed to be a combination of parenchymal necrosis and check-valve airway obstruction. A pneumatocele appears as an approximately round, thin-walled airspace in the lung.

name: Single transverse palmar crease
description: The distal and proximal transverse palmar creases are merged into a single transverse palmar crease.
synonyms: ["HP:0006214","Simian crease","Simian creases","Simian line","Single flexion crease","Single palmar crease","Single palmar creases","Single transverse palmar creases","Transverse palmar crease"]

name: Curved middle phalanx of the 4th finger
description: Curved appearance of the middle phalanx of the 4th (ring) finger.

name: Anterior cervical hypertrichosis
description: Anterior cervical hypertrichosis (ACH) or 'hairy throat' refers to the presence of a tuft of terminal hair on the anterior neck, just above the laryngeal prominence.

name: Anti-mGluR5 antibody
description: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against metabotropic glutamate receptor 5 (mGluR5).

name: Positive urine amphetamine test
description: Detection of amphetamine or its metabolites in urine.

name: Ivory epiphysis of the middle phalanx of the 2nd toe
synonyms: ["Increased bone density of end part of the middle bone of the 2nd toe"]

name: Glomerular extracapillary fibrin
description: Presence of ropey, eosinophilic material (brght red on Trichrome staining) consistent with extracapillary fibrin outside of capillary lumina.

name: Food-induced anaphylaxis
description: Food-induced anaphylaxis is a severe, potentially fatal, systemic allergic reaction that occurs suddenly after contact with an allergy-causing food.

name: Limb ataxia
description: A kind of ataxia that affects movements of the extremities.

name: History of recent tick bite
description: Medical history of a recent bite injury due to a tick.

name: Abnormal presence of ultra-large von Willebrand factor multimers
description: Detection of abnormal ultra-large von Willebrand factor multimers.

name: Hemiplegia
description: Paralysis (complete loss of muscle function) in the arm, leg, and in some cases the face on one side of the body.

name: Perihilar glomerular hyalinosis
description: Accumulation of amorphous, eosinophilic, glassy, periodic acid-Schiff (PAS)-positive, silver-negative material in the glomerulus at the vascular pole/perihilum.

name: Ventricular septal defect
description: A hole between the two bottom chambers (ventricles) of the heart. The defect is centered around the most superior aspect of the ventricular septum.
synonyms: ["HP:0001652","Hole in heart wall separating two lower heart chambers","Ventricular septal defects","Ventriculoseptal defect","VSD"]

name: Impaired flow-mediated arterial dilatation
description: Flow-mediated dilatation is a noninvasive tests of endothelial function that leverages ultrasound to measure arterial diameter and its response to an increase in shear stress, which normally causes endothelium-dependent dilatation. This term pertains to an abnormal reduction in the magnitude of dilatation. Flow-mediated dilatation is usually measured at the brachial artery.

name: Aplasia/hypoplasia involving bones of the hand
description: Absence (due to failure to form) or underdevelopment of the bones of the hand.
synonyms: ["Absent/small hand bones","Absent/underdeveloped hand bones","Hypoplasia/absence of hand bones"]

name: Focal cortical dysplasia
description: A type of malformation of cortical development that primarily affects areas of neocortex. It can be identified on conventional magnetic resonance imaging as focal cortical thickening, abnormal gyration, and blurring between gray and white matter, often associated with clusters of heterotopic neurons.

name: Gaze-evoked nystagmus
description: Nystagmus made apparent by looking to the right or to the left.

name: Subretinal fluid
description: Edema/fluid accumulating between the retinal pigment epithelium and Bruch's membrane.

name: obsolete Abnormal morphology of bones of the upper limbs
Low levels of vitamin E
description: A reduced concentration of vitamin E in the blood circulation. Vitamin E is a lipophilic vitamin that is also known as alpha-tocopherol.

name: Poor suck
description: An inadequate sucking reflex, resulting in the difficult of newborns to be breast-fed.

name: H-type rectovestibular fistula
description: Rectovestibular fistula with a normal anus is known as H-type fistula or double termination of the alimentary tract.

name: Hypoplastic ilia
description: Underdevelopment of the ilium.
synonyms: ["HP:0003176","HP:0003178","Short and small iliac bones","Small iliac bones","Small wings of the pelvic girdle"]

name: Postductal coarctation of the aorta
description: Narrowing or constriction of the aorta localized distal to the ductus arteriosus, i.e., to the postductal region of aortic arch.

name: Abnormality of upper lip
description: An abnormality of the upper lip.

name: Quadruple gallop rhythm
description: A type of gallop rhytm in which both the third and the fourth sounds are present.

name: Ulnar metaphyseal irregularity
description: Irregularity of the normally smooth surface of the metaphysis of the ulna.

name: Chronic pain
description: Persistent pain, usually defined as pain that has lasted longer than 3 to 6 months.

name: Elevated circulating 5-oxoproline concentration
description: Concentration of L-pyroglutamic acid in the blood is above the normal range.

name: Anti-SUMO-activating enzyme subunit 1 antibody positivity
description: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against SAE 1.

name: Lower limb pain
description: An unpleasant sensation characterized by physical discomfort (such as pricking, throbbing, or aching) localized to the leg.

name: Pulmonic stenosis
description: A narrowing of the right ventricular outflow tract that can occur at the pulmonary valve (valvular stenosis) or just below the pulmonary valve (infundibular stenosis).
synonyms: ["Narrowing of pulmonic valve","Pulmonary stenosis","Pulmonary valve stenosis","Pulmonic valve stenosis"]

name: Impaired lymphocyte transformation with phytohemagglutinin
description: Normal peripheral blood lymphocytes, when stimulated by phytohemagglutinin (PHA) are cytotoxic for homologous and heterologous cells but not for autologous cells in monolayer culture. The cytotoxic effect is thought to be indicative of the immunological competence of the lymphocytes.

name: Atrioventricular reentrant tachycardia
description: Accessory pathway-related atrioventricular reentrant tachycardia (AVRT) involves an abnormal electrical conduction of the accessory pathway. The accessory pathway connecting impulses between the atrium and the ventricle can be seen at any site in the AV groove.

name: Abnormality of hand cortical bone
description: An anomaly of the outer shell (cortex) of a hand bone.
synonyms: ["Abnormality of the cortex of hand bones"]

name: Metaphyseal dappling
description: The presence of spots or rounded patches of abnormally increased density of metaphyseal bone.

name: Deviation of the 3rd finger
description: Displacement of the 3rd finger from its normal position.

name: Abnormality of the seventh cranial nerve
description: Abnormality of the seventh cranial nerve sometimes also referred to as the facial nerve.

name: Absence of CD8-positive T cells
description: Lack of detectible CD8-positive T cells

name: Fetor hepaticus
description: Fetor hepaticus is the characteristic breath of patients with severe parenchymal liver disease, which has been said to resemble the odor of a mixture of rotten eggs and garlic.

name: Bradykinesia
description: Bradykinesia literally means slow movement, and is used clinically to denote a slowness in the execution of movement (in contrast to hypokinesia, which is used to refer to slowness in the initiation of movement).

name: Stiff interphalangeal joints
description: Interphalangeal joint stiffness is a perceived sensation of tightness in the interphalangeal joints when attempting to move them after a period of inactivity.

name: Depressed nasal tip
description: Decreased distance from the nasal tip to the nasal base.
synonyms: ["HP:0005279","Caved in nasal tip","Depressed nasal tip","Depressed tip of nose","Flat nasal tip","Flat tip of nose","Flattened nasal tip","Nasal tip, depressed","Nasal tip, recessed","Nasal tip, retruded","Retruded tip of nose"]

name: Triangular shaped distal phalanx of the 4th finger
description: Triangular shaped distal phalanx of the 4th (ring) finger. A triangular or so called delta shaped phalanx is a typical result after a bracket epiphysis of the affected phalanx.
synonyms: ["Triangular shaped outermost bone of the ring finger"]

name: Abnormal sialylation of N-linked protein glycosylation
description: An anomaly of the addition of sialic acids to N-linked glycans.

name: Abnormal brainstem morphology
description: An anomaly of the brainstem.
synonyms: ["Abnormal shape of brainstem","Abnormality of brainstem morphology","Abnormality of the brainstem"]

name: Abnormal response to endocrine stimulation test
description: An anomalous response to a test that is designed to probe the function of the endocrine system.

name: Enlarged epiphysis of the middle phalanx of the 5th toe
synonyms: ["Enlarged end part of the middle bone of the little toe","Enlarged end part of the middle bone of the pinkie toe","Enlarged end part of the middle bone of the pinky toe"]

name: Increased glutamine family amino acid level in urine
description: An elevated level of an glutamine family amino acid in the urine.

name: Heinz body anemia
description: Anemia characterized by abnormal intracellular inclusions, composed of denatured hemoglobin, found on the membrane of red blood cells.

name: Abnormal epiphyseal ossification
description: An abnormality of the formation and mineralization of an epiphysis.
synonyms: ["Abnormality of the mineralisation or ossification of the epiphyses"]

name: Blistering by histological location
description: Blistering (presence of multiple fluid filled blisters) categorized according to the layer of the skin in which the blister originates.

name: Increased anti-house dust mite IgE antibody level
description: Increased level of IgE antibody against house dust mites, a common allergen.
synonyms: ["Increased anti-house dust IgE antibody level","Increased level of anti-house dust IgE antibody"]

name: Hyperplasia of midface
description: Abnormally anterior positioning of the infraorbital and perialar regions, or increased convexity of the face, or increased nasolabial angle. The midface includes the maxilla, the cheeks, the zygomas, and the infraorbital and perialar regions of the face

name: Phenylalaninuria
description: Increased level of phenylalanine in urine.

name: Abnormal blood gas level in cord blood
Plantar pits
description: The presence of multiple pits (small, pinpoint-large indentations on the surface of the skin) located on the skin of sole of foot.

name: Dysplastic sacrum
description: A developmental defect of the sacrum characterized by partial or disordered development of the sacrum in which portions of the sacrum, which normally is formed by fusion of five sacral vertebrae S1-S5, fail to form or fail to form normally.
synonyms: ["Absence of some of the sacral and coccygeal bones","Partial sacral agenesis","Sacral dysgenesis"]

name: Hamartoma of the eye
description: A hamartoma (disordered proliferation of mature tissues) which can originate from any tissue of the eye.

name: Cutaneous leiomyoma
description: The presence of leiomyoma of the skin.

name: obsolete Dilatation of the descending aorta
Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the fifth metatarsal bone
synonyms: ["Absent/small 5th long bone of foot","Absent/underdeveloped 5th long bone of foot"]

name: Subcutaneous nodule
description: Slightly elevated lesions on or in the skin with a diameter of over 5 mm.
synonyms: ["HP:0005903","Firm lump under the skin","Growth of abnormal tissue under the skin","Nodule below the skin"]

name: Focal aware myoclonic seizure
description: A type of focal myoclonic seizure during which awareness is fully retained throughout.

name: Hypoparathyroidism
description: A condition caused by a deficiency of parathyroid hormone characterized by hypocalcemia and hyperphosphatemia.

name: Paramedian lip pit
description: Depression located paramedially on the vermilion of a lip.

name: Persistent bleeding after trauma
synonyms: ["HP:0007463","Excessive bleeding after minor trauma","Frequent bleeding with trauma","Prolonged bleeding after minor trauma"]

name: Sleep-interrupting
description: Applied to pain that wakes the affecting individual from sleep.

name: Intestinal polyposis
description: The presence of multiple polyps in the intestine.
synonyms: ["Growths in inner lining of intestine","Multiple intestinal polyps"]

name: EEG with temporal epileptiform discharges
description: Focal epileptiform EEG discharges recorded in the temporal region.

name: Absent facial hair
description: Absence of facial hair.

name: Broad 2nd toe
description: A broad appearance of the second toe.

name: Colon perforation
description: A hole (perforation) in the wall of the colon.

name: Abnormality of the lymph nodes
description: A lymph node abnormality.
synonyms: ["HP:0008149","Abnormal lymph node histology","Abnormality of the lymph nodes"]

name: Abnormal CSF tyrosine concentration
description: Any deviation from the normal concentration of tyrosine in the cerebrospinal fluid.

name: Segmentally thickened glomerular basement membrane
description: Prominent glomerular basement membrane (GBM) reflecting a segmental and increase in thickness (subjective estimate) with no evidence of electron dense deposits by EM. Thickening is measured from endothelial to visceral epithelial plasma membrane and mainly attributable to an increase in thickness of the lamina densa, generally to an overall thickness more than 2 standard deviations greater than that of the normal mean GBM thickness for health age- and sex matched individuals.

name: Abnormality of bone marrow cell morphology
description: An anomaly of the form or number of cells in the bone marrow.

name: Glandular cell neoplasm
description: A tumor that arises from a gland cell.

name: Generalized dystonia
description: A type of dystonia that affects all or most of the body.

name: Eczema
description: Eczema is a form of dermatitis. The term eczema is broadly applied to a range of persistent skin conditions and can be related to a number of underlying conditions. Manifestations of eczema can include dryness and recurring skin rashes with redness, skin edema, itching and dryness, crusting, flaking, blistering, cracking, oozing, or bleeding.

name: Abnormal inferior oblique muscle physiology
description: A functional anomaly of the inferior oblique muscle, an extraocular muscle that has its origin on the maxillary bone just posterior to the inferior medial orbital rim and lateral to the nasolacrimal canal and that is innervated by the inferior branch of the oculomotor nerve.

name: Dull
description: Applied to pain that is dull, i.e., not severe but that continues over a long period of time.

name: Abnormality of medial pterygoid muscle
description: An abnormality of a medial pterygoid muscle.

name: Decreased methylmalonyl-CoA mutase activity
description: An abnormality of Krebs cycle metabolism that is characterized by a decreased rate of methylmalonyl-CoA mutase activity.

name: Abnormal morphology of the shoulder musculature
description: Any abnormality of the shoulder muscles.
synonyms: ["Abnormality of the shoulder musculature","Muscle issues in the shoulder"]

name: Abnormal ascending aorta morphology
description: Any structural anomaly of the portion of the aorta that arises from the base of the left ventricle and extends upward to the aortic arch and from which the coronary arteries arise.

name: Dermatan sulfate excretion in urine
description: An increased concentration of dermatan sulfate in the urine.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the phalanges of the 4th toe
synonyms: ["Absent/small bones of 4th toe","Absent/underdeveloped bones of 4th toe"]

name: Talocalcaneal synostosis
synonyms: ["Fusion of foot joint","Fusion of the subtalar joint"]

name: Abnormal acetabulum morphology
description: An abnormality of the acetabulum, i.e., the Acetabular part of hip bone, which together with the head of the femur forms the hip joint.
synonyms: ["Abnormality of the acetabulum","Abnormality of the hipbone socket","Acetabular abnormality"]

name: Stippling of the epiphysis of the middle phalanx of the 5th finger
description: The presence of abnormal punctate (speckled, dot-like) calcifications in the epiphysis of the middle phalanx of the 5th finger.
synonyms: ["Speckled calcifications in end part of the middle bone of the little finger","Speckled calcifications in end part of the middle bone of the pinkie finger","Speckled calcifications in end part of the middle bone of the pinky finger"]

name: Irregular epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 2nd toe
synonyms: ["Irregular end part of the outermost bone of the 2nd toe"]

name: Increased proportion of central memory CD4-positive, alpha-beta T cells
description: An abnormally elevated proportion of central memory CD4-positive, alpha-beta memory T cells compared to the total number of T cells in the blood. These cells have the phenotype of CCR7-positive, CD127-positive, CD45RA-negative, CD45RO-positive, and CD25-negative.
synonyms: ["HP:0025621","Elevated proportion central memory CD4-positive, alpha-beta T cells","Elevated proportion of CD4+ central memory cells","Increased proportion of CD4+ central memory cells","Increased proportion of central memory CD4+, alpha-beta T cell"]

name: Abnormality of fibular epiphyses
synonyms: ["Abnormality of the end part of the calf bone"]

name: Cleft helix
description: A notched form of the helix of the ear. That is, a defect in the continuity of the helix, which may occur at any point along its length.

name: Absent pulmonary artery
description: A congenital defect with aplasia (absence) of one of the right or left pulmonary artery.

name: Posterior scalloping of vertebral bodies
description: An excessive concavity of the posterior surface of one or more vertebral bodies.

name: Bladder outlet obstruction
description: A compression or resistance upon the bladder outflow channel at any location from the bladder neck to urethral meatus, which usually causes lower urinary tract symptoms (LUTS).

name: Skin rash
description: A red eruption of the skin.

name: Abnormality of the tympanic membrane
description: An abnormality of the tympanic membrane

name: Moderate constriction of peripheral visual field
description: Peripheral visual field constriction with 20-49 degrees binocular visual field preserved.

name: Low posterior hairline
description: Hair on the neck extends more inferiorly than usual.
synonyms: ["Low hairline at back of neck","Low posterior hair line"]

name: Cleft earlobe
description: Discontinuity in the convexity of the inferior margin of the lobe.

name: Deviation of the 2nd finger
description: Displacement of the 2nd finger from its normal position.

name: Facial hypotonia
description: Reduced muscle tone of a muscle that is innervated by the facial nerve (the seventh cranial nerve).
synonyms: ["Decreased facial muscle tone","Hypotonic facies","Low facial muscle tone","Reduced facial muscle tone"]

name: Aplasia of the musculature of the pelvis
description: Absence of the musculature of the pelvis.

name: Peripheral amyelination
description: Congenital absence of the myelin sheath on a nerve.

name: Increased extraneuronal autofluorescent lipopigment
description: Lipofuscin, a generic term applied to autofluorescent lipopigment, is a mixture of protein and lipid that accumulates in most aging cells, particularly those involved in high lipid turnover (e.g., the adrenal medulla) or phagocytosis of other cell types (e g., the retinal pigment epithelium or RPE; macrophage). This term pertains if there is an increase in the extraneuronal accumulation of lipofuscin (also known as autofluorescent lipoprotein) more than expected for the age of the patient.

name: Partial absence of specific antibody response to hepatitis B vaccine
description: A reduced ability to synthesize postvaccination antibodies against a hepatitis B antigen, as measured by antibody titer determination following vaccination.

name: Enlarged Eustachian valve
description: An abnormally large Eustachian valve (postnatally). The Eustachian valve is also known as the valve of the inferior vena cava, and is an embryologic remnant of the valve of the inferior vena cava.

name: Hyperphalangy of the 3rd finger
description: An accessory phalanx of the third (middle) finger that is arranged linearly with the other phalanges. Hyperphalangy results from an accessory ossification center at the metacarpophalangeal joint.

name: Enlarged vestibular aqueduct
description: Increased size of the vestibular aqueduct.

name: Diastolic heart murmur
description: A heart murmur that occurs during diastole, i.e., in the time between S2 and the subsequent S1.

name: Elevated urine 4-hydroxyphenylacetic acid level
description: Increased amount of 4-hydroxyphenylacetic acid in the urine.

name: Exudative retinal detachment
description: A type of retinal detachment arising from damage to the outer blood-retinal barrier that allows fluid to access the subretinal space and separate the neurosensory retina from the retinal pigment epithelium.

name: Abnormal CD4:CD8 ratio
description: Any abnormality in the relative amount of CD4+ and CD8+ T lymphocytes.

name: Decreased inflammatory response
description: An abnormal reduction in the inflammatory response to injury or infection.

name: Type III atherosclerotic lesion
description: Type III (intermediate) atherosclerotic lesions are the morphological and chemical bridge between type II and advanced lesions. Type III lesions appear in some adaptive intimal thickenings (progression-prone locations) in young adults and are characterized by pools of extracellular lipid in addition to all the components of type II lesions.

name: Abnormal hallux phalanx morphology
synonyms: ["Abnormal big toe bones","Abnormality of the phalanges of the hallux"]

name: Snoring
description: Deep, noisy breathing during sleep accompanied by hoarse or harsh sounds caused by the vibration of respiratory structures (especially the soft palate) resulting in sound due to obstructed air movement during breathing while sleeping.

name: Osteolytic defects of the middle phalanx of the 3rd finger
description: Dissolution or degeneration of bone tissue of the middle phalanx of the 3rd finger.

name: Increased CSF isoleucine concentration
description: Abnormally increased levels of isoleucine in cerebrospinal fluid.
synonyms: ["High levels of isoleucine in cerebrospinal fluid"]

name: Difficulty climbing stairs
description: Reduced ability to climb stairs.

name: Pancreatic adenocarcinoma
description: The presence of an adenocarcinoma of the pancreas.

name: Decreased pyruvate carboxylase activity
description: A decreased rate of pyruvate carboxylase activity.

name: Cleft soft palate
description: Cleft of the soft palate (also known as the velum, or muscular palate) as a result of a developmental defect occurring between the 7th and 12th week of pregnancy. Cleft soft palate can cause functional abnormalities of the Eustachian tube with resulting middle ear anomalies and hearing difficulties, as well as speech problems associated with hypernasal speech due to velopharyngeal insufficiency.
synonyms: ["Cleft muscular palate","Cleft of soft palate","Cleft velum"]

name: Limb undergrowth
description: Limb shortening because of underdevelopment of one or more bones of the extremities.
synonyms: ["HP:0003058","HP:0005049","HP:0005057","Hypoplasia involving bones of the extremities","limb shortening","Limb undergrowth","Short limb","Short limbs"]

name: Merkel cell skin cancer
description: A malignant cutaneous tumor of the elderly that is characterized by an aggressive course with regional nodal involvement, distant metastases and a high rate of recurrence. Most patients present with rapidly growing, painless, firm, non-tender, dome-shaped red, occasionally ulcerated skin nodules, which have a red or bluish color, measuring up to several centimeters, on predominantly sun-exposed areas of the body. The overlying skin is smooth and shiny, sometimes exhibiting ulcerative, acneiform or telangiectatic features.
synonyms: ["Anaplastic carcinoma of the skin","Cutaneous APUDoma","Merkel cell cancer of the skin","Neuroendocrine carcinoma of the skin","Neuroendocrine tumor of the skin","Neuroendocrine tumour of the skin","Primary small cell carcinoma of the skin","Primary undifferentiated carcinoma of the skin"]

name: Abnormal morphology of the conjunctival vasculature
description: Any abnormality of the blood vessels of the conjunctiva.
synonyms: ["Abnormal morphology of the conjunctiva vasculature","Abnormal vasculature of the conjunctiva morphology","Abnormality of the vasculature of the conjunctiva"]

name: Decrease in high molecular weight von Willebrand factor Multimers
description: A decrease in high molecular weight von Willebrand factor multimers.

name: Abnormality of cartilage of external ear
description: An abnormality of a cartilage of external ear.

name: Ivory epiphyses
description: Sclerosis of the epiphyses, leading to an increased degree of radiopacity (white or ivory appearance) in X-rays.
synonyms: ["Epiphyseal sclerosis","Increased bone density in end part of bone"]

name: Increased proinsulin:insulin ratio
description: An elevated concentration of proinsulin (the prohormone precursor to insulin) to mature insulin in the circulation.

name: Pseudophakia
description: The term pseudophakia refers to having an artificial lens implanted after the natural eye lens has been removed. During cataract surgery the natural cloudy lens is replaced by an pseudophakia intraocular lens (IOL).

name: Dural ectasia
description: A widening or ballooning of the dural sac surrounding the spinal cord usually at the lumbosacral level.

name: Absent ossification of capital femoral epiphysis
description: Lack of ossification of the proximal epiphysis of the femur.

name: Arteriosclerosis
description: Sclerosis (hardening) of the arteries with increased thickness of the wall of arteries as well as increased stiffness and a loss of elasticity.

name: Vascular tortuosity
description: Abnormal twisting of arteries or veins.

name: Abnormality of galactoside metabolism
description: Abnormality of galactoside metabolism. A galactoside is a glycoside (a suger moiety bound to some other moiety) containing galactose.

name: Paroxysmal dyspnea
description: A sudden attack of dyspnea that occurs while the affected person is at rest.

name: Dysfibrinogenemia
description: Qualitatively abnormal fibrinogen.

name: Deep plantar creases
description: The presence of unusually deep creases (ridges/wrinkles) on the skin of sole of foot.

name: Increased circulating corticosterone level
description: An abnormally elevated concentration of corticosterone in the blood.

name: Decreased circulating creatine kinase concentration
description: A reduction in the level of the enzyme creatine kinase (also known as creatine phosphokinase, CPK; EC 2.7.3.2) in the blood.

name: Reduced hematocrit
description: A reduction below the normal ratio of the volume of red blood cells to the total volume of blood.

name: Pulmonary artery sling
description: An anomalous origin of the left pulmonary artery, such that it arises from the posterior aspect of the right pulmonary artery and passes between the trachea and esophagus to reach the left hilum.

name: Osteolysis involving tarsal bones
description: An increased resorption of bone matrix by osteoclasts leading to bony defects involving the tarsal bones.

name: Fingerprint intracellular accumulation of autofluorescent lipopigment storage material
description: An intracellular accumulation of autofluorescent lipopigment storage material in a trabecular or fingerprint-like pattern.
synonyms: ["Fingerprint profiles' ultrastructurally in cells","Fingerprint profiles ultrastructurally"]

name: Telecanthus
description: Distance between the inner canthi more than two standard deviations above the mean (objective); or, apparently increased distance between the inner canthi.
synonyms: ["Corners of eye widely separated","Dystopia canthorum","Increased distance between medial canthi","Increased intercanthal distance"]

name: Anti-laminin antibody positivity
description: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against a laminin. Laminins are major components of the basement membrane.

name: Undetectable visual evoked potentials
synonyms: ["Absence of visual evoked potentials","Non-detectable VEP","Undetectable VEP"]

name: Anti-Homer-3 antibody
description: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against Homer-3.

name: Bullet-shaped 1st metatarsal
description: An abnormal morphology of the firstmetatarsal bone, which is short and wide and tapers distally, and lacks the normal diaphyseal constriction.

name: Axillary epidermoid cyst
description: An epidermoid cyst in the armpit.

name: obsolete Distal sensory loss of all modalities
Atretic occipital cephalocele
description: A congenital defect in the occipital region of the skull, covered by skin of the scalp and containing meninges or remnants of glial or neural tissues.
