name: Triangular shaped proximal phalanx of the 2nd toe
Amyotrophy of ankle musculature
description: Atrophy of the muscles of the ankle.

name: EMG: impaired neuromuscular transmission
description: An electromyographic finding associated with erratic or absent neuromuscular transmission with erratic, moment-to-moment changes in the shape of the motor unit potential (MUP).

name: Venous malformation of the lip
description: A vascular malformation located in the lip that is related to abnormal vascular morphogenesis.

name: Patchy sclerosis of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger
description: Uneven (irregular) increase in bone density of the proximal phalanx of the second finger.
synonyms: ["Uneven increase in bone density in innermost index finger bone"]

name: Abnormal urinary 3-methylhistidine level
description: Abnormal amount of 3-methylhistidine in the urine.

name: Anal margin Paget's disease
description: An intraepithelial adenocarcinoma originating in the anal margin and characterized by presence of typical Paget's cells, appearing as large rounded vacuolated cells.

name: Posterior retinal neovascularization
description: A type of retinal neovascularization that affects the posterior pole of the retina.
synonyms: ["Neovascularization of peripheral and posterior retina","Posterior retinal neovascularisation"]

name: Clinodactyly of the 4th toe
description: Bending or curvature of a fourth toe in the tibial direction (i.e., towards the big toe).

name: Abnormal serum interferon level
description: Abnormal levels of interferon in the blood.

name: Fragmentation of the epiphysis of the middle phalanx of the 2nd toe
synonyms: ["Fragmentation of the end part of the middle bone of the 2nd toe"]

name: Maculopapular exanthema
description: A skin rash that is characterized by diffuse cutaneous erythema with areas of skin elevation. It may evolve to vesicles or papules as part of a more severe clinical entity. Different degrees of angioedema with involvement of subcutaneous tissue may also appear.

name: Connective tissue nevi
description: Connective tissue nevi are hamartomas in which one or several components of the dermis is altered.

name: Hypochromia
description: A qualitative impression that red blood cells have less color than normal when examined under a microscope, usually related to a reduced amount of hemoglobin in the red blood cells.

name: Pseudoepiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger
description: A secondary ossification center in the distal phalanx of the fifth finger that is distinct from the normal epiphysis that does not contribute to the longitudinal growth of a tubular bone.

name: Vasculitis
description: Inflammation of blood vessel.

name: Atrial septal defect
description: Atrial septal defect (ASD) is a congenital abnormality of the interatrial septum that enables blood flow between the left and right atria via the interatrial septum.
synonyms: ["HP:0001630","An opening in the wall separating the top two chambers of the heart","ASD","Atria septal defect","Atrial septum defect","Atrioseptal defect","Defect in the atrial septum","Hole in heart wall separating two upper heart chambers"]

name: Abnormality of cardiovascular system morphology
description: Any structural anomaly of the heart and great vessels.

name: Laryngeal dystonia
description: A form of focal dystonia that affects the vocal cords, associated with involuntary contractions of the vocal cords causing interruptions of speech and affecting the voice quality and often leading to patterned, repeated breaks in speech.

name: Scaling skin
description: Refers to the loss of the outer layer of the epidermis in large, scale-like flakes.

name: Elevated circulating transferrin concentration
description: An abnormally increased concentration of transferrin in the blood circulation.

name: Fractured elbow joint
description: A partial or complete breakage of the elbow joint.

name: Carotid cavernous fistula
description: An abnormal connection between a carotid artery and the cavernous sinus.

name: Ivory epiphyses of the metacarpals
description: Sclerosis of the epiphyses of the metacarpals, leading to an increased degree of radiopacity (white or ivory appearance) in X-rays.
synonyms: ["Increased bone density of end part of the long bone of hands"]

name: Barrett esophagus
description: An abnormal change (metaplasia) in the cells of the inferior portion of the esophagus. The normal squamous epithelium lining of the esophagus is replaced by metaplastic columnar epithelium. Columnar epithelium refers to a cell type that is typically found in more distal parts of the gastrointestinal system.

name: Abnormality of the basal ganglia
description: Abnormality of the basal ganglia.
synonyms: ["HP:0006952","HP:0007257","Anomaly of the basal ganglia","Basal ganglia disease"]

name: Abnormal renal corticomedullary differentiation
description: An abnormality of corticomedullary differentiation (CMD) on diagnostic imaging such as magnetic resonance imaging, computer tomography, or sonography. CMD is a difference in the visualization of cortex and medulla.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the middle phalanx of the 3rd toe
synonyms: ["Absent/small middle 3rd toe bone","Absent/underdeveloped middle 3rd toe bone"]

name: Atrophic superior cerebellar peduncle
description: Atrophy of the superior cerebellar peduncle.

name: Abnormal hepcidin level
description: Any deviation from the normal concentration of hepcidin in the blood circulation.

name: Hypoplastic scapulae
description: Underdeveloped scapula.
synonyms: ["HP:0000906","HP:0006616","Hypoplastic scapula","Scapular hypoplasia","Short scapulae","Small scapula","Small scapulae","Small shoulder blade"]

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the corpus callosum
description: Absence or underdevelopment of the corpus callosum.
synonyms: ["HP:0007003","HP:0007060","HP:0007061","HP:0007137","Absent/hypoplastic corpus callosum","Agenesis/hypoplastic corpus callosum","Complete or partial absence of the corpus callosum","Hypoplasia or absence of the corpus callosum","Hypoplastic or absent corpus callosum"]

name: Anti-B23 antibody positivity
description: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against B23.

name: Abnormal nasolacrimal system morphology
description: An abnormality of the nasolacrimal drainage system, which serves as a conduit for tear flow from the external eye to the nasal cavity.

name: Ophthalmoparesis
description: Ophthalmoplegia is a paralysis or weakness of one or more of the muscles that control eye movement.
synonyms: ["HP:0007701","HP:0008044","Extraocular muscle palsy","Extraocular muscle paralysis","Weakness of extraocular eye movement","Weakness of muscles controlling eye movement"]

name: Multiple non-erupting secondary teeth
synonyms: ["Failure of eruption of multiple adult teeth","Failure of eruption of multiple permanent teeth","Multiple non-erupting adult teeth","Multiple non-erupting permanent teeth","Multiple unerupted adult teeth","Multiple unerupted permanent teeth"]

name: Generalized hypotonia due to defect at the neuromuscular junction
synonyms: ["Generalised hypotonia due to defect at the neuromuscular junction"]

name: Skin plaque
description: A plaque is a solid, raised, plateau-like (flat-topped) lesion greater than 1 cm in diameter.

name: Hypermanganesemia
description: An elevation above the normal concentration of manganese in the blood.

name: Decreased post-bronchodilator forced expiratory volume in one second
description: An abnormal reduction in the amount of air a person can forcefully expel in one second, with the test being performed after the administration of a bronchodilating medication.
synonyms: ["Decreased post bronchodilator forced expiratory volume in one second","Decreased postbronchodilator forced expiratory volume in one second"]

name: Excessive femoral anteversion
description: An increased degree of femoral version, which is defined as the angular difference between axis of femoral neck and transcondylar axis of the knee. Thus, femoral anteversion is an inward twisting of the femur that causes the knees and feet to turn inward.

name: Hypernatremia
description: An abnormally increased sodium concentration in the blood.

name: Absent sternal ossification
description: Lack of formation of mineralized bony tissue of the sternum.

name: Skin ulcer
description: A discontinuity of the skin exhibiting complete loss of the epidermis and often portions of the dermis and even subcutaneous fat.

name: Anterior bowing of long bones
description: An abnormal anterior curvature of a long bone.

name: Abnormal QT interval
description: Any anomaly of the time interval between the start of the Q wave and the end of the T wave as measured by the electrocardiogram (EKG).

name: Abnormality of secondary sexual hair
description: Abnormality of the growth of secondary sexual hair, which normally ensues during puberty. In males, secondary sexual hair usually comprises body hair, including underarm, abdominal, chest, and pubic hair. In females, secondary sexual hair usually comprises a lesser degree of body hair, most prominently underarm and pubic hair.

name: Hypophenylalaninemia
description: A decreased amount of phenylalanine in the blood.

name: Ragged cuticle
description: The cuticle (properly known as the eponychium, or the medial nail fold or the proximal nail fold), is the thickened layer of skin surrounding fingernails and toenails. Its function is to protect the area between the nail and epidermis from exposure to bacteria. This term refers to the presence of and irregular edge or outline of the cuticle.

name: Erosive vitreoretinopathy
description: A form of vitreoretinopathy characterized by thinning (erosion) of the retinal pigment epithelium that permits increased visualization of the choroidal vessels.

name: Abnormal urine hormone level
description: An abnormal concentration of a hormone in the urine.

name: Supernumerary nipple
description: Presence of more than two nipples.

name: Fractured patella
description: A partial or complete breakage of the patella.

name: Short middle phalanx of the 5th toe
description: Developmental hypoplasia of the middle phalanx of the 5th toe.
synonyms: ["Hypoplastic/small middle phalanx of the 5th toe","Short middle bone of little toe","Short middle bone of pinkie toe","Short middle bone of pinky toe","Short middle phalanx of the fifth toe"]

name: Sclerosis of 4th toe phalanx
description: An elevation in bone density in one or more phalanges of the fourth toe. Sclerosis is normally detected on a radiograph as an area of increased opacity.
synonyms: ["Increased bone density in 4th toe bone","Sclerosis of the phalanges of the 4th toe"]

name: Abnormal pharynx physiology
description: A functional anomaly of the pharynx.

name: Decreased dendritic spine number
description: An abnormal reduction in the amount of spines on a given dendrite.

name: High iliac wing
description: Increased height of the wing (or ala) of the ilium (which is the large expanded portion which bounds the greater pelvis laterally).

name: Peg-like central prominence of distal tibial metaphyses
Elevated urinary epinephrine
description: An increased concentration of adrenaline in the urine.

name: Cyclic neutropenia in myeloid maturation arrest in bone marrow
description: Cyclic neutropenia arising from an impaired proliferation and maturation of myeloid progenitor cells in the bone marrow.

name: Supraventricular tachycardia with a concealed accessory connection
description: Supraventricular tachycardia with an accessory connection mediated pathway that is called concealed becasue it is not seen on the ECG during sinus rhythm.
synonyms: ["Supraventricular tachycardia with a concealed accessory connexion"]

name: Ivory epiphyses of the middle phalanges of the hand
description: Epiphyses of the middle phalanges of the hand are hard and dense like ivory. Such an epiphysis has a uniformly dense appearance on radiographs.
synonyms: ["Increased bone density of end part of the middle hand bones"]

name: Abnormality of the thenar eminence
description: An abnormality of the thenar eminence, i.e., of the muscle on the palm of the human hand just beneath the thumb.

name: Increased pulmonary vascular resistance
description: Pulmonary vascular resistance (PVR) more than 3 wood units, as defined by the current definition of pulmonary hypertension. 95% of individuals have a PVR of less than 2.4 wood units.

name: Thickening of the lateral border of the scapula
synonyms: ["Thickening of the lateral border of the shoulder blade"]

name: Neoplasm
description: An organ or organ-system abnormality that consists of uncontrolled autonomous cell-proliferation which can occur in any part of the body as a benign or malignant neoplasm (tumour).

name: Increased proportion of unswitched memory B cells
description: An increase above the normal proportion of non-class-switched memory B cells relative to the total number of B cells.
synonyms: ["Elevated proportion of unswitched memory B cells","Increased proportion of non-class-switched memory B cells"]

name: Irregular vertebral endplates
description: An irregular surface of the vertebral end plates, which are normally relatively smooth.
synonyms: ["HP:0003420","HP:0004583","HP:0004628","end-plate irregularities","endplate irregularities","endplate irregularity","Irregular end plates","Irregular endplates","irregular vertebral plates","vertebral endplate irregularity"]

name: Triceps areflexia
description: Inability to elicit triceps tendon reflex.

name: Axenfeld anomaly
description: Axenfeld's anomaly is a bilateral disorder characterized by a prominent, anteriorly displaced Schwalbe's line (posterior embryotoxon) and peripheral iris strands which span the anterior chamber angle to attach to Schwalbe's line.

name: Constipation
description: Infrequent or difficult evacuation of feces.

name: Elevated circulating CHI3L1 level
description: Increased concentration of chitinase 3-like 1 (CHI3L1) in the blood circulation.
synonyms: ["Elevated circulating chitinase 3-like 1 level","Elevated circulating YKL40 level"]

name: Dysmetric horizontal saccades
description: Inaccurate saccades (rapid movement of the eye between fixation points) in the horizontal direction.

name: Abnormality of the calcaneus
description: An abnormality of the calcaneus, also known as the heel bone, one of the or heel bone, one of the components of the tarsus of the foot which make up the heel.

name: Elevated circulating 1-methylhistidine concentration
description: An abnormally increased level of 1-methylhistidine in the blood circulation. 1-methylhistidine is a derivative of L-histidine.

name: Focal impaired awareness autonomic seizure with urge to urinate/defecate
description: A focal autonomic seizure with urge to urinate / defecate characterized by impaired awareness at some point during the seizure.

name: Post-capillary pulmonary hypertension
description: Post-capillary pulmonary hypertension is a hemodynamic condition characterised by elevated mean pulmonary artery pressure (mPAP greater than 20 mmHg) and pulmonary artery wedge pressure (PAWP greater than 15 mmHg) and pulmonary vascular resistance (PVR less than 3 Wood units).

name: Increased proportion of CD4-positive T cells
description: An elevation in the proportion of CD4-positive T cells relative to the total number of T cells.
synonyms: ["Elevated proportion of CD4-positive T cells","Increased proportion of CD4+ T cells","Increased proportion of CD4-positive, alpha-beta T cells"]

name: Increased oocyte death
description: An increase in death of oocytes, the female germ cell (egg cell), which can be observed clinically in the setting of in vitro fertilization.

name: Increased blood pressure
description: Abnormal increase in blood pressure. An individual measurement of increased blood pressure does not necessarily imply hypertension. In practical terms, multiple measurements are recommended to diagnose the presence of hypertension.

name: Abnormality of synovial bursa morphology
description: A structural anomaly of a synovial bursa.

name: Increased level of xylitol in CSF
description: An increase in the level of xylitol in the cerebrospinal fluid.
synonyms: ["Increased level of xylitol in cerebrospinal fluid"]

name: Decreased acrosin in sperm head
description: A reduced amount of the enzyme acrosin in the sperm head acrosome. The acrosome is an organelle in the anterior half of the head of spermatozoa, and acrosin is a protease that contributes to the digestation of the zona pellucida in the fertilization process.

name: Flattened, squared-off epiphyses of tubular bones
synonyms: ["Flattened, squared-off end part of tubular bones"]

name: Abnormal temporal bone morphology
description: Abnormality of the temporal bone of the skull, which is situated at the sides and base of the skull roughly underlying the region of the face known as the temple.

name: Leukonychia
description: White discoloration of the nails.

name: Osteolytic defects of the middle phalanges of the hand
Increased CSF tyrosine concentration
description: Abnormally increased levels of tyrosine in cerebrospinal fluid.

name: Multiple pulmonary cysts
description: The presence of multiple lung cysts.

name: Athetosis
description: A slow, continuous, involuntary writhing movement that prevents maintenance of a stable posture. Athetosis involves continuous smooth movements that appear random and are not composed of recognizable sub-movements or movement fragments. In contrast to chorea, in athetosis, the same regions of the body are repeatedly involved. Athetosis may worsen with attempts at movement of posture, but athetosis can also occur at rest.
synonyms: ["HP:0007167","HP:0007316","Athetoid movements","Involuntary writhing movements","Involuntary writhing movements in fingers, hands, toes, and feet"]

name: Increased circulating band cell count
description: An abnormally increased number of band cells in the peripheral blood circulation. Band cells are immature neutrophils with a size of 10-18 micrometers, a horseshoe-shaped nucleus with no nucleoli, light-pink staining cytoplasm with many small seconday granules, and a nucleus:cytoplasm ratio of 1:2.

name: Protrusio acetabuli
description: Intrapelvic bulging of the medial acetabular wall.

name: Triangular epiphyses of the 3rd finger
description: A triangular appearance of the epiphyses of the 3rd finger of the hand.
synonyms: ["Delta-shaped epiphyses of the 3rd finger","Triangular end part of middle finger bone"]

name: Abdominal distention
description: Distention of the abdomen.

name: Diabetes insipidus
description: A state of excessive water intake and hypotonic (dilute) polyuria. Diabetes insipidus may be due to failure of vasopressin (AVP) release (central or neurogenic diabetes insipidus) or to a failure of the kidney to respond to AVP (nephrogenic diabetes insipidus).

name: Anti-Y-box protein-1 antibody positivity
description: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against Y-box protein-1.

name: Decreased CSF 5-hydroxyindolacetic acid
description: CSF 5-HIAA (5-hydroxyindolacetic acid) level is below the lower limit of normal.

name: Acetabular spurs
description: The presence of osteophytes (bone spurs), i.e., of bony projections originating from the acetabulum.

name: Abnormal circulating thromboxane concentration
description: Any deivation from the normal concentration in the blood circulation of a thromboxane. Thromboxanes are derived from prostaglandin precursors in platelets, and stimulate aggregation of platelets and constriction of blood vessels.

name: Abnormal morphology of myocardial trabeculae
description: Any structural anomaly of the muscular columns which project from the inner surface of the right and left ventricles of the heart (cardiac trabeculae, trabeculae carneae).

name: Abnormal circulating long-chain fatty-acid concentration
description: Any deviation from the normal concentration of a long-chain fatty acid in the blood circulation.

name: Perioral hyperkeratosis
description: Increased thickness of the stratum corneum (the outer layer of the skin) in the skin surrounding the mouth.

name: Abnormal cardiac ventricle morphology
description: An abnormality of a cardiac ventricle.

name: Abnormal pharynx morphology
description: A structural anomaly of the pharynx.

name: Mesangial cell loss
description: Loss of mesangial cells segmentally or globally.

name: Bilateral tonic-clonic seizure
description: A bilateral tonic-clonic seizure is a seizure defined by a tonic (bilateral increased tone, lasting seconds to minutes) and then a clonic (bilateral sustained rhythmic jerking) phase.
synonyms: ["HP:0001306","HP:0002407","HP:0007252","Bilateral convulsive seizures","Generalised convulsion","Generalised tonic-clonic seizure (without specification of onset)","Generalized convulsion","Generalized tonic-clonic seizure (without specification of onset)","Grand mal","Grand mal seizures","Seizures, tonic-clonic","Tonic-clonic convulsion","Tonic-clonic convulsions"]

name: Short uvula
description: Decreased length of the uvula.

name: Nongranulomatous uveitis
description: A form of uveitis that is not associated with the formation of granulomas.

name: Upper limb muscle weakness
description: Weakness of the muscles of the arms.

name: Decreased circulating free fatty acid level
Abnormality of lower-limb metaphyses
synonyms: ["Abnormality of the wide portion of the lower-limb bone"]

name: Affective epileptic aura
description: Affective auras with subjective qualities similar to those experienced in life but are recognized by the subject as occurring outside of actual context.

name: Neck muscle hypoplasia
description: Underdevelopment of muscles of the neck.
synonyms: ["Decreased size of neck muscle","Small neck muscle","Underdevelopment of neck muscle"]

name: Patchy sclerosis of the middle phalanx of the 2nd finger
description: Uneven (irregular) increase in bone density of the middle phalanx of the second finger.
synonyms: ["Uneven increase in bone density in the middle bone of the index finger"]

name: Limbal edema
description: Swelling of the margin of the cornea overlapped by the sclera.

name: Severe conductive hearing impairment
description: A severe form of conductive hearing impairment.

name: Morphological abnormality of the inner ear
description: A structural anomaly of the internal part of the ear.

name: Premature loss of teeth
description: Exfoliation of a tooth more than 2 SD earlier than the normal age for the deciduous teeth and not related to traume or neglect. Exfoliation of a permanent tooth is per se abnormal.
synonyms: ["HP:0000701","HP:0001564","HP:0006343","Early tooth loss","Loss of teeth","Premature teeth loss","Premature tooth loss"]

name: Arcuate artery lumen organized thrombi
description: Thrombi containg fibrous tissue and capillary-like vascular channels located within the lumen of the arcuate arteries of the kidney.

name: Blood group O
description: ABO phenotype O, corresponding to the genotype OO.

name: Rachitic rosary
description: A row of beadlike prominences at the junction of a rib and its cartilage (i.e., enlarged costochondral joints), resembling a rosary.

name: Elevated circulating tetradecanolycarnitine concentration
description: Elevated circulating tetradecanoyl concentration.

name: Portosystemic collateral veins
description: Presence of biliary veins that serve as a collateral channel to the systemic circulation

name: Multiple biliary hamartomas
description: Multiple biliary hamartomas are a rare clinicopathologic entity, consisting of small (less than 1.5cm), usually multiple and nodular cystic lesions in the liver.

name: Widely-spaced incisors
synonyms: ["Anterior diastema of teeth","Gap between front teeth","Widely spaced front teeth"]

name: Sebaceous hyperplasia
description: A common, benign skin condition involving hypertrophy of the sebaceous glands characterized by single or multiple lesions that manifest as yellow, soft, small papules with umbilication. The lesions are located commonly on the central face (specifically, the nose, cheeks and forehead) but may also occur elswehere, including the chest, mouth, scrotum, foreskin, penile shaft, vulva, and areola.

name: Abnormal circulating pregnenolone concentration
description: An abnormality of the concentration of pregnenolone in the blood.

name: Abnormality of vision
description: Abnormality of eyesight (visual perception).

name: Elevated vascular endothelial growth factor level
description: Increased blood concentration of vascular endothelial growth factor (VEGF).

name: Enlarged epiphysis of the middle phalanx of the 4th finger
description: Abnormally large size of the epiphysis located at the proximal end of the middle phalanx of the 4th finger with respect to age-dependent norms.
synonyms: ["Enlarged end part of the middle bone of the ring finger"]

name: Focal impaired awareness epileptic spasm
description: A type of focal-onset epileptic spasm in which awareness is impaired at some point during the seizure.

name: Elevated circulating L-alloisoleucine concentration
description: Abnormally increased concentration of L-alloisoleucine in the blood circulation.

name: Low maternal serum chorionic gonadotropin
description: An abnormally low concentration of maternal serum human chorionic gonadotropin as compared to normal values for gestational-age.

name: Focal cortical dysplasia type II
description: A type of focal cortical dysplasia that is characterized by disrupted cortical lamination and specific cytological abnormalities.

name: Abnormal adiponectin level
description: A deviation from the normal circulating concentration of adiponectin, a 30-kDa complement C1-related protein that is the most abundant secreted protein expressed in adipose tissue, and that plays a crucial role in the regulation of insulin sensitivity and glucose metabolism.

name: Steroid-resistant nephrotic syndrome
description: A form of nephrotic syndrome that does not respond to treatment with steroid medication, defined as persistent proteinuria despite 60mg/m2 or 2mg/kg for 8 weeks, after insuring no infection or non-adherence to medication.

name: Glomerular capillary wire loop deposits
description: Glomerulus showing markedly and irregularly thickened capillary walls with massive fuchsinophilic subendothelial deposits, resulting in narrowing of capillary lumina. This feature is said to resemble a wire loop.

name: Focal impaired awareness myoclonic seizure
description: A focal myoclonic seizure in which awareness is partially or fully impaired at some point during the seizure.

name: Nuchal rigidity
description: Resistance of the extensor muscles of the neck to being bent forwards (i.e., impaired neck flexion) as a result of muscle spasm of the extensor muscles of the neck. Nuchal rigidity is not a fixed rigidity. Nuchal rigidity has been used as a bedside test for meningism, although its sensitivity for this purpose has been debated.

name: Ranula
description: A ranula is a mucocele that occurs in the floor of the mouth and usually involve the major salivary glands. Specifically, the ranula originates in the body of the sublingual gland, in the ducts of the sublingual gland, in the Wharton's duct of the submandibular gland or infrequently from the minor salivary glands at this location.

name: Abnormal CD4-positive, CD25-positive, alpha-beta regulatory T cell count
description: A deviation from the normal count of CD4-positive, CD25-positive, alpha-beta regulatory T cells.

name: Secondary hyperparathyroidism
description: Secondary hyperparathyroidism refers to the production of higher than normal levels of parathyroid hormone in the presence of hypocalcemia.

name: Acanthoma
description: A benign epithelial skin tumor manifesting as a slightly elevated circular plaque or nodule with a red, pink or brown color and a diameter up to 22 mm.

name: Enlarged epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 3rd finger
description: Abnormally large size of the epiphysis located at the proximal end of the distal phalanx of the 3rd finger with respect to age-dependent norms.
synonyms: ["Enlarged end part of the outermost bone of the 3rd finger"]

name: Abnormal glomerular capillary lumen morphology
description: Abnormal structural characteristics of the interior space of the capillary of the renal glomerulus.

name: Coronary ostial atresia
description: Absence of the normal opening of a coronary ostium. There are normally two coronary ostia, which are site of origin of the main left or right main coronary artery and are located in the ascending aorta just above the aortic valve.

name: Increased circulating prealbumin concentration
description: An elevation above the normal concentration of prealbumin in the blood circulation.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia involving the vertebral column
synonyms: ["Absent/small backbone","Absent/small spine","Absent/small vertebral column","Absent/underdeveloped backbone","Absent/underdeveloped spine","Absent/underdeveloped vertebral column"]

name: Hydroxyprolinemia
description: An increased concentration of hydroxyproline in the blood.

name: Pulmonary cavity
description: A gas-filled space, seen as lucency or low-attenuation area, within a nodule, mass or area of parenchymal consolidations. It has a clearly defined wall over 4 mm thick.

name: Non-pruritic urticaria
description: Pale reddish slightly elevated papules and plaques of 0.5-3 cm in diameter and not accompanied by pruritus.

name: Malalignment of the great toenail
description: A lateral deviation of the nail plate of the great toe along the longitudinal axis due to the lateral rotation of the nail matrix. The nail plate grows out in ridges.

name: Unilateral multifocal epileptiform discharges
description: Epileptiform discharges being identified at multiple locations in one hemisphere.

name: Vertical eyelid laxity
description: Abnormally lax eyelid associated with tissue relaxation, predominantly in the vertical plane. It can be demonstrated by vertical lid pull. Loosening of vertical stabilising structures (e.g. lower lid retractors) or tarsal atrophy are often present.

name: Refractory drug response
description: Absent or significantly reduced efficacy of drug intervention characterized by lack of measurable benefit or deterioration of disease course.

name: Abnormal circulating lipoprotein lipase concentration
description: A deviation from the normal concentration of lipoprotein lipase in the blood circulation.

name: Sinusitis
description: Inflammation of the paranasal sinuses owing to a viral, bacterial, or fungal infection, allergy, or an autoimmune reaction.

name: Iris melanoma
description: Malignant tumor of melanocytes affecting the iris.

name: Cardiac tamponade
description: The accumulation of pericardial fluid with subsequent compression of all cardiac chambers which prevents cardiac filling.

name: Impaired ability to form peer relationships
Urinary incontinence
description: Loss of the ability to control the urinary bladder leading to involuntary urination.

name: Biventricular hypertrophy
description: Thickening of the heart walls in both ventricles.

name: Diplomyelia
description: Duplication of the spinal cord.

name: Flexion contracture of the 2nd toe
description: One or more bent (flexed) joints of the second toe that cannot be straightened actively or passively.

name: Increased sarcoplasmic glycogen
description: Elevated glycogen content in the sarcoplasm (cytoplasm) of muscle fibers.

name: Mycobacterium abscessus abscessus infection
description: Mycobacterium abscessus complex comprises a group of rapidly growing, multidrug-resistant, nontuberculous mycobacteria that are responsible for a wide spectrum of skin and soft tissue diseases, central nervous system infections, bacteremia, and ocular and other infections.

name: Low-output congestive heart failure
description: A form of heart failure characterized by reduced cardiac output. This may be seen in patients with heart failure owing to ischemic heart disease, hypertension, cardiomyopathy, and other causes.

name: Increased circulating cathepsin D level
description: An increase in concentration of cathepsin D in the blood circulation.

name: Anterior polar cataract
description: A polar cataract that affects the anterior pole of the lens.

name: Abnormality of the kidney
description: An abnormality of the kidney.
synonyms: ["Abnormal kidney","Abnormality of the kidney","Renal anomalies","Renal anomaly"]

name: Complete duplication of the first metacarpal
description: Complete duplication of the first metacarpal bone.
synonyms: ["Complete duplication of the first long bone of hand"]

name: Symphalangism affecting the proximal phalanx of the 5th finger
description: Fusion of the proximal phalanx of the 5th finger with another bone.
synonyms: ["Fused innermost bone of little finger","Fused innermost bone of pinkie finger","Fused innermost bone of pinky finger"]

name: Extension of hair growth on temples to lateral eyebrow
description: A pattern of hair growth in which there is hair extending from the temples to the lateral eyebrows.
synonyms: ["Unusual hairline with hair growth on temples extending to lateral eyebrow"]

name: Complete duplication of the distal phalanx of the 4th finger
description: Complete duplication of the distal phalanx of ring finger.
synonyms: ["Complete duplication of the outermost bone of the ring finger"]

name: Atrophy/Degeneration affecting the central nervous system
Broad first metatarsal
description: Increased side-to-side width of the first metatarsal bone.
synonyms: ["HP:0004709","HP:0008085","HP:0008139","Broad 1st metatarsal","Enlarged first metatarsal","Wide 1st long bone of foot"]

name: Bladder fistula
description: The presence of a fistula connecting the urinary bladder to another organ or the skin. The fistula can involve the bowel, the vagina, or rarely, the skin.

name: Decreased hemoglobin concentration
description: An abnormal reduction below normal hemoglobin concentration in the circulation.

name: Trichodysplasia
description: Developmental dysplasia of the hair.

name: Congenital pulmonary airway malformation
description: Congenital pulmonary airway malformation (CPAM) - previously known as congenital cystic adenomatoid malformation (CCAM) - is a relatively rare developmental malformation of the lower respiratory tract. It is a hamartomatous, dysplastic developmental abnormality of the lung characterized by abnormal airway patterning during lung branching morphogenesis and is formed by abnormal branching of the immature bronchioles.
synonyms: ["HP:0006540","HP:0006545","CCAM","Congenital cystic adenomatoid malformation of the lung","Congenital cystic disease of the lung","Cystic adenomatoid lung disease"]

name: Elevated urine aconitic acid level
description: An abnormally increased level of aconitic acid in the urine.

name: Vulvar neoplasm
description: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the female external genital tract (vulva).
synonyms: ["Neoplasm of the vulva","Tumor of the vulva","Tumour of the vulva"]

name: Anal margin neoplasm
description: A tumor of the anal margin.

name: Hypoplasia of the phalanges of the toes
Fractured epiphysis of second metacarpal bone
description: A partial or complete breakage of the epiphysis of second metacarpal bone.

name: EEG with generalized polymorphic epileptiform discharges
description: Generalized epileptiform discharges of different shapes and frequencies.

name: Arteria lusoria
description: Usually, three large arteries arise from the arch of the aorta: the brachiocephalic trunk (divided into the right common carotid artery and the right subclavian artery), the left common carotid artery, and the left subclavian artery. However, when aberrant right subclavian artery variant is present, the brachiocephalic trunk is absent and four large arteries arise from the arch of the aorta: the right common carotid artery, the left common carotid artery, the left subclavian artery, and the final one with the most distal left sided origin, the right subclavian artery, also called the arteria lusoria.

name: Abnormality of the proximal phalanx of the thumb
description: An anomaly of the shape or form of the proximal phalanx of the thumb.
synonyms: ["HP:0004076","Abnormal innermost thumb bone","Abnormality of proximal thumb phalanx"]

name: Persistent patent ductus venosus
description: Persistence of blood flow through the ductus venosus for longer than the normal time after birth.

name: Secondary microcephaly
description: Head circumference which falls below 2 standard deviations below the mean for age and gender because of insufficient head growth after birth.
synonyms: ["HP:0000241","HP:0000259","HP:0005499","Acquired microcephaly","Deceleration of head growth","Development of small head that was not present at birth","Microcephaly, acquired","Microcephaly, postnatal","Postnatal deceleration of head circumference","Postnatal microcephaly"]

name: Club-shaped proximal femur
description: An abnormal conformation of the femur that becomes gradually enlarged towards the proximal end. This feature affects the proximal femoral metaphysis and epiphysis.

name: Supraumbilical raphe
description: An abnormality of the sternum that presents at birth as a ventral sternal non-union defect, due to an abnormality of the fusion of the layers of the skin. It presents as a scar-like line that extends upward from the umbilicus (belly button).

name: Myofibromatosis
description: A mesenchymal neoplasm characterized by solitary or multiple nodules involving the skin, striated muscles, bones and, sometimes, viscera. It usually appears as a subcutaneous nodule, but can also appear as an ulcer, pedunculated lesion, or similar to a hemangioma. Histology shows well-circumscribed tapered cell lobes, resembling smooth muscle cells. At its center, perivascular round cells (hemangiopericitoides) are usually observed, giving a biphasic appearance.

name: Perinephric fluid collection
description: An accumulation of fluid in one or more of the perinephric spaces, which consist of the subcapsular, perirenal, anterior and posterior pararenal spaces. This abnormality can be demonstrated by cross-sectional imaging, particularly computed tomography.

name: Long proximal phalanx of finger
description: Increased length of the proximal phalanx of finger.

name: Muscular dystrophy
description: The term dystrophy means abnormal growth. However, muscular dystrophy is used to describe primary myopathies with a genetic basis and a progressive course characterized by progressive skeletal muscle weakness and wasting, defects in muscle proteins, and histological features of muscle fiber degeneration (necrosis) and regeneration. If possible, it is preferred to use other HPO terms to describe the precise phenotypic abnormalities.

name: Ureter fissus
description: A partial duplication of the ureter where the duplicated ureters fuse to a single ureter before their insertion into the bladder.

name: Multiple cafe-au-lait spots
description: The presence of six or more cafe-au-lait spots.
synonyms: ["HP:0007416","Multiple birthmarks","Multiple flat light-brown marks on skin"]

name: Lower-limb metaphyseal irregularity
description: Irregularity of the normally smooth surface of one or more metaphyses of a bone of the leg.

name: Decreased liver function
description: Reduced ability of the liver to perform its functions.

name: ST segment depression
description: An electrocardiographic anomaly in which the ST segment is observed to be located inferior to the isoelectric line.

name: Abnormality of temperature regulation
description: An abnormality of temperature homeostasis.

name: Benzodiazepine addiction
description: Addiction to a benzodiazepine.

name: Subvalvular aortic stenosis
description: A fixed form of obstruction to blood flow across the left-ventricular outflow tract related to stenosis (narrowing) below the level of the aortic valve.
synonyms: ["Narrowing of blood vessel below aortic heart valve","Subaortic stenosis"]

name: Mandibular condyle hypoplasia
synonyms: ["Decreased size of condylar process of mandible","Decreased size of mandibular condyle","Hypoplasia of condylar process of mandible","Hypoplasia of mandibular condyle","Hypoplasia of subcondylar region of mandible","Small mandibular condyle"]

name: Abnormal morphology of female internal genitalia
description: An abnormality of the female internal genitalia.

name: Abnormal morphology of the olfactory bulb
description: An abnormal morphology of the olfactory bulb (bulbus olfactorius), which is involved in olfaction, i.e. the sense of smell.

name: Sclerodactyly
description: Localized thickening and tightness of the skin of the fingers or toes.

name: Fetal pleural effusion
description: Fetal pleural effusion is the accumulation of excess fluid in the layers of tissue (pleura) lining the lungs and wall of the chest. It may be primary, also termed hydrothorax, occurring as an isolated finding or it may be secondary, most commonly resulting from non-immune hydrops.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the eyebrow
description: Absence or underdevelopment of the eyebrow.
synonyms: ["Absence of eyebrow","Agenesis of eyebrow","Hypotrophic eyebrow","Lack of eyebrow","Missing eyebrow"]

name: Decreased fumarate hydratase activity
description: An abnormality of Krebs cycle metabolism that is characterized by a decreased rate of fumarate hydratase activity.

name: Late young adult onset
description: Onset of disease at an age of greater than or equal to 25 to under 40 years.

name: Calcification of falx cerebri
description: The presence of calcium deposition in the falx cerebri.

name: Increased circulating nicotinurate level
description: An increased amount of nicotinurate in the blood.

name: Anti-neurofascin-155 antibody positivity
description: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against NF155.

name: obsolete Wide/broad phalanges of the ring finger
Fractured cervical vertebra
description: A partial or complete breakage of the cervical vertebra.

name: Aplasia of the olfactory bulb
description: Lack of formation (congenital absence) of the olfactory bulb.

name: Eyelid coloboma
description: A short discontinuity of the margin of the lower or upper eyelid.
synonyms: ["Cleft eyelid","Eyelid coloboma","Full thickness defect of the eyelid","Notched eyelid"]

name: Follicular lymphoma
description: An indolent B cell lymphoproliferative disorder of transformed follicular center B cells. Follicular lymphoma is characterized by diffuse lymphadenopathy, bone marrow involvement, splenomegaly and less commonly other extranodal sites of involvement.

name: Decreased glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase level in dried blood spot
description: A decrease in the level of glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase in a dried blood spot.
synonyms: ["Decreased G6PD level in dried blood spot","Decreased glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase level in DBS"]

name: Abnormal cardiac MRI
description: Abnormal results of a MRI for the heart.
synonyms: ["Abnormal cardiac magnetic resonance imaging","Abnormal heart MRI"]

name: Abnormality of abdominal situs
description: An abnormality of the abdominal situs, i.e., of the sidedness of the abdomen and its organs.

name: Generalized lipodystrophy
description: Generalized degenerative changes of the fat tissue.

name: Impaired thromboxane A2 agonist-induced platelet aggregation
description: Abnormal response to thromboxane as manifested by reduced or lacking aggregation of platelets upon addition of thromboxane A2 receptor agonists.

name: Triggered by cheese ingestion
description: Applies to a sign or symptom that is provoked or brought about by eating cheese.

name: Reduced blood urea nitrogen
description: An abnormally low concentration of urea nitrogen in the blood.

name: Podocyte foot process effacement
description: An anomaly of podocyte morphology characterized by the loss of the interdigitating foot process pattern (generally called foot process effacement; FPE). The term FPE designates the loss of the usual interdigitating pattern of foot processes of neighboring podocytes, leading to relatively broad expanses of podocyte processes covering the glomerular basement membrane (GBM). It is widely viewed as a pathological derangement that is associated with leakage of macromolecules such as albumin through the glomerular filtration barrier.

name: Cone-shaped epiphyses of the 3rd finger
description: A cone-shaped appearance of the epiphyses of the 3rd finger of the hand, producing a 'ball-in-a-socket' appearance. The related entity 'angel-shaped' epiphysis refers to a pronounced cone-shaped epiphysis in combination with a pseudoepiphysis at the distal end of a phalanx.
synonyms: ["Cone-shaped end part of middle finger bone"]

name: Abnormality of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 2nd toe
synonyms: ["Abnormality of the end part of the outermost bone of the 2nd toe"]

name: Subconjunctival hemorrhage
description: Bleeding beneath the mucous membrane that lines the inner surface of the eyelid.

name: Triangular epiphyses of the 4th finger
description: A triangular appearance of the epiphyses of the 4th finger of the hand.
synonyms: ["Delta-shaped epiphyses of the 4th finger","Triangular end part of ring finger bone"]

name: Increased CSF glutamate concentration
description: Abnormally increased levels of glutamic acid in cerebrospinal fluid.
synonyms: ["High glutamic acid levels in cerebrospinal fluid"]

name: Epididymitis
description: The presence of inflammation of the epididymis.

name: Anti-desmoplakin I antibody positivity
description: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against desmoplakin-1.

name: Pulmonary situs ambiguus with bilateral morphologic left lungs
description: An abnormality of the pulmonary situs, i.e., of the sidedness of the morphological right and left lungs, in which both lungs have the morphology of a left lung.

name: Abnormal pancreatic duct morphology
description: Any structural anomaly of the pancreatic duct, which is the tubular structure that collects exocrine pancreatic secretions and transports them to the duodenum.

name: Abnormal hand morphology
description: Any structural anomaly of the hand.

name: Lamellar pulverulent cataract
description: A Lamellar cataract with a pulverulent (punctate, \"dust-like\" opacities) appearance.

name: Abnormal glomerular visceral epithelial cell morphology
description: Any structural anomaly of the podocyte, which is a highly specialized cell of the Bowman capsule and which forms multiple interdigitating foot processes. Podocytes are interconnected by slit diaphragms and cover the exterior basement membrane surface of the glomerular capillary.
synonyms: ["Abnormal podocyte morphology","Abnormal visceral epithelial cell morphology"]

name: Pigment gallstones
description: Gallstones composed primarily of bilirubin and calcium salts (calcium bilirubinate) with a low cholesterol concentration.

name: Abnormality of levator labii superioris
description: An abnormality of a levator labii superioris.

name: Coarctation in the transverse aortic arch
description: Narrowing or constriction of the aorta localized to the region of the transverse aortic arch.

name: Reflex tearing
description: A form of watery eye associated with overproduction of tears due to reflex tearing in response to a local irritant (e.g. trichiasis or foreign body), chronic ocular surface disease (e.g. blepharitis) or systemic disease (e.g. thyroid eye disease).

name: Cervical neoplasm
description: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the uterine cervix.

name: Focal emotional seizure with laughing
description: Focal emotional seizure with laughing (gelastic) is characterized by bursts of laughter or giggling, usually without appropriate related emotion of happiness, and described as 'mirthless'.

name: Renal arteriole medial hypertrophy
description: Increased thickness of middle layer of the arterioles of the kidney.

name: Verrucous papule
description: A wartlike (with multiple small elevated projections) papule.

name: Abnormal sixth cranial nerve morphology
description: Any structural abnormality of the abducens nerve.
synonyms: ["Abnormal abducens nerve morphology","Abnormality of the sixth cranial nerve"]

name: Abnormality of the parathyroid physiology
description: A functional abnormality of the parathyroid gland.

name: Limited head rotation
description: Reduced range of motion turning the head side to side.

name: Anterior clefting of vertebral bodies
description: Anterior schisis (cleft or cleavage) of vertebral bodies.

name: Isometric tremor
description: An isometric tremor occurs with muscle contraction against a rigid stationary object (e.g., when making a fist).

name: Reduced cell surface marker level
description: Reduced level of a protein that is normally present on the cell surface as assessed by flow cytometry.

name: Tapered distal phalanges of finger
description: A reduction in diameter of the distal phalanx of finger towards the distal end.
synonyms: ["HP:0006052","Tapered distal phalanges","Tapered distal phalanges of the hand","Tapered outermost finger bone"]

name: Moon facies
description: A rounded, puffy face with fat deposits in the temporal fossa and cheeks, a double chin.

name: Retinal pigment epithelial mottling
description: Mottling (spots or blotches with different shades) of the retinal pigment epithelium, i.e., localized or generalized fundal pigment granularity associated with processes at the level of the retinal pigment epithelium.
synonyms: ["HP:0001124","Focal hypopigmentation of the retinal pigment epithelium","Retinal pigment epithelium irregularity","RPE irregularity","RPE mottling","Salt and pepper retinal pigmentation","Salt and pepper retinopathy"]

name: Steroid-responsive anemia
description: Amelioration of anemia upon treatment with a steroid medication.

name: Female external genitalia in individual with 46,XY karyotype
description: The presence of female external genitalia in a person with a male karyotype.

name: Zonular cataract
description: Zonular cataracts are defined to be cataracts that affect specific regions of the lens.

name: Focal cortical dysplasia type Ib
description: A subtype of focal cortical dysplasia type I that is characterized by abnormal tangential cortical lamination.

name: obsolete Short phalanges of the ring finger
Abnormal scapula morphology
description: Any abnormality of the scapula, also known as the shoulder blade.

name: Osteolytic defects of the 1st metacarpal
description: Dissolution or degeneration of bone tissue of the 1st metacarpal.

name: Intralobular septal thickening
description: Intralobular septal thickening is a computed tomography finding of increased width of the walls (septa) within a pulmonary lobule. Secondary pulmonary lobules represent a cluster of up to 30 acini 9 supplied by a common distal pulmonary artery and bronchiole. These clustered acini are bounded by interstitial fibrous septa (interlobular septa) which outline an irregular polyhedron of varying size between 1 and 2.5 cm. Interlobular septal thickening is seen on chest radiographs as thin linear opacities at right angles to and in contact with the lateral pleural surfaces near the lung bases. In contrast, intralobular septal thickening are visible as fine linear opacities in a lobule when the intralobular interstitial tissue is abnormally thickened. When numerous, they may appear as a fine reticular pattern.

name: Bifid uvula
description: Uvula separated into two parts most easily seen at the tip.
synonyms: ["HP:0000173","HP:0410032","Bifid palatine uvula","Cleft of uvula","Cleft uvula","Forked uvula","Split uvula","Uvula bifida"]

name: Pulmonary fibrosis
description: Replacement of normal lung tissues by fibroblasts and collagen.

name: Osteoarthritis of the first carpometacarpal joint
Localized skin lesion
description: A lesion of the skin that is located in a specific region rather than being generalized.

name: Abnormality of subcutaneous fat tissue
synonyms: ["Abnormality of fatty tissue below the skin"]

name: Decreased circulating copper concentration
description: A reduced concentration of copper in the blood.

name: Exercise-induced muscle stiffness
description: A type of muscle stiffness that occurs following physical exertion.
synonyms: ["HP:0003633","Exercise-induced muscle stiffness","Muscle stiffness with exercise","Muscle stiffness, exercise-induced"]

name: Increased circulating adrenic acid concentration
description: An increased concentration of adrenic acid (also known as cis-7,10,13,16-Docosatetraenoic acid) in the blood circulation.

name: Fragmentation of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 5th toe
synonyms: ["Fragmentation of the end part of the innermost bone of the little toe","Fragmentation of the end part of the innermost bone of the pinkie toe","Fragmentation of the end part of the innermost bone of the pinky toe"]

name: Absent aortic valve cusps
description: A developmental defect characterized by the lack of aortic valve cusps (leaflets). There may be remnants of the aortic valve in form of a nonobstructive fibrous ridge or rudimentary leaflets or sinuses of Valsalva.

name: Posterior capsular cataract
description: A cataract which is found in the back outer layer of the lens. This type often develops more rapidly.

name: Enlarged epiphysis of the middle phalanx of the 3rd toe
synonyms: ["Enlarged end part of the middle bone of the 3rd toe"]

name: Hypoplasia of the epiglottis
description: Hypoplasia of the epiglottis.

name: Cavitating leukodystrophy
description: A type of leukodystrophy characterized by multiple small cavitations typically in the periventricular and deep cerebral white matter. The cavitations are visible as a central cavity with cerebrospinal fluid-like signal intensity.

name: Triangular shaped middle phalanx of the 5th finger
description: Triangular shaped middle phalanx of the 5th (little) finger. A triangular or so called delta shaped phalanx is a typical result after a bracket epiphysis of the affected phalanx.
synonyms: ["Triangular shaped middle little finger bone","Triangular shaped middle pinkie finger bone","Triangular shaped middle pinky finger bone"]

name: Anti-GQ1b IgG antibody positivity
description: The presence of IgG autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against ganglioside Q1b.

name: Clinical modifier
description: This subontology is designed to provide terms to characterize and specify the phenotypic abnormalities defined in the Phenotypic abnormality subontology, with respect to severity, laterality, age of onset, and other aspects.

name: Focal absence of the external ear
description: Absence of a localized portion of the ear that cannot be described by a more precise term (e.g., absent ear lobe).

name: Myocardial steatosis
description: Steatosis in the myocardium.

name: Hypodeviation
description: A type of strabismus in which the visual axis of one eye is lower than that of the other.

name: Oppenheim reflex
description: Dorsiflexion of the big toe, sometimes accompanied by fanning of the other toes, elicited by stroking along the medial side of the tibia (the normal response would be no movement of the big toe).

name: Decreased proportion of CD4-positive, alpha-beta memory T cells
description: Decresaed proportion of CD4-positive, alpha-beta memory T cells compared to the total number of T cells in the blood. These cells have the phenotype of CD45RO-positive and CD127-positive. This cell type is also described as being CD25-negative, CD44-high, and CD122-high.

name: Neuritis
description: Inflammation of a nerve.

name: Abnormal talus morphology
description: An abnormality of the talus.

name: Coarctation of aorta
description: Coarctation of the aorta is a narrowing or constriction of a segment of the aorta.
synonyms: ["Aortic coarctation","Coarctation of the aorta","Narrowing of aorta","Narrowing of the aorta"]

name: Decreased specific antibody response to protein vaccine
description: A reduced ability to synthesize postvaccination antibodies against proteins in vaccines, as measured by antibody titer determination following vaccination.

name: Short distal phalanx of the 3rd toe
description: Developmental hypoplasia of the distal phalanx of third toe.
synonyms: ["Hypoplastic/small distal phalanx of the 3rd toe","Short distal phalanx of the third toe","Short outermost bone of the 3rd toe"]

name: Congenital adrenal hypoplasia
description: A type of adrenal hypoplasia with congenital onset.

name: Medial flaring of the eyebrow
description: An abnormal distribution of eyebrow hair growth in the medial direction.

name: Abnormal morphology of the musculature of the neck
description: An abnormality of the neck musculature.
synonyms: ["Abnormality of cervical musculature","Abnormality of the musculature of the neck","Neck muscle issue"]

name: Conjunctival hyperemia
description: Dilatation of the blood vessels of the conjunctiva leading to a red appearance of the sclera.

name: Hypoplasia of the fovea
description: Underdevelopment of the fovea centralis.

name: Chilblains
description: Chilblains, also called perniosis, are an inflammatory skin condition related to an abnormal vascular response to the cold. We are unaware of a reliable estimate of incidence. It typically presents as tender, pruritic red or bluish lesions located symmetrically on the dorsal aspect of the fingers, toes, ears and nose. Less commonly, reports describe involvement of the thighs and buttocks. The lesions present hours after exposure to cold and usually resolve spontaneously in one to three weeks.

name: Thoracic hypertrichosis
description: Excessive, increased hair growth located in the thoracic region.

name: Thickened helices
description: Increased thickness of the helix of the ear.

name: Thin proximal phalanges with broad epiphyses of the hand
synonyms: ["Thin innermost bone with broad end part of the hand bone","Thin proximal phalanges with broad epiphyses"]

name: Partial duplication of the middle phalanx of the 2nd finger
description: Partial duplication of the middle phalanx of index finger, seen on x-rays as a broad and/or bifid phalanx.
synonyms: ["Partial duplication of the middle bone of the index finger"]

name: Hooded lower eyelid
description: Lower eyelid partly covered by skin when eyes are open.

name: Bruxism
description: Bruxism is characterized by the grinding of the teeth including the clenching of the jaw and typically occur during sleep.

name: Anorgasmia
description: Inability of individual to reach orgasm.

name: Osteoporosis of vertebrae
description: Osteoporosis affecting predominantly the vertebrae.

name: Decreased activity of mitochondrial complex II
description: A reduction in the activity of the mitochondrial respiratory chain complex II, which is part of the electron transport chain in mitochondria.

name: Partial duplication of the middle phalanges of the hand
description: A partial duplication, depending on severity leading to a broad or bifid appearance, affecting one or more of the middle phalanges of the hand. As opposed to a complete duplication there is still a variable degree of fusion between the duplicated bones.
synonyms: ["Partial duplication of the middle bones of hand"]

name: Xanthelasma
description: The presence of xanthomata in the skin of the eyelid.
synonyms: ["Fatty deposits in skin around the eyes","Fatty deposits on eyelids","Xanthelasma palpebrarum","Xanthoma"]

name: Reduced insulin like growth factor binding protein acid labile subunit level
description: Blood concentration of insulin like growth factor binding protein acid labile subunit level below normal limits.
synonyms: ["Acid-labile subunit deficiency","Decreased levels of acid labile subunit"]

name: Aneurysmal bone cyst
description: Radiographic features include a dilated, radiolucent lesion typically located eccentrically within the metaphyseal portion of the bone, with fluid levels visible on magnetic resonance imaging.

name: Focal impaired awareness cognitive seizure with anomia
description: A focal cognitive seizure with anomia characterized by impairment of awareness at some point during the seizure.

name: Fragile nails
description: Nails that easily break.

name: Encysted hydrocele of the cord
description: A type of hydrocele testis in which both the proximal and distal portions of processus vaginalis get obliterated while the central portion remains patent and fluid accumulates within it.

name: Stippling of the epiphyses of the hallux
description: The presence of abnormal punctate (speckled, dot-like) calcifications in the epiphyses of the hallux.
synonyms: ["Speckled calcifications in the end part of the big toe bone"]

name: Tibial torsion
description: Tibial torsion is inward twisting (medial rotation) (PATO:0002155) of the tibia.

name: Flattened metacarpal heads
description: Abnormally flat shape of the heads of the metacarpal bones.
synonyms: ["Flattened head of long bone of hand"]

name: Abnormal ossification of the trapezoid bone
Decreased circulating IgG level
description: An abnormally decreased level of immunoglobulin G (IgG) in blood.
synonyms: ["HP:0003289","HP:0003294","HP:0005394","HP:0008325","HP:0008340","Decreased gamma-globin expression","Decreased IgG level","Decreased IgG level in blood","Decreased immunoglobulin G","Decreased serum IgG","IgG deficiency","Reduced IgG levels"]

name: Hyperalbuminemia
description: Elevation in the concentration of albumin in the blood.

name: Hypothalamic hypometabolism in FDG PET
description: Reduced uptake of-fluorodeoxyglucose (FDG) in the hypothalamus as measured by positron emission tomography (PET) brain scan.

name: Abnormal pattern electroretinogram
description: An anomalous response to a pattern electroretinogram (PERG), a particular kind of ERG obtained in response to contrast modulation of patterned visual stimuli at constant mean luminance-typically contrast-reversing gratings or checkerboards-whose characteristics are fundamentally different from those of the traditional ERG in response to diffuse flashes of light.

name: Focal autonomic seizure with lacrimation
description: A type of focal autonomic seizure characterized by lacrimation as the initial semiological feature.

name: Focal non-motor seizure
description: A type of focal-onset seizure characterized by non-motor signs or symptoms (or behaviour arrest) as its initial semiological manifestation.
synonyms: ["Focal seizure without motor onset","Partial seizure without motor onset"]

name: Aplastic/hypoplastic lacrimal glands
description: Absence or underdevelopment of the lacrimal gland.

name: Hyperplastic labia majora
description: Overgrowth of the outer labia.

name: Cephalohematoma
description: Hemorrhage between the skull and periosteum of a newborn resulting from rupture of blood vessels that cross the periosteum.

name: Mid-frequency hearing loss
description: A type of hearing impairment affecting primarily the middle frequencies of sound (1000 Hz to 3000 Hz).

name: Osteolytic defects of the proximal phalanx of the 4th toe
Reduced brain gamma-aminobutyric acid level by MRS
description: An decreased level of gamma-aminobutyric acid in the brain identified by magnetic resonance spectroscopy (MRS).

name: Dilatation of the cerebral artery
description: The presence of a localized dilatation or ballooning of a cerebral artery.

name: Hyperuricosuria
description: An abnormally high level of uric acid in the urine.

name: Increased vertebral height
description: Increased top to bottom height of vertebral bodies.

name: Abnormal CSF pyruvate family amino acid concentration
description: Any deviation from the normal concentration of pyruvate-family amino acids in the cerebrospinal fluid.
synonyms: ["Abnormal pyruvate-family amino acid levels in cerebrospinal fluid"]

name: Abnormal horizontal rectus muscle physiology
description: A functional anomaly of the medial rectus muscle or lateral rectus muscle.

name: Disseminated cutaneous warts
description: Multiple skin warts located in multiple parts of the body, e.g., neck, trunks, and extremities.

name: Choreoathetosis
description: Involuntary movements characterized by both athetosis (inability to sustain muscles in a fixed position) and chorea (widespread jerky arrhythmic movements).

name: Abnormality of the lens
description: An abnormality of the lens.

name: Conical tooth
description: An abnormal conical form of the teeth, that is, a tooth whose sides converge or taper together incisally.
synonyms: ["Cone shaped tooth","Conoid tooth","Peg shaped teeth","Peg tooth","Peg-shaped teeth","Shark tooth"]

name: Hypoplasia of the pharynx
description: Underdevelopment of the pharynx.
synonyms: ["Decreased size of pharynx","Small pharynx","Underdevelopment of pharynx"]

name: Tip-toe gait
description: An abnormal gait pattern characterized by the failure of the heel to contact the floor at the onset of stance during gait.

name: Gastric duplication
description: Gastric duplication is a usually cystic malformation of gastrointestinal tract, usually attached to the greater curvature of the stomach and has no communication with the stomach.

name: Increased circulating purine concentration
description: Abnormally elevated concentration of a purine compound. Purine compounds are aromatic heterocyclic compounds containing a purine moiety, which is formed a pyrimidine-ring ring fused to an imidazole ring.

name: Anterior chamber cells grade 3+
description: Anterior chamber cells with 26-50 cells in a 1 mm by 1 mm slit beam field, employing adequate light intensity and magnification on a slit lamp.

name: Compensated hypothyroidism
description: Condition associated with a raised serum concentration of thyroid stimulating hormone (TSH) but a normal serum free thyroxine (FT4).

name: Aplasia of facial bones
synonyms: ["Absence of facial bones","Agenesis of facial bones","Aplasia of facial skeleton","Failure of development of facial bones","Failure of development of facial skeleton"]

name: Agoraphobia
description: A type of anxiety disorder characterized by avoidance of public places, especially where crowds gather.

name: Precocious costochondral ossification
description: Early ossification of the costochondral junction, which is the joint between the ribs and costal cartilage in the front of the rib cage.

name: Partial duplication of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger
description: Partial duplication of the distal phalanx of little finger, seen on x-rays as a broad and/or bifid phalanx.
synonyms: ["Bifid terminal phalanx of the 5th finger","Notched outermost pinky finger bone","Partial duplication of outermost little finger bone","Partial duplication of outermost pinkie finger bone","Partial duplication of outermost pinky finger bone"]

name: Absolute eccentric fixation
description: Eccentric fixation in which the angle of eccentricity equals the objective angle of deviation.

name: Fundus hemorrhage
description: Bleeding within the fundus of the eye.

name: Molar tooth sign on MRI
description: An abnormal appearance of the midbrain in axial magnetic resonance imaging in which the elongated superior cerebellar peduncles give the midbrain an appearance reminiscent of a molar or wisdom tooth.
synonyms: ["molar tooth sign' on brain imaging","molar tooth' sign on imaging","Molar tooth sign"]

name: Venous varicosities of celiac and mesenteric vessels
description: Elongated and tortuous mesenteric veins, which comprise the inferior mesenteric vein and the superior mesenteric vein.
synonyms: ["Venous varicosities of coeliac and mesenteric vessels"]

name: Neoplasm of the stomach
description: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the stomach.

name: Short neck
description: Diminished length of the neck.
synonyms: ["HP:0005992","HP:0200137","Cervical shortening","Decreased cervical height","Decreased cervical length","Decreased length of neck","Short neck"]

name: Conjunctival amyloidosis
description: A form of amyloidosis that affects the conjunctiva.

name: Hyperparathyroidism
description: Excessive production of parathyroid hormone (PTH) by the parathyroid glands.

name: Mild albuminuria
description: The presence of mildly increased concentrations of albumin in the urine, defined as an albumin-creatinine ratio (ACR) less than 30 mg/gm (less than 3.4 mg/mmol).

name: Reduced circulating acylcarnitine concentration
description: An abnormally reduced concentration in the blood circulation of acylcarnitine, which is produced by reversible esterification of the 3-hydroxyl group of carnitine.

name: Abnormal muscle fiber laminin beta 1
description: A deviation from normal of the amount of laminin beta 1 in muscle fiber tissue. Laminin 2 is a major component of the basal lamina of skeletal muscle cells. It is a heterotrimer composed of 3 chains: merosin (laminin alpha 2 chain), beta 1, and gamma 1.

name: Shagreen patch
description: A plaque representing a connective-tissue nevus. Connective tissue naevi are uncommon skin lesions that occur when the deeper layers of the skin do not develop correctly or the components of these layers occur in the wrong proportion. Shagreen patches are oval-shaped and nevoid, skin-colored or occasionally pigmented, smooth or crinkled, The word shagreen refers to a type of roughened untanned leather.

name: Absent microvilli on the surface of peripheral blood lymphocytes
description: Absence of the fingerlike protrusive, actin-dependent structures found on the surface of peripheral blood lymphocytes.

name: Elevated circulating amyloid A
description: An increased concentration of serum amyloid A in the blood circulation.

name: Chiari type II malformation
description: A type of Chiari malformation that consists of brainstem herniation and a towering cerebellum in addition to the herniated cerebellar tonsils and vermis due to an open distal spinal dysraphism/myelomeningocele.

name: Absent left sided atrioventricular connection
description: A defect where there is no connection between the left atrium and left ventricle.

name: Impaired glucose tolerance
description: An abnormal resistance to glucose, i.e., a reduction in the ability to maintain glucose levels in the blood stream within normal limits following oral or intravenous administration of glucose.

name: Syringomyelia
description: Dilated, glial-lined cavity in spinal cord. This cavity does not communicate with the central canal, and usually is between the dorsal columns unilaterally or bilaterally along the side of the cord.

name: Irregular epiphyses of the 5th toe
synonyms: ["Irregular end part of the little toe bone","Irregular end part of the pinkie toe bone","Irregular end part of the pinky toe bone"]

name: Abnormal brainstem MRI signal intensity
description: A deviation from normal signal on magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of the brainstem.

name: Cluster headache
description: A type of headache characterized by repeated attacks of unilateral pain lasting 15 to 180 minutes and associated with local autonomic signs.

name: Abnormal blood chloride concentration
description: An abnormality of chloride homeostasis or concentration in the body.
synonyms: ["Abnormal blood Cl concentration","Abnormal blood Cl- concentration","Abnormality of chloride homeostasis"]

name: Neonatal hypoproteinemia
description: A neonatal decreased concentration of proteins in the blood.

name: Intestinal edema
description: Accumulation of cell free, noninflammatony fluid within the wall of the intestinal tract producing uniform thickening of the mucosal folds.

name: Abnormality of central motor conduction
description: Any anomaly of the conduction of motor nerve impulses in the central nervous system.

name: Plantar hyperkeratosis
description: Hyperkeratosis affecting the sole of the foot.

name: Agenesis of putamen
description: A developmental defect characterized by the absence of the putamen owing to its failure to develop.

name: Adrenal insufficiency
description: Insufficient production of steroid hormones (primarily cortisol) by the adrenal glands.

name: Intellectual disability, profound
description: Profound mental retardation is defined as an intelligence quotient (IQ) below 20.
synonyms: ["IQ less than 20","Mental retardation, profound","Profound mental retardation"]

name: Lumbar hemivertebrae
description: Absence of one half of the vertebral body in the lumbar spine.

name: Abnormal total iron binding capacity
description: Any deviation from the normal total-iron binding capacity, which measures how much serum iron is bound if an excess of radioactive iron is added.

name: Ash-leaf spot
description: A hypopigmented spot in the shape of a leaf from the mountain ash tree.

name: Geographic atrophy
description: Sharply demarcated area of partial or complete depigmentation of the fundus reflecting atrophy of the retinal pigment epithelium with associated retinal photoreceptor loss. The margins of the de-pigmented area are usually scalloped and the large choroidal vessels are visible through the atrophic retinal pigment epithelium.

name: Fractured epiphysis of third metacarpal bone
description: A partial or complete breakage of the epiphysis of third metacarpal bone.

name: Ectopic scrotum
description: Scrotum in a position other than the usual position inferior to the base of the penis.

name: Decreased muscle glycogen content
description: A decreased amount of glycogen in muscle tissue.

name: Percussion-induced rapid rolling muscle contractions
description: Mechanical percussion (i.e., striking a muscle with a reflex hammer) leads to spreading waves of muscle contractions that begin proximally and spread laterally across the muscle.

name: Malaligned philtral ridges
description: Absence of the usual parallel position of philtral ridges.
synonyms: ["Asymmetric philtral columns","Asymmetric philtral ridges","Malaligned philtral columns","Philtral Ridges, Malaligned"]

name: Constrictive median neuropathy
description: Injury to the median nerve caused by its entrapment at the wrist as it traverses through the carpal tunnel. Clinically, constrictive median neuropathy is characterized by pain, paresthesia, and weakness in the median nerve distribution of the hand.

name: Limited knee extension
description: Reduced ability to extend (straighten) the knee joint.

name: Abnormal heart valve morphology
description: Any structural abnormality of a cardiac valve.

name: Pericardial late gadolinium enhancement
description: Areas of high signal intensity in magnetic resonance imaging of the pericardium appearing around 10 minutes after injection of the intercellular contrast agent gadolinium.

name: Hemivertebrae
description: Absence of one half of the vertebral body.

name: Pericardial lymphangiectasia
description: An abnormal dilatation of lymph vessels in the pericardium.

name: Bilateral facial palsy
description: Two-sided or bilateral weakness of the muscles of facial expression and eye closure.
synonyms: ["Bilateral facial muscle paralysis","Bilateral facial muscle weakness","Bilateral facial paralysis","Paralysis of both sides of the face","Weakness of both sides of the face"]

name: Multiple trichilemmomata
description: Presence of multiple trichilemmomata, a benign tumour originating from the outer root sheath of the hair follicle.

name: Microspherophakia
description: Lens of the eye is smaller than normal and spherically shaped.

name: Enlarged hippocampus
description: Increase in size of the hippocampus.

name: Osteolytic defects of the proximal phalanx of the 5th toe
Anteriorly placed odontoid process
description: Anterior mislocalization of the dens of the axis.

name: Reduced granulocyte CD18 level
description: Reduced level of CD18 on the granulocyte surface. This feature can be assessed by flow cytometry.

name: Simple ear
description: The pinna has fewer folds and grooves than usual.

name: Fibular hypoplasia
description: Underdevelopment of the fibula.

name: Fractured middle phalanx of manual digit 3
description: A partial or complete breakage of the middle phalanx of manual digit 3.

name: Constant exotropia
description: A form of divergent strabismus (exotropia) in which the eye turns outward at all distances and at all times.

name: Respiratory insufficiency due to defective ciliary clearance
obsolete Dilatation of the ascending aorta
Epidermal acanthosis
description: Diffuse hypertrophy or thickening of the stratum spinosum of the epidermis (prickle cell layer of the skin).
synonyms: ["Acanthosis","Acanthotic epidermis","Thickening of upper layer of skin"]

name: Contracture of the proximal interphalangeal joint of the 2nd finger
description: Chronic loss of joint motion of the proximal interphalangeal joint of the 2nd finger due to structural changes in non-bony tissue.
synonyms: ["Camptodactyly of 2nd finger","Camptodactyly of index finger","Camptodactyly of second finger"]

name: Urinary hesitancy
description: Difficulty in beginning the process of urination.

name: Aplasia of the olfactory tract
description: Aplasia (congenital absence) of the olfactory tract, which causes anosmia, a complete loss of the sense of smell.

name: Androgen insufficiency
description: Insufficient amount of androgenic activity.

name: Lens coloboma
description: A sectoral indentation of the crystalline lens, usually due to zonular weakness or absence.

name: Bilateral tonic-clonic seizure with generalized onset
description: A bilateral tonic-clonic seizure with generalized onset is a type of bilateral tonic-clonic seizure characterised by generalized onset; these seizures rapidly engage networks in both hemispheres at the start of the seizure.
synonyms: ["Bilateral tonic-clonic seizure with generalised onset","Generalised tonic-clonic seizure without focal onset","Generalised tonic-clonic seizure without partial onset","Generalised tonic-clonic seizures without focal onset","Generalised-onset tonic-clonic seizure","Generalized tonic-clonic seizure without focal onset","Generalized tonic-clonic seizure without partial onset","Generalized tonic-clonic seizures without focal onset","Generalized-onset tonic-clonic seizure","Primarily generalised tonic-clonic seizures","Primarily generalized tonic-clonic seizures","Primary generalised tonic-clonic seizure","Primary generalised tonic-clonic seizures","Primary generalized tonic-clonic seizure","Primary generalized tonic-clonic seizures"]

name: Asymmetric radial dysplasia
description: The presence of asymmetric developmental dysplasia of the radius.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the frontal sinuses
description: Absence or underdevelopment of frontal sinus.

name: Confetti hypopigmentation pattern of lower leg skin
synonyms: ["Confetti hypopigmentation pattern of lower leg skin"]

name: Renal interstitial IgG4+ plasma cell infiltration
description: An increased number of IgG4+ plasma cells in the interstitial space of the kidney.

name: Myocardial granulomatous infiltrates
description: The presence of multiple granulomata (small nodular inflammatory lesions containing grouped mononuclear phagocytes) in the myocardium.

name: Double outlet right ventricle with subaortic ventricular septal defect and pulmonary stenosis
description: A double outlet right ventricle with a ventricular spetal defect (a hole between the two bottom chambers (ventricles) of the heart), that is considered to be closely related to the aortic origin.
