There is associated pulmonary stenosis, the abnormal narrowing or constriction of the pulmonary artery, in the main pulmonary artery and/or in the left or right pulmonary artery branches.
synonyms: ["DORV with subaortic VSD and pulmonary stenosis"]

name: Cortical peritubular capillaritis
description: Inflammation of the peritubular capillaries in the cortex of the kidney characterized by Inflammatory cells in over 10 percent of the interstitial capillaries in the cortex with at least some capillaries having three or more luminal cells.

name: Duplication of phalanx of 4th finger
description: This term applies if one or more of the phalanges of the 4th finger are either partially duplicated, depending on severity leading to a broad or bifid appearance of the phalanges, or completely duplicated.
synonyms: ["Duplication of bones of the ring finger","Partial/complete duplication of phalanges of the 4th finger"]

name: Pink urine
description: An abnormal pink color of urine.

name: Recurrent viral infections
description: Increased susceptibility to viral infections, as manifested by recurrent episodes of viral infection.

name: Spastic diplegia
description: Spasticity (neuromuscular hypertonia) primarily in the muscles of the legs, hips, and pelvis.

name: Posterior pituitary agenesis
description: Absence of the neurohypophysis owing to a developmental defect.

name: obsolete Acral ulceration and osteomyelitis leading to autoamputation of the digits (feet)
Macrosquare-wave jerks
description: Horizontal 10-40 degree excursions from fixation and back again.

name: Reduced factor XI activity
description: Decreased activity of coagulation factor XI. Factor XI, also known as plasma thromboplastin antecedent, is a serine proteinase that activates factor IX.

name: Tetralogy of Fallot
description: A congenital cardiac malformation comprising pulmonary stenosis, overriding aorta, ventricular septum defect, and right ventricular hypertrophy. The diagnosis of TOF is made if at least three of the four above mentioned features are present.

name: Verrucous cell carcinoma of the tongue
description: A low-grade variant of squamous cell carcinoma of the tongue with a warty (verrucous) appearance.

name: Erratic myoclonus
description: A type of myoclonus in which the myoclonias shift from body region to another in a random and asynchronous fashion. Erratic myoclonus can affect the face or limbs, are brief, single or repetitive, very frequent and nearly continuous.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the middle phalanx of the 2nd finger
synonyms: ["HP:0006221","Absent/hypoplastic middle phalanx of 2nd finger","Absent/small middle index finger bone","Absent/underdeveloped middle index finger bone","Hypoplastic/aplastic middle phalanx of index finger"]

name: Craniofacial dystonia
description: A form of focal dystonia affecting the face and especially the jaw that is induced by the act of speaking. It is an involuntary contraction of the masticatory muscles, resulting in dysarthria or dysphagia.
synonyms: ["Abnormal craniofacial muscle tone","Abnormal craniofacial posture","Distorted craniofacial posture"]

name: White oral mucosal macule
description: A small circumscribed whitish change in the color of the oral mucosa that is neither elevated nor depressed.

name: Radial club hand
description: Wrist is bent inward toward the thumb because of a congenital defect associated with shortening or absence of the radius.

name: Invasive parasitic infection
description: A parasitic infection whereby the parasite invades (migrates through) tissues of the infected host.

name: Decreased CSF glutamate concentration
description: Abnormally decreased levels of glutamic acid in cerebrospinal fluid.
synonyms: ["Low glutamic acid levels in cerebrospinal fluid"]

name: Steroid-dependent nephrotic syndrome
description: A type of nephrotic syndrome in which two consecutive relapses (albumin urine dipstick at least 3+ or proteinuria greater than 40 mg/m2/d or urinary protein to creatinine ratio at least 2000 mg/g for 3 consecutive days) occur during corticosteroid therapy, or within 14 days of ceasing therapy.

name: Brown pigment gallstones
description: A type of pigment gallstone that is brown, containing calcium fatty acids. These stones are softer than black pigment gallstones.

name: Unguarded tricuspid valve
description: A form of agenesis of the tricuspid valve in which (although the normal orifice between the right atrium and right ventricle exists) there is no tricuspid valvular tissue.
synonyms: ["Rudimentary tricuspid valve leaflets","Unguarded tricuspid valve orifice"]

name: obsolete Atrioventricular canal defect with right ventricle aorta and pulmonary atresia
Abnormal muscle fiber delta sarcoglycan
description: Deviation from normal in the amount of delta sarcoglycan in muscle. The alpha, beta, gamma, and delta sarcoglycans are components of the dystrophin-complex. They are all N-glycosylated transmembrane proteins with a short intra-cellular domain, a single transmembrane region and a large extra-cellular domain containing a cluster of conserved cysteines.

name: Enlarged humeral metaphyses
synonyms: ["Enlarged wide portion of long bone of upper arm","Expanded humeral metaphyses"]

name: Increased antral follicle count
description: A count of antral follicles that is higher than normal for age.

name: Coronary artery calcification
description: An accumulation of calcium and phosphate in arteries with mineral deposits in the intimal or medial layer of the vessel wall in a coronary artery.

name: Pancreatic endocrine tumor
description: A neuroendocrine tumor originating in a hormone-producing cell (islet cell) of the pancreas.

name: Abnormal hair quantity
description: An abnormal amount of hair.

name: Abnormal urine phosphate concentration
description: An abnormal phosphate concentration in the urine.

name: Alkalosis
description: Depletion of acid or accumulation base in the body fluids.

name: Fetal fifth finger clinodactyly
description: Fifth finger clinodactyly is defined by a hypoplastic or absent mid-phalanx of the fifth digit. Ultrasound identification of the fetal hand must first be undertaken and then appropriate magnification accomplished. The evaluation requires stretching of the 5 fingers. The diagnosis is established when the middle phalanx of the fifth finger is markedly smaller than normal or absent, which often causes the finger to be curved inward (PMID:16100637).
synonyms: ["Fetal little finger curvature","Fetal pinkie finger curvature","Fetal pinky finger curvature","Foetal fifth finger clinodactyly","Foetal little finger curvature","Foetal pinkie finger curvature","Foetal pinky finger curvature"]

name: Arcuate vein lumen organized thrombi
description: Thrombi containg fibrous tissue and capillary-like vascular channels located within the lumen of the arcuate veins of the kidney.

name: Increased lymphocyte apoptosis
description: A elevation in the rate of apoptosis in lymphocytes.

name: Broad long bones
description: Increased cross-section (diameter) of the long bones. Note that widening may primarily affect specific regions of long bones (e.g., diaphysis or metaphysis), but this should be coded separately.
synonyms: ["Broad long bones","Wide long bones","Widened long bones"]

name: Irregular ossification of the humeral epiphyses
Hyperhomocystinemia
description: An increased concentration of homocystine in the blood.

name: Photosensitive myoclonic seizure
description: Generalised myoclonic seizure provoked by flashing or flickering light.

name: Abnormal number of erythroid precursors
description: A deviation from the normal count of erythroid precursor cells, that is, erythroid lineage cells in the bone marrow.

name: Dacryocystitis
description: Inflammation of the nasolacrimal sac.

name: Absent/hypoplastic paranasal sinuses
description: Aplasia or hypoplasia of the paranasal sinuses.

name: Anti-Hu antibody positivity
description: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against Hu.

name: Sclerotic foci of metaphyses of the elbow
synonyms: ["Vertical linear mixed lucent and sclerotic pattern of metaphyses"]

name: Self-biting
description: Habitual biting of one's own body.

name: Reduced beta-hexosaminidase activity
description: Diminished activity of the enzyme beta-hexosaminidase in the blood circulation.

name: Renal transitional cell carcinoma
description: A malignant tumor that arises from the transitional (urothelial) epithelial cells lining the urinary tract from the renal calyces to the ureteral orifice.
synonyms: ["renal TCC","Renal urothelial carcinoma","Transitional renal cell carcinoma"]

name: Abnormal circulating copper concentration
description: An abnormal concentration of copper.

name: Progressive bowing of long bones
description: Progressive bending or abnormal curvature of a long bone.

name: Abnormal dental pulp morphology
description: An abnormality of the dental pulp.
synonyms: ["Abnormality of the dental pulp","Abnormality of tooth pulp"]

name: Absence of intrinsic factor
description: Absence of gastric intrinsic factor, which is normally produced by the parietal cells of the stomach, and is required for the absorption of vitamin B12.

name: Increased proteinogenic amino acid level in urine
description: An elevated level of a proteinogenic amino acid in the urine. These are the 23 alpha-amino acids that are precursors to proteins, and are incorporated into proteins during translation. The group includes the 20 amino acids encoded by the nuclear genes of eukaryotes together with selenocysteine, pyrrolysine, and N-formylmethionine.

name: Increased femoral torsion
description: Femoral torsion, also known as femoral rotation or femoral version, refers to the twist between the proximal and distal parts of the femur on the transverse plane. Femoral anteversion averages between 30-40 degress at birth, and between 8-14 degrees in adults. This term applies if the amount of femoral torsion exceeds this range.

name: Trismus
description: Limitation in the ability to open the mouth.
synonyms: ["Decrease in jaw mobility","Decrease in jaw movement","Decrease in jaw opening","Decrease in mandibular mobility","Decrease in mandibular movement","Decrease in mandibular opening","Limited jaw mobility","Limited jaw movement","Limited jaw opening","Limited mandibular mobility","Limited mandibular opening","Limited mouth opening","Lockjaw","Pain of muscles of mastication"]

name: Carpal bone hypoplasia
description: Underdevelopment of one or more carpal bones.
synonyms: ["HP:0001209","HP:0006029","HP:0006072","HP:0006117","HP:0006130","HP:0006227","Hypoplasia of carpal bones","Hypoplastic carpal bones","Small carpal bones","Small carpals","Small wrist bones"]

name: obsolete Disseminated Bacillus Calmette-Guerin infection
description: Failure to contain thebacillus Calmette-Guerin (BCG) following vaccination leading to spread of BCG to many sites in the body. The tuberculosis vaccine BCG contains live attenuated Mycobacterium bovis.

name: Abnormal circulating selenium concentration
description: Any deviation from the normal circulating concentration of selenium.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the distal phalanx of the thumb
synonyms: ["Absent/small outermost thumb bone","Absent/underdeveloped outermost thumb bone"]

name: Abnormality of inferior alveolar artery
description: An abnormality of an inferior alveolar artery.

name: Noncompaction cardiomyopathy
description: A type of cardiomyopathy characterized anatomically by deep trabeculations in the ventricular wall, which define recesses communicating with the main ventricular chamber.

name: Epiblepharon
description: Redundant eyelid skin pressing the eyelashes against the cornea and/or conjunctiva.

name: Decreased circulating lipoprotein lipase concentration
description: Reduction in the level of lipoprotein lipase in the blood.

name: Increased circulating trypsinogen
description: An abnormally high concentration of trypsinogen in the blood circulation.

name: Posterior crocodile shagreen of the cornea
description: Grayish, polygonal pattern of opacities with intervening clear zones across the central cornea that resembles crocodile skin.

name: Low levels of vitamin B2
description: A reduced concentration of vitamin B2.

name: Abnormality of the epiphysis of the 4th metacarpal
description: Any abnormality of the epiphysis of the 4th metacarpal bone.
synonyms: ["Abnormality of the end part of the 4th long bone of hand"]

name: Apical pulmonary opacity
description: An apical cap is a caplike lesion at the lung apex, usually caused by intrapulmonary and pleural fibrosis pulling down extrapleural fat or possibly by chronic ischemia resulting in hyaline plaque formation on the visceral pleura. The prevalence increases with age. It can also be seen in hematoma resulting from aortic rupture or in other fluid collection associated with infection or tumor, either outside the parietal pleura or loculated within the pleural space.

name: Drumstick terminal phalanges
description: Rounding and broadening of the tufts of the distal phalanges.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplastia of the eccrine sweat glands
description: Absence or developmental hypoplasia of the eccrine sweat glands.

name: Flattened epiphysis
description: Abnormal flatness (decreased height) of epiphyses.

name: Papulovesicular eruption
description: An acute onset rash characterized by by multiple vesicles, which are circumscribed, fluid-containing, epidermal elevations with a diameter less than 10mm at the widest point, and by multiple papules, which are circumscribed, solid epidermal elevations with no visible fluid with a diameter less than 10mm at the widest point.

name: Retinal pigment epithelial loss on macular OCT
Complete duplication of the distal phalanges of the hand
description: A complete duplication affecting one or more of the distal phalanges of the hand.
synonyms: ["Complete duplication of the outermost bones of the hand"]

name: Anomalous origin of right coronary artery from the pulmonary artery
description: Right coronary artery begins (branches off from) the pulmonary artery rather than as normal from the root of the aorta, above the right cusp of the aortic valve.

name: Distributed along Blaschko lines
description: Applies to an abnormality whose localization corresponds to the lines of Blaschko, which correspond to the lineage of epithelia cells. Blaschko lines are normally invisible but may become apparent with certain skin diseases and then can be seen to be distributed in lines horizontal to the body.

name: Abnormal second heart sound
description: Any anomaly of the second heart sound (S2), which is produced by aortic (A2) and pulmonic (P2) valve closure. The A2-P2 interval normally increases with inspiration and narrows with expiration.

name: Type 3 schizencephaly
description: A type of Schizencephaly in which CSF-containing cleft present with non-abutting lining lips of abnormal grey matter.

name: Abnormality of the skin
description: An abnormality of the skin.

name: Increased intracranial pressure
description: An increase of the pressure inside the cranium (skull) and thereby in the brain tissue and cerebrospinal fluid.
synonyms: ["Intracranial hypertension","Intracranial pressure elevation","Rise in pressure inside skull"]

name: Duplication of the phalanges of the 5th toe
description: Partial or complete duplication of one or more phalanx of little toe.
synonyms: ["Duplication of the bones of the little toe","Duplication of the bones of the pinkie toe","Duplication of the bones of the pinky toe","Duplication of the phalanges of the fifth toe","Partial/complete duplication of the phalanges of the 5th toe"]

name: Absent circulating B cells
description: Complete lack of mature B cells, that is, of B cells that have left the bone marrow.

name: Restrictive ventricular septal defect
description: Any ventricular septal defect (VSD) that is small enough to restrict flow across it such that a pressure gradient exists between the two sides of the VSD.

name: Abnormal corpus callosum morphology
description: Abnormality of the corpus callosum.
synonyms: ["HP:0007323","Abnormal corpus callosum","Abnormality of the corpus callosum","Corpus callosum abnormality"]

name: Cardiac valve calcification
description: Abnormal calcification of a cardiac valve.

name: Abnormality of the midnasal cavity
description: Abnormality of the midnasal cavity which includes the cavity between the nares and the choanae.

name: Triangular tongue
description: A form of macrogloassia (increased size of the tongue) characterized by a broad based root of the tongue but a small tongue tip, giving the appearance of a triangle.

name: P pulmonale
description: The presence of tall, peaked P waves in EKG lead II.

name: Abnormal B cell proliferation
description: Any abnormality in the multiplication or reproduction of B cells, which results in the expansion of a cell population.

name: Grade II preterm intraventricular hemorrhage
description: Intraventricular hemorrhage that occurs in a preterm infant and that has extension into normal-sized ventricles and typically fills less than 50% of the volume of the ventricle.

name: Eosinophilic pneumonia
description: The presence of eosinophils in lung tissue, generally as detected by tissue biopsy, with or without blood eosinophilia.
synonyms: ["Eosinophilic pulmonary infiltration","Pulmonary eosinophilic infiltrate","Pulmonary eosinophilic infiltration"]

name: Contracture of the distal interphalangeal joint of the fingers
description: Chronic loss of joint motion in one or more distal interphalangeal joints of the fingers.

name: Abnormal circulating fatty-acid anion concentration
description: Any deviation from the normal concentration of a fatty acid anion in the blood circulation.

name: Chronic myelogenous leukemia
description: A myeloproliferative disorder characterized by increased proliferation of the granulocytic cell line without the loss of their capacity to differentiate.
synonyms: ["HP:0005544","Chronic myelocytic leukaemia","Chronic myelocytic leukemia","Chronic myelogenous leukaemia","Chronic myeloid leukaemia","Chronic myeloid leukemia"]

name: Elevated urinary catecholamines
description: An increased concentration of catecholamine in the urine.

name: Alkaline urine
description: Urine pH of 8 or higher.

name: Increased circulating oleate level
description: An abnormally high concentration of oleic acid (oleate) in the blood circulation.

name: Ventricular hypertrophy
description: Enlargement of the cardiac ventricular muscle tissue with increase in the width of the wall of the ventricle and loss of elasticity. Ventricular hypertrophy is clinically differentiated into left and right ventricular hypertrophy.

name: Aortic dissection
description: Aortic dissection refers to a tear in the intimal layer of the aorta causing a separation between the intima and the medial layers of the aorta.
synonyms: ["HP:0002622","Tear in inner wall of large artery that carries blood away from heart"]

name: Patchy sclerosis of 5th toe phalanx
description: Patchy (irregular) increase in bone density of one or more of the phalanges of the fifth toe. This can take on many forms depending on severity and distribution as can be seen on x-rays.
synonyms: ["Patchy sclerosis of the phalanges of the 5th toe","Uneven increase in bone density in little toe bone","Uneven increase in bone density in pinkie toe bone","Uneven increase in bone density in pinky toe bone"]

name: Decreased low-density lipoprotein particle size
description: An abnormal decrease in the average size of low-density lipoprotein particle size in the blood circulation.

name: Coronary artery stenosis
description: Abnormal narrowing of the coronary artery.

name: Exacerbated by aspirin ingestion
description: Applied to a sign or symptom that is worsened by ingestion of aspirin.

name: Folate-unresponsive megaloblastic anemia
description: A type of megaloblastic anemia that does not improve upon administration of folate. Since vitamin B12 acts by promoting recycling of folate, administration of vitamin B12 also does not improve this type of anemia.

name: Fibular duplication
description: Duplication of the fibula. This may occur as a part of diplopodia (accessory tarsal or metatarsal bone). Diplopodia with double fibula is an extremely rare condition.

name: Anhydramnios
description: A complete or near-complete lack of amniotic fluid surrounding a fetus. This finding can be observed sonographically in the third trimesters if the deepest pocket of amniotic fluid is less than or equal to 2 cm.

name: Herpetiform corneal ulceration
description: The presence of one or more dendritic corneal epithelial ulcers characterized by a treelike branching linear pattern with feathery edges and terminal bulbs. Herpetiform corneal ulcers can be identified by fluorescein staining.

name: Recurrent enteroviral infections
description: Increased susceptibility to enteroviral infections, as manifested by recurrent episodes of enteroviral infection.

name: Abnormal circulating amino sulfonic acid concentration
Intestinal lymphangiectasia
description: Angiectasia of lymph vessels (i.e., dilatation of lymphatic vessels) in the intestines.

name: Giant hypertrophic gastritis
description: A type of gastritis characterized by excessive proliferation of the gastric mucosa and diffuse thickening of the gastric mucosal folds.

name: Hypertaurinemia
description: An increased amount of taurine in the blood.
synonyms: ["Elevated serum taurine levels","Increased circulating taurine levels in the blood"]

name: Wide mouth
description: Distance between the oral commissures more than 2 SD above the mean. Alternatively, an apparently increased width of the oral aperture (subjective).

name: Short foot
description: A measured foot length that is more than 2 SD below the mean for a newborn of 27 - 41 weeks gestation, or foot that is less than the 3rd centile for individuals from birth to 16 years of age (objective). Alternatively, a foot that appears disproportionately short (subjective).

name: Patellar overgrowth
description: Excessive growth of the kneecap (patella).

name: Femoral spur
description: A bony projection (spur, osteophyte) originating from the femur, often in the medial femoral neck.

name: Short second metatarsal
description: Short (hypoplastic) second metatarsal bone.

name: Abnormal basophil count
description: Any deviation from the normal number of basophils per volume in the blood circulation.

name: Sclerosis of toe phalanx
description: An elevation in bone density in one or more phalanges of the toes. Sclerosis is normally detected on a radiograph as an area of increased opacity.
synonyms: ["Increased bone density in the toe bone","Sclerosis of the phalanges of the toes"]

name: Polyostotic fibrous dysplasia
description: Fibrous dysplasia of the bones were lesions are localized in many bones throughout of the body. Polyostotic fibrous dysplasia is a cardinal feature of McCune-Albright syndrome.

name: Drug-induced agranulocytosis
description: A type of agranulocytosis related to ingestion of a specific medication.

name: Enteroviral hepatitis
description: Inflammation of the liver due to infection with enterovirus.

name: Internal carotid artery hypoplasia
synonyms: ["Decreased size of internal carotid artery","Small internal carotid artery"]

name: Pulmonary situs ambiguus with bilateral morphologic right lungs
description: An abnormality of the pulmonary situs, i.e., of the sidedness of the morphological right and left lungs, in which both lungs have the morphology of a right lung.

name: Absent muscle fiber merosin
description: Lack of merosin protein in the muscle biopsy.
synonyms: ["Absent merosin staining in muscle biopsy","Absent muscle fiber laminin alpha 2","Absent muscle fibre laminin alpha 2","Absent muscle fibre merosin"]

name: Gastrointestinal stroma tumor
synonyms: ["Gastrointestinal stroma tumour","Gastrointestinal stromal tumor","Gastrointestinal stromal tumour","GI stroma tumor","GI stroma tumour","GIST"]

name: Dilation of lateral ventricles
synonyms: ["HP:0006796","HP:0006945","HP:0007173","Dilatation of lateral cerebral ventricles","Enlarged lateral ventricles","Lateral ventricle dilatation"]

name: Reduced fibroblast CD16 level
description: Reduced level of CD16 on the fibroblast surface as assessed by flow cytometry.

name: Glomerulomegaly
description: Abnormally large size of glomeruli.

name: Premature epimetaphyseal fusion in fibula
description: Stop of growth at the epiphyseal plate the hyaline cartilage plate in the metaphysis at one or more long bones in the fibula, at an earlier than normal age, resulting in growth arrest and shortening of the involved bone.

name: Irregular humeral epiphyses
synonyms: ["Irregular end part of long bone in upper arm"]

name: Abnormality of connective tissue
description: Any abnormality of the soft tissues, including both connective tissue (tendons, ligaments, fascia, fibrous tissues, and fat).

name: Triangular epiphyses of the phalanges of the hand
description: A triangular appearance of the epiphyses of the phalanges of the fingers of the hand.
synonyms: ["HP:0009369","Delta-shaped epiphyses of the fingers","Triangular end part of finger bones","Triangular epiphyses of the fingers"]

name: Pulmonary artery atresia
description: A congenital anomaly with a narrowing or complete absence of the opening between the right ventricle and the pulmonary artery.

name: Reduced hemolytic complement activity
description: A diminished activity of the classical complement pathway as measured by the assay for 50% haemolytic complement (CH50) activity of serum.

name: Acute myelomonocytic leukemia
description: An acute leukemia characterized by the proliferation of both neutrophil and monocyte precursors.

name: Fractured manual digit 1 phalanx
description: A partial or complete breakage of the manual digit 1 phalanx.

name: Fractured acetabular part of hip bone
description: A partial or complete breakage of the acetabular part of hip bone.

name: Saccadic oscillation
description: An involuntary abnormality of fixation in which there is an abnormal saccade away from fixation followed by an immediate corrective saccade.

name: Interrupted aortic arch type A
description: Non-continuity of the aortic arch with an atretic point or absent segment at the level of the isthmus.

name: Proximal fibular overgrowth
description: Overgrowth of the proximal part of the fibula.
synonyms: ["Overgrowth of innermost part of calf bone"]

name: Prolactinoma
description: A benign tumor (adenoma) of the pituitary gland

name: Thinking-induced seizure
description: Seizures induced by thinking and decision-making. comment:

name: Cutaneous T-cell lymphoma
description: A type of T-cell lymphoma that exhibits malignant infiltration of the skin.

name: Lateral spinal meningocele
description: Protrusion of the arachnoid and dura through spinal foramina.

name: Focal autonomic seizure with pallor/flushing
description: A type of focal autonomic seizure characterized by changes of the skin as the initial semiological feature.

name: Abnormal gallbladder morphology
description: A structural anomaly of the gallbladder.

name: Curved middle phalanx of the 4th toe
description: A deviation from the normal straight form of the middle phalanx of the fourth toe.

name: Pelvic girdle muscle weakness
description: Weakness of the muscles of the pelvic girdle (also known as the hip girdle), that is, lack of strength of the muscles around the pelvis.
synonyms: ["HP:0003692","HP:0008999","HP:0009036","Hip girdle muscle weakness","Hip girdle weakness","Hip-girdle muscle weakness","Pelvic girdle weakness"]

name: Decreased level of D-mannose in urine
description: A decrease in the level of D-mannose in the urine.

name: Mitochondrial hypertrophy
description: Enlargment of mitochondria. Mitochondrial hypertrophy is not discernible by light microscopy. By electron microscopy (EM), hypertrophic mitochondria have normal cristae and normal matrix density. In contrast, swollen mitochondria display swollen cristae and irregular matrix densities in EM.

name: Biventricular noncompaction cardiomyopathy
description: Noncompaction cardiomyopathy that affects both ventricles.

name: Abnormality of femur morphology
description: Any anomaly of the structure of the femur.
synonyms: ["HP:0001439","Abnormality of the femora","Abnormality of the thighbone"]

name: Supernumerary pulmonary fissure
description: Presence of a lung fissure that does not exist normally. Supernumerary fissures include the superior accessory fissure, the medial basal fissure, the left horizontal fissure, and the azygos fissure form supernumerary lobes.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the spleen
description: Absence or underdevelopment of the spleen.

name: Cervical C2/C3 vertebral fusion
description: Fusion of cervical vertebrae at C2 and C3, caused by a failure in the normal segmentation or division of the cervical vertebrae during the early weeks of fetal development, leading to a short neck with a low hairline at the back of the head, and restricted mobility of the upper spine.
synonyms: ["HP:0004636","Fusion of cervical vertebrae c2-3","Klippel-Feil anomaly","Klippel-Feil syndrome"]

name: Global systolic dysfunction
description: A reduced ejection fraction and an enlarged left ventricle chamber, the latter by an increased resistance to filling with increased filling pressures. Systolic dysfunction is clinically associated with left ventricular failure in the presence of marked cardiomegaly.

name: Duplication of phalanx of 5th finger
description: This term applies if one or more of the phalanges of the 5th finger are either partially duplicated, depending on severity leading to a broad or bifid appearance of the phalanges, or completely duplicated.
synonyms: ["Partial/complete duplication of little finger bone","Partial/complete duplication of phalanges of the 5th finger","Partial/complete duplication of pinkie finger bone","Partial/complete duplication of pinky finger bone"]

name: Absent P wave
description: The P wave that normally precedes each QRS complex by a fixed PR interval of 120 to 200 milliseconds is not present.

name: Palilalia
description: Repetition of one's own words or phrases.

name: Central serous chorioretinopathy
description: An anomaly of the retina with serous detachment of the neurosensory retina secondary to one or more focal lesions of the retinal pigment epithelium (RPE), and associated with blurred vision, usually in one eye only and perceived typically by the patient as a dark spot in the centre of the visual field with associated micropsia and metamorphopsia. Normal vision often recurs spontaneously within a few months.

name: Increased urinary 11-deoxycortisol level
description: An abnormally elevated concentration of 11-deoxycortisol in the urine.

name: Hypopigmented genitalia
description: Localized or generalized decreased genital pigmentation.

name: Abnormal cardiac output
description: A deviation from normal Cardiac output, which is defined as the amount of blood pumped by the heart minute and is the mechanism whereby blood flows around the body, especially providing blood flow to the brain and other vital organs.

name: Fulminant hepatitis
description: Acute hepatitis complicated by acute liver failure with hepatic encephalopathy occurring less than 8 weeks after the onset of jaundice.

name: Globe retraction and deviation on abduction
Tessier number 2 facial cleft
description: As is typically seen in isolated cleft cases, a cleft of the lip is present. There is hypoplasia, but not true notching of the ala nasi with flattening of the lateral part of the nose. The nasal root is broadened, with lateral displacement of the inner canthus. The palpebral fissure and lacrimal drainage system are not disturbed. The alveolar cleft is through the lateral incisor area and extends to the pyriform aperture. There is normal septation between the nasal cavity and maxillary sinus. Notching at the junction between the nasal bone is present, as is a broad, flat frontal process of the maxilla. Transverse ethmoid enlargement produces orbital hypertelorism. Above the cleft of the lip and palate is a true broad cleft of the nostril that is medial to the intact, but laterally displaced, tail of the alar cartilage. A shallow soft tissue groove extends superiorly to the asymmetrically widened nasal root. The lacrimal system, palpebral fissures, and eyebrows remain intact. The alveolar cleft extends posteriorly as a complete unilateral cleft of the hard and soft palate. The nasal septum is intact but deviated to the opposite side. The nasal cavity remains separated from the normally pneumatized, although hypoplastic, maxilla on the cleft side. Above the nasomaxillary notching, the ethmoid sinus is less well developed, and there is no pneumatization of the frontal sinus on this side. Anterior rotation of the greater and lesser wings of the sphenoid occurs on the cleft side in relation to the narrower orbit and smaller ethmoid sinus. There is mild asymmetry of the anterior cranial fossa, which is narrower on the cleft side. The cranium is brachycephalic with marked occipital flattening.

name: Hypoproteinemic edema
description: An abnormal accumulation of fluid beneath the skin, or in one or more cavities of the body because of decreased osmotic pressure of plasma (hypoproteinemia).

name: Abnormal form of the vertebral bodies
description: Abnormal morphology of vertebral body.

name: Abnormality of the peritoneum
description: An abnormality of the peritoneum.

name: Abnormal nasal base
description: An anomaly of the nasal base, which can be conceived of as an imaginary line between the most lateral points of the external inferior attachments of the alae nasi to the face.
synonyms: ["Abnormal nasal base","Abnormality of base of nose","Anomaly of base of nose","Anomaly of nasal base"]

name: Anti-myelin oligodendrocyte glycoprotein antibody positivity
description: Presence of antibodies in the serum that react against myelin oligodendrocyte glycoprotein.

name: Cortical sclerosis
description: Sclerosis (abnormal hardening) of cortical bone, characterized by increased radiodensity.

name: Unconjugated hyperbilirubinemia
description: An increased amount of unconjugated (indirect) bilurubin in the blood.

name: Myocardial bridging
description: A congenital variant of a coronary artery in which a portion of an epicardial coronary artery (most frequently the middle segment of the left anterior descending artery) takes an intramuscular course.

name: Abnormal mandible morphology
description: Any abnormality of the mandible, the bone of the lower jaw.
synonyms: ["HP:0000209","Abnormality of the lower jaw bone","Abnormality of the mandible"]

name: Sertoli cell neoplasm
description: The presence of a neoplasm of the testis with origin in a Sertoli cell.

name: Superior oblique muscle underaction
description: Reduced ocular movement of the superior oblique muscle which improves on testing ductions, typically associated with neurogenic palsy.

name: Pericentral retinitis pigmentosa
description: A subtype of retinitis pigmentosa in which, instead of the pathology starting in the mid-periphery like typical retinitis pigmentosa, the disease starts in the near periphery closer to the vascular arcades and tends to spare the far periphery.

name: Abnormal morphology of erythroid progenitor cell
description: Abnormal form of the progenitor cells committed to the erythroid lineage.

name: Finger syndactyly
description: Webbing or fusion of the fingers, involving soft parts only or including bone structure. Bony fusions are referred to as \"bony\" Syndactyly if the fusion occurs in a radio-ulnar axis. Fusions of bones of the fingers in a proximo-distal axis are referred to as \"Symphalangism\".

name: Upper limb amyotrophy
description: Muscular atrophy involving the muscles of the upper limbs.

name: Renal arteriole neutrophil endoarterial hypercellularity
description: A type of renal arteriole leukocytic endoarterial hypercellularity due to the presence of increased numbers of neutrophils within the arteriolar lumen.
synonyms: ["Endoarterial hypercellularity within arterioles consisting of neutrophils"]

name: Abnormality of the middle phalanx of the 3rd toe
synonyms: ["Abnormality of the middle bone of 3rd toe"]

name: Camptodactyly of 2nd-5th fingers
description: The distal interphalangeal joint and/or the proximal interphalangeal joint of the second to fifth fingers cannot be extended to 180 degrees by either active or passive extension.

name: Short fourth metatarsal
description: Short fourth metatarsal bone.
synonyms: ["Bilateral fourth metatarsal shortening","Short 4th long bone of foot","Short fourth metatarsus"]

name: Congenital curved nail of fourth toe
Ileocecal ulcer
description: An erosion of the mucous membrane in the region connecting the ileum and cecum.

name: Thyroid C cell hyperplasia
description: An abnormal growth of parafollicular (C-cells) cells.

name: Atresia of the external auditory canal
description: Absence or failure to form of the external auditory canal.
synonyms: ["HP:0008547","HP:0008564","HP:0008626","Absent auditory canals","Absent ear canal","Absent external auditory canals","Atretic auditory canal","Atretic auditory canals","Atretic external auditory canal","Atretic external auditory canals","Auditory canal atresia","External acoustic meatus atresia","External auditory canal atresia","External auditory meatal atresia","External auditory meatus atresia"]

name: Elevated urinary delta-aminolevulinic acid
description: An increased concentration of 5-aminolevulinic acid (CHEBI:17549) in the urine.

name: Fractured epiphysis of third metatarsal bone
description: A partial or complete breakage of the epiphysis of third metatarsal bone.

name: Anti-tyrosyl-tRNA synthetase antibody positivity
description: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against tyrosyl-tRNA synthetase.

name: Enlarged epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger
description: Abnormally large size of the epiphysis located at the proximal end of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger with respect to age-dependent norms.
synonyms: ["Enlarged end part of the outermost bone of little finger","Enlarged end part of the outermost bone of pinkie finger","Enlarged end part of the outermost bone of pinky finger"]

name: Green teeth
description: A green staining of teeth.
synonyms: ["Green colored teeth","Green coloured teeth","Green teeth","Green tooth shade"]

name: Elevated leukocyte cystine
description: An increased concentration of cystine within white blood cells.

name: 4-5 finger syndactyly
description: Syndactyly with fusion of fingers four and five.

name: Granular corneal dystrophy
description: The presence of central, fine, whitish granular lesions in the stroma of the cornea. This type of corneal dystrophy is usually asymptomatic and begins in childhood and shows a slow progression. Later in the course, the corneal epithelium and Bowman's layer may be affected. Histologically, the cornea shows a uniform deposition of hyaline material.

name: Abnormal CSF glutamine family amino acid concentration
description: Any deviation from the normal concentration of glutamine-family amino acids in the cerebrospinal fluid.
synonyms: ["Abnormal glutamine family amino acid levels in cerebrospinal fluid"]

name: Patchy sclerosis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb
description: An uneven increase in bone density of the proximal phalanx of the thumb.
synonyms: ["Uneven increase in bone density in the innermost thumb bone"]

name: Signet ring sign
description: This finding is composed of a ring-shaped opacity representing a dilated bronchus in cross section and a smaller adjacent opacity representing its pulmonary artery, with the combination resembling a signet (or pearl) ring. It is the basic sign of bronchiectasis in pulmonary computed tomography imaging.

name: D-2-hydroxyglutaric aciduria
description: An increased concentration of 2-hydroxyglutaric acid in the urine.

name: Cone-shaped epiphysis of the middle phalanx of the 3rd toe
synonyms: ["Cone-shaped end part of the middle bone of the 3rd toe"]

name: Abnormality of the epiphysis of the femoral head
description: Any abnormality of the proximal epiphysis of the femur.
synonyms: ["HP:0010589","Abnormality of the end part of the innermost thighbone","Abnormality of the proximal femoral epiphysis"]

name: Acute constipation
description: Constipation of sudden onset and lasting for less than three months.

name: Focal verbal automatism seizure
description: A type of focal automatism seizure characterized by the production of single or repetitive words, phrases, or brief sentences at onset.

name: Amyelia
description: Congenital absence of the spinal cord.

name: Decreased prealbumin level
description: A reduced concentration of prealbumin in the blood. Prealbumin, also known as transthyretin, has a half-life in plasma of about 2 days, much shorter than that of albumin. Prealbumin is therefore more sensitive to changes in protein-energy status than albumin, and its concentration closely reflects recent dietary intake rather than overall nutritional status.

name: Bilateral triphalangeal thumbs
description: A bilateral form of triphalangeal thumb.

name: Periostitis
description: Inflammation of the periosteum

name: Hyperuricemia
description: An abnormally high level of uric acid in the blood.

name: Morphological abnormality of the pyramidal tract
description: Any structural abnormality of the pyramidal tract, whose chief element, the corticospinal tract, is the only direct connection between the brain and the spinal cord. In addition to the corticospinal tract, the pyramidal system includes the corticobulbar, corticomesencephalic, and corticopontine tracts.

name: Abnormal urinary purine level
description: Any deviation from the normal amount of a purine compound in the urine. Purines are aromatic heterocyclic compounds containing a purine moiety, which is formed a pyrimidine-ring ring fused to an imidazole ring. Two of the four deoxyribonucleotides (deoxyadenosine and deoxyguanosine) and two of the four ribonucleotides (adenosine, or AMP, and guanosine, or GMP) are purines.

name: Abnormality of skin physiology
description: Any abnormality of the physiological function of the skin.

name: Abnormal HDL2b concentration
description: Any deviation from the normal concentration of the HDL2a subfraction in the blood circulation. An HDL2B particle is defined as an HDL particle with a size of 9.7-12 nm.

name: Central Y-shaped metacarpal
description: A central Y-shaped metacarpal is the result of a partial fusion of two central metacarpals (i.e., metacarpals 2-4) of the hand, with the two arms of the Y pointing in the distal direction. Central Y-shaped metacarpals may be seen as a result of a central polydactyly with partial fusion of the duplicated metacarpal.

name: Increased blood folate concentration
description: An elevated circulating concentration of folic acid, which is also known as vitamin B9.

name: Infra-orbital crease
description: Skin crease extending from below the inner canthus laterally along the malar process of the maxilla and zygoma.
synonyms: ["HP:0007796","Crease in skin under the eye","Groove in skin under the eye","Infraorbital crease","Infraorbital creases","Underorbital skin creases"]

name: Small epiphysis of the middle phalanx of the 5th toe
synonyms: ["Small end part of the middle bone of the little toe","Small end part of the middle bone of the pinkie toe","Small end part of the middle bone of the pinky toe"]

name: Abnormality of the nasal alae
description: An abnormality of the Ala of nose.

name: Abnormal upper-limb motor evoked potentials
description: An anomaly identified by motor evoked potentials (MEPs) in the arm.
synonyms: ["Abnormal motor evoked potentials in the upper limb"]

name: Hypomagnesemia
description: An abnormally decreased magnesium concentration in the blood.
synonyms: ["HP:0003284","Low blood magnesium levels","Low blood Mg levels"]

name: Hypoplasia of teeth
description: Developmental hypoplasia of teeth.
synonyms: ["HP:0000688","HP:0006281","HP:0006307","Decreased size of teeth","Hypoplastic teeth","Underdevelopment of teeth"]

name: Hemopericardium
description: Accumulation of blood within the pericardial sac.

name: Insect allergy
description: Hypersensitivity in form of an adverse immune reaction against insects.
synonyms: ["Allergy to insects","IgE-mediated insect allergy","Immunoglobulin E-mediated insect allergy","Insect allergy"]

name: Abnormal circulating IgE level
description: An abnormal deviation from normal levels of IgE immunoglobulin in blood.

name: Decreased adiponectin level
description: A reduced circulating concentration of adiponectin, a 30-kDa complement C1-related protein that is the most abundant secreted protein expressed in adipose tissue.

name: Monomorphic ventricular tachycardia
description: A type of ventricular tachycardia that is characterized by uniform QRS complexes within each lead (i.e., each QRS is identical or nearly so).

name: Duplication of the distal phalanx of hand
description: This term applies if one or more of the distal phalanges of the hand are either partially duplicated, depending on severity leading to a broad or bifid appearance of the phalanges, or completely duplicated.
synonyms: ["HP:0001228","HP:0010007","Bifid terminal phalanges","Duplication of the outermost bone of hand","Notched outermost bone of hand","Partial/complete duplication of the distal phalanges of the hand"]

name: Delirium
description: A state of sudden and severe confusion.

name: Increased level of methylsuccinic acid in urine
description: An increase in the level of methylsuccinic acid in the urine.
synonyms: ["Increased level of pyrotartaric acid in urine"]

name: Multiple long-bone exostoses
description: Multiple exostoses originating in long bones.

name: Partial atrioventricular canal defect
description: A specific combination of heart defects including a primum atrial septal defect and cleft anterior mitral valve leaflet. There is not an inlet ventricular septal defect present. There are two valve annuluses and two valve orifices.

name: Porencephalic cyst
description: A cavity within the cerebral hemisphere, filled with cerebrospinal fluid, that communicates directly with the ventricular system.

name: Ureterocele
description: A ureterocele is a congenital saccular dilatation of the distal segment of the ureter.

name: Reversible airflow obstruction
description: Airflow obstruction with a significant response to a bronchodilator defined as an increase in FEV1 and/or FVC by 12 percent or more and by at least 200 mL.

name: Renal tubular herpes simplex virus inclusions
description: Renal tubular nuclear inclusions that stain positive for herpes simplex virus (HSV). HSV is typically associated with multinucleated giant cells with nuclear inclusions and may cause hemorrhagic interstitial nephritis.

name: Low back pain
description: An unpleasant sensation characterized by physical discomfort (such as pricking, throbbing, or aching) localized to the lower back.

name: Patchy sclerosis of the middle phalanx of the 3rd finger
description: Uneven (irregular) increase in bone density of the middle phalanx of the third finger.
synonyms: ["Uneven increase in bone density in the middle bone of the middle finger"]

name: Fractured rib
description: A partial or complete breakage of the rib.

name: Short humerus
description: Underdevelopment of the humerus.
synonyms: ["HP:0002989","HP:0003014","HP:0003064","HP:0006419","HP:0006464","HP:0006468","Humeral hypoplasia","Humeral shortening","Hypoplastic humerus","Short humeri","Short humerus","Short long bone of upper arm","Short upper arms"]

name: Hypoplastic carotid canal
description: Underdevelopment of the carotid canal, which normally is a circular aperture in the temporal bone of the skull through which the internal carotid artery and the carotid plexus of nerves traverse.

name: Patchy sclerosis of 3rd toe phalanx
description: Patchy (irregular) increase in bone density of one or more of the phalanges of the third toe. This can take on many forms depending on severity and distribution as can be seen on x-rays.
synonyms: ["Patchy sclerosis of the phalanges of the 3rd toe","Uneven increase in bone density in 3rd toe bone"]

name: T-wave inversion in the right precordial leads
Hiatus hernia
description: The presence of a hernia in which the upper part of the stomach, i.e., mainly the gastric cardia protrudes through the diaphragmatic esophageal hiatus.

name: Avascular necrosis
description: A disease where there is cellular death (necrosis) of bone components due to interruption of the blood supply.
synonyms: ["Aseptic bone necrosis","Aseptic necrosis","Bone infarction","Death of bone due to decreased blood supply","Ischaemic bone necrosis","Ischemic bone necrosis","Osteochondronecrosis","Osteonecrosis"]

name: Hypermetric downward saccades
description: Overshoot of downward saccadic eye movements.

name: Unilateral renal hypoplasia
description: One sided hypoplasia of the kidney.
synonyms: ["Small kidney on one side","Underdeveloped kidney on one side"]

name: Focal impaired awareness cognitive seizure with receptive dysphasia/aphasia
description: A focal cognitive seizure with receptive dysphasia / aphasia characterized by impairment of awareness at some point during the seizure.

name: Automatic atrial tachycardia
description: Chronic supraventricular tachycardia predominantly seen in childhood.

name: Generalized hypertrichosis
description: Generalized excessive, abnormal hairiness.

name: Epidural hemorrhage
description: Hemorrhage occurring between the dura mater and the skull.

name: Anterior beaking of lower thoracic vertebrae
description: Anterior tongue-like protrusions of the lower thoracic vertebral bodies.

name: Atretic vas deferens
description: Abnormal closure or blockage of the vas deferens.
synonyms: ["Atresia of the vas deferens","Vas deferens atresia"]

name: Lower limb peromelia
description: Peromelia affecting only the lower limbs. That is, the distal parts of the leg are missing leading to stump formation.

name: Failure of eruption of permanent teeth
description: Lack of tooth eruption of the secondary dentition.
synonyms: ["HP:0006309","Failure of eruption of adult teeth","Unerupted adult dentition","Unerupted adult teeth","Unerupted permanent dentition","Unerupted permanent teeth"]

name: Recurrent viral skin infections
description: Increased susceptibility to viral skin infections, as manifested by recurrent episodes of viral skin infections.

name: Decreased mucosal sucrase-isomaltase activity
description: Reduced activity of the linked disaccharidase, sucrase-isomaltase, which is a glycoprotein localized to the brush border membrane of small intestinal villi.

name: Abnormal cardiac test
description: Abnormal test result of cardiovascular physiology.

name: Gout
description: Recurrent attacks of acute inflammatory arthritis of a joint or set of joints caused by elevated levels of uric acid in the blood which crystallize and are deposited in joints, tendons, and surrounding tissues.

name: Osteolytic defects of the distal phalanges of the toes
Femoral bowing present at birth, straightening with time
description: Congenital onset bending or abnormal curvature of the femur that normalizes with age.
synonyms: ["Bowing of thighbone at birth, straightening with time"]

name: Unusual CNS infection
description: A type of infection of the central nervous system that can be regarded as a sign of a pathological susceptibility to infection.

name: Hypoornithinemia
description: An abnormal decrease in ornithine in the blood.
synonyms: ["Decreased blood ornithine concentrations","Low blood ornithine levels"]

name: Abnormal fundus fluorescein angiography
description: An abnormality observed by retinal fluorescein angiography, which involves the intravenous injection of fluorescein dye followed by fluorescent imaging of the fundus immediately after injection and for up to ten minutes thereafter. It can be used to study various retinal abnormalities including especially anomalies of the choroidal and retinal circulation.

name: Abnormality of the proximal phalanx of the 5th finger
description: Abnormality of the proximal phalanx of the little (5th) finger.
synonyms: ["Abnormality of the innermost bone little finger","Abnormality of the innermost bone pinkie finger","Abnormality of the innermost bone pinky finger"]

name: Atransferrinemia
description: Absence of transferrin, a protein that transports iron, in the blood.

name: Absence of the third cerebral ventricle
description: A developmental defect characterized by the absence of the third ventricle.

name: EEG with generalized slow activity
description: Diffuse slowing of cerebral electrical activity recorded along the scalp by electroencephalography (EEG).
synonyms: ["EEG with generalised slow activity","EEG: generalised slow activity","EEG: generalized slow activity"]

name: Long palpebral fissure
description: Distance between medial and lateral canthi is more than two standard deviations above the mean for age (objective); or, apparently increased length of the palpebral fissures.
synonyms: ["HP:0007904","Broad opening between the eyelids","Broad palpebral fissure","Long opening between the eyelids","Long palpebral fissures","Wide opening between the eyelids","Wide palpebral fissure","Wide palpebral fissures"]

name: Increased CSF arginine concentration
description: Abnormally increased levels of arginine in cerebrospinal fluid.

name: Attenuation of retinal blood vessels
synonyms: ["Narrowing of blood vessels in back of eye"]

name: Abnormal circulating monocarboxylic acid cocentration
description: Any deviation from the normal concentration of a monocarboxylic acid in the blood circulation.

name: Bleeding with minor or no trauma
description: Significant bleeding or hemorrhage without significant precipitating factor.
synonyms: ["Bleeding with minor or no trauma","Easy bleeding"]

name: Bilateral ulnar hypoplasia
description: Underdevelopment of the ulna on both sides.

name: Shoulder dimple
description: A subtype of skin dimples occurring in the shoulder region.

name: Medial calcification of large arteries
description: Calcification, that is, pathological deposition of calcium salts in the tunica media of large (conduit) arteries.

name: Ependymoma
description: The presence of an ependymoma of the central nervous system.

name: Abnormal umbilical artery Doppler pattern in pregnancy
description: Abnormal waveform of the umbilical artery dopplers during pregnancy.

name: Compensatory head tilt to the right shoulder
description: A tendency to tilt the head towards the right shoulder to compensate for a limitation of eye movement.

name: Abnormal myeloid leukocyte morphology
description: An abnormality of myeloid leukocytes.

name: Rubral tremor
description: Rubral tremor is characterized by a slow coarse tremor at rest that is exacerbated by postural adjustments and by guided voluntary movements.

name: Triceps hyporeflexia
description: Reduced intensity of the triceps tendon reflex.

name: Spindle-shaped finger
description: Swelling of the hand at the knuckles, that gives the fingers a spindle shape (i.e., a round stick with tapered end and a broader base).

name: Low self esteem
description: Negative opinion about oneself characterized by low self-confidence and exaggeratedly critical feelings about oneself.

name: Bracket epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 3rd finger
description: An abnormality of the distal phalanx of the third finger in which the epiphysis surrounds a phalangeal bone, having a bracket-like form and reaching from the proximal side of a phalanx to the distal side.
synonyms: ["Bracket shaped end part of the outermost bone of the middle finger"]

name: Elevated circulating luteinizing hormone level
description: An elevated concentration of luteinizing hormone in the blood.
synonyms: ["HP:0030343","Elevated LH level","Elevated luteinizing hormone","Increased circulating luteinizing hormone level"]

name: Unilateral wrist flexion contracture
description: A chronic loss of wrist joint motion on one side only.

name: Renal juxtaglomerular cell hypertrophy/hyperplasia
description: Increased number and size of the juxtaglomerular cells.

name: Midline brainstem cleft
description: A developmental defect characterized by an abnormal cleft (V-shaped indentation of the stalklike part of the brain consisting of the medulla oblongata, the midbrain, and the pons.

name: Macrodontia
description: Increased size of the teeth, which can be defined as a mesiodistal tooth diameter (width) more than 2 SD above mean for age. Alternatively, an apparently increased maximum width of the tooth.
synonyms: ["Hyperplasia of tooth","Hypertrophy of tooth","Increased size of tooth","Increased width of tooth","Large tooth","Megalodontia"]

name: Severity
description: The intensity or degree of a manifestation.

name: Long hallux
description: Increased length of the big toe.
synonyms: ["HP:0001867","Increased length of the hallux","Large halluces","Long big toe","Long halluces"]

name: Bilateral breast hypoplasia
description: Underdevelopment of the breast on both sides.

name: Increased blood urea nitrogen
description: An increased amount of nitrogen in the form of urea in the blood.

name: Panhypogammaglobulinemia
description: A reduction in the circulating levels of all the major classes of immunoglobulin. is characterized by profound decreases in all classes of immunoglobulin with an absence of circulating B lymphocytes.

name: Anti-neutrophil elastase antibody positivity
description: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against neutrophil elastase.

name: Disseminated cryptosporidium infection
description: Failure to contain infection by a protozoan of the genus Cryptosporidium, leading to spread to many parts of the body.

name: Abnormal cerebral artery morphology
description: Any structural anomaly of a cerebral artery. The cerebral arteries comprise three main pairs of arteries and their branches, which supply the cerebrum of the brain. These are the anterior cerebral artery, the middle cerebral artery, and the posterior cerebral artery.
synonyms: ["Abnormality of cerebral artery","Abnormality of the cerebral arteries"]

name: Impaired use of nonverbal behaviors
description: Reduced ability to use nonverbal behavior for communication, such as eye-to-eye gaze, facial expression, body posture, and gestures.
synonyms: ["Impaired use of nonverbal behaviors","Impaired use of nonverbal behaviours"]

name: Paraplegia/paraparesis
description: Weakness of both lower extremities with sparing of the upper extremities. Paraplegia refers to a severe or complete loss of strength, whereas paraparesis refers to a relatively mild loss of strength.

name: Reduced kininogen activity
description: Reduction in the amount of kininogen, which functions as a cofactor in the contact phase of the intrinsic blood coagulation cascade.
synonyms: ["HP:0004867","HP:0005500","HP:0005530","HP:0005538","Fitzgerald factor deficiency","Kininogen deficiency","Williams factor deficiency","Williams-Fitzgerald-Flaujeac factor deficiency"]

name: Cerebral visual impairment
description: A form of loss of vision caused by damage to the visual cortex rather than a defect in the eye.

name: Abnormal circulating beta-C-terminal telopeptide level
description: A deviation from the normal concentration of beta-C-terminal telopeptide of type I collagen in the blood circulation, a marker of the rate of bone turnover.
synonyms: ["Abnormal circulating beta-CrossLaps level","Abnormal circulating beta-CTx level"]

name: Poor appetite
description: A reduced desire to eat.

name: Neoplasm of the ceruminal gland
description: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the ceruminal gland.

name: Tetralogy of Fallot with atrioventricular canal defect
Tetany
description: A condition characterized by intermittent involuntary contraction of muscles (spasms) related to hypocalcemia or occasionally magnesium deficiency.

name: Disturbance of facial expression
description: An abnormality of the gestures or movements executed with the facial muscles with which emotions such as fear, joy, sadness, surprise, and disgust can be expressed.

name: Cerumen abnormality
description: Any anomaly of the cerumen (ear wax), the yellowish waxy substance secreted in the ear canal.

name: Impaired vibratory sensation
description: A decrease in the ability to perceive vibration. Clinically, this is usually tested with a tuning fork which vibrates at 128 Hz and is applied to bony prominences such as the malleoli at the ankles or the metacarpal-phalangeal joints. There is a slow decay of vibration from the tuning fork. The degree of vibratory sense loss can be crudely estimated by counting the number of seconds that the examiner can perceive the vibration longer than the patient.
synonyms: ["HP:0006836","HP:0007116","Decreased vibration sense","Decreased vibratory sense","Diminished vibratory sense","Hypopallesthesia","Impaired vibratory sensation","Impaired vibratory sense"]

name: Asterixis
description: A clinical sign indicating a lapse of posture and is usually manifest by a bilateral flapping tremor at the wrist, metacarpophalangeal, and hip joints.

name: Architectural distortion of the lung
description: Architectural distortion is characterized by abnormal displacement of bronchi, vessels, fissures, or septa caused by diffuse or localized lung disease, particularly interstitial fibrosis. This is visible in lung biopsy and CT scans in a distorted appearance and is usually associated with pulmonary fibrosis and accompanied by volume loss.

name: Advanced ossification of carpal bones
description: Ossification of carpal bones at an abnormally early age.
synonyms: ["HP:0006104","Accelerated carpal bone maturation","Accelerated wrist bone maturation","Advanced carpal bone age","Advanced carpal ossification","Precociously ossified carpal bones"]

name: Achilles tendon contracture
description: A contracture of the Achilles tendon.
synonyms: ["HP:0004711","HP:0005031","HP:0006430","Achilles tendon contractures","Contractures of the Achilles tendon","Shortening of the achilles tendon","Tight achilles tendon"]

name: Absent upper eyelashes
synonyms: ["Absent upper eyelashes","Atrichia of upper eyelashes","Failure of development of upper eyelashes"]

name: Abnormal CSF serine concentration
description: Any deviation from the normal concentration of serine in the cerebrospinal fluid.

name: Symmetric lesions of the basal ganglia
Abnormality of pulmonary circulation
description: A functional anomaly of that portion of the cardiosvascular system that carries deoxygenated blood from the heart to the lungs and returns oxygenated blood back to the heart.

name: Abnormality of the gastrointestinal tract
description: An abnormality of the gastrointestinal tract.
synonyms: ["Abnormality of the gastrointestinal tract","Abnormality of the GI tract"]

name: Abnormal circulating leucine concentration
description: Any deviation from the normal circulation of leucine in the blood circulation.

name: Arterial intimal fibrosis
description: Formation of excess fibrous connective tissue in the tunica intima (innermost layer) of arteries.

name: Retinal flecks
description: Presence of multiple yellowish-white lesions of various size and configuration on the retina not related to vascular lesions.

name: Hepatic necrosis
description: The presence of cell death (necrosis) affecting the liver.

name: Steep acetabular roof
description: An exaggeration of the normal arched form of the acetabular roof such that it takes on a steep appearance.

name: Left superior vena cava draining directly to the left atrium
description: A persistent left superior vena cava (PLSVC) that drains into the left atrium instead of the right atrium via the coronary sinus, resulting in a right to left sided shunt.

name: Renal arteriole intima/media necrosis
description: Cell death (necrosis) in the inner or middle layer of the arterioles of the kidney.

name: Cyclophoria
description: A form of latent strabismus (heterophoria) in which the occluded eye wheel-rotates on dissociation.

name: Retinal perforation
description: A small hole through the whole thickness of the retina.

name: Aplasia of the proximal phalanges of the toes
Vertical clivus
description: An abnormal vertical orientation of the clivus (which normally forms a kind of slope from the sella turcica down to the region of the foramen magnum).

name: Anti-CV2/CRMP5 antibody
description: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against CV2/CRMP5. Anti-CV2/CRMP5 autoantibody is the most commonly detected anti-neuronal autoantibody. Patients with typical paraneoplastic chorea show fully developed chorea in the course of weeks to months with acute inflammation in the striatum.

name: Cortical thickening of long bone diaphyses
description: Abnormal thickening of the cortex of the diaphyseal region of long bones.

name: Body odor
description: A perceived unpleasant smell given off by the body.

name: Impairment of activities of daily living
description: Difficulty in performing one or more activities normally performed every day, such as eating, bathing, dressing, grooming, work, homemaking, and leisure.

name: Pulmonary artery stenosis
description: An abnormal narrowing or constriction of the pulmonary artery, in the main pulmonary artery and/or in the left or right pulmonary artery branches.

name: Ridged nail
description: Longitudinal, linear prominences in the nail plate.

name: Oligoarthritis
description: A type of arthritis that affects up to four joints in the first six months of disease.

name: Perianal abscess
description: The presence of an abscess located around the anus.

name: Urinary glycosaminoglycan excretion
description: Excretion of glycosaminoglycan in the urine. Glycosaminoglycans are long unbranched polysaccharides consisting of a repeating disaccharide unit.

name: Beta 2-microglobulinuria
description: Increased level of beta 2-microglobulins in the urine.

name: Juvenile onset
description: Onset of signs or symptoms of disease between the age of 5 and 15 years.

name: Joint contracture of the 5th finger
description: Chronic loss of joint motion in the 5th finger due to structural changes in non-bony tissue. The term camptodactyly of the 5th finger is used if the distal and/or proximal interphalangeal joints are affected.

name: Stippling of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 5th finger
description: The presence of abnormal punctate (speckled, dot-like) calcifications in the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 5th finger.
synonyms: ["Speckled calcifications in end part of the innnermost bone of the little finger","Speckled calcifications in end part of the innnermost bone of the pinkie finger","Speckled calcifications in end part of the innnermost bone of the pinky finger"]

name: Trichorrhexis nodosa
description: Trichorrhexis nodosa is the formation of nodes along the hair shaft through which breakage readily occurs. It is thus a focal defect in the hair fiber that is characterized by thickening or weak points (nodes) that cause the hair to break off easily. The result is defective, abnormally fragile hair.

name: Abnormal pupil shape
description: A deviation from the normal circular shape of the pupil

name: Bifid sternum
description: The sternal cleft is a rare congenital anomaly resulting from a fusion failure of the sternum.

name: Decreased circulating ceruloplasmin concentration
description: Decreased concentration of ceruloplasmin in the blood.

name: Abnormal natural killer cell morphology
description: An anomaly of the natural killer cell, which is a lymphocyte that can spontaneously kill a variety of target cells without prior antigenic activation via germline encoded activation receptors. It also regulates immune responses via cytokine release and direct contact with other cells.
synonyms: ["Abnormal NK cells","Abnormality of natural killer cells"]

name: Focal cognitive seizure with anomia
description: A focal cognitive seizure characterized by anomia as the initial semiological manifestation.

name: Increased circulating IgG2 level
description: An abnormally increased concentration of the IgG2 subtype in the blood circulation.

name: Stippling of the epiphyses of the middle phalanges of the hand
synonyms: ["Speckled calcifications in the end part of the middle hand bones"]

name: Reduced fetal femur/foot length ratio
description: This ratio relates the length of the fetal femur to that of the fetal foot. The ratio is approximately 1 throughout the age range of 14 to 40 weeks of gestation. A substantial reduction in the raio can help differentiate fetuses that have dysplastic limb reduction from those whose limbs are short because of constitutional factors or IUGR. It can reduce the problem of an unknown gestational age and help to distinguish between fetal skeletal dysplasia and intrauterine growth retardation caused by other factors.

name: Enlarged sylvian cistern
description: An increase in size of the subarachnoid space associated with the lateral cerebral sulcus (Sylvian fissure).
synonyms: ["Enlarged lateral fissure","Enlarged lateral sulcus","Enlarged sylvian fissure"]

name: Abnormal superficial reflex
description: An anomaly of a reflex that is elicited as a motor response to scraping of the skin. They are generally graded as present or absent. They differ from tendon reflexes in that the sensory signal must ascend the spinal cord to reach the brain and then descend the spinal cord to reach the motor neurons.

name: Congenital malformation of the great arteries
description: Defect or defects of the morphogenesis of the aorta and pulmonary arteries.

name: Abnormality of the tibial metaphysis
synonyms: ["Abnormality of the wide portion of shankbone","Abnormality of the wide portion of shinbone"]

name: Decreased proportion of transitional B cells
description: A reduction in the normal proportion of transitional B cells (CD19+/CD38high/IgMhigh) in circulation relative to the total number of B cells. B cells originate from precursors in the bone marrow, and the first cells which migrate to the peripheral blood have been classified as transitional B cells.

name: Asymmetry of the position of the ears
Aplasia of the 4th finger
description: Absent 4th finger.

name: Elevated circulating pyridinoline concentration
description: An increased concentration of hydroxylysyl-pyridinoline (pyridinoline) in the blood circulation.

name: Bowel diverticulosis
description: The presence of multiple diverticula of the intestine.

name: Patchy sclerosis of proximal phalanx of finger
description: Uneven increase in bone density of the proximal phalanges of the hand.
synonyms: ["HP:0009869","Patchy sclerosis of the proximal phalanges of the hand","Uneven increase in bone density in innermost finger bone"]

name: Poor wound healing
description: A reduced ability to heal cutaneous wounds.

name: Small epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 3rd finger
description: Abnormally small size of the epiphysis located at the proximal end of the proximal phalanx of the 3rd finger with respect to age-dependent norms.
synonyms: ["Small end part of innermost long bone of the middle finger"]

name: Compound motor action potential abnormality
description: An abnormal finding in a compound motor action potential measurement in EMG. Nerve conduction studies involve the application of a depolarising square wave electrical pulses to the skin over a peripheral nerve producing: (1) a propagated nerve action potential (NAP) recorded at a distant point over the same nerve: and (2) a compound muscle action potential (CMAP) arising from the activation of muscle fibres in a target muscle supplied by the nerve. In both cases these may be recorded with surface or needle electrodes. The CMAP is a summated voltage response from the individual muscle fibre action potentials. The shortest latency of the CMAP is the time from stimulus artefact to onset of the response and is a biphasic response with an initial upward deflection followed by a smaller downward deflection. The CMAP amplitude is measured from baseline to negative peak (the neurophysiological convention is that negative voltage is demonstrated by an upward deflection) and measured in millivolts (mV).

name: Recurrent cystitis
description: Repeated infections of the urinary bladder.

name: EEG with generalized polyspikes
description: EEG with repetitive generalized sharp transient waves of a duration less than 80 msec.

name: Shortening of all phalanges of the toes
description: Developmental hypoplasia (shortening) of all phalanges of the foot.

name: Thalamic hypometabolism in FDG PET
description: Reduced uptake of-fluorodeoxyglucose (FDG) in the thalamus as measured by positron emission tomography (PET) brain scan.

name: Nail dysplasia
description: The presence of developmental dysplasia of the nail.

name: Elevated functional residual capacity
description: An abnormal increase in the volume remaining in the lungs after a normal, passive exhalation.

name: Renal oncocytoma
description: A renal tumor originating from an oncocyte, which is an epithelial cell characterized by an excessive amount of mitochondria, resulting in an abundant acidophilic, granular cytoplasm.

name: Neonatal onset
description: Onset of signs or symptoms of disease within the first 28 days of life.
synonyms: ["HP:0003622","Neonatal onset","Onset in first weeks of life","Onset in neonatal period"]

name: Decreased circulating antibody level
description: An abnormally decreased level of immunoglobulin in blood.
synonyms: ["HP:0010703","Decreased antibody level in blood","Decreased immunoglobulin level","Decreased serum immunoglobulin","Hypogammaglobulinemia","Immunoglobulin deficiency","Reduced immunoglobulin levels"]

name: Invasive pulmonary aspergillosis
description: Infection of the lungs with aspergillus. In the respiratory mucosa, the spores may germinate into hyphae, which in turn can invade the mucosa leading to invasive pulmonary aspergillosis.

name: Reduced vital capacity
description: An abnormal reduction on the vital capacity, which is defined as the total lung capacity (volume of air in the lungs at maximal inflation) less the residual volume (i.e., volume of air in the lungs following maximal exhalation) of the lung.

name: Abnormality of the upper limb
description: An abnormality of the arm.
synonyms: ["HP:0003838","Abnormality of the arm","Abnormality of the upper limb"]

name: Vertical incomitant strabismus
description: A type of incomitant strabismus in which the angle of deviation varies as the patient's gaze shifts upwards and/or downwards.

name: Abnormality of orbicularis oris muscle
description: An abnormality of an orbicularis oris muscle.

name: Abnormal branching pattern of left aortic arch
description: A deviance from the norm of the origin or course of the right brachiocephalic artery, the left common carotid artery, the left subclavian artery or the proximal vertebral arteries, whereby the aortic arch descends on the left as normal (as opposed to right aortic arch).

name: Easy fatigability
description: Increased susceptibility to fatigue.

name: Renal arteriole intima/media crystal accumulation
description: Deposition of crystals such as uric acid, oxalate, or cystine in the inner or middle layer of the arterioles of the kidney.

name: Agenesis of the anterior commissure
description: Absence of the anterior commissure.

name: Y-shaped metatarsals
description: Y-shaped metatarsals are the result of a partial fusion of two metatarsal bones, with the two arms of the Y pointing in the distal direction. Y-shaped metatarsals may be seen in combination with polydactyly.

name: Polyclonal elevation of circulating IgG
description: An increase in polyclonal immunoglobulins resulting from many different plasma cells. On serum electrophoresis, a polyclonal gammopathy is characterized by a broad diffuse band with one or more heavy chains and kappa and lambda light chains.

name: Setting-sun eye phenomenon
description: An ophthalmologic sign in young children resulting from upward-gaze paresis. In this condition, the eyes appear driven downward, the sclera may be seen between the upper eyelid and the iris, and part of the lower pupil may be covered by the lower eyelid.

name: Elevated circulating homovanillic acid concentration
description: Increased concentration of homovanillic acid in the blood circulation.

name: Bicuspid pulmonary valve
description: The presence of a bicuspid pulmonary valve.

name: Tegumentary leishmaniasis susceptibility
description: Increased susceptibility to infection by the protozan parasite of the genus Leishmania.

name: Physiological reactivity to cues
description: Marked physiological reactions to internal or external cues that symbolize or resemble an aspect of the traumatic event(s).

name: Pleural plaque
description: Deposits of hyalinized collagen fibres in the parietal pleura (preferentially pleura adjacent to ribs, particularly the sixth through ninth ribs).

name: Abnormal renal medulla morphology
description: Any structural abnormality of the medulla of the kidney.

name: Bone marrow maturation arrest
description: Interruption of the procecss of diffferentiation of hematopoietic cells in the bone marrow, manifested by an increased proportion of immature cells in the bone marrow.

name: Renal artery atherosclerosis
description: An atherosclerotic lesion located in the renal artery.

name: Increased variability in muscle fiber diameter
description: An abnormally high degree of muscle fiber size variation. This phenotypic feature can be observed upon muscle biopsy.
synonyms: ["HP:0003556","Increased fiber size variation","Increased fibre size variation","Increased variability in muscle fiber size","Increased variability in muscle fibre diameter","Increased variability in muscle fibre size","Increased variation in fiber size","Increased variation in fibre size","Increased variation in muscle fiber size","Increased variation in muscle fibre size","Variation in muscle fiber size","Variation in muscle fibre size"]

name: Short ribs
description: Reduced rib length.

name: Fixed splitting of the second heart sound
description: Lack of variation in the splitting between the two components of the second heart sound with respiration. Normally, the aortic valve closure (A2) is followed by the pulmonic valve closure (P2) but the A2-P2 interval increases with inspiration and decreases with expiration.

name: Decreased scrotal rugation
description: Decreased number or density of the folded ridges (wrinkles) of skin of the scrotum.

name: Short proximal phalanx of the 3rd finger
description: Hypoplasia (congenital reduction in size) of the proximal phalanx of the third finger.
synonyms: ["HP:0004169","HP:0004170","Hypoplastic/small proximal phalanx of the 3rd finger","Short innermost bone of middle finger","Short proximal middle-finger phalanx","Short proximal phalanx of the third finger","Small proximal middle-finger phalanx"]

name: Axillary freckling
