description: The presence in the axillary region (armpit) of an increased number of freckles, small circular spots on the skin that are darker than the surrounding skin because of deposits of melanin.

name: Advanced pneumatization of cranial sinuses
description: A degree of pneumatization that is increased compared to age-related norms.

name: Decreased nasal nitric oxide
description: Reduced level of nasal nitric oxide (nNO). Current American Thoracic Society/European Respiratory Society (ATS/ERS) guidelines for nNO measurements recommend air aspiration via a nasal probe while the subject exhales through the mouth against resistance in order to maintain velum closure.

name: Eosinophilic liver infiltration
description: Cellular infiltration of the liver parenchyma with a preponderance of eosinophils.

name: Increased intestinal transit time
description: An increase in the length of time required for food to pass through the intestines.

name: Abnormality of blood and blood-forming tissues
description: An abnormality of the hematopoietic system.
synonyms: ["HP:0003135","Abnormality of blood and blood-forming tissues","Abnormality of the haematopoietic system","Abnormality of the hematopoietic system","Haematological abnormality","Hematological abnormality"]

name: Abnormal muscle fiber morphology
description: Any abnormality of the skeletal muscle cell. Muscle fibers are subdivided into two types. Type I fibers are fatigue-resistant and rich in oxidative enzymes (they stain light with the myosin ATPase reaction), and type II fibers are fast-contracting, fatigue-prone, and rich in glycolytic enzymes (these fibers stain darkly). Normal muscle tissue has a random distribution of type I and type II fibers.
synonyms: ["HP:0003706","HP:0011806","Abnormal muscle fibre morphology","Abnormal skeletal muscle fiber morphology","Abnormal skeletal muscle fibre morphology","Abnormality of muscle fibers","Abnormality of muscle fibres"]

name: Elevated cholesterol ester level
description: An elevated concentration of circulating cholesterol esters, which are fatty acid esters of cholesterol and make up about two-thirds of total plasma cholesterol.
synonyms: ["HP:0500010","Elevated cholesteryl ester level","Increased cholesterol esters","Increased cholesteryl esters"]

name: Megaloblastic bone marrow
description: Abnormal increased number of megaloblasts in the bone marrow.

name: Chronic villitis
description: Villitis of unknown etiology (synonymous with villitis of unknown aetiology) is a histologic diagnosis and, although it may have a variable distribution, evidence indicates that 3 parenchymal blocks will identify 62% of villitis, reaching an asymptote of 6 and 7 blocks identifying 85% of villitis. Villitis of unknown etiology by definition excludes those cases where an etiology is identified, such as viral or acute infections, and thus is preferred to the term nonspecific chronic villitis. It is usually lymphohistiocytic: although the presence of rare plasma cells does not exclude the diagnosis, thorough evaluation for an infectious etiology, such as cytomegalovirus, is required in a predominantly plasma cell villitis.
synonyms: ["Chronic villitis (non-infectious)","Nonspecific chronic villitis","Villitis of unknown aetiology","Villitis of unknown etiology"]

name: Reduced maximal expiratory pressure
description: A decrease in the maximum amount of pressure of expired air achieved by a person after a full inspiration.

name: Uniparental heterodisomy
description: A type of uniparental disomy in which the two different chromosomes (or chromosome segments) of the same parent are transmitted.

name: Cardiac total anomalous pulmonary venous connection
description: Type 2 total anomalous pulmonary venous connection.
synonyms: ["Cardiac total anomalous pulmonary venous connexion","Total anomalous pulmonary venous connection, intracardiac","Type 2 total anomalous pulmonary venous connection"]

name: Fine hair
description: Hair that is fine or thin to the touch.
synonyms: ["HP:0200132","Fine hair","Fine hair shaft","Fine hair texture","Thin hair","Thin hair shaft","Thin hair texture","Thinned hair"]

name: Short finger
description: Abnormally short finger associated with developmental hypoplasia.
synonyms: ["HP:0004098","HP:0006015","Hypoplastic digits","Hypoplastic fingers","Hypoplastic/small fingers","Short finger","Stubby finger","Stubby fingers"]

name: Aplasia/hypoplasia of the 1st metatarsal
description: Absence or underdevelopment of the first metatarsal bone.
synonyms: ["Absent/small 1st long bone of foot","Absent/underdeveloped 1st long bone of foot"]

name: Perivascular pre-capillary pulmonary artery inflammation
description: Inflammatory cell infiltration surrounding precapillary pulmonary arteries (arterioles; 20-70 micrometer).
synonyms: ["Perivascular inflammation of arterioles in the pulmonary circulation","Perivascular inflammation of pre-capillary pulmonary arteries"]

name: Decreased circulating parathyroid hormone level
description: An abnormally decreased concentration of parathyroid hormone.
synonyms: ["Decreased circulating PTH level","Decreased serum parathyroid hormone","Decreased serum parathyroid hormone level","Decreased serum PTH"]

name: Neoplasm of the large intestine
description: The presence of a neoplasm of the large intestine.

name: Increased circulating chylomicron concentration
description: Increased plasma concentrations of chylomicrons, the large lipid droplet (up to 100 mm in diameter) of reprocessed lipid synthesized in epithelial cells of the small intestine and containing triacylglycerols, cholesterol esters, and several apolipoproteins.

name: Type 2 schizencephaly
description: A type of Schizencephaly in which CSF-containing cleft is present with abutting lining lips of abnormal grey matter that are opposed to each other.

name: Calvarial skull defect
description: A localized defect in the bone of the skull resulting from abnormal embryological development. The defect is covered by normal skin. In some cases, skull x-rays have shown underlying lytic bone lesions which have closed before the age of one year.

name: Triangular shaped distal phalanges of the hand
synonyms: ["HP:0006061","HP:0009842","Triangular shaped outermost bone of the hand"]

name: Wrist ganglion
description: A benign soft tissue tumor of the wrist usually found in the dorsal aspect of the wrist and communicate with the joint via a pedicle. This pedicle usually originates not only at the scapholunate ligament, but also may arise from a number of other sites over the dorsal aspect of the wrist capsule.

name: Recurrent hypoglycemia
description: Recurrent episodes of decreased concentration of glucose in the blood.
synonyms: ["hypoglycaemia, recurrent","hypoglycemia, recurrent","Hypoglycemic episodes","Recurrent hypoglycaemia","Recurrent hypoglycemic episodes","Recurrent low blood sugar levels"]

name: Complete or near-complete absence of specific antibody response to Haemophilus influenzae type b (Hib) vaccine
description: The inability to synthesize postvaccination antibodies against a Haemophilus influenzae type b (Hib) antigen, as measured by antibody titer determination following vaccination.

name: Diaminoaciduria
description: An increased urine level of any amino acid carrying two amino groups (Asparagine, glutamine and lysine, cystine, ornithine).

name: Hyperpituitarism
description: Hypersecretion of one or more pituitary hormones. This can occur in conditions in which deficiency in the target organ leads to decreased hormonal feedback, or as a primary condition most usually in connection with a pituitary adenoma.

name: Lacrimal gland hypoplasia
description: Underdevelopment of the lacrimal gland.

name: Reduced von Willebrand factor activity
description: Decreased activity of von Willebrand factor. Von Willebrand factor mediates the adhesion of platelets to the collagen exposed on endothelial cell surfaces.

name: Low maternal serum alpha-fetoprotein
description: An abnormally low concentration of serum alpha-fetoprotein as compared to normal values for gestational-age.

name: Increased uridine diphosphate glucose-4-epimerase level in red blood cells
description: An increase in uridine diphosphate glucose-4-epimerase level in red blood cells. Uridine diphosphate glucose-4-epimerase catalyzes the reaction: UDP-glucose = UDP-galactose.
synonyms: ["Increased UDP-glucose 4-epimerase level in RBCs","Increased UDP-glucose 4-epimerase level in red blood cells"]

name: Abnormality of the alternative complement pathway
description: A deviation in any aspect of the alternative complement pathway.

name: Pelvic kidney
description: A developmental defect in which a kidney is located in an abnormal anatomic position within the pelvis.

name: Triangular shaped distal phalanx of the 2nd toe
Absence of large von Willibrand factor multimers
description: Absence of large von Willebrand Factor multimers on gel electrophoresis.

name: Lichenification
description: Thickening and hardening of the epidermis seen with exaggeration of normal skin lines.

name: Agenesis of permanent mandibular lateral incisor
synonyms: ["Failure of development of permanent mandibular lateral incisor"]

name: Subcutaneous calcification
description: Deposition of calcium salts in subcutaneous tissue (i.e., the the lowermost layer of the integument).

name: Decreased CSF histidine concentration
description: Abnormally decreased levels of histidine in cerebrospinal fluid.

name: Hyperorality
description: A tendency or compulsion to examine objects by mouth.

name: Diminished motivation
description: A reduction in goal-directed behavior, that is, motivation, the determinant of behavior and adaptation that allows individuals to get started, be energized to perform a sustained and directed action.
synonyms: ["Diminished motivation","Lack of initiative","Lack of motivation","Lacking in initiative","Lacks initiative"]

name: Fusiform cerebral aneurysm
description: A localized circumferential (i.e., bulges on all sides) dilatation or ballooning of a cerebral artery.

name: Abnormal mitral valve physiology
description: Any functional anomaly of the mitral valve.

name: Decreased serum bile acid concentration
description: A reduction in the concentration of bile acid in the blood.

name: Rickets
description: Rickets is divided into two major categories including calcipenic and phosphopenic. Hypophosphatemia is described as a common manifestation of both categories. Hypophosphatemic rickets is the most common type of rickets that is characterized by low levels of serum phosphate, resistance to ultraviolet radiation or vitamin D intake. There are several issues involved in hypophosphatemic rickets such as calcium, vitamin D, phosphorus deficiencies. Moreover, other disorder can be associated with its occurrence such as absorption defects due to pancreatic, intestinal, gastric, and renal disorders and hepatobiliary disease. Symptoms are usually seen in childhood and can be varied in severity. Severe forms may be linked to bowing of the legs, poor bone growth, and short stature as well as joint and bone pain. Hypophosphatemic rickets are associated with renal excretion of phosphate, hypophosphatemia, and mineral defects in bones. The familial type of the disease is the most common type of rickets.

name: Nasal ulcer
description: An open sore of the nasal mucosa.

name: Abnormality of the 5th metacarpal
description: Any abnormality of the fifth metacarpal bone.
synonyms: ["Abnormality of the 5th long bone of hand"]

name: Subchorionic thrombohematoma
description: A large maternal clot that separates the chorionic plate from the villous chorion.

name: Abnormal iris pigmentation
description: Abnormal pigmentation of the iris.

name: Abnormal speech prosody
description: An anomaly of the expressive patterns of speech that involve intonation, stress pattern, loudness variations, pausing, articulatory force, and rhythm.

name: Prolonged QRS complex
description: Increased time for the complex comprised of the Q wave, R wave, and S wave as measured by the electrocardiogram (EKG).. In adults, normal values are 0.06 - 0.10 sec.

name: Bullet-shaped proximal phalanx of the hallux
description: An abnormal morphology of the proximal phalanx of the big toe, with a short and wide phalanx that tapers distally. Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction.
synonyms: ["Bullet-shaped innermost bone of the big toe"]

name: Symmetric peripheral demyelination
description: A symmetric loss of myelin from the internode regions along myelinated nerve fibers of the peripheral nervous system.

name: Prolonged QTc interval
description: A longer than normal interval (corrected for heart rate) between the Q and T waves in the heart's cycle. Prolonged QTc can cause premature action potentials during late phase depolarizations thereby leading to ventricular arrhythmias and ventricular fibrillations.

name: Unilateral absence of pectoralis major muscle
description: Aplasia (congenital absence) of the pectoralis minor on only one side of the chest.

name: Progressive massive fibrosis
description: This condition is caused by slow-growing conglomeration of dust particles and collagen deposition in individuals (mostly coal workers) heavily exposed to inorganic dust. Progressive massive fibrosis manifests as masslike lesions, usually bilateral and in the upper lobes. Background nodular opacities reflect accompanying pneumoconiosis, with or without emphysematous destruction adjacent to the massive fibrosis. Lesions similar to progressive massive fibrosis sometimes occur in other conditions, such as sarcoidosis and talcosis.

name: Focal lissencephaly
description: A congenital absence of the convolutions of the cerebral cortex and a poorly formed sylvian fissure that affects a particular part of the cortex.

name: Broad phalanges of the 2nd finger
synonyms: ["HP:0004118","Wide index finger bones","Wide/broad index finger phalanges"]

name: Bloody mucoid diarrhea
description: Passage of many stools containing blood and mucus.

name: EEG with generalized spikes
description: EEG with generalized sharp transient waves of a duration less than 80 msec.

name: Dry hair
description: Hair that lacks the lustre (shine or gleam) of normal hair.

name: Abnormal cord blood measurement
description: An abnormality in any umbilical cord measurement performed after birth, such as the blood gas level.

name: Fulminant hepatic failure
description: Hepatic failure refers to the inability of the liver to perform its normal synthetic and metabolic functions, which can result in coagulopathy and alteration in the mental status of a previously healthy individual. Hepatic failure is defined as fulminant if there is onset of encephalopathy within 4 weeks of the onset of symptoms in a patient with a previously healthy liver.

name: Small epiphysis of the middle phalanx of the 5th finger
description: Abnormally small size of the epiphysis located at the proximal end of the middle phalanx of the 5th finger with respect to age-dependent norms.
synonyms: ["Small end part of the middle bone of the little finger","Small end part of the middle bone of the pinkie finger","Small end part of the middle bone of the pinky finger"]

name: Biceps hyporeflexia
description: Reduced intensity of the biceps tendon reflex.

name: Complete duplication of the phalanges of the 2nd toe
description: Complete duplication of a phalanx of second toe.

name: Decreased platelet glycoprotein Ib-IX-V
description: Decreased cell membrane concentration of the glycoprotein complex Ib-IX-V.

name: Peripheral hypermyelination
description: Increased amount of peripheral myelination.

name: Short chordae tendineae of the mitral valve
description: Abnormally short chordae tendineae of the mitral valve.

name: Otitis media with effusion
description: Otitis media characterized by thick or sticky fluid behind the tympanic membrane.

name: Anasarca
description: An extreme form of generalized edema with widespread and massive edema due to effusion of fluid into the extracellular space.

name: Hyaline casts
description: A type of acellular urinary cast that are composed only of Tamm-Horsfall glycoprotein, a fact which explains their low refractive index. Hyaline casts may display a spectrum of morphologies, which includes fluffy, compact, convoluted or wrinkled casts. Hyaline casts have a smooth texture and usually have parallel sides with clear margins and blunted ends.

name: Cor triatriatum dexter
description: A congenital anomaly with partitioning of the right atrium to form a triatrial heart caused by persistence of the right valve of the sinus venosus. Typically, the right atrial partition is due to exaggerated fetal eustachian and thebesian valves, which together form an incomplete septum across the lower part of the atrium. This septum may range from a reticulum to a substantial sheet of tissue.

name: Anti-AK5 antibody positivity
description: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against anti-adenylate kinase 5 (AK5).

name: Gingival fibromatosis
description: The presence of fibrosis of the gingiva.

name: Bowed humerus
description: A bending or abnormal curvature of the humerus.
synonyms: ["Bowed long bone in upper arm","Bowing of the humerus","Humeral bowing"]

name: Photopsia
description: Perceived flashes of light.

name: Congenital adrenal hyperplasia
description: A type of adrenal hyperplasia with congenital onset.

name: Moderately short stature
description: A moderate degree of short stature, more than -3 SD but not more than -4 SD from mean corrected for age and sex.

name: Premature epimetaphyseal fusion in foot
description: Stop of growth at the epiphyseal plate the hyaline cartilage plate in the metaphysis at one or more long bones in the foot, at an earlier than normal age, resulting in growth arrest and shortening of the involved bone.

name: Very severe constriction of peripheral visual field
description: Peripheral visual field constriction with <10 degrees central field preserved.

name: Delayed onset bleeding
description: Abnormal bleeding related to a procedure or trauma which does not start at the time of the initial insult, but after delay by at least 24 hours.

name: Increased triceps skinfold thickness
description: Increased thickness of the triceps skinfold, which is measured halfway down the back of the upper arm is increased.

name: Neonatal seizure with bilateral asymmetric automatism
description: Neonatal seizure with bilateral asymmetric automatism is a type of neonatal electro-clinical seizure where the electrographic event is correlated with coordinated motor activity, typically oral, usually with impaired awareness, occurring at both sides of the body asymmetrically.

name: Cutaneous hamartoma
description: A hamartoma (tissue malformation consisting of an abnormal mixture of constitutive components) originating in the skin.

name: Cortical radial artery medial atrophy
description: Atrophy (wasting, decreased thickness) of the middle layer of the cortical radial arteries (also known as the interlobular arteries) of the kidney.
synonyms: ["Interlobular artery medial atrophy","Medial atrophy within interlobular arteries"]

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the diaphragm
description: Absence or underdevelopment of the diaphragm.

name: Megaduodenum
description: Dilation and elongation of the duodenum with hypertrophy of all layers of the duodenum.

name: Increased level of hippuric acid in urine
description: An increase in the level of hippuric acid in the urine.

name: Neuroblastoma
description: Neuroblastoma is a solid tumor that originate in neural crest cells of the sympathetic nervous system. Most neuroblastomas originate in the abdomen, and most abdominal neuroblastomas originate in the adrenal gland. Neuroblastomas can also originate in the thorax, usually in the posterior mediastinum.

name: Ultra-low vision with retained light perception
description: Ultra-low vision but with retained ability to perceive the difference between light and dark.

name: Fibrocellular crescent
description: A type of glomerular crescent characterized by extracapillary hypercellularity of more than 2 cell layers and involving over 10% of the capsular circumference, composed of 25% to 75% cells with or without fibrin, and the remainder fibrous matrix.

name: Peripheral axonal degeneration
description: Progressive deterioration of peripheral axons.

name: Decreased CD69 upregulation upon TCR activation
description: Reduced or impaired upregulation of CD69 on T cells after activation via the T cell receptor (TCR).

name: Shortened O-fucosylated glycan on properdin
description: Decreased length of O-fucosylated glycans present on properdin.
synonyms: ["Presence of terminal O-fucose glycans on properdin"]

name: Elevated urine pyrophosphate
description: An abnormally increased diphosphate(4-) concentration in the urine. Diphosphate(4-), as ester with two phosphate groups, is also known as pyrophosphate.

name: Duplication of the proximal phalanx of hand
description: This term applies if one or more of the proximal phalanges of the hand are either partially duplicated, depending on severity leading to a broad or bifid appearance of the phalanges, or completely duplicated.
synonyms: ["Duplication of the innermost bones of hand","Partial/complete duplication of the proximal phalanges of the hand"]

name: Adenoiditis
description: An inflammation of the adenoid tissue.

name: Abnormality of long bone morphology
description: An abnormality of size or shape of the long bones.
synonyms: ["HP:0100713","HP:0100714","HP:0100715","Abnormal shape of long bone","Abnormality of the tubular bones"]

name: Juxtafoveal choroidal neovascularization
description: A type of choroidal neovascularization in which the nearest edge of the area of neovascularization is located 1 to 199 micrometers from the center of the fovea.

name: Incisional hernia
description: An abdominal hernia that occurs at a site of weakness in the abdominal wall resulting from an incompletely-healed surgical wound.

name: Abnormal best corrected visual acuity test
Decreased circulating beta-2-microglobulin level
description: Reduced concentration of beta-2-microglobulin in the blood.

name: Iris flocculi
description: Multiple cysts along the pupillary margin that appear as spherical or tear-drop-shaped pigmented lesions or wrinkled masses emerging from the pupillary border of the iris.

name: Giant neutrophil granules
description: The presence of abnormally large granules in neutrophils. This finding can be appreciated on a peripheral blood smear. The finding is characteristic of Chediak Higashi syndrome. The giant granules are derived from azurophil granules, whereas peroxidase-negative granules are not involved in their formation.

name: Simplified gyral pattern
description: An abnormality of the cerebral cortex with fewer gyri but with normal cortical thickness. This pattern is usually often associated with congenital microcephaly.

name: Metaphyseal sclerosis
description: Abnormally increased density of metaphyseal bone.
synonyms: ["Increased bone density in wide portion of long bone","Sclerotic metaphyses"]

name: Neonatal unilateral epileptic spasm
description: Neonatal unilateral epileptic spasm is a sudden flexion, extension, or mixed extension-flexion of predominantly proximal and truncal muscles that occurs at one side of the body.

name: Esophoria
description: A form of strabismus with both eyes turned inward to a relatively mild degree, usually defined as less than 10 prism diopters.

name: Hypoautofluorescent macular lesion
description: Decreased amount of autofluorescence in the macula as ascertained by fundus autofluorescence imaging.

name: Vulvar intraepithelial neoplasia
description: Vulvar intraepithelial neoplasia (VIN) is widely accepted as the precursor lesion of vulvar squamous cell carcinoma (VSCC). VSCC arises via either a human papilloma virus (HPV)-associated pathway, or more commonly, via a mechanism independent of HPV, often being linked to chronic inflammatory conditions such as lichen sclerosus (LS). Accordingly, two distinct subtypes of VIN are recognised: the HPV-associated high-grade squamous intraepithelial lesion/usual VIN (HSIL/uVIN) and the non-HPV-associated differentiated VIN (dVIN). HSIL is clinically identified by its multifocal, warty appearance and on histology by conspicuous cytological and architectural atypia. Differentiated VIN, on the other hand, often produces ill-defined lesions, and on histology, notoriously mimics non-neoplastic epithelial disorders (NNED), particularly LS. As a result, dVIN is rarely identified in advance of a diagnosis of invasive malignancy, despite being the precursor lesion of the majority of VSCC.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of fingers
description: Small/hypoplastic or absent/aplastic fingers.

name: Agenesis of premolar
description: Agenesis of premolar tooth.
synonyms: ["Agenesis of bicuspid","Failure of development of bicuspid","Failure of development of premolar"]

name: Lumbosacral hirsutism
description: Abnormally increased hair growth in the lumbosacral region.

name: Macular hypopigmentation
description: Decreased amount of pigmentation in the macula lutea.

name: Focal cortical dysplasia type I
description: A type of focal cortical dysplasia that is characterized by abnormal cortical layering.

name: Praxis-induced seizure
description: A seizure precipitated by complex, cognition-guided tasks often involving visuomotor coordination and decision-making.

name: Triangular shaped distal phalanx of the 5th toe
synonyms: ["Triangular shaped outermost bone of the little toe","Triangular shaped outermost bone of the pinkie toe","Triangular shaped outermost bone of the pinky toe"]

name: Abnormal cardiomyocyte morphology
description: Any structural anomaly of cardiomyocytes, which are terminally differentiated muscle cells in the heart that are interconnected end to end by gap junctions, which allows coordinated contraction of heart tissue.

name: Cervical vertebral bodies with decreased anteroposterior diameter
Occipital meningocele
description: A herniation of meninges through a congenital bone defect in the skull in the occipital region.

name: Bracket epiphysis of the middle phalanx of the 5th toe
synonyms: ["Bracket shaped end part of the middle bone of the little toe","Bracket shaped end part of the middle bone of the pinkie toe","Bracket shaped end part of the middle bone of the pinky toe"]

name: Ectopic accesory toe-like appendage
description: In contrast to forms of polydactyly where the supernumerary digit (this can either be a rudimentary or a completely 'normal' digit) is either located postaxial (on the fibular side of the foot, next top the little toe), preaxial (on the tibial side of the foot, next to the big toe) or mesoaxial (somewhere central, between big and little toe), a supernumerary digit may also be placed ectopically, meaning anywhere else except post-,meso- or preaxial. In the literature this is sometimes referred to as Disorganisation-like Syndrome (OMIM223200).

name: Abnormal circulating fatty-acid concentration
description: A deviation from the normal concentration of a fatty acid in the blood circulation.

name: Anti-TRIM9/TRIM67 antibody
description: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against TRIM9/TRIM67.

name: Fragmentation of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 4th finger
description: Fragmented appearance of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 4th finger.
synonyms: ["Fragmentation of end part of the outermost bone of the ring finger"]

name: Anti-thyroglobulin antibody positivity
description: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react to thyroglobulin.

name: Percussion myotonia
description: A localized myotonic contraction in a muscle in reaction to percussion (tapping with the examiner's finger, a rubber percussion hammer, or a similar object).
synonyms: ["HP:0004304","Transient swelling of muscle induced by percussion"]

name: Absence of ganglioside GM3
description: The absence of ganglioside GM3.

name: Lumbar hyperlordosis
description: An abnormal accentuation of the inward curvature of the spine in the lumbar region.
synonyms: ["HP:0002941","HP:0004560","HP:0004574","HP:0004596","Exaggerated lumbar lordosis","Excessive inward curvature of lower spine","Increased lumbar lordosis","Lumbar lordosis","Prominent lumbar lordosis"]

name: Hydrocolpos
description: Distention of the vagina caused by accumulation of fluid due to congenital vaginal obstruction.

name: Moderate postnatal growth retardation
description: A moderate degree of slow or limited growth after birth, being between three and four standard deviations below age- and sex-related norms.

name: Absent penis
description: Lack of recognizable penile structures.

name: Undetectable light- and dark-adapted electroretinogram
description: Absence of the combined rod-and-cone response on electroretinogram.
synonyms: ["HP:0003230","HP:0008280","Absent cone and rod functions by electroretinogram","Absent rod-and cone-mediated responses on ERG"]

name: Urethral diverticulum
description: The presence of a diverticulum (sac or pouch) in the wall of the urethra.

name: Glomerular endothelial tubuloreticular inclusion
description: Inter-anastomosing tubular structures located within cisternae of endoplasmic reticulum, most often within endothelial cells and associated with exposure to interferon.

name: Spontaneous pneumothorax
description: Pneumothorax occurring without traumatic injury to the chest or lung.

name: Fractured thoracic vertebra
description: A partial or complete breakage of the thoracic vertebra.

name: Reticular hyperpigmentation
description: Increased pigmentation of the skin with a netlike (reticular) pattern.

name: Accessory scrotum
description: Additional scrotum, or part of a scrotum in an abnormal location.

name: Paraseptal emphysema
description: Paraseptal emphysema is characterized by predominant involvement of the distal alveoli and their ducts and sacs. It is characteristically bounded by any pleural surface and the interlobular septa. This emphysema is characterized by subpleural and peribronchovascular regions of low attenuation separated by intact interlobular septa, sometimes associated with bullae.

name: Fixation-off epileptiform discharges
description: Fixation off sensitivity (FOS) is characterized by posterior or generalized epileptiform discharges that consistently occur with conditions that eliminate central vision, such as closed eyes, complete darkness, modified Ganzfeld stimulation (using a large white surface without visual cues), and Frenzel lenses. The FOS electroencephalogram (EEG) pattern usually consists of spikes/polyspikes and waves localized in occipital regions (bilateral or unilateral) or generalized discharges. It is usually inhibited by fixation of gaze, observing patterns, or intermittent photic stimulation (e.g., flashing light or patterns used as stimuli during the recording of the EEG).

name: Curved middle phalanx of the 2nd toe
description: A deviation from the normal straight form of the middle phalanx of the 2nd toe.

name: Alveolar ridge overgrowth
description: Increased width of the alveolar ridges.
synonyms: ["HP:0009078","HP:0009083","Alveolar ridge excess","Enlarged alveolar ridge","Hyperplasia of alveolar process of jaw","Hyperplasia of alveolar ridge","Increased size of alveolar ridge","Increased size of gum ridge","Overgrowth of alveolar ridge","Overgrowth of gum ridge","Thick alveolar ridges","Thickened alveolar ridges"]

name: Left-to-right shunt
description: Pattern of blood flow in the heart that deviates from the normal circuit of the circulatory system from the left side of the heart to the right.

name: Ossifying fibroma
description: A benign central bone tumor composed of fibrous connective tissue within which bone is formed.

name: Hematuria
description: The presence of blood in the urine. Hematuria may be gross hematuria (visible to the naked eye) or microscopic hematuria (detected by dipstick or microscopic examination of the urine).

name: Elevated urinary homovanillic acid
description: An increased concentration of homovanillic acid in the urine.

name: Caudal interpedicular narrowing
description: Narrowing (becoming gradually narrower) of the distance between vertebral pedicles that gets progressively more severe towards to caudal (lower) end of the vertebral column. Note that normally, the interpedicular distances get progressively wider as one proceeds down the spine.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the 3rd metacarpal
description: Aplasia or Hypoplasia affecting the 3rd metacarpal.
synonyms: ["Absent/small 3rd long bone of hand","Absent/underdeveloped 3rd long bone of hand"]

name: Cervical C3/C4 vertebral fusion
description: Fusion of cervical vertebrae at C3 and C4, caused by a failure in the normal segmentation or division of the cervical vertebrae during the early weeks of fetal development.

name: Juvenile type ovarian granulosa cell tumor
description: Juvenile granulosa cell ovarian tumor (JGCOT) is a rare sex cord stromal tumor, occuring most frequently in premenarchal girls or young women. In contrast to adult granulosa cell tumor, JGCOT has a high mitotic index and more aggressive tumor growth. Microscopically it is seen as diffuse and regularly distributed neoplastic cells with a wide cytoplasm and pleomorphic hyperchromatic nucleus. Follicle formation, in various sizes and shapes, is important in JGCOT. Call-Exner bodies are infrequently seen in JGCOT in contrast to the adult type.
synonyms: ["Juvenile type ovarian granulosa cell tumour","Ovarian juvenile granulosa cell tumor","Ovarian juvenile granulosa cell tumour"]

name: Violet lip discoloration
description: An alteration of the color of the lip to take on a violet color. This term does not include cyanosis.

name: Molybdenum cofactor deficiency
description: Absence of molybdenum cofactor(2-), a cofactor for enzymes including sulfite oxidase, xanthine oxidoreductase, and aldehyde oxidase.

name: Impaired tandem gait
description: Reduced ability to walk in a straight line while placing the feet heel to toe.

name: Impaired platelet aggregation
description: An impairment in the rate and degree to which platelets aggregate after the addition of an agonist that stimulates platelet clumping. Platelet aggregation is measured using aggregometer to measure the optical density of platelet-rich plasma, whereby platelet aggregation causes the plasma to become more transparent.
synonyms: ["HP:0008177","Defective platelet aggregation","Deficient platelet aggregation","Platelet aggregation defect"]

name: Generalized cerebral atrophy/hypoplasia
description: Generalized atrophy or hypoplasia of the cerebrum.

name: Reduced circulating transferrin concentration
description: An abnormally decreased concentration of transferrin in the blood circulation.

name: Mesomelia
description: Shortening of the middle parts of the limbs (forearm and lower leg) in relation to the upper and terminal segments.
synonyms: ["Disproportionately short middle portion of limb","Mesomelic limb shortening","Mesomelic shortening of limbs","Symmetric mesomelic limb shortness"]

name: Frequent
description: Present in 30% to 79% of the cases.

name: Elfin facies
description: This is a description previously used to describe a facial form characterized by a short, upturned nose, wide mouth, widely spaced eyes, and full cheeks. Because of the imprecision in this definition it is preferable to describe these features precisely. This term is retained because it was often used in the past, but it should not be used for new annotations.

name: Decreased FasL-mediated apoptosis
description: A reduced amount of programmed cell death upon stimulation of the FAS receptor, which normally induces caspase-8 dependent apoptosis.

name: Decreased serum complement C4b
description: A reduced level of the complement component C4b in circulation.

name: Anti-aquaporin 4 antibody positivity
description: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against aquaporin-4.

name: Duplication of the distal phalanx of the 5th toe
description: Partial or complete duplication of the distal phalanx of little toe.
synonyms: ["Duplication of the distal phalanx of the fifth toe","Duplication of the outermost bone of the fifth toe","Duplication of the outermost bone of the little toe","Duplication of the outermost bone of the pinkie toe","Duplication of the outermost bone of the pinky toe","Partial/complete duplication of the distal phalanx of the 5th toe"]

name: Encephalocele
description: A neural tube defect characterized by sac-like protrusions of the brain and the membranes that cover it through openings in the skull.

name: Abnormal CSF/serum albumin ratio
description: A deviation from the normal range of the ratio of the albumin concentration in the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) to the concentration in serum (which may be defined as 3.2-9.0). This is an index of blood-brain barrier (BBB) integrity, adjusted for the serum albumin concentration, and an increased ratio is taken as a sign of a loss of integrity of the BBB with leakage of albumin into the CSF.

name: EEG with generalized sharp slow waves
description: EEG with generalized sharp transient waves of a duration between 80 and 200 msec followed by a slow wave.

name: Ciliary dyskinesia
description: A deviation from the normally well coordinated pattern of intracellular and intercellular synchrony of motile cilia. Dyskinetic cilia usually beat out of synchrony relative to neighboring cilia.
synonyms: ["Lack of coordinated beating of respiratory cilia"]

name: Sparse medial eyebrow
description: Decreased density/number and/or decreased diameter of medial eyebrow hairs.

name: EEG with photoparoxysmal response grade IV
description: Occurrence of generalized epileptiform discharges during photic stimulation.

name: Advanced ossification of the hand bones
description: Ossification of hand bones at an earlier age than normal.

name: Penoscrotal hypospadias
description: A severe form of hypospadias in which the urethral opening is located at the junction of the penis and scrotum.

name: Abnormality of mesenteric lymph nodes
description: A morphological anomaly of lymph nodes in the mesenteric root or throughout the mesentery.

name: Small epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd toe
synonyms: ["Small end part of the innermost bone of the 2nd toe"]

name: Focal impaired awareness seizure with dissociation at onset
description: A focal cognitive seizure with dissociation at the onset of the seizure impairment of awareness at at some point during the seizure.

name: Ivory epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 4th toe
synonyms: ["Increased bone density of end part of the outermost bone of the 4th toe"]

name: Abnormality of the musculoskeletal system
description: An anomaly of the musculoskeletal system, which consists of the bones of the skeleton, muscles, cartilage, tendons, ligaments, joints, and other connective tissue. The musculoskeletal system supports the weight of the body, maintains body position and produces movements of the body or of parts of the body.

name: Pigment deposition in the trabecular meshwork
description: Accumulation of abnormal amounts of pigment within the trabecular meshwork.

name: Skin dimple over apex of long bone angulation
Irregular epiphyses of the upper limbs
synonyms: ["Irregular end part of upper limb bones"]

name: Enlarged metaphyses
description: Abnormal increase in size of one or more metaphyses.
synonyms: ["HP:0005018","Enlarged wide portion of a long bone"]

name: Hypocholesterolemia
description: An decreased concentration of cholesterol in the blood.

name: Apneic episodes precipitated by illness, fatigue, stress
description: Recurrent episodes of apnea that are precipitated by factors such as illness, fatigue, or stress.
synonyms: ["Episodic apnea induced by febrile illness or stress"]

name: Biliary cirrhosis
description: Progressive destruction of the small-to-medium bile ducts of the intrahepatic biliary tree, which leads to progressive cholestasis and often end-stage liver disease.

name: Abnormal morphology of phalanx of the 2nd toe
description: An anomaly of a phalanx of second toe.

name: Absent external genitalia
description: Lack of external genitalia in a male or female individual.

name: Abnormality of the scalp hair
description: An abnormality of the hair of head.

name: Triggered by sudden movement
description: Applies to a sign or symptom that is provoked or brought about by a sudden movement.
synonyms: ["Kinesigenic","Sudden movement triggered symptoms","Triggered by sudden movement"]

name: Abnormality of the urinary system physiology
Abnormal atrial arrangement
description: Abnormality of the spatial relationship of the atria to other components of the heart.

name: Abnormal stool urobilinogen concentration
description: Abnormal concentration of urobilinogen present in the stool.

name: Weakness of facial musculature
description: Reduced strength of one or more muscles innervated by the facial nerve (the seventh cranial nerve).
synonyms: ["Decreased facial muscle strength","Decreased strength of facial muscles","Face weakness","Facial muscle weakness","Facial weakness","Myasthenia of facial muscles","Reduced facial muscle strength","Weakness of face","Weakness of facial musculature"]

name: Cloacal exstrophy
description: Cloacal exstrophy is a severe anterior abdominal wall defect in which the two hemibladders are visible and are separated by a midline intestinal plate, an omphalocele, and an imperforate anus.

name: Immediate-type hypersensitivity drug reaction
description: Hypersensitivity that is observed within 1 hr of exposures. A variety of adverse reactions can occur within minutes to hours of exposure to a drug. Some can be related to the pharmacological action of the drug (WHO Adverse Reaction Terminology type A for augmented) and usually have a low mortality. Others are not readily predictable based on the structure and pharmacological action of the drug and have a relatively high mortality risk (Type B for bizarre). The most serious form of immediate onset drug hypersensitivity reaction, anaphylaxis. Other reactions including itching,dizziness/light-headedness, nausea, chest discomfort but without any objective skin features, physical signs or physiological compromise. Skin only reactions include generalized erythema, urticaria or angioedema without any sentinel features (see below) of other organ involvement.

name: Focal cognitive seizure with dyslexia/alexia
description: A focal cognitive seizure characterized by dyslexia / alexia as the initial semiological manifestation.

name: Aplasia of metacarpal bones
description: Developmental defect associated with absence of one or more metacarpal bones.
synonyms: ["HP:0005911","Absent long bone of hand","Absent metacarpal","Absent metacarpals"]

name: Elevated urinary norepinephrine
description: An increased concentration of noradrenaline in the urine.

name: Argininosuccinic aciduria
description: Increased amount of argininosuccinate in the urine.

name: Abnormal urinary pyrimidine level
description: Any deviation from the normal amount of a pyrimidine compound in the urine. Pyrimidines and pyrimidine derivatives are compounds containing a pyrimidne ring, which is a six-member aromatic heterocycle which consists of two nitrogen atoms (at positions 1 and 3) and four carbon atoms. The nucleotides cytosine, thymine and uracil are pyrimidines.

name: Abnormality of mesentery morphology
description: Folds of membranous tissue (peritoneum, mesothelium) attached to the wall of the abdomen and enclosing viscera. Examples include the mesentery for the small intestine; the transverse mesocolon, which attaches the transverse portion of the colon to the back wall of the abdomen; and the mesosigmoid, which enfolds the sigmoid portion of the colon. Cells of the same embryologic origin also surround the other organs of the body such as the lungs (pleura) or the heart (pericardium).

name: Sleep apnea
description: An intermittent cessation of airflow at the mouth and nose during sleep. Apneas of at least 10 seconds are considered important, but persons with sleep apnea may have apneas of 20 seconds to up to 2 or 3 minutes. Patients may have up to 15 events per hour of sleep.

name: Osteolytic defects of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger
description: Dissolution or degeneration of bone tissue of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger.

name: Expressive aphasia
description: Impairment of expressive language and relative preservation of receptive language abilities. That is, the patient understands language (speech, writing) but cannot express it.
synonyms: ["Broca's aphasia","Loss of expressive speech","Motor aphasia","Non-fluent aphasia"]

name: Semidominant inheritance
description: A mode of inheritance that is observed for traits related to a gene encoded on chromosomes in which a trait can manifest in the heterozygotes and homozygotes, with differing phenotype severity present dependent on the number of alleles affected.

name: Contracture of the metatarsophalangeal joint of the 5th toe
description: The joint between the fifth metatarsal and the proximal phalanx of the fifth toe cannot be straightened actively or passively.

name: Abnormality of dermal melanosomes
description: An abnormality of the melanosomes, i.e., of the cellular organelles in which melanin pigments are synthesized and stored within melanocytes (the cells that produce pigment in the dermis).

name: Hypermobility of interphalangeal joints
description: The ability of the interphalangeal joints to move beyond their normal range of motion.

name: Abnormal eye physiology
description: A functional anomaly of the eye.

name: Pulmonary arterial plexiform lesion
description: Focal proliferation of pulmonary artery endothelial cells, leading to the formation of complex capillary-like channels.

name: Loud first heart sound
description: Abnormally increased volume of the first heart sound.

name: Abnormal lymphocyte apoptosis
description: A anomaly in the rate of programmed cell death (apoptosis) in lymphocytes.

name: Type VI atherosclerotic lesion
description: Type VI atherosclerotic lesions generally have the underlying morphology of type IV or V lesions, surface disruptions, hematoma, and thrombosis may be (although less often) superimposed on any other type of lesion and even on intima without an apparent lesion. Complicating features may arise because of individual differences in risk factors and tissue reactions. These may include differences in composition of the blood, the relative quantities and distributions in the components of the underlying lesion or intima, as well as modifications of shear and tensile forces to which the lesion or intima is exposed. Clinical imaging of lesions may be expected to contribute greatly to the understanding of type VI lesions and the associated clinical syndromes.

name: Hypopigmented macule
description: A white or lighter patch of skin that may appear anywhere on the body and are caused by decreased skin pigmentation.

name: Abnormality of the thymus
description: Abnormality of the thymus, an organ located in the upper anterior portion of the chest cavity just behind the sternum and whose main function is to provide an environment for T lymphocyte maturation.

name: Pseudocoarctation of the aorta
description: Pseudocoarctation is a congenital anomaly of kinking, or buckling, of the aorta without a pressure gradient across the lesion. It is characterized by elongation and kinking of the aorta at the level of the ligamentum arteriosum.

name: Lymphocytic infiltration of the colorectal mucosa
description: Abnormally increased intraepithelial lymphocyte count. This finding may be appreciated as large numbers of surface intraepithelial lymphocytes as seen (for instance) with hematoxylin and eosin staining of a colonic biopsy sample taken during colonoscopy.

name: Fused labia minora
description: Fusion of the labia minora as a result of labial adhesions resulting in vaginal obstruction.

name: Abnormal platelet aggregation
description: An abnormality in the rate and degree to which platelets aggregate after the addition of an agonist that stimulates platelet clumping. Platelet aggregation is measured using aggregometer to measure the optical density of platelet-rich plasma, whereby platelet aggregation causes the plasma to become more transparent.

name: Increased serum iduronate sulfatase level
description: An increased level of iduronate-2-sulfatase activity in the blood.

name: Spiral fracture
description: A type of fracture in which the break spirals around the bone.

name: Bullet-shaped 4th toe phalanx
description: An abnormal morphology of one or more phalanges of the fourth toe, with a short and wide phalanx that tapers distally. Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction.
synonyms: ["Bullet-shaped bones of the 4th toe","Bullet-shaped phalanges of the 4th toe"]

name: Cloacal abnormality
description: A developmental anomaly associated with the failure of rectum, vagina, and bladder to separate.

name: Segmental glomerulosclerosis
description: Segmental solidification of the glomerular tuft by increased extracellular matrix, causing glomerular capillary obliteration and can include hyalinosis, foam cells, hypertrophy of overlying glomerular epithelial cells, podocyte depletion, halo and adhesion of the tuft to the Bowman capsule.

name: Transitional cell carcinoma of the bladder
description: The presence of a carcinoma of the urinary bladder with origin in a transitional epithelial cell.

name: Nasal septum perforation
description: A full-thickness defect of the nasal septum.

name: Enlarged naris
description: Increased aperture of the nostril.
synonyms: ["Broad nostril","Dilated nares","Dilated nostril","Enlarged nares","Enlarged nostril","Increased diameter of nares","Increased diameter of nostril","Increased width of nares","Large nares","Naris, broad","Naris, enlarged","Wide nares","Wide nostril"]

name: HbS hemoglobin
description: Presence of an abnormal type of hemoglobin characterized by the subsitution of a glutamic acid residue at position 7 following the initial methionine residue by a valine (the mutation causative of sickle cell disease). The mutation promotes the polymerization of the HbS under conditions of low oxygen concentration. HbS can be identified by multiple methodologies including hemoglobin electrophoresis and high-performance liquid chromatography.

name: Angular cheilitis
description: A type of inflammation of the lips involving one or both of the corners of the mouth.
synonyms: ["Angular cheilosis","Angular stomatitis","Commissural cheilitis","Inflammation of corners of the mouth","Inflammation of oral commisures","Red and sore corners of the mouth"]

name: Hyperchloremic metabolic acidosis
description: A form of metabolic acidosis with increased serum chloride levels.

name: Gastrointestinal dysmotility
description: Abnormal intestinal contractions, such as spasms and intestinal paralysis, related to the loss of the ability of the gut to coordinate muscular activity because of endogenous or exogenous causes.

name: Astrocytosis
description: Proliferation of astrocytes in the area of a lesion of the central nervous system.

name: Morphological abnormality of the posterior semicircular canal
Thyroglossal cyst
description: An abnormality of the thyroid gland owing to the presence of a fibrous cyst resulting from the persistence of the thyroglossal duct.

name: High insertion of columella
description: Insertion of the posterior columella superior to the nasal base.

name: Increased urinary non-proteinogenic amino acid level
description: An increased level in the urine of an alpha-amino acid which is not a member of the group of 23 proteinogenic amino acids.

name: Small scrotum
description: Apparently small scrotum for age.
synonyms: ["HP:0030276","Hypoplastic scrotum","Scrotal hypoplasia","Smaller than typical growth of scrotum","Underdeveloped scrotum"]

name: Primum atrial septal defect
description: An ostium primum atrial septal defect is located in the most anterior and inferior aspect of the atrial septum. The ostium primum refers to an anterior and inferior opening (ostium) within the septum primum, which divides the rudimentary atrium during fetal development. The ostium primum is normally sealed by fusion of the superior and inferior endocardial cushions around 5 weeks' gestation. Ostium primum defects result from a failure of the fusion of the embryologic endocardial cushion and septum primum.
synonyms: ["Atrial septal defect, primum type","Ostium primum atrial septal defect","Primum atrioventricular canal defect","Septum primum defect"]

name: Abnormal meniscus morphology
description: Abnormal structure of the meniscus of the knee, two crescent shape fibrocartilaginous pads that disperse the weight of the body and reduce friction of the knee joint during movement.

name: Low-grade vesicoureteral reflux
description: Vesicoureteral reflux without dilation of the renal calyces (Grade I-II).

name: Sound sensitivity
description: Decreased tolerance to sound.

name: Growth arrest lines
description: Growth arrest lines are alternating transverse rings of sclerosis at the metaphysis of a long bone.

name: Enlarged fetal cisterna magna
description: The cisterna magna is measured on a transaxial view of the fetal head angled 15 degrees caudal to the canthomeatal line. The anterior/posterior diameter is taken between the inferior/posterior surface of the vermis of the cerebellum to the inner surface of the cranium. An enlarged cisternal magna is defined by an anterior/posterior diameter of 10 mm or more (PMID:16100637).

name: Hemiareflexia
description: Areflexia that is limited to one side of the body.

name: Neoplasm of the male external genitalia
description: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the male external genitalia.

name: Abnormal renal tubular lumen morphology
description: Abnormal structure or form of the lumen (opening) of kidney tubules.

name: Trichiasis
description: Inversion and rubbing of the eyelashes against the globe of the eye.
synonyms: ["Ingrown eyelashes","Introversion of eyelashes","Trichiasis of eyelid eyelashes"]

name: Abnormal sperm mid-piece morphology
description: A structural abnormality of the sperm mid-piece.

name: Retinal thinning
description: Reduced anteroposterior thickness of the retina. This phenotype can be appreciated by retinal optical coherence tomography (OCT).

name: Scaling skin on fingertip
description: Loss of the outer layer of the epidermis in large, scale-like flakes localized to one or more fingertips.

name: Underdeveloped superior crus of antihelix
description: Decreased protrusion of the superior crus relative to the prominence of a normal antihelix stem.
synonyms: ["Hypoplastic superior crus of antihelix","Hypotrophic superior crus of antihelix"]

name: Proximal radio-ulnar synostosis
description: An abnormal osseous union (fusion) between the proximal portions of the radius and the ulna.

name: Amelia
description: Congenital absence (aplasia) of one or more limbs.

name: Heart murmur
description: An extra or unusual sound heard during a heartbeat caused vibrations resulting from the flow of blood through the heart.

name: Citrullinuria
description: An increased concentration of citrulline in the urine.

name: Abnormal spleen physiology
description: Any anomaly of the function of the spleen.

name: Bulbous nose
description: Increased volume and globular shape of the anteroinferior aspect of the nose.

name: Complete or near-complete absence of specific antibody response to tetanus vaccine
description: The inability to synthesize postvaccination antibodies against a tetanus antigen, as measured by antibody titer determination following vaccination.

name: Absent humeral epiphyseal ossification
description: Lack of formation of bone in the epiphysis of the humerus.
synonyms: ["Absent maturation of end part of long bone in upper arm","Absent ossification of the humeral epiphyses"]

name: Abnormality of musculoskeletal physiology
description: An abnormality of the function of the skeletal system.

name: Decreased serum creatinine
description: An abnormally reduced amount of creatinine in the blood.
synonyms: ["Decreased serum creatinine","Low blood creatinine level","Reduced creatinine levels"]

name: Permanent junctional reciprocating tachycardia
description: An incessant orthodromic tachycardia with anterograde conduction over the atrioventricular node and by retrograde conduction via an accessory pathway usually located in the posteroseptal region with slow and decremental conduction.

name: Triceps hypoplasia
description: Hypoplasia of the triceps muscle.

name: Prolonged bleeding after surgery
description: Bleeding that persists longer than the normal time following a surgical procedure.
synonyms: ["Excessive bleeding during surgery","Prolonged bleeding after surgery","Protracted bleeding after surgery"]

name: Abnormality of dental morphology
description: An abnormality of the morphology of the tooth.
synonyms: ["HP:0000697","Abnormality of dental shape","Abnormality of shape of tooth","Abnormally shaped teeth","Deformity of teeth","Dental deformity","Dental malformations","Malformation of teeth","Malformed teeth","Misshapen teeth","Misshapened teeth"]

name: Cleft at the superior portion of the pinna
synonyms: ["Cleft at the superior portion of the ear"]

name: Abnormal insertion of umbilical cord
description: Anomalous location of the insertion of umbilical cord in the placenta. Normally, the insertion is at least two centimers distant from the edge of the placenta.

name: Small hypothenar eminence
description: Reduced muscle mass on the ulnar side of the palm, that is, reduction in size of the hypothenar eminence.

name: Abnormality of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb
description: This term applies if the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb, which is located at the proximal end of the phalanx, does not appear in concordance with gender and age dependant norms as seen on x-rays. In contrast to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5, the proximal phalanx of the thumb is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits.
synonyms: ["Abnormality of end part of thumb innermost long bone"]

name: Focal aware cognitive seizure with dysgraphia/agraphia
description: A focal cognitive seizure with dysgraphia / agraphia characterized by retained awareness throughout the seizure.

name: Transient neutropenia
description: A transient reduction in the number of neutrophils in the peripheral blood. Transient neutropenia is most commonly associated with viral infections, but other causes include drugs and autoimmunity.

name: Increased hepatitis A virus antibody level
description: An abnormally increased level of immunoglobulin against hepatitis A virus in the blood.

name: Abnormal lower limb bone morphology
synonyms: ["HP:0040066","Abnormal morphology of bones of the lower limbs","Abnormal shape of bones of the lower limbs","Abnormality of lower limb bone"]

name: Oral mucosa nodule
description: A palpable, solid lesion greater than 5mm in diameter. that is located in the mucosa of the mouth.

name: Anti-neurofascin 186 antibody positivity
description: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against NF186.

name: Panacinar emphysema
description: Panacinar emphysema involves all portions of the acinus and secondary pulmonary lobule more or less uniformly. It predominates in the lower lobes and is the form of emphysema associated with1-antitrypsin deficiency. CT scans show a generalized decrease of the lung parenchyma with a decrease in the caliber of blood vessels in the affected lung. Severe panacinar emphysema may coexist and merge with severe centrilobular emphysema. The appearance of feature less decreased attenuation may be indistinguishable from severe constrictive obliterative bronchiolitis.

name: Hypoplasia of the pons
description: Underdevelopment of the pons.

name: Repeated implantation failure
description: Repeated implantation failure refers to a situation in which embryos of good quality fail to implant following several in vitro fertilization (IVF) treatment cycles.

name: Upper extremity hypokinesia
description: Abnormally diminished movement of the upper extremities. In contrast to paralysis, hypokinesia is not characterized by a lack of motor strength, but rather by a poverty of movement. The typical habitual movements (e.g., folding the arms, crossing the legs) are reduced in frequency.

name: Tenesmus
description: A repeated, painful urge to defecate without excreting stool.

name: Distal widening of metacarpals
description: Abnormal increase in width of the distal region of the metacarpal bones.

name: Abnormal 5th finger morphology
description: An abnormality affecting one or both 5th fingers.
synonyms: ["Abnormality of the 5th finger","Abnormality of the little finger","Abnormality of the pinkie finger","Abnormality of the pinky finger"]

name: Cervical aortic arch
description: The aortic arch extends into the soft tissues of the neck before turning down into to become the descending aorta.

name: Absent foveal reflex
description: Lack of the foveal reflex, which normally occurs as a result of the reflection of light from the ophthalmoscope in the foveal pit upon examination. The foveal reflex is a bright pinpoint of light that is observed to move sideways or up and down in response to movement of the opthalmoscope.

name: Oral cavity telangiectasia
description: Presence of telangiectases in the oral cavity.

name: Absence of the sacrum
description: Absence (aplasia) of the sacrum.

name: Elevated right ventricular systolic pressure
description: Elevation of right ventricular systolic pressure (RVSP) above normal limits. In adults, RVSP is normally 20-30 mmHg.

name: Multiple exostoses
description: Presence of more than one exostosis. An exostosis is a benign growth the projects outward from the bone surface. It is capped by cartilage, and arises from a bone that develops from cartilage.

name: Facial telangiectasia
description: Telangiectases (small dilated blood vessels) located near the surface of the skin of the face.

name: Abnormal circulating complement factor H related protein 1 concentration
description: A deviation from the normal concentration in blood of factor H-related protein 1 (FHR-1)

name: Abnormality of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 5th finger
description: Abnormality of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the fifth finger. This epiphysis is located on the proximal end of the phalanx.
synonyms: ["Abnormality of end part of the innermost bone of little finger","Abnormality of end part of the innermost bone of pinkie finger","Abnormality of end part of the innermost bone of pinky finger"]

name: Increased hemoglobin oxygen affinity
description: An abnormal increase in the binding affinity of hemoglobin for oxygen.
synonyms: ["Increased haemoglobin O2 affinity","Increased haemoglobin oxygen affinity","Increased Hb O2 affinity","Increased Hb oxygen affinity","Increased hemoglobin O2 affinity"]

name: Curved linear dimple below the lower lip
Copper accumulation in brain
description: An anomalous build up of copper (Cu) in the brain.

name: Small pituitary gland
description: An abnormally decreased size of the pituitary gland.

name: Single-lobed right lung
description: A developmental defect of pulmonary lobation characterized by the presence of only one lobe of the right lung, which normally has three lobes.

name: Absent malleus
description: Aplasia of the malleus.

name: Retinopathy of prematurity zone III
description: Retinopathy which is a residual crescent of retina anterior to zone II.

name: Multiple pancreatic beta-cell adenomas
description: The presence of multiple pancreatic islet cell adenomas.

name: Triangular shaped proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger
description: Triangular shaped proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger. A triangular or so called delta shaped phalanx is a typical result after a bracket epiphysis of the affected phalanx.
synonyms: ["HP:0004125","Triangular proximal index finger phalanx","Triangular shaped innermost bone of index finger"]

name: Dumbbell-shaped humerus
description: The humerus is shortened and displays flaring (widening) of the metaphyses.

name: Abnormal placental size
description: A deviation from normal size of the placenta.

name: Proximal tubulopathy
description: Dysfunction of the proximal tubule, which is the portion of the duct system of the nephron of the kidney which leads from Bowman's capsule to the loop of Henle.
synonyms: ["HP:0000806","Proximal renal tubule defect","Proximal renal tubulopathy","Proximal tubular defect","Proximal tubule dysfunction","Selective proximal tubular damage"]

name: Solitary median maxillary central incisor
description: A single maxillary central incisor positioned in the midline with morphological symmetry of the crown and bordered by lateral incisors.
synonyms: ["HP:0001568","HP:0001573","HP:0006356","Only one upper front tooth","Single central incisor","Single central upper incisor","Single maxillary central incisor","Single median incisor","Single median maxillary central incisor","Single median maxillary incisor","Single midline maxillary incisor","Single midline upper front tooth","Solitary median maxillary central incisor","Solitary midline maxillary central incisor"]

name: Vitreoretinopathy
description: Ocular abnormality characterised by premature degeneration of the vitreous and the retina that may be associated with increased risk of retinal detachment.

name: Hypoplasia of the thymus
description: Underdevelopment of the thymus.

name: Junctional ectopic tachycardia
description: Junctional ectopic tachycardia (JET) is a unique type of supraventricular arrhythmia defined by narrow QRS complex and atrioventricular (AV) dissociation or retrograde atrial conduction in a 1:1 pattern.

name: Childhood onset sensorineural hearing impairment
description: Sensorineural hearing impairment with childhood onset.

name: Abnormality of urine homeostasis
description: An abnormality of the composition of urine or the levels of its components.

name: Interictal epileptiform activity
description: Epileptiform activity refers to distinctive EEG waves or complexes distinguished from background activity found in in a proportion of human subjects with epilepsy, but which can also be found in subjects without seizures. Interictal epileptiform activity refers to such activity that occurs in the absence of a clinical or subclinical seizure.

name: Abnormality of the nervous system
description: An abnormality of the nervous system.
synonyms: ["HP:0001333","HP:0006987","Abnormality of the nervous system","Brain and/or spinal cord issue","Neurologic abnormalities","Neurological abnormality"]

name: Abnormal metatarsal ossification
description: Any abnormal process of ossification of the metatarsal bones, which normally are each ossified from two centers: one for the body, and one for the head (metatarsal II,III,IV, and V) and one for the body and one for the base (metatarsal I). The ossification process begins in the center of the body about the ninth week, and extends toward either extremity. The center for the base of the first metatarsal appears about the third year, and the centers for the heads of the other bones between the fifth and eighth years. They join the bodies between the eighteenth and twentieth years.

name: Polycyclic
description: A distribution of skin lesions resembling multiple merged circles. For instance, this can be seen with multiple urticarial wheals as the individual, circular wheals resolve and merge.

name: Painful subcutaneous lipomas
description: The presence of multiple subcutaneous lipoma that cause pain.
synonyms: ["Painful noncancerous fat tissue tumor under the skin","Painful noncancerous fat tissue tumour under the skin"]

name: Vitreomacular traction
description: Vitreomacular traction is characterized by anomalous posterior vitreous detachment accompanied by anatomic distortion of the fovea, which may include pseudocysts, macular schisis, cystoid macular edema, and subretinal fluid. Vitreomacular traction can be subclassified by the diameter of vitreous attachment to the macular surface as measured by OCT, with attachment of 1500 micrometers or less defined as focal and attachment of more than 1500 micrometers as broad.

name: Fusiform descending thoracic aortic aneurysm
description: A concentric abnormal localized widening (dilatation) of the descending thoracic aorta that involves the full circumference of the vessel wall
synonyms: ["Dilatation of the fusiform descending thoracic aorta"]

name: 3-4 metacarpal synostosis
description: A congenital hand malformation characterized by the coalescence of the coalescence of third and fourth metacarpals (i.e., those corresponding to the middle and ring fingers).
synonyms: ["Fused third and fourth metacarpals","Middle and ring finger metacarpal synostosis","Synostosis of third and the fourth metacarpal bones"]

name: Tubulointerstitial fungal infiltration
description: Tubulointerstitial infiltration of yeast or hyphal-microrganisms identified on routine and/or special (PAS, silver) stains.

name: Lipomeningocele
description: A form of closed neural tube defect in which the spinal tissue lies within the spinal cord having a junction between the spinal cord and the lipoma. Intact skin covers the defect. Neurologic findings first appear during the second year of life.

name: Anti-Gerbich phenotype 1 antibody positivity
description: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against Ge-1.

name: obsolete Cone-shaped epiphysis of terminal phalanx of the middle finger
Dynein arm defect of respiratory motile cilia
description: An anomaly of the dynein arms of motile cilia. This feature is usually appreciated by electron microscopy.

name: Increased level of D-threitol in plasma
description: An increase in the level of D-threitol in the plasma.

name: Decreased hip abduction
description: Reduced ability to move the femur outward to the side.

name: Metaphyseal cupping of proximal phalanges
description: Metaphyseal cupping affecting the proximal phalanges.

name: Abnormal glomerular capillary morphology
description: A structural anomaly of the capillary blood vessels in the renal glomerulus.

name: Atrial situs ambiguous
description: Common atrium without defining morphologic features.

name: Progressive congenital scoliosis
description: A progressive form of scoliosis with congenital onset.

name: Cardiomyopathy
description: A myocardial disorder in which the heart muscle is structurally and functionally abnormal, in the absence of coronary artery disease, hypertension, valvular disease and congenital heart disease sufficient to cause the observed myocardial abnormality.

name: Abnormal umbilical cord blood vessel morphology
Hypercitraturia
description: A greater than normal concentration of citrate(3-) in the urine.

name: Persistent repetition of words
description: Repetitive use of words, phrases, intonation, or sounds of speech, often of the speech of others.

name: Abnormal peritubular capillary morphology
description: Anomalous structure of the capillaries that are derived from the efferent arteriole, forming a capillary network that surrounds the distal portions of the nephron tubule,

name: Metaphyseal spurs
description: Bony outgrowths that extend laterally from the margin of the metaphysis.

name: Right aortic arch with retroesophageal diverticulum of Kommerell
description: Aortic arch crosses the right mainstem bronchus. The left carotid artery is the first branch, right carotid artery the second branch and right subclavian artery as the third branch.

name: Absent thumbnail
description: Absence of thumb nail.

name: Short palm
description: Short palm.

name: Tyrosinuria
description: An abnormally increased level of tyrosine in the urine.

name: Scotoma
description: A regional and pathological increase of the light detection threshold in any region of the visual field surrounded by a field of normal or relatively well-preserved vision.

name: Abnormality iris morphology
description: An abnormality of the iris, which is the pigmented muscular tissue between the cornea and the lens, that is perforated by an opening called the pupil.

name: Abnormal pulmonary valve morphology
description: Any structural abnormality of the pulmonary valve.
synonyms: ["Abnormality of the pulmonary valve","Anomaly of the pulmonary valve"]

name: Focal necrosis of right ventricular muscle cells
Dissociative reaction
description: A disruption and/or discontinuity in the normal integration of consciousness, memory, identity, emotion, perception, body representation, motor control, and behavior. Clinical presentations of dissociation may include a wide variety of symptoms, including experiences of depersonalization, derealisation, emotional numbing, flashbacks of traumatic events, absorption, amnesia, voice hearing, interruptions in awareness, and identity alteration.

name: Abnormality of vitamin metabolism
description: An anomaly in the metabolism of a vitamin.

name: Mild malformation of cortical development
description: A malformation of cortical development characterized by mild abnormalities of the cortex: excessive heterotopic neurons in Layer 1 or microscopic neuronal clusters or excess of single neurons of normal morphology in deep white matter.

name: Cervical (neck)
description: Applies to an abnormality that is situated in the neck.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the colon
description: Congenital absence or underdevelopment of the colon.

name: Abnormality of radial ray
synonyms: ["Deformity of radial ray","Radial ray abnormality","Radial ray anomaly","Radial ray deformity"]

name: Exercise intolerance
description: A functional motor deficit where individuals whose responses to the challenges of exercise fail to achieve levels considered normal for their age and gender.
synonyms: ["Decreased ability to exercise","Inability to exercise","Low exercise endurance","Poor exercise tolerance"]

name: Scoliosis
description: The presence of an abnormal lateral curvature of the spine.

name: Ulnar deviation of the 3rd finger
description: Displacement of the 3rd finger towards the ulnar side (i.e., towards the ring finger).

name: Hypoplasia of the femoral head
description: Underdevelopment of the femoral head.
synonyms: ["HP:0008831","Hypoplastic femoral head","Small femoral heads","Small head of thigh bone"]

name: Stasis dermatitis
description: Stasis dermatitis commonly occurs in older age. It is caused by venous hypertension resulting from retrograde flow due to incompetent venous valves, valve destruction, or obstruction of the venous system. Further tissue changes arise from an inflammatory process mediated by metalloproteinases, which are up-regulated by ferric ion from extravasated red blood cells. Stasis dermatitis presents initially as poorly demarcated erythematous plaques of the lower legs bilaterally, classically involving the medial malleolus.

name: Mixed total anomalous pulmonary venous connection
description: Type 4 total anomalous pulmonary venous connection.
synonyms: ["Mixed total anomalous pulmonary venous connexion","Total anomalous pulmonary venous connection, mixed","Type 4 total anomalous pulmonary venous connection"]

name: Blindness
description: Blindness is the condition of lacking visual perception defined as visual perception below 3/60 and/or a visual field of no greater than 10 degrees in radius around central fixation.

name: Increased urinary 8-oxo-7,8-dihydroguanosine level
description: An elevated amount of 8-oxo-7,8-dihydroguanosine in the urine.

name: Alveolar capillary dysplasia
description: A developmental defect of the alveolar airspace during cananicular lung development characterized by a decreased number of pulmonary capillaries located away from the alveolar epithelium, thickened alveolar septae, media hypertrophy of small pulmonary arteries and muscularization of distal arterioles, and in some cases lymphangiectasis.

name: Spinal canal stenosis
description: An abnormal narrowing of the spinal canal.

name: Supranuclear gaze palsy
description: A supranuclear gaze palsy is an inability to look in a particular direction as a result of cerebral impairment. There is a loss of the voluntary aspect of eye movements, but, as the brainstem is still intact, all the reflex conjugate eye movements are normal.

name: Delayed proximal femoral epiphyseal ossification
description: Developmental delay of ossification of the proximal epiphysis of the femur.
synonyms: ["Delayed ossification of the proximal femoral epiphysis","Delayed ossification proximal femoral epiphyses"]

name: Obligate
description: Always present, i.e. in 100% of the cases.

name: Absent sebaceous glands
description: Absence of the sebaceous gland, the holocrine gland that secretes sebum into the hair follicles, or in hairless areas into ducts.

name: Periportal fibrosis
description: The presence of fibrosis affecting the interlobular stroma of liver.

name: Saccular aortic arch aneurysm
description: An eccentric abnormal localized widening (dilatation) of the aortic arch that involves only a portion of the circumference of the vessel wall.

name: Broad middle phalanx of the 4th toe
Reduced number of intrahepatic bile ducts
description: The presence of reduced numbers of intrahepatic bile duct than normal.

name: Cone-shaped epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger
description: A cone-shaped appearance of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the little finger of the hand, producing a 'ball-in-a-socket' appearance. This epiphysis is located at the proximal end of the phalanx and is normally nearly flat. The related entity 'angel-shaped' epiphysis refers to a pronounced cone-shaped epiphysis in combination with a pseudoepiphysis at the distal end of the phalanx.
synonyms: ["Cone-shaped end part of the outermost little finger bone","Cone-shaped end part of the outermost pinkie finger bone","Cone-shaped end part of the outermost pinky finger bone","Cone-shaped epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the little finger"]

name: Abnormality of the tarsal bones
description: An abnormality of the tarsus are the cluster of seven bones in the foot between the tibia and fibula and the metatarsus, including the calcaneus (heel) bone and the talus (ankle) bone.

name: Frontal polymicrogyria
description: A type of polymicrogyria with a gradient of severity (anterior more severe than posterior) extending from frontal poles posteriorly to precentral gyrus and inferiorly to frontal operculum.

name: Patellar subluxation
description: The kneecap normally is located within the groove termed trochlea on the distal femur and can slide up and down in it. Patellar subluxation refers to an unstable kneecap that does not slide centrally within its groove, i.e., a partial dislocation of the patella.

name: Spinal epidural abscess
description: Spinal epidural abscess (SEA) is caused by a suppurative infection in the epidural space.
