The mass effect ofthe abscess can compress and reduce blood flow to the spinal cord, conus medullaris, or cauda equina. Left untreated, the infection can lead to sensory loss,muscle weakness, visceral dysfunction, sepsis, and even death. Early diagnosis is essential to limit mor-bidity and neurologic injury. The classic triad of fever, axial pain, and neurological deficit occurs in as few as 13 percent of patients, highlighting the diagnosticchallenge associated with SEA.
synonyms: ["A severe pyogenic infection of the epidural space"]

name: Abnormal arcuate vein intima/media morphology
description: Any structural anomaly located in the inner or middle layer of the arcuate veins of the kidney.

name: Slender humeral diaphysis
synonyms: ["Slender shaft of long bone in upper arm"]

name: Carotid artery calcification
description: An accumulation of calcium and phosphate in arteries with mineral deposits in the intimal or medial layer of the vessel wall in a carotid artery.

name: Abnormal proportion of naive CD8 T cells
description: Any abnormality in the proportion of naive CD8 T cells relative to the total number of T cells.

name: Ectropion of lower eyelids
synonyms: ["Lower eyelid folded out","Lower eyelid turned out"]

name: Bronchocentric
description: Centered in bronchi or bronchioles.

name: Loss of subcutaneous adipose tissue in limbs
description: Loss (disappearance) of previously present subcutaneous fat tissue in arm or leg.
synonyms: ["HP:0003757","Loss of fat tissue below the skin in limbs","Loss of subcutaneous adipose tissue from extremities"]

name: Triangular shaped phalanges of the 5th toe
synonyms: ["Triangular shaped little toe bone","Triangular shaped pinkie toe bone","Triangular shaped pinky toe bone"]

name: Abnormal cartilage morphology
description: Any morphological abnormality of cartilage.
synonyms: ["HP:0410007","Abnormal shape of cartilage","Abnormality of cartilage morphology"]

name: Impaired gluconeogenesis
description: An impairment of gluconeogenesis.

name: Broad metacarpals
description: Abnormally broad metacarpal bones.

name: Fallopian tube cyst
description: A fluid filled sac located in the Fallopian tube.

name: Prominent xiphoid process
description: Increased prominence of the xiphoid process of the sternum.

name: Preauricular cyst
description: Preauricular sinus is an occasional finding and most frequently appears as a small pit close to the anterior margin of the ascending portion of the helix. The opening has also been reported along the postero superior margin of the helix, the tragus or the lobule. Preauricular sinus may lead to the formation of a subcutaneous cyst that is intimately related to the tragal cartilage and the anterior crus of the helix.

name: Secondary hypercortisolism
description: Hypercortisolemia associated with a overproduction of ACTH (often from a tumor), leading secondarily to overproduction of cortisol.

name: Absent epiphyses of the toes
description: Absence of the epiphyses of the phalanges of the toes.
synonyms: ["Absent end part of the toe bones"]

name: Perineal hypospadias
description: Hypospadias with location of the urethral meatus in the perineal region.

name: Normal density transverse bands in metaphyses of the upper limbs
Neoplasm of the nail
description: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the nail.

name: Abnormality of enteric ganglion morphology
description: An abnormality of the enteric nervous system, which comprises two types of ganglia, the myenteric (Auerbach's) and submucosal (Meissner's) plexuses. The enteric nervous system functions to control gut movement, fluid exchange between the gut and its lumen, and local blood flow.

name: Abnormal response to gonadotropin-releasing hormone stimulation test
description: An abnormal response to the gonadotropin-releasing hormone (GnRH) stimulation test. This test typically involves intravenous administration of GnRH followed by repeated blood sampling at various time points to measure the levels of luteinizing hormone (LH) and follicle-stimulating hormone (FSH).

name: Otitis media
description: Inflammation or infection of the middle ear.

name: Elevated circulating C-reactive protein concentration
description: An abnormal elevation of the C-reactive protein level in the blood circulation.

name: Double depressor palsy
description: An ocular movement abnormality characterised by simultaneous weakness of the inferior rectus muscle and superior oblique muscle of the same eye.

name: Abnormal cardiac catheterization
description: Abnormal results from the diagnostic tests resulting from cardiac catheterization.

name: Bulbous tips of toes
description: An abnormality of the morphology of the toes, such that the tips of the toes are prominent and bulbous.

name: Abnormal response to short acting pulmonary vasodilator
description: Pulmonary vasodilator testing is performed during right-heart catheterization and involves a short-acting vasoactive agent such as adenosine, epoprostenol, or inhaled nitric oxide. The current definition of a normal (positive) response is a drop in mean pulmonary artery pressure of at least 10 mm Hg (or 20 percent) to below 40 mm Hg.

name: Increased level of hexanoylglycine in urine
description: Elevated concentration of hexanoylglycine in the urine.

name: Triggered by fasting
description: Applies to a sign or symptom that is provoked or brought about by abstaining from eating food (fasting).
synonyms: ["Fasting triggered attacks","Fasting triggered symptoms","Triggered by fasting"]

name: Abnormality of the proximal fibular epiphysis
description: Any abnormality of the proximal epiphysis of the fibula.
synonyms: ["Abnormality of the innermost end part of calf bone"]

name: Decreased proportion of memory B cells
description: A reduction in the normal proportion of memory B cells (CD19+/CD27+) in circulation relative to the total number of B cells. Memory B cells develop from naive B cells. Upon antigen rechallenge, memory B cells rapidly expand and differentiate into plasma cells under the cognate control of memory Th cells (Phase IV).

name: Penile freckling
description: Multiple pigmented macules located on the skin of the penis.

name: Hyperextensibility at elbow
description: The ability of the elbow joint to move beyond its normal range of motion.

name: Short nasal septum
description: Reduced superior to inferior length of the nasal septum.
synonyms: ["Decreased length of nasal septum","Decreased length of septum of nose","Short nasal septum","Short septum of nose"]

name: Tibial arterial calcification
description: An accumulation of calcium and phosphate in arteries with mineral deposits in the intimal or medial layer of the vessel wall of the tibial artery.

name: Fetal neck anomaly
description: A structural anomaly in the fetal neck region.

name: Abnormal diaphysis morphology
description: An abnormality of the structure or form of the diaphysis, i.e., of the main or mid-section (shaft) of a long bone.
synonyms: ["HP:0006504","Abnormal shape of shaft of long bone","Abnormality involving the diaphyses of the limbs","Abnormality of shaft of long bone of the limbs","Abnormality of the diaphyses","Anomaly of the limb diaphyses","Anomaly of the limb diaphyses morphology"]

name: Vaginitis
description: Inflammation of the vagina that can result from a spectrum of conditions that cause vaginal and sometimes vulvar symptoms, such as itching, burning, irritation, odor, and vaginal discharge.

name: Abnormal morphology of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd toe
synonyms: ["Abnormality of the innermost bone of the 2nd toe"]

name: Reduced haptoglobin level
description: An abnormally low concentration of haptoglobin in the blood circulation. Decreased haptoglobin in conjunction with increased reticulocyte count and anemia may indicate hemolysis. Decreased haptoglobin levels can also occur in the absence of hemolysis, due to cirrhosis of the liver, disseminated ovarian carcinomatosis, pulmonary sarcoidosis, and elevated estrogen state.

name: Adrenal medullary hypoplasia
description: Developmental hypoplasia of the adrenal medulla.

name: Geophagia
description: The practice of eating earth or soil-like substrates such as clay or chalk.

name: Abnormality of infra-orbital nerve
description: A structural abnormality of an infra-orbital nerve. The infraorbital nerve arises from the maxillary branch of the trigeminal nerve and normally traverses the orbital floor in the infraorbital canal.

name: Abnormality of the gingiva
description: Any abnormality of the gingiva (also known as gums).

name: Decreased serum complement C3
description: A reduced level of the complement component C3 in circulation.
synonyms: ["HP:0005408","Decreased serum C3","Decreased serum complement C3 level"]

name: Delayed eruption of teeth
description: Delayed tooth eruption, which can be defined as tooth eruption more than 2 SD beyond the mean eruption age.
synonyms: ["HP:0000686","HP:0006294","HP:0006314","HP:0006328","Delayed dental development","Delayed dental eruption","Delayed eruption","Delayed eruption of teeth","Delayed teeth eruption","Delayed tooth eruption","Eruption, delayed","Late eruption of teeth","Late tooth eruption"]

name: Focal aware cognitive seizure with left-right confusion
description: A focal cognitive seizure with left-right confusion characterized by retained awareness throughout the seizure.

name: Abnormality of von Willebrand factor
description: Decreased quantity or activity of von Willebrand factor. Von Willebrand factor mediates the adhesion of platelets to the collagen exposed on endothelial cell surfaces.

name: Neoplasm of the lip
description: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the lip.

name: EEG with periodic lateralized epileptiform discharges
description: Periodic lateralized epileptiform discharges (PLEDs)are periodic, lateralized, and epileptiform. PLEDs show a relatively constant interval between discharges (0.5 to 3 seconds).

name: Cryptorchidism
description: Testis in inguinal canal. That is, absence of one or both testes from the scrotum owing to failure of the testis or testes to descend through the inguinal canal to the scrotum.

name: Premature ventricular contraction
description: Premature ventricular contractions (PVC) or ventricular extrasystoles are premature contractions of the heart that arise in response to an impulse in the ventricles rather than the normal impulse from the sinoatrial (SA) node.
synonyms: ["HP:0006678","Extra heart beat","Premature ventricular beat","Premature ventricular contractions","Ventricular ectopics","Ventricular extrasystoles","Ventricular premature beat"]

name: Middle age onset
description: A type of adult onset with onset of symptoms at the age of 40 to 60 years.

name: Respiratory insufficiency due to muscle weakness
synonyms: ["HP:0004882","HP:0004888","Decreased lung function due to weak breathing muscles","Decreased respiratory function due to muscle weakness","Respiratory distress due to muscle weakness","Respiratory failure due to muscle weakness","Respiratory muscle weakness"]

name: Frontotemporal dementia
description: A dementia associated with degeneration of the frontotemporal lobe and clinically associated with personality and behavioral changes such as disinhibition, apathy, and lack of insight. The hallmark feature of frontotemporal dementia is the presentation with focal syndromes such as progressive language dysfunction, or aphasia, or behavioral changes characteristic of frontal lobe disorders.

name: Double outlet right ventricle
description: Double outlet right ventricle (DORV) is a type of ventriculoarterial connection in which both great vessels arise entirely or predominantly from the right ventricle.

name: Anticardiolipin IgM antibody positivity
description: The presence of circulating IgM autoantibodies to cardiolipin.

name: Round face
description: The facial appearance is more circular than usual as viewed from the front.
synonyms: ["HP:0000304","HP:0004653","Circular face","Round face","Round facial appearance","Round facial shape","Round facies","Round, full face"]

name: Anti-SOX1 antibody
description: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against SOX1. Anti-SOX1 antibodies, also known as antiglial nuclear antibody (AGNA), are specifically found in paraneoplastic neurological disorders. Since SOX1 is expressed in neuronal precursor cells in the developing central nervous system, it has been used as an early marker of neural stem cells.

name: Abnormality of circulating fibrinogen
description: An abnormality of the level of activity of circulating fibrinogen.

name: Mild short stature
description: A mild degree of short stature, more than -2 SD but not more than -3 SD from mean corrected for age and sex.

name: Serpiginous crus of helix
description: Curving course of the crus of the helix, approaching or joining the antitragus.

name: Hypometric horizontal saccades
description: Saccadic undershoot of horizontal saccadic eye movements, i.e., a horizontal saccadic eye movement that has less than the magnitude that would be required to gain fixation of the object.

name: Paramesangial deposits
description: Mesangial immune deposit located adjacent to the paramesangial glomerular basement membrane.

name: Elevated circulating oleylcarnitine concentration
description: Increased concentration of oleylcarnitine in the blood circulation.

name: Abnormality of urinary uric acid level
description: Abnormal amount of urate in the urine.

name: Increased alpha-globulin
description: An abnormally increased level of circulationg alpha-globulin. Alpha globulins are a group of serum proteins defined by their mobility on serum electrophoresis. The alpha1-protein fraction is comprised of alpha1-antitrypsin, thyroid-binding globulin, and transcortin. Ceruloplasmin, alpha2-macroglobulin, and haptoglobin contribute to the alpha2-protein band. The alpha2 component is increased as an acute-phase reactant.

name: Aortic elastic fiber thinning
description: A thinning out of elastic fibers of the media of the aorta that creates widening of intralamellar spaces, as identified on a stain for elastic fibers.

name: Psoriasiform lesion
description: A skin lesions that resembles the lesions observed in psoriasis, viz., an erythematous plaque covered by fine silvery scales. Psoriasiform lesions can be observed in psoriasis as well as in other conditions including allergic contact dermatitis, seborrhoeic dermatitis, Atopic dermatitis, pityriasis rubra, and lichen simplex chronicus.

name: Submucous cleft of soft and hard palate
description: Soft and hard-palate submucous clefts are characterized by bony defects in the midline of the soft and hard palate that are covered by the lining (ie mucous membrane) of the roof of the mouth.

name: Pancreatic abscess
description: A circumscribed area of pus or necrotic debris in the parenchyma of the pancreas.

name: Bowing of the legs
description: A bending or abnormal curvature affecting a long bone of the leg.

name: Arcuate artery intraluminal thrombi
description: Mixture of fibrin, red blood cells, platelets partly or completely occluding the vascular lumen of the arcuate arteries of the kidney.

name: Aplastic nasopharyngeal adenoids
description: Absence of the nasopharyngeal adenoids as a developmental defect.

name: Impaired cortisol response to glucagon stimulation test
description: Failure of cortisol levels to respond adequately (by increasing) to the glucagon stimulation test.

name: Decreased proportion of CD8-positive T cells
description: A decreased proportion of circulating CD8-positive, alpha-beta T cells relative to total number of T cells.
synonyms: ["HP:0005481","CD8+ T-cell lymphopenia","Decreased proportion of CD8+ T cells","Decreased proportion of CD8-positive, alpha-beta T cells"]

name: Flexion contracture of thumb
description: Chronic loss of joint motion in the thumb due to structural changes in non-bony tissue. The term camptodactyly is used if the distal and/or proximal interphalangeal joints are affected.
synonyms: ["HP:0004061","HP:0006043","Contracture of thumb","Flexion deformities of thumbs","Joint contractures of the thumb"]

name: Decreased mean corpuscular volume
description: A reduction from normal of the mean corpuscular volume, or mean cell volume (MCV) of red blood cells (usually defined as an MCV below 80 femtoliters).

name: Albuminuria
description: Increased concentration of albumin in the urine.

name: Bracket epiphysis of the middle phalanx of the 3rd toe
synonyms: ["Bracket shaped end part of the middle bone of 3rd toe"]

name: Diffuse optic disc pallor
description: A pale yellow discoloration of the entire optic disc.

name: Airway casts
description: A replicate of airways from accumulated and condensed mucous and cellular material. These semisolid occlusions take the shape of the airway within they are formed, leading to obstruction of the tracheobronchial tree with consecutive respiratory insufficiency. Based on their principal composition, one can differentiate fibrin casts and mucin casts. Plastic bronchitis is the name of the condition characterized by the formation of airway casts.

name: Intracranial neurenteric cyst
description: A neurenteric cyst located within the skull.

name: Anti-endomysial antibody positivity
description: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against endomysial tissue transglutaminase 2 (tTG2).

name: Intermittent lactic acidemia
description: An intermittent (discontinuous) form of lactic acidemia.

name: Focal-onset seizure evolving into bilateral convulsive status epilepticus
description: A type of bilateral convulsive seizure of focal onset (which could be with awareness or impaired awareness, either motor or non- motor) that is sufficiently prolonged (or repeated without recovery) to reach the threshold for status epilepticus.
synonyms: ["Focal onset seizure evolving into bilateral convulsive status epilepticus","Focal-onset seizure evolving into generalised convulsive status epilepticus","Focal-onset seizure evolving into generalized convulsive status epilepticus","Partial onset seizure evolving into convulsive status epilepticus","Partial-onset seizure evolving into convulsive status epilepticus","Secondarily generalised convulsive status epilepticus","Secondarily generalised tonic-clonic status epilepticus","Secondarily generalized convulsive status epilepticus","Secondarily generalized tonic-clonic status epilepticus"]

name: Unilateral narrow palpebral fissure
description: A fixed reduction in the vertical distance between the upper and lower eyelids with short palpebral fissures on one side only.

name: Submucous cleft soft palate
description: A cleft of the muscular (soft) portion of the palate that is covered by mucous membrane. Soft-palate submucous clefts are characterized by a midline deficiency or lack of muscle tissue.
synonyms: ["Partial thickness cleft soft palate","Submucous cleft velum"]

name: Abnormality of complement system
description: An abnormality of the complement system.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the bladder
description: Absence or underdevelopment of the urinary bladder.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the 5th metacarpal
description: Aplasia or Hypoplasia affecting the 5th metacarpal.
synonyms: ["Absent/small 5th long bone of hand","Absent/underdeveloped 5th long bone of hand"]

name: Decreased circulating fetuin A concentration
description: A reduction below normal of fetuin A in the blood circulation.

name: Abnormal sarcomere morphology
description: Any structural anomaly of the sarcomere, which is unit of a myofibril in a muscle cell, composed of an array of overlapping thick and thin filaments between two adjacent Z discs.

name: Fractured orbit of skull
description: A partial or complete breakage of the orbit of skull.

name: Decreased number of sternal ossification centers
description: A less than normal number of sternal ossification centers. The sternum is initially formed from bilateral sternal plates that chondrify and begin to fuse with ribs at 10 weeks gestational age. Ossification starts in the manubrium and upper part of the sternal body at the 6th month, in the middle of the sternal body at the 7th month, in the lower part of the body during the 1st postnatal year and in the xiphoid process between years 5 and 18. The number of ossification centers vary up to six, and it is the ossification centers that are visualized by prenatal ultrasound. This term describes a reduction in the number of ossification centers compared with age-related norms.

name: Ulnar deviation of the hand or of fingers of the hand
Venom allergy
description: Hypersensitivity in form of an adverse immune reaction against insect venom.
synonyms: ["Allergy to venom","IgE-mediated venom allergy","Immunoglobulin E-mediated venom allergy","Venom allergy"]

name: Shawl scrotum
description: Superior margin of the scrotum superior to the base of the penis.

name: Reduced factor VIII activity
description: Reduced activity of coagulation factor VIII. Factor VIII (fVIII) is a cofactor in the intrinsic clotting cascade that is activated to fVIIIa in the presence of minute quantities of thrombin. fVIIIa acts as a receptor, for factors IXa and X.

name: Pulmonary air embolism
description: Venous air embolism is a consequence of air being introduced into the venous circulation, and subsequently to the right heart, and pulmonary circulation. When small amounts of air reach pulmonary circulation they can be removed by gas diffusion across the arteriolar wall into the alveoli, amounts of gas exceeding 50 ml can cause pulmonary outflow tract obstruction with or without concomitant arterial embolisation.

name: Abnormal branching pattern of the aortic arch
description: A deviance from the norm of the origin or course of the right brachiocephalic artery, the left common carotid artery, the left subclavian artery or the proximal vertebral arteries.

name: Increased circulating galectin-3 level
description: An increased circulation of galectin-3 in the blood circulation.
